column5: つちうら城
column6: Tsuchiura Castle
column7: NOTE: this is the area name, which is displayed when you open the menu. every map has one of these (it's usually but not always the first message). the names will automatically be "squished" to fit inside the window, so don't worry too much about the length.

column5:
ここは　つちうら城で　ござる\n
黄門さまは　上の階に\n
いらっしゃいます！　さあ！　どうぞ！
column6:
This is Tsuchiura Castle.\n
Koumon-sama is on the upper floor!\n
Please, come right in!

column5:
え！　おぬしが　火の一族！？\n
じゃあ　すぐに　黄門さまに\n
お会いください
column6:
What? You're of the Fire Clan?!\n
You must speak with Koumon-sama at once!

column5:
黄門さまは\n
水戸に　おもどりに　なられました
column6: Koumon-sama has returned to Mito.

column5:
赤地に　黄色い文字で\n
「大」と　しるされた　大きな石がある
column6: There is a large red stone marked with a yellow 大 symbol.
column7:
CHECK: can we keep a Japanese character in the text? Because 大 here is literally what is drawn on the rock.
NOTE: wish granted

column5: なにもありませんでした
column6: You find nothing.

column5: 筑波国
column6: Tsukuba

column5: ポンポコリン！
column6: Ponpokorin!

column5:
おおっ！　火の一族か！！\n
なんじゃ！　その　疑いの　まなこは！\n
わしは　神の使い　白ダヌキじゃぞ！
column6:
Ah-ha, you must be of the Fire Clan!\n
...Hey, what's with the stink-eye? I'm the White Tanuki, a messenger of the divine!

column5:
わしの一族の　末えいの　大ダヌキめが\n
大門教に　そそのかされて\n
迷惑を　かけているようじゃな
column6: It seems that Oodanuki, my descendant, fell for the Daimonists' honeyed words and is causing you trouble!

column5:
おわびと　いっては　なんじゃが\n
わしの神通力を　さずけよう！！\n
粉火の巻物じゃ！！
column6: As a way of apologizing, I'll bestow upon you my divine power! The scroll of Konabi!

column5:
粉火の術は　敵の一匹に\n
無数の　火の粉を　あびせて\n
やっつける術じゃ！！
column6: The Konabi jutsu will rain fire on a single enemy target! It's as deadly as it sounds!

column5:
大門教を　たおせ！！\n
マサカドを　復活させては　ならぬ！！\n
行け！　ジライア！！
column6:
Defeat the Cult of Daimon!\n
Don't let them revive Masakado!\n
Now go, young Ziria!

column5: 神獣白ダヌキの　封印を　解き放った\n
column6: You have broken the seal of the divine beast White Tanuki.\n

column5: 粉火の巻物を　手に入れた\n
column6: Obtained Scroll of Konabi.\n

column5:
粉火の術は　敵の一匹に\n
無数の　火の粉を　あびせて\n
やっつける術じゃ！！
column6: The Konabi jutsu will rain fire on a single enemy target! It's as deadly as it sounds!

column5:
大門教を　たおせ！！\n
マサカドを　復活させては　ならぬ！！\n
行け！　ジライア！！
column6:
Defeat the Cult of Daimon!\n
Don't let them revive Masakado!\n
Now go, young Ziria!

column5: 筑波山
column6: Mount Tsukuba

column5:
マサカドを　復活させて\n
ジパングを　支配しようとしているのは\n
大門教っていう　連中なんだ！
column6: The ones trying to resurrect Masakado and take over Jipang are some bunch called the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
大門教は　マサカドを　使って\n
ジパングを　こっぱみじんに\n
しようと　してるんだよ！
column6: The Daimonists want to use Masakado to smash Jipang into smithereens.

column5:
きっと　その後で　ジパングに\n
自分たちの　ユートピアを\n
つくるつもりなんだ！
column6: After that, they must be planning to turn Jipang into their own utopia!

column5:
オレ　そんなの　いやだ！\n
ジライア！　大門教を　やっつけて\n
ジパングを　まもってくれよ！
column6:
I can't stand the thought!\n
Ziria! Beat the Cult of Daimon and protect Jipang!

column5:
これ　オレからの　せんべつだ\n
受け取ってくれよ
column6:
Here's a parting gift from me.\n
Take it with you.

column5:
がんばってくれよ！！\n
大門教のやつらを\n
退治してくれよ！！
column6:
Go for it!\n
Take out those Daimonist jerks!

column5:
筑波の山のために！！\n
そして　ジパングのために！！
column6:
For the sake of Mount Tsukuba!\n
And the sake of Jipang!

column5:
大門教っていうのは\n
ジパングの　外の国からきた\n
悪魔たちなんだ！！
column6: The Cult of Daimon is a bunch of demons who came from lands outside Jipang!

column5:
あいつら　外の国を　みんな\n
ほろぼして　次は　ジパングを\n
自分たちのものに　しようとしてるんだ
column6: They've brought all the countries outside to ruin, and now, they're trying to make Jipang theirs.
column7: NOTE: I believe this is the first and last we hear of the Daimonists taking over countries outside Jipang, much less "all the countries"

column5:
ジライア！　あんなやつらの\n
思いどおりに　させちゃいけないよ！\n
大門教を　やっつけてくれよ！！
column6:
Ziria! You can't let those guys get away with what they're plotting!\n
Beat the Daimonists!

column5:
これ　少ないけど　受け取ってくれ！！\n
オレが　いままで　ためた　お金だ\n
旅に　役立ててくれよ
column6:
This isn't much, but take it!\n
It's the money I've saved up till now.\n
Make use of it in your travels.

column5:
がんばってくれよ！！\n
大門教のやつらを\n
退治してくれよ！！
column6:
Go for it!\n
Take out those Daimonist jerks!

column5:
筑波の山のために！！\n
そして　ジパングのために！！
column6:
For the sake of Mount Tsukuba!\n
And the sake of Jipang!

column5:
大門教は　ジパングの\n
まものや　妖怪を　てなずけて\n
思うままに　あやつっているんだ！！
column6: The Daimonists have won over Jipang's beasts and youkai, and are in total control of them!

column5:
ちかごろじゃ　このへんにも\n
大門教の　まものが　現れて\n
ひとを　おそうんだよ！！
column6: Lately, Daimonist monsters have been showing up and attacking people around here, too.

column5:
これ　少ないけど　受け取ってくれ！！\n
オレが　いままで　ためた　お金だ\n
旅に　役立ててくれよ
column6:
This isn't much, but take it!\n
It's the money I've saved up till now.\n
Make use of it in your travels.

column5:
がんばってくれよ！！\n
マサカドを　退治してくれよ！！\n
筑波の山のために
column6:
You can do it!\n
Take down Masakado -- for the sake of Mount Tsukuba!

column5:
ジライアは　火の一族の\n
まつえい　だったんだ！！\n
どうりで　強いわけだ！！
column6: You're a descendant of the Fire Clan, Ziria! No wonder you're strong!

column5:
マサカドは　火の一族じゃないと\n
たおせないんだってね！\n
がんばってくれよ　ジライア！
column6:
I hear you can't beat Masakado unless you're from the Fire Clan.\n
Give it your all, Ziria!

column5:
オレ　なにも　できないけど\n
ここから　ジライアのこと\n
おうえんしているよ！！
column6: I can't do anything, but I'll be cheering you on from here!

column5:
これ　オレからの　せんべつだ\n
受け取ってくれよ
column6:
Here's a parting gift from me.\n
Take it with you.

column5:
がんばってくれよ！！\n
マサカドを　退治してくれよ！！\n
筑波の山のために
column6:
You can do it!\n
Take down Masakado -- for the sake of Mount Tsukuba!

column5: ２０両を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained 両20 (20 ryou).
column7: NOTE: let's be nice and tell players how to pronounce this archaic currency symbol they've never seen

column5: ガマ仙人の家
column6: Toad Hermit's House

column5: ようっ！　ガマ仙人の　じっちゃま！！\n
column6: Hey! Ol' Toad Hermit!
column7:
NOTE: this dialogue is duplicated from the intro, but the version that's actually used for that is in script_intro_ending -- this in-game version isn't normally used.
Interestingly, if you hack the game to skip the normal intro, this actually will show up if you talk to the old man at the start of the game (the intro sequence specifically sets the memory flag that prevents this conversation from playing).

column6:
\n
Is this Masakado guy really that strong?

column5:
ふむ\n
きゃつが　動く時\n
大木は倒れ　火が走り
column6: Indeed...They say that when he stirred, great trees fell, fires raged,

column5:
その後には\n
しかばねしか残らんと\n
言われておる
column6: and in the aftermath, naught was left but corpses.

column5:
へぇー！　そんなに　すごいやつが\n
復活したら　この筑波山も\n
消えて　なくなっちまうのか
column6: Oh man! If a guy like THAT comes back, Mount Tsukuba here's gonna get wiped out, isn't it?

column5: そうじゃ！！
column6: So it will!

column5:
筑波山の　鳥や　動物も　カエルたちも\n
みんな　マサカドのやつに\n
消されちまうのか？
column6: So Mount Tsukuba's birds and animals, its frogs -- Masakado'll obliterate them all?

column5: そうじゃ！！
column6: He will!

column5:
秋に実をつける　リンゴの木や\n
栗の木も　菜の花も\n
みんな　燃やされちまうのか！！
column6: The apple and chestnut trees that bear fruit in the fall, the rapeseed flowers -- he'll burn them ALL?!

column5: そうじゃ！！
column6: He will!

column5: そんなやつ　ゆるしておけねえなあ！！
column6: We can't let him get away with it!

column5: うむ！！
column6: Indeed!

column5:
ジライア！！\n
それで　わしは　おまえに　今まで\n
苦しい修行を　あたえてきたのだ！！
column6:
Ziria!\n
It is for this that I have put you through such harsh training up until now!

column5:
オイラに\n
マサカドってやつが\n
たおせるのか？
column6: Will I be able to beat this Masakado?

column5: おそらく・・・無理じゃろう
column6: Most likely...you will not.

column5:
だったら\n
なんで　オイラは\n
今まで　修行してきたんだよ！
column6: Then why have I been training all this time?!

column5:
おまえ　ひとりでは\n
無理だと　いうことじゃ
column6: What I mean is that you will not be able to do it alone.

column5:
しかし　おまえと\n
同じ　さだめをもった者が\n
あと　ふたりおる
column6: But there are yet two others who hold the same destiny as you.

column5:
この　ふたりと　力を合わせれば\n
マサカドの復活を\n
阻止することができるじゃろう！
column6: If you join forces with them, you should be able to prevent Masakado's return!

column5:
冗談じゃねえよ！！\n
マサカドなんてやつ\n
オイラ　ひとりで　十分だよ！
column6:
Screw that!\n
I'm enough to take down this Masakado nutjob all by myself!

column5: ならば　行ってこい！！
column6: Then go!

column5:
しかし　火の一族　ふたりと\n
力を合わせねば\n
マサカドには　たちむかえぬぞ！！
column6: But if you do not unite with the other two of the Fire Clan, you will never be able to stand against Masakado!

column5:
なにをしておる！\n
大門教が　ジパングを\n
支配してしまうぞ！　いそぐのじゃ！！
column6:
What are you doing?!\n
The Cult of Daimon is going to take over Jipang! HURRY!
column7: NOTE: this line is the only one that's actually used

column5: 筑波村
column6: Tsukuba Village

column5:
ジライアさん\n
村の外には　大門教の　魔物が\n
出るから　あぶないですよ
column6: Ziria-san, it's full of Daimonist monsters outside!

column5:
旅に　出るなら　この筑波村で\n
したくして　いきなさい
column6: Before you begin your journey, you should get what you need here in Tsukuba Village.

column5:
ジライアさん！！\n
火の一族の　金太っていう　人が\n
あんたを　さがしてたよ
column6: Ziria-san! A guy from the Fire Clan called Kinta is looking for you.

column5:
最近　村の外の　タヌキが\n
凶暴になって\n
人を　おそうのよ！！
column6: Lately, the tanuki outside the village have become violent. They're even attacking people!

column5:
大門教が　タヌキを\n
魔物に　かえたに　ちがいないわ！
column6: The Daimonists must have turned the tanuki into monsters!

column5:
マ　マ　マサカドが　復活したら\n
どうすれば　いいの！！\n
どこへ　逃げれば　いいの！！
column6:
Wh-What if Masakado IS revived?!\n
Where can we go?!

column5:
どこへ　かくれれば　いいの！！\n
わたしは　どうなるの！！\n
子供は　どうなるの！！
column6:
Is there even a safe place to hide?!\n
What's going to happen to me?!\n
What about the children?!

column5:
ジライアさん！\n
大門教が　この村の　南にある\n
ナマズの　ほこらを　埋めてしまった！
column6: Ziria-san! The Daimonists have buried the Namazu shrine to the south under a landslide!

column5:
きっと　火の一族の　あんたを\n
筑波山に　とじこめようとしてるんだ！
column6: I'm sure they did it to trap you here in Mount Tsukuba, knowing you're of the Fire Clan!

column5:
ナマズのほこらを　通らなければ\n
その先にある　つちうらの町には\n
行くことが　できないんです！
column6: The only way to reach Tsuchiura Town is through the Namazu shrine!

column5:
火の一族の　金太さんが\n
ナマズの　ほこらを　ぬける方法を\n
知っているって　言ってたわ
column6: Kinta-san of the Fire Clan said he knows a way to get past the Namazu shrine.

column5:
ナマズの　ほこらには　むかしから\n
山ほども　デッカイ　大ナマズが\n
住んでるらしいよ！
column6: I heard a giant catfish lives inside the Namazu shrine!

column5:
まだ　ボクは\n
見たことがないけどね\n
ものすげえ　デッカイってさ！！
column6:
They say it's as big as a mountain!\n
I wanna see it!

column5: ポンポコリン！！
column6: Ponpokorin!
column7: ZenkiTN: "Ponpokorin" has no real meaning, but it's a funny sound associated with tanuki. It's used various times throughout the game (and in Japanese popular culture). The fact that Kinta here drops a "ponpokorin" is a hint that he is in fact a tanuki in disguise (which is something they do)

column5:
おまえが　ジライアか！\n
待ちくたびれちまったよ！\n
オレは　金太っていうんだ！！
column6:
There you are!\n
You must be Ziria!\n
Name's Kinta!

column5:
おまえと　同じ　火の勇者さ！\n
さあ　マサカドを\n
たおしに　いこうぜ！！
column6:
I'm a Fire Hero, just like you!\n
Let's fight Masakado together!

column5:
刀や　よろいは　あとまわしでいいって\n
とにかく　いそごうぜ！！\n
まずは　南の　ナマズの　ほこらだ！！
column6: Don't worry about swords or armor for now! Let's hurry to the Namazu shrine, to the south!
column7:
ZenkiTN: The fact he suggests to forget about buying equipment is another hint that Kinta isn't actually on your side.
Supper: well, armor is completely useless in this game, so half of this is actually sound advice!

column5: 金太が　仲間に　加わった！
column6: Kinta has joined you!

column5:
マサカドが　復活するためには\n
たくさんの　人間の　たましいが\n
必要なんだ！！
column6: The Daimonists need a lot of human souls to revive Masakado!

column5:
大門教は　そのために\n
人をだまして　信者を　あつめ\n
たましいを　ぬき取っちまうんだよ！
column6: That's why they deceive people into joining their cult! They do it to steal their souls!

column5:
大門教と　たたかって\n
体力が　減ったら\n
はやめに　宿屋に　とまるんだよ
column6: Fighting against the Cult of Daimon won't be easy. When you're tired, you should rest at an inn.

column5:
それと　宿屋には\n
きろく人がいるから\n
こまめに　セーブしなよ！！
column6:
You'll find record keepers at every inn.\n
Save as often as possible!

column5:
大門教が　マサカドを　復活させたら\n
この国の　生きものは\n
みんな　死に絶えてしまうんでしょ！
column6: If Masakado is revived, every living creature in the country will die!

column5:
ジライアさん　おねがいです\n
マサカドが　よみがえる前に\n
大門教を　たおしてください！
column6:
Ziria-san, I beg you!\n
Stop the Cult of Daimon before they revive Masakado!

column5:
家の中にも　人が　いるから\n
とびらの　あいている家には\n
かならず　はいるのよ！
column6: If you see a house with an open door, you should always go inside!

column5:
マサカドを　たおすための\n
だいじな話が　\n
きけるかも　しれないわ
column6: You might learn something that'll help you in your quest to defeat Masakado!

column5:
「しらべる」で\n
ジライアさんの　めのまえを\n
調べることが　できるのよ
column6: The {Check} command inspects the area right in front of you.

column5:
あしもと　じゃないから\n
まちがえないでね\n
なれると　こっちのほうが　便利よ！
column6: Keep in mind that it won't check what's under your feet. It's actually way more convenient this way -- you'll see!

column5:
ジライアさんと　金太さんは\n
うりふたつ　なんだなあ！\n
オレ　まちがえちまったよ！
column6: You and Kinta-san sure are alike, aren't you?

column5:
血のつながっている　火の一族だから\n
にてるのも　あたりまえだけど\n
それにしても　そっくりだ！
column6:
It must be because you're both descendants of the Fire Clan.\n
I can barely tell you apart!

column5:
「徳」というのは　おぬしが\n
まことの　火の勇者に　なるための\n
モノサシのようなものじゃ！
column6: {Virtue} is a value that measures how much of a true Fire Hero you are.

column5:
敵を　倒した時は　もちろん　増えるが\n
人助けや　友との出会いの中で\n
自然と　身につくものなのじゃ
column6: Defeating enemies increases it, of course, but you'll also gain it by helping people and meeting new friends.

column5: 武具屋
column6: Armory

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　武具屋です\n
ご用件は　何ですか？
column6:
Welcome to my armory!\n
How can I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それでは　また　ご利用ください
column6: Come back anytime.

column5:
オラ　知らなかっだども\n
刀とか　よろいとかってもんは\n
「そうび」しないと　ダメなんだと！
column6:
Don't make my mistake!\n
Remember to {Equip} swords and armor that you buy!

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
マサカドが　復活するって\n
話が　ひろまってからよお　うぃ　\n
みんら　なげやりになっちまってよお
column6: Ev'ryone shayin' that Mashakado's comin' back 'n' only the Fire Clan can beat 'im. (hic)
column7: ZenkiTN: these lines are said with a drunken slur.

column5:
オレも　毎日　酒びたり　なんら\n
火のいちろくは　まらかあー！\n
へのいりろくを　よんれこい！　ヒック
column6: Sho I drinksh while I wait. C'mon, Fire Clan, get a move on! (burp)
column7: ZenkiTN: these lines are said with a drunken slur.

column5:
あんらが　へのいりろく　らったんらね\n
らいもん教の　ゴーモンを\n
たおしらんらってね　　ありらろ
column6: Sho you were the Fire Clan all along, huh? Thanksh for beatin' that Goumon guy. (hic)
column7: ZenkiTN: these lines are said with a drunken slur.

column5:
オラは　つちうら町から　来たんだけど\n
大門教たらの　タヌキが\n
旅人を　ねらうんで　けえれねんだ！！
column6: I came from Tsuchiura Town, but with those Daimonist tanuki attacking travelers, I can't go back!

column5:
いいつたえによると\n
マサカドは　一夜にして\n
ジパングの　半分を　灰にしたらしいぜ
column6: According to legend, Masakado turned half of Jipang to ashes in but a single night.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　４両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両4 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　４両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両4 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！

column6: House

column5:

ナマズの　ほこらが\n
埋まってしまったことが　あってな
column6: A long time ago, a landslide buried the Namazu shrine.
column7: ZenkiTN: "Namazu" is a giant catfish from Japanese myths. In short, they're said to cause earthquakes by thrashing about.

column5:

大ひげぬきを　使って\n
大ナマズの　ひげを　ひっこぬいてよう
column6: So the villagers used giant tweezers to pull out one of Namazu's catfish whiskers.
column7: ZenkiTN: I went for "catfish whiskers" because I wanted to make it clear that "Namazu" is a catfish.

column5:
大ナマズの　起こす地震で\n
ほこらを　ふたたび\n
通れるように　したんだよ
column6: The earthquake caused by Namazu's awakening cleared the path to the shrine.

column5:

なくなってしもうた！

きっと　大門教の　悪ダヌキが\n
盗みよったに　ちがいないわい！

あれがないと　大ナマズを\n
起こすことが　できんのじゃ！

column5: 民家
column6: House

My grandpa once told me something interesting about the Fire Clan.\n
They're not just one {clan.}

column6: After they sealed Masakado, people started calling the three tribes that did it {the Fire Clan.}

おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？

Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす

Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column6: Have a nice day.

column6: Ponpokorin!

なおすから　ちょっと　先に\n
行っててくれよ！

The strap on my sandal came loose!\n
Go on ahead while I fix it!

I'm Kinta the Tanuki! An assassin sent by the Cult of Daimon!

いるわきゃないだろ！！

You'll never defeat Masakado-sama!\n
It's time you learned how terrifying the Cult of Daimon really is!

You look inside the casket.\n
There is nothing inside.

column6: You look inside the casket.

column5: たぬきカギを　手に入れた\n
column6: Obtained Tanuki Key.\n

column5: ここは　とーせんぼだ　ポン！

column5: ナマズの洞
column6: Namazu Shrine

column5: グウグウ　わしゃねむい
column6: Zzz...So sleepy...

column5: いきなり　なんじゃ　おまえは・・・
column6: What's wrong with you? Sheesh...

column5: ヒエー　いてててて\n
column6: Ouch! Owww!\n

column5:
大ナマズが　あばれだして\n
地震が　おこった！！
column6: Namazu thrashes about, causing an earthquake!

column5:
大きなつづらが　ある\n
がっちり　カギが　かかっていて\n
あかない

There is a large casket here.\n
It's locked tight.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　なにも　入っていなかった

You look inside the casket.\n
There is nothing inside.

つづらの　ふたが　開いた\n

There is a pair of giant tweezers inside.

You're a Fire Hero, right?\n

おねげえしますじゃ！\n

column5:
雲切の里って　急に　いわれても\n

column5:
でも　あんたの　味方だってことは\n

column5:
なさけないけど\n
今の　黄門さまには\n

column5:
マサカドが　復活すると\n

There is currently no way to reach the other side.

column5: なにもありませんでした

Ziria-san, when you're in a hurry,\n
hold Button II while walking.

column6: That will increase your movement speed.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　７両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両7 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます

column5:
ひと晩　７両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両7 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！

Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください

いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま

きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません

Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column6: House

column5:
黄門さまは　やさしいお方じゃ\n
この筑波の国を　だれよりも\n
愛していらっしゃる！！
column6: Koumon-sama is a kind man who loves these lands of Tsukuba more than anyone else.

column5:
その黄門さまを\n
水戸から追い出すとは\n
わしゃ　大門教が　ゆるせん！！
column6: How dare those dirty Daimonists drive him out of Mito?!

column5:
わしが　あと　５０さい　若かったら\n
大門教と　戦うのに！！！！！\n
プチッ！　うっ　血管がきれた！
column6:
If I were but fifty years younger, I'd teach them a lesson myself!!\n
...Ack! My blood pressure...

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
この　あたりに　おった\n
大ダヌキめが　子分を　ひきつれ\n
大門教の　手下に　なったらしい
column6: A large tanuki used to live nearby. Apparently, he and his minions all became Daimonists.

ひとすじなわでは　いかんくせものよ\n
すぐに　人を　たぶらかしよる
column6: Be very careful. He's a master of deceit.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
黄門さまは　誰にでも\n
会ってくださる\n
心のひろい　お殿さまです
column6: Koumon-sama will grant anyone an audience. He's very open-minded.

column5: つちうら城
column6: Tsuchiura Castle

column5:
わたしが　スケさんです\n
黄門さまの　許しがでれば\n
すぐに　橋を　渡れるように　できます
column6:
I am Suke-san.\n
As soon as Koumon-sama gives his permission, we will lower the bridge.
column7: ZenkiTN: "Suke-san" and "Kaku-san" is how Mito Koumon's attendants were always introduced in the late 60s jidaigeki "Mito Koumon". Incidentally, his full name is Sasaki Sukesaburo.

column5:
黄門さまは　まいにち\n
水戸城の　方角に　向かって\n
ひとり　なみだして　おられます
column6: Every single day, Koumon-sama looks in the direction of Mito Castle and sheds a tear...

column5:
ジライアさん！！\n
あなたが　さいごの　たよりです\n
どうか　がんばってください
column6:
You're our only hope, Ziria-san!\n
Good luck!

column5:
わたしが　カクさん　なにもかくさん！\n

水戸から　にげてきました
column6:
I am Kaku-san, and YOU'RE cuckoo, son!\n
We escaped from Mito alongside our lord, Koumon-sama.
column7:
ZenkiTN: His full name is Atsumi Kakunoshin.
The original pun here is "nani mo kakusan", which means "I have nothing to hide". However, the pun works because "kakusan" (not hiding) has the same reading as his name, Kaku-san.

column5:
水戸にのこした　人たちのことを\n
思うと　夜も　ねむれません！\n
どうか　お力を　おかしください！！
column6: I cannot sleep when I think about those poor people left in Mito! Please help us, I beg you!

column5:
わたし　カクさん　なにも　かくさん！\n
ゴホンといえば　りゅうカクさん！！\n
高倉は　ケンさん　遠山は　キンさん！
column6:
I am Kaku-san, and YOU'RE cuckoo, son!\n
Watch out or it'll cook you: sun!\n
My singing silkworm's cocoon sung!
column7:
ZenkiTN: everything about this line is a completely untranslateable joke based on names... This'll need to be workshopped, since it's meant to be bad puns and nothing actually plot-relevant.
Just for reference, "gohon to ieba ryuukakusan" is the commercial for a popular brand of throat lozenges (And they also made a jidaigeki musical). Ken Takakura (known as "Ken-san") was a beloved actor (the "Clint Eastwood of Japan") who played in many jidaigeki. Finally, Tōyama no Kin-san is another popular subject for jidaigeki. So the joke here is that Kaku-san is mentioning other short names that have a -san in them and are related to jidaigeki.
I just wrote some bad word puns that sound similar to -san for now.
Supper: Ever the funnyman, I've tried to improve on these a bit to make the connection to his name more obvious.

column5:
なんていう　ざれごとを　言って\n
黄門さまを　おなぐさめ\n
もうしあげていた　ところです
column6: Sorry, I'm trying to cheer up Koumon-sama with some wordplays.

column5:
ホッホッホ　わしが　黄門じゃ！\n
おまえが　火の勇者ジライアか！！\n
うむ　いい目をしておる！
column6:
Hoh hoh hoh! My name is Koumon!\n
You must be Ziria, the Fire Hero!\n
My, what a brave gaze in your eyes!

column5:
今　外の国から来た　大門教が\n
マサカドの　復活を　くわだて\n
ジパングを　しんりゃく　しておる！
column6: As we speak, the foreign Cult of Daimon is invading Jipang, their aim the resurrection of Masakado!

column5:
やつら　大門教は　強い！！\n
とても　われわれ　ふつうの　人間には\n
たちうち　できぬ！
column6:
They are incredibly strong!\n
Too strong for ordinary humans like us!

column5:
やつらを　たおせるのは　ジライアよ！\n
そちたち　火の勇者のみじゃ！
column6: Ziria! Only Fire Heroes such as yourself stand a chance!

column5:

column6: And so I ask you: Will you stand against the demons of the Cult of Daimon and bring peace back to our Jipang?

column5:
みんなのために\n
戦ってくれい！！
column6: I beg of you! You must fight!

column5:
ホッホッホッ　そうか！\n
大門教と　戦ってくれるか\n
さすが　火の勇者　ジライアじゃ！
column6:
Hoh hoh hoh! So you're willing to fight against the Daimonists!\n
You truly are a Fire Hero, Ziria!

column5:
すぐに　東の橋を\n
渡れるように　てはいしよう\n
そして　もうひとつ・・・
column6: I will have the eastern bridge lowered at once. And one more thing...

column5:
わが家に　２００年　つたわる宝\n
あおいの剣を　さずけよう！\n
かならず　大門教を　たおしてくれ！！
column6: I bestow upon you the Aoi Sword, handed down in my family for 200 years! Please, defeat the Daimonists once and for all!

column5: 黄門の　依頼を　引き受けた

column5:
残念じゃ！\n
この橋を　渡すことは　できんでな！\n
ゆるせよ！

A pity!\n
Then I cannot let you cross the bridge. Forgive me!

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: ボクデンの家
column6: Bokuden's House

column5:
わしが　剣の名人　ボクデンじゃ！\n
必殺剣を　ならいたくば　わしを\n
たおしてみよ！　どうだ　たたかうか？

I am Bokuden, master of the blade!\n
If you can defeat me, I will teach you a special technique! Up for a fight?

column5:

さっさと　かえれ！
column6:
Tch! Coward!\n

column5:
ジライアよ！\n
わしは　よい　デシを　もった\n
さあ　行くのじゃ！
column6:
You are a worthy pupil, Ziria!\n
Go forth, young hero!

column5: 雲切の里１
column6: Kumogiri Hamlet 1

column5:
雲切りの里の　まんなかには\n
火の一族の　石像が\n
まつってあるんですよ
column6: The statues in the middle of our hamlet represent the Fire Clan.
column7: ZenkiTN: for reference, the statues are a frog, a snake, and a slug (the "spirit animals" of Ziria, Orochimaru, and Tsunade)

ジライアさん　がんばってくださいね

Everyone here respects the Fire Clan.\n
Good luck, Ziria-san.

column5:
えっ　あんたが　ジライアさん！？\n

column6:

column5:

column7: ZenkiTN: Basically this is how you can fast travel. The "Kogama" command will let you go back to any Kumogiri Hamlet you visited.

さあ　マサカドを　たおしに　行こう！

I'm incredibly useful -- you'll see!\n
Now let's go kick Masakado's butt!

column6: Kogama, your helper, has joined your quest.

あんたを　追いかけて\n
この里に　来てるよ
column6: Kogama, one of the frogs from the Toad Hermit's place, came to our hamlet looking for you.

ピョンピョンと　とびはねて\n
まったく　どこへ　いっちまったんだ

人間思いの　よくできたやつだぜ\n
けなげに　ピョンピョンしやがってよ！
column6: He's a brave little frog. Can you believe he came all the way here on his own?

This isn't the only Kumogiri Hamlet!\n

おつくりになったんだ！

お金を　ぬすんだり

ぬすっと　みたいなことを\n

雲切の里で　ございます

待っているんですよ

かなしみに　うちふるえる\n
白シカさまの　声が　きこえるようじゃ

column7: NOTE: if we're including the original symbol in the game, we should probably explain how to say it at least once

column5:
まるで　大門教の　力を\n
誇らしげに　見せつけているようだ！\n
誰か　大門教を　やっつけてくれよ！
column6: It's so glaring, as if the Daimonists are proud of their evil! I hope someone defeats them soon!

column5:
白シカさまが\n

column6: The rock the White Deer was sealed inside is red, with a 大 (dai) symbol written on it in yellow!

column5:
まるで　大門教の　力を\n
誇らしげに　見せつけているようだ！\n
誰か　大門教を　やっつけてくれよ！
column6: It's so glaring, as if the Daimonists are proud of their evil! I hope someone defeats them soon!

I am a servant of Orochimaru-sama.\n
My master is waiting for you in Sannohe.

column5:
わたしはオロチ丸さまの使いの白ヘビ\n
オロチ丸さまが蛇泉洞でお待ちです\n
行ってください
column6: I am the White Snake, messenger of Orochimaru-sama. The master is waiting for you inside the Snake Spring Cave.
column7: ZenkiTN: in this old version, the cave is called "Snake Spring Cave", but it was renamed to "Snake Hermit Cave" in the final version.

column5:
ここは通すわけにはいかない\n
チューイ　米沢の新しい城主\n
仁木弾正様の命令だ
column6:
(FWEEET)\n
By order of Nikki Danjou, new lord of Yonezawa, none shall pass!

column5:
チューイ　チューイ\n
ここは通行止めだ\n
チューイ　チューイ
column6:
(FWEEET) (FWEEET)\n
This road is closed!\n
(FWEEET) (FWEEET)

column5:
きれいな顔の剣士が\n
通って行きましたが\n
知り合いですか
column6: A beautiful swordsman just passed through. Do you know him?

column5:
戦のためここはまもなく封鎖される\n
この国には帰ってこれないだろうが\n
それでもいいなら通ってよろしい
column6: The road will be sealed off soon due to the war. You may pass now, but you won't be able to come back.

column5:
北の国　陸奥（むつ）で\n
地震がありました
column6: There was an earthquake in Mutsu, north of the country.

column5:
十三（とさ）港の町が\n
津波におそわれました
column6: The port town of Tosa was hit by a tsunami.

column5: 猫魔ヶ岳
column6: Nekomagatake

column5:
あっ！\n
こいつ白目むいてやがる！\n
いがいとなさけない奴だなぁ・・・
column6: Look! He fainted! How pathetic.

column5:
ぶぉぶぁぁぁぁん・・・・\n
やった！　ホテイ丸エライ！
column6:
Bwobwan...\n
Yay! Hoteimaru is great!
column7: ZenkiTN: not sure what kind of noise that's supposed to be, but this is unused anyway.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　ガマの油が　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is toad oil inside.

column5: ガマの油を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Toad Oil.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　金　５０両が　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There are 両50 inside.

column5: 金　５０両を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained 両50.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　なにも　入っていなかった
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is nothing inside.

column5: タヌキの洞
column6: Tanuki Cave

column5:
ごめんなさい！　ポン！\n
もう　しません！\n
ゆるして　ください！
column6:
I'm so sorry, pon!\n
I won't do bad things anymore!\n
Please forgive meeee!

column5:
アッカンベー！\n
また　だまされた\n
おぼえてろ！　ボケめ！　ポンポコリン
column6:
Bleeeh! Fooled ya!\n
See you, moron! Ponpokorin!

column5:
あなたは　心の　やさしい\n
勇者だと　きいています\n
ゆるしてください！　シクシク
column6: You're supposed to be a hero, brave and kind! You must forgive me! Sob sob!

column5: 大ダヌキを　ゆるした
column6: You forgave the Oodanuki.

column5: 雲切の里２
column6: Kumogiri Hamlet 2

column5:
ジライアさん\n
ここは　雲切の里２です
column6: Ziria-san, this is Kumogiri Hamlet 2.

column5:
雲切のおやぶんが\n
宿の中で　お待ちです
column6: Chief Kumogiri is waiting for you inside the inn.

column5:
雲切の　おやぶんは　ふたたび\n
マサカドが　復活し\n
火の一族が　立ち上がる日が
column6: Chief Kumogiri founded Kumogiri Hamlets all over the country as beacons of justice,

column5:
来るやもしれんと　全国に\n
雲切の里という　正義のとりでを\n
おつくりに　なられたのさ！
column6: in case Masakado were to return and the Fire Clan rise up against him!

column5:
雲切のおやぶんは　あんたみたいに\n
火の一族の　血は　ひいてないけど\n
正義の心は　少しも　おとらないぜ！
column6: Chief Kumogiri may not be a descendant of the Fire Clan like you, but none can deny his love for justice!

column5:
大門教が　巣喰う　水戸町は\n
この里の　北の湖の　むこう側だ
column6: The Daimonists are using Mito Town as their base. It's just north from here, beyond the lake.

column5:
あの町は　大門教が　入ってから\n
なんだか　人のようすが\n
かわっちまった！！
column6: Everyone there has been acting weird ever since!

column5:
どうやら　水戸町は\n
もとどおりに　なったみたいですね
column6: Mito Town is finally back to normal.

column5:
黄門さまを　追い出して\n
水戸城を　占領した\n
大門教のボスは　ゴーモンって名だ！
column6: Koumon-sama was kicked out of Mito Castle by Goumon, one of the heads of the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
名前の通り　人を　拷問するのが\n
三度のメシより　好きらしい\n
なんて　エグいやつだ！
column6: He's a violent man who loves torturing people!
column7: ZenkiTN: the original line says "just like his name implies". That's because "Goumon" and "torture" (拷問, goumon) have the same pronunciation.

column5:
大門教に　入れば\n
不老不死に　なれるといって\n
信者を　集めているらしい
column6: It seems the Cult of Daimon is gathering believers by telling them that if they join, they can become immortal.

column5:
ジライアさまで　ごぜえますか\n
雲切のおやぶんさんは\n
あなたが来るのを　待ちわびています
column6: Chief Kumogiri has been expecting you, Ziria-sama.

column5:
ご自分の　あみだした技を\n
ジライアさまに　さずけるんだと\n
たいそうな　ハリキリようですよ
column6: He looks forward to teaching you one of the techniques he designed!

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
あんたは　小さかったから\n
おぼえてないかも　しれないけどさ
column6: You were probably too young to remember, but...

column5:
雲切のおやぶんも\n
あんたみたいに　ガマ仙人の元に\n
いたことが　あるらしいよ
column6: Chief Kumogiri was once a pupil of the Toad Hermit, just like you.

column5:
雲切のおやぶんは　ガキのあんたを\n
ひとめ見て　あんたが　将来\n
火の勇者になると　確信したらしいよ
column6: Apparently, when you were very young, he took one look at you and concluded that one day you'd become a Fire Hero.

column5:
おお　やっと　来たか　ジライア！！\n
おれだよ　雲切だ！！\n
ずいぶん　りっぱに　なったもんだ！
column6:
Here you are, Ziria!\n
It's me, Kumogiri!\n
You've really grown!

column5:
あんたが　火の勇者として\n
大門教の　デーモンたちと　戦うなら\n
かならずや　ちからになるぜ！！
column6: If you're going up against the demons of the Cult of Daimon, I'll be behind you all the way!

column5:
ガマ仙人との　約束なんだ！！\n
だが　それだけじゃねえ！！\n
大門教のやつらが　ゆるせねえのさ！！
column6: Not just because I promised the Toad Hermit, but because those damn Daimonists have crossed the line!

column5:
人の弱味に　つけこんで　信者にさせ\n
あげくに　たましいを　ぬき取るなど\n
まったく　ヒデエ　話だぜ！！
column6: They exploit people's weaknesses to turn them into their followers, and then they take their souls! They're utter slime!

column5:
それを　なんとか　できるのは\n
ジライア！！　火の勇者である\n
あんたしか　いませんぜ！！
column6: Ziria! Only you, a Fire Hero, can put an end to their evil!

column5:
さあ　おれの　あみだした技を\n
おしえよう！！\n
戦いのとき　使ってくだせえ！
column6:
Allow me to teach you a technique of my own design.\n
You can use it in battle!

column5:
ジライアは\n
「ぬすむ」の技を　おぼえた！
column6: Ziria has learned how to steal!

column5:
あんたが　火の勇者として\n
大門教の　デーモンたちと　戦うなら\n
かならずや　ちからになるぜ！！
column6: If you're going up against the demons of the Cult of Daimon, I'll be behind you all the way!

column5:
ガマ仙人との　約束なんだ！！\n
だが　それだけじゃねえ！！\n
大門教のやつらが　ゆるせねえのさ！！
column6: Not just because I promised the Toad Hermit, but because those damn Daimonists have crossed the line!

column5:
人の弱味に　つけこんで　信者にさせ\n
あげくに　たましいを　ぬき取るなど\n
まったく　ヒデエ　話だぜ！！
column6: They exploit people's weaknesses to turn them into their followers, and then they take their souls! They're utter slime!

column5:
それを　なんとか　できるのは\n
ジライア！！　火の勇者である\n
あんたしか　いませんぜ！！
column6: Ziria! Only you, a Fire Hero, can put an end to their evil!

column5:
雲切のおやぶんの　命令で\n
水戸城に　しのびこんで\n
今　けえってきたところなんだ
column6: Chief Kumogiri ordered me to infiltrate Castle Mito. I just got back.

column5:
どうやら　水戸城の地下には\n
ばんもう国に　ぬける道が\n
あるらしいんだよ
column6: Apparently, there's a secret path to the lands of Banmou under the castle.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両5 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両5 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: 賭場
column6: Gambling Den

column5:
ジライアさん　じゃないですかぁ！\n
こんな所で　遊んでいて　いいんですか\n
まっ　たまには　息ぬきしないとね
column6:
My, if it isn't Ziria-san!\n
Should you really be here?\n
Eh, I guess it's fine every once in a while!

column5:
ツボふりの　ネエちゃん　きれいだろ！\n
もう　ちょっとで\n
見えそう　なんだけどなあ！！
column6:
The dice lady is a real babe!\n
When I play, I'm not exactly looking at the dice, if you catch my drift!
column7: ZenkiTN: the more literal translation is "A little more and I can almost see it", assumedly about her breasts. I only changed it because it sounded awkward, but considering how much I strayed from the original line I figured I should mention it. Keep in mind this line is repeated in all gambling dens.

column5:
二つの　サイコロの目を　たして\n
偶数なら　「丁」で\n
奇数なら　「半」だ！
column6:
It's a simple game!\n
Just bet whether the sum of the two dice will be even or odd!

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 盗人訓練所
column6: Thieving School

column5:
ここは　大門教を　やっつけるために\n
ぬすっとを　養成する\n
通称　ぬすっと訓練所です！！
column6: This is a Thieving School, where you can improve your thievery in order to help defeat the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
奥の　部屋に　入って\n
教官を　よけて\n
つづらの中の　お金を　とるんです！
column6: Head inside, avoid the instructors, and steal the money from the casket!

column5:
みごと　お金を　とることに\n
成功したら\n
そのお金は　あなたのものです！
column6: If you can steal the money successfully, you get to keep it for yourself!

column5:
まあ　遊びだと　おもって\n
気軽に　たのしんでくださいよ！\n
だけど　マサカド打倒も　お忘れなく！
column6:
Think of it as a game and have fun!\n
But don't forget your quest to defeat Masakado!

column5: 水戸町
column6: Mito Town

column5:
ここは　水戸町です\n
大門教の　おかげで\n
みんな　幸せに　くらしているんです
column6:
This is Mito Town.\n
Thanks to the Cult of Daimon, we can all live happy lives.

column5:
ポンポコリン！\n
ごめんなさい　ジライアさん
column6:
Ponpokorin!\n
Forgive us, Ziria-san!

column5:
大門教は　とても　ありがてえだよ\n
病気が　なおったり　若返ったり\n
この世の　苦しみから　開放されるだよ
column6: The Cult of Daimon is fantastic. It heals all sicknesses, restores your youth, and frees you from all the world's ills!

column5:
水戸町を　西に出て　南へ行った山に\n
おらたちの　守り神\n
白ダヌキさまが　おるだよ
column6: Go west from Mito Town and head south, and you'll find the mountain where our guardian deity, the White Tanuki, lives.

column5:
教会に　行って　洗礼を受ければ\n
だれでも　大門教に　入会できるのさ\n
あんたも　早く　行くといいよ！
column6: Anyone can become a Daimonist. You simply need to go to the church and get baptized. You should go right now!

column5:
胎内洞の中には\n
成仏できない　たましいが\n
ウヨウヨ　している　そうです
column6: I heard Innards Grotto is swarming with the souls of those who can't be reborn into this world.

column5:
あー　だめだめ！　だめだ！！\n
大門教じゃなければ　ここから先は\n
入っちゃだめだ！　下がって　！！
column6:
No, no, no! Stop right there!\n
Only Daimonists may pass through here! Turn back at once!

column5:
町の人は　みんな　ゴーモンに\n
つかまって　城の地下に\n
閉じ込められているんです
column6: Goumon has thrown all of the town's residents in the dungeons of Mito Castle.

column5:
根性の　曲がった連中は\n
水戸城の　ゴーモンさまが\n
城の地下で　なおしているんだよ
column6: Those who won't join the Cult of Daimon are being {convinced} by Goumon-sama in Mito Castle's dungeons.

column5:
大門教は　マサカドを\n
復活させるために　町の人の\n
たましいを　ぬきとっているんだ！！
column6: The Daimonists are stealing the souls of the townspeople and using them to revive Masakado!

column5:
この町の人は　みんな親切だろ\n
大門教に入って\n
悪い心が　洗われたおかげだよ
column6:
The people of this town are so kind.\n
It's because the Cult of Daimon has washed away the evil in their hearts!

column5:
ポンポコリン！\n
胎内洞から　次の国　ばんもう国へ\n
ぬけることが　できるだよ
column6:
Ponpokorin!\n
Go through Innards Grotto and you'll reach the next country, Banmou!

column5:
神父さまが　城への通行を\n
とめているので　大門教徒以外は\n
通すわけには　いきません
column6: The head priest has sealed the path to the castle. Only Daimonists can go through.

column5:
くそーっ！　大門教め\n
オラ　おこったぞ\n
赤いキツネと　いかりのタヌキ！
column6:
Damn those Daimonists!\n
Stick a fork in me 'cause I'm so done with them!
column7: ZenkiTN: the original line makes a reference to a series of commercials for a brand of instant noodles by Toyo Suisan, "Akai Kitsune" and "Midori no Tanuki". The line here is "Akai kitsune to ikari no tanuki". Of course it's completely untranslateable. It only makes sense because the speaker is a tanuki. I'm only mentioning this because I removed the reference in the translation.

column5: ありがとうねっ！
column6: Thank you so much!

column5:
水戸町の人たちは　みんな\n
根性が　曲がっていたので\n
城の地下へ　連れて行かれたんだ！
column6: The people of Mito Town have been taken to the castle's dungeons to get {fixed}!

column5:
ゴーモンさまに　たましいを\n
入れ替えて　もらえば\n
まともな　大門教徒に　なれるぞ！！
column6: Once Goumon-sama replaces their souls, they'll become faithful Daimonists!

column5:
町の人は　みんな　ゴーモンに\n
つかまって　城の地下に\n
閉じ込められているんです
column6: Goumon has thrown all of the town's residents in the dungeons of Mito Castle.

column5:
ゴーモンさまが　守ってくださるので\n
ホンに　この村は　平和なのじゃ\n
ありがたや　ありがたや
column6:
Our town is peaceful thanks to Goumon-sama's protection.\n
We are eternally grateful.

column5: ごめんなさい　ごめんなさい
column6: I'm sorry! I'm sorry!

column5:
えらそうな　黄門たちが　いなくなって\n
せいせいしたよ！　カクの野郎の\n
ダジャレには　うんざりしてたんだ！！
column6: I'm glad Koumon and his stooges are gone! I was so sick of Kaku's dreadful wordplays!

column5:
大門教は　マサカドを\n
復活させるために　町の人の\n
たましいを　ぬきとっているんだ！！
column6: The Daimonists are stealing the souls of the townspeople and using them to revive Masakado!

column5:
神父さまは　悪い人から　お城を\n
守るために　入口を　封鎖したのです\n
本当に　かしこい　お方だ！！
column6:
The head priest sealed the way to the castle to protect it from bad guys!\n
How ingenious!

column5: 預かり所
column6: Warehouse

column5:
これは　これは　いらっしゃいませ\n
親切　ていねい　責任第一がモットーの\n
預かり所で　ございます
column6:
Welcome to the warehouse!\n
Our motto is {Courtesy, kindness, and professionalism}!

column5:
今日は　なんのご用でしょうか？\n
どの品でも　責任を　もって\n
お預かりさせていただきます
column6:
How can I help you, friend?\n
I'll take good care of your items!

column5:
ありゃ！　あんた　大門教じゃないのか\n
ばかやろう！　気を使って　損したぜ！\n
とっとと　失せろ　このやろう！
column6:
What? You're not in the Cult of Daimon?\n
Get outta here, moron! I hope you lose all your stuff!

column5:
胎内洞へ　行く前に　とらわれている\n
村人たちを　助けてやってくださいね\n
とくに　若い女を　先にね・・・
column6:
Please save the villagers before you go through Innards Grotto.\n
Especially the young ladies...

column5: 武具屋
column6: Armory

column5:
いらしゃいませ！！\n
ここは　武具屋で　ございます
column6: Welcome to the armory!

column5:
ゴーモンの剣は　いかがでございますか\n
なめらかな切れ味で　大門教に\n
さからう連中は　まっぷたつですよ！
column6: May I interest you in this Goumon Sword? It will cleave in half anyone foolish enough to oppose the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
定価１００両のところを\n
特別価格５０００００００００両で\n
大門教以外のかたにも　ごほうし中です
column6: It's usually 両100, but we have a special price of 両5,000,000,000 for non-members of the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
今　お買い上げの　かたには\n
ゴーモンちゃん人形を　プレゼント！\n
お買い求めは　お早目にどうぞ！
column6: Buy now, and I'll throw in a Goumon-chan doll for free! It's a limited edition!

column5:
水戸町を　西に出て　南へ行った山に\n
おらたちの　守り神\n
白ダヌキさまが　おるだよ
column6: Go west from Mito Town and head south, and you'll find the mountain where our guardian deity, the White Tanuki, lives.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　武具屋です\n
ご用件は　何ですか？
column6:
Welcome to my armory!\n
How can I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それでは　また　ご利用ください
column6: Come back anytime.

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
は？　おとまりですか？\n
よろしいですよ\n
いい部屋も　空いております！
column6:
Huh? You wanna stay?\n
Sure, I have a room, just for you!

column5:
５０００００００両ですが・・・\n
えっ！　ない\n
それじゃ　とめられないね！！
column6:
It's 両50,000,000 for the night...\n
What? You ain't got that much?\n

column5:

胎内洞から　次の国　ばんもう国へ\n
ぬけることが　できるだよ

Ponpokorin!\n
Go through Innards Grotto and you'll reach the next country, Banmou!

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます

column5:
ひと晩　１５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両15 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　１５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両15 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！

Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
火の勇者が　大門教に　さからってるが\n
そんなやつらは　ゴーモンさまが\n
きっと　やっつけてくれる
column6:
Can you believe that the self-proclaimed {Fire Hero} actually thinks he can defeat the Cult of Daimon?
#BOXPAUSE()
Goumon-sama will surely put an end to him in no time!

大門教が　ジパングを　征服したら\n
タヌキ王国を　つくってやるといわれて\n
つい　だまされて　しまったんです！
column6: The Cult of Daimon claimed they would establish the Tanuki Kingdom after conquering Jipang!

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
おめえ　大門教徒じゃないな！\n
そんな野郎に　ウチの　しきいを\n
またいでもらいたくねえな　ケッ！
column6:
What? You're not a Daimonist?\n
Leave at once! You're stinking up the place! Hmph!

column5:
胎内洞は\n
人間の内ぞうに　そっくりな\n
気味の悪い　洞くつです
column6: Innards Grotto is called that because it's a nasty cavern that's like the inside of a human body.

column5:
洞くつの中は\n
粘液で　ベトベトしてるんです！
column6:
That cave is filled with sticky mucus!\n
It's so gross!

column5: 大門教会
column6: Daimon Church

column5:
わたし　この　大門教会の　神父です\n
あなた　大門教　信じますか？
column6: I am the head priest of the Daimon church. Are you a faithful believer?

column5:
ばかめー！　ジライア！\n
また　だまされたな\n
大マヌケの　ポンポコリン！！
column6:
Hah! Fooled you again!\n
You're so gullible, Ziria!\n
Ponpokorin!

column5:
すこし　りこうに　なったな！\n
こんどは　負けないぞ　ポン！
column6:
Well, well, aren't you clever?\n
But you won't beat me THIS time, pon!

column5:
信ずる　ものは　すくわれる！\n
神父さまに　洗礼を　受けなさい
column6:
Only the faithful shall be saved!\n
Let the head priest baptize you!

column5:
水戸城から　救出していただいた\n
村人の　人数は　全部で\n
なんと　３０人も　いたんですよ！！
column6: Can you believe it? We rescued a total of thirty people from Mito Castle!

column5:
あんな　せまい部屋に\n
ジライアさんを　入れて\n
３１人も　いたんですね
column6: Counting you, there were thirty-one people inside that cramped room, Ziria-san!

column5:
大門教　バンザイ！\n
ゴーモンさまに　栄光あれ！！
column6:
Glory to Goumon-sama!\n
Long live the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
ここを　てらこやに\n
改築しようと　思っています
column6: I'm considering converting this building into an elementary school.
column7: ZenkiTN: a "terakoya" is a buddhist temple that provides basic education for commoners.

column5:
お城に　入れるように　しておきます\n
城の　地下にいる　ゴーモンを\n
やっつけて　くださいね！！
column6: I'll have the way to the castle opened for you. Please, go to the dungeons and defeat Goumon once and for all!
column7: ZenkiTN: these two lines are also used in the boss battle.

column5:
おらたちは　山に　もどって\n
ひっそりと　オーエンします\n
ポンポコリン！
column6: We'll return to the mountains and cheer for you in secret. Ponpokorin!
column7: ZenkiTN: these two lines are also used in the boss battle.

column5:
ゴーモンは　町の人たちを\n
城の地下へ　とじこめているんです\n
どうか　助けてあげてください
column6:
Goumon is holding the townspeople captive in the castle's dungeons.\n
Please, save them!

column5:
ポンポコリン！\n
ごめんなさい！　ごめんなさい！\n
もう　人をだましたりは　しません
column6:
Ponpokorin!\n
I'm sorry! I'm sorry!\n
I'll stop tricking people!

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
いらっしゃい！\n
ここは　よろず屋だよ
column6: Welcome to my general store!

column5:
人の　たましいなら\n
高く　引き取らせてもらうよ！
column6: I'll pay premium prices if you've got human souls for me!

とくに　この世に　恨みつらみのある\n
たましいは　ゴーモンさまが\n
いい値で　買ってくださるんだ
column6: See, Goumon-sama pays good money for the souls of those with a grudge against the world.

column5:
町の人は　みんな　ゴーモンに\n
つかまって　城の地下に\n
閉じ込められているんです
column6: Goumon has thrown all of the town's residents in the dungeons of Mito Castle.

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5:
赤字で　「大」と　しるされた\n
がっちりとした　鉄のとびらが　ある\n
カギが　かかっている
column6:
There is an iron door with a 大 symbol painted on it in red.\n
The door is locked.

column5:
赤字で　「大」と　しるされた\n
がっちりとした　鉄のとびらが　ある
column6: There is an iron door with a 大 symbol painted on it in red.

column5: 鉄のとびらが　開いた
column6: You open the iron door.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　鉄のカギが　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is an iron key inside.

column5: 鉄のカギを　手に入れた\n
column6: Obtained Iron Key.\n

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　なにも　入っていなった
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is nothing inside.

column5: 水戸城
column6: Mito Castle

column5:
ホッホッホ　わしじゃ　黄門じゃ！\n
まことに　あっぱれじゃ　ジライア殿\n
よくぞ　水戸城を　取り返してくれた
column6:
Hoh hoh hoh! It is I, Koumon!\n
Thanks to you, Ziria-dono, I've finally returned to Mito Castle.

しかし　ゴーモンは　大門教１３人衆の\n
ひとりに　すぎない・・・まだまだ\n
各地で　人々が　くるしんでおる

平和を　取り戻してくれい！！

column7: NOTE: the first of many many repetitions of the mantra 勇気と愛と根性. or maybe it's 愛と勇気と根性, they're not consistent with the order.

column5:
ジライア殿\n
このたびの　ごかつやく\n
おみごとでした！
column6: Your skills never fail to impress, Ziria-dono!

column5:
黄門さまも　およろこびの　ご様子！\n
水戸の町では　ジライア殿の\n
おウワサで　もちきりです
column6: Koumon-sama is always delighted to hear about your exploits. In fact, you're the hottest topic in Mito!

column5: ポンポコリン！
column6: Ponpokorin!

column5:
なーんてね\n
わたしは　なにも　カクさんです！\n
ジライア殿　ありがとう！！
column6:
Just kidding!\n
I am Kaku-san, and YOU'RE cuckoo, son!\n
Thank you so much, Ziria-dono!

column5: 水戸城
column6: Mito Castle

column5: 水戸城
column6: Mito Castle

column5:
ヒー！　こんなところに　ずっと\n
いるくらいなら　さっさと　たましいを\n
ぬかれた方が・・いいわきゃねえだろ
column6:
Argh! Too many people!\n
I wish they'd take my soul away already!\n
...Okay, not really.

column5:
こんな　せまいところに\n
押し込まれていた　私たちの\n
気持ち　わかりますか？
column6: Do you have any idea how it feels to be crammed into such a small room?

column5:
おお！　やっと　村に帰れる！\n
とにかく　腹がへった！　よし！\n
帰ったら　タヌキじるを　くってやる
column6:
Can we go back home? I'm starving!\n
I could go for some tanuki soup right now!

column5:
だから　おれは　大門教に\n
入ろうといったのに\n
カミさんが　ガンコなもんだから
column6:
See, I knew we couldn't trust these Daimonists, but did my wife listen?\n
Noooo way!

column5:
いやあ　たすかりました！\n
こんなところでは　はずかしくて\n
１０日も　ウンコ　してないんですよ！
column6: You saved us all! I mean it! It's a bit embarrassing to admit, but I haven't pooped in ten days!

column5:
このままでは　今まで　ゴーモンに\n
たましいを　うばわれた　人たちが\n
うかばれません！！
column6: Goumon must be stopped, or those whose souls have been stolen will never rest in peace!

column5:
あんたも　ゴーモンに　たまいしいを\n
ぬかれちまうのさ・・これも\n
運命だと　おもって　あきらめな！
column6:
Goumon will steal your soul too...\n
Just give up and accept your fate!

column5:
えーと　ににんが５！　にさんが９！\n
にく１２！　よし！　正常だ！\n
たましいは　ぬかれていないな
column6:
Let's see...Two twos are five!\n
Three twos are nine! Nine twos are twelve!
#BOXPAUSE()
All good! I still have my soul!

column5:
ゴーモンは　村人に　化けさせた\n
タヌキを　使って　村々を\n
支配しているんだ
column6: Goumon swaps real people with shapeshifted tanuki to take over towns!

column5:
神も　仏も　ないのか\n
こんなところで　たましいを\n
とられるなんて！！
column6:
Is there no God to help us?\n
I don't want to lose my soul!

column5:
助けてくだせえ　おねげえしますだ！\n
たましいなんか　とられたら\n
命が　死んでしまうべさ！！
column6:
Help us, please!\n
We'll die without our souls!

column5:
ゴーモンの　拷問は　おそろしい\n
たましいを　ぬいてしまうんだ\n
おらぁ　そんなの　イヤだッペ！！
column6: Goumon's torture is so vicious that you literally lose your soul...I shudder to think of it!

column5:
この下は　胎内洞っていうんだ\n
ゴーモンがなあ　人間の　たましい\n
ぬきとっちまう　ところなんだぜ
column6: You'll find Innards Grotto down below. That's where Goumon steals people's souls!

column5:
こわい！　こわい！\n
拷問の絶叫の　しゅんかんに\n
スッと　たましいを　ぬきとるんだ
column6:
I'm scared! I'm scared!\n
Goumon snatches your soul the moment you scream during torture!

column5:
かいだんを　おりると\n
胎内洞に　入っちまうぜ！\n
たましいを　ぬかれても　しらねえよ
column6: Take the stairs down and you'll be inside Innards Grotto. Watch out for your soul!

column5:
胎内洞を　ぬけると\n
となりの　ばんもう国へ　行けるが\n
ゴーモンが　いるから　ムリだろうな
column6: Banmou is beyond Innards Grotto, but good luck getting there with Goumon blocking the way!

column5:
オラオラ　どいた！　どいた！\n
じゃまな　やつだぜ　まったく！！
column6:
Get out of the way!\n
This place is cramped enough as it is!

column5:
あなたが　ゴーモンを\n
たおしに　いくわけ？\n
命を　粗末にしちゃ　ダメじゃないの？
column6:
What? You're gonna fight Goumon?\n
Hey, it's your funeral!

column5:
いやあねえ！　あなた　いま\n
わたしの　おしり　さわったでしょう？\n
ウソついても　だめよ！
column6:
H-Hey! Did you just touch my butt?!\n
Don't you lie to me!

column5:
さあ　ここで　モンダイです！\n

せーの　ハウマッチ！？
column6: Come on down! You're the next contestant! How many people are in this room?

column5:
イ、２９人　ロ、３０人　ハ、３１人\n
ニ、３２人　ホ、３３人　ヘ、３５人\n
さあ　みんなで考えよう〜！
column6:
Is it 29? Is it 30? Or is it 31?\n
Could it be 32? 33? Maybe even 35!\n
Can you guess?

column5:
答えは　水戸町の中に　あります\n
あるあるあるあるあるアル！\n
トラブル　チャンス！！
column6: Closest without going over wins! To find out the answer, ask around in Mito Town!
column7:
ZenkiTN: these three lines are a reference to an 80s game show called "世界まるごとHOWマッチ" as well as a quiz show called "クイズ100人に聞きました". The first one is about curious things from foreign countries and guessing their price, while the second one is about guessing the answer as surveyed by 100 people. I think their western equivalent are "The Price is Right" and "Family Feud" (in fact, I confirmed the second one was based on Family Feud). The problem is that I don't know those shows well enough to know which memorable quotes would be in them. Keep this in mind during editing if you want to make this irrelevant reference closer to its intended meaning.
Supper: well, I ignored the two gameshows that weren't Family Feud when I localized the parody show in Yuna 2, so I guess it's only fair to drop Family Feud this time...

column5:
ゴーモンの　しうちは　なんてひどいの\n
私たちが　どんな苦しみを　味わったか\n
おもいしらせて　やりたいわ
column6:
Goumon is treating us like cattle...\n
I'd like him to feel our pain one of these days.

column5:
しくしく・・・\n
大門教は　私たちのたましいを\n
マサカドの復活に　使うんですって
column6: (sob) The Daimonists will use our souls to revive Masakado...

column5:
ここはどこ？　わたしは　だあれ？\n
あなたは　何しにきたの？\n
まだ　たましいは　ぬかれてないわね
column6:
Where are we? Who am I?\n
What are you doing here?\n
You still have your soul, don't you?

column5:
おねがいします！　私のことは\n
いいですから　子供たちだけでも\n
助けてやってください！！
column6:
Don't worry about me!\n
Save the children, I beg you!

column5:
ゴーモンを　たおせるのは　もう\n
あなたしか　いません！\n
どうか　おねがいします
column6:
Only you can defeat Goumon!\n
Help us, Ziria! You're our only hope!

column5:
ゴーモンは　この地下にある\n
胎内洞で　みんなの\n
たましいを　ぬいているのよ！
column6: Goumon is down below, inside Innards Grotto. That's where he steals people's souls!

column5:
拷問なんて・・・シクシク\n
ぜったいに　いやよ・・・シクシク\n
私　いっときますけど　嫁入り前なのよ

Th-They can't torture me!\n
I'm not even married yet!

column5:

おにいちゃん　絶対に\n

column6:
You'll help us, right?\n
Please, beat that nasty Goumon!

column5:
大門教に入ると　不老不死だなんて\n
そんなの　大ウソさ！\n

column5:
この国を　支配する　つもりなんだ\n
みんな　まだ　そのことに\n

column5:
大門教に　入会しなかったといって\n
こうして　とじこめてしまうなんて\n
あまりにも　ひどいよ！
column6:
They locked us in here because we wouldn't join the Cult of Daimon!\n

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　１００両が　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There are 両100 inside.

column5: 金　１００両を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained 両100.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　ガマの油が　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is toad oil inside.

column5: ガマの油を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Toad Oil.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　なにも　入っていなかった
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is nothing inside.

column5: 胎内洞
column6: Innards Grotto

column5:
うう〜　苦しいよ〜\n
はやく　楽にしてくれ〜
column6:
Urgh...I'm suffering...\n
Please, deliver me from this pain...

column5:
死ぬほど　拷問されてよ\n
恐怖が　絶頂になった　しゅんかんに\n
たましいを　引きぬかれた！

I was tortured to death...\n
The moment your fear is at its peak, you lose your soul!

column5:
人の　恨みや　憎しみの　こもった\n
たましいほど　マサカドは\n
よろこぶって　いうんだ
column6: Masakado delights in souls filled with regret and hatred...

column5:
ここにいる　たましいは　みんな\n
マサカドに　喰われちまうんだ\n
つぎは　おれの番かもしれない
column6: Masakado consumes the souls that end up here...It could be my turn next...

column5:
ゴーモンを　たおして\n
はやく　わたしたちを\n
もとの姿に　もどしてください！
column6: Please, defeat Goumon and bring us back!

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
わたしは　毎日　教会に\n
お祈りに　行っています\n
そのおかげで　ハゲが　なおりました！
column6:
I go to church every day to pray.\n
As a result, I'm no longer bald!

column5:
ゴーモンは　きっと　胎内洞で\n
あなたを　まちかまえています！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさん！
column6:
Goumon must be waiting for you inside Innards Grotto!\n
Be careful, Ziria-san!

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
黄門の野郎は　ゴーモンさまに\n
城を　追ん出されて　いまごろ　どこで\n
泣いてることやら・・・へっへっへ！
column6: That Koumon fool has been driven out of the castle by Goumon-sama. Bet he's off crying in some shack. Heh heh heh!

column5:
黄門さまは　ゴーモンの野郎に\n
城を　追われて　いまごろ\n
どうしていらっしゃることやら・・・
column6:
Koumon-sama has been driven out of the castle by that Goumon fool.\n
I hope he's well...

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
への一族とかいう　きたならしい連中が\n
大門教に　さからってるんだ\n
まったく　バカにつける薬は　ないぜ！

I heard some {Failure Clan} is rising up against the Cult of Daimon!\n
There's really no cure for idiocy!

column5:
ジライアさん　ごめんなさい\n
火の一族の　勇者として\n
がんばってください

I'm sorry for my harsh words, Ziria-san.\n
Keep up the good fight as the hero of the Fire Clan.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
わははは！　大門教に　入ったおかげで\n
毎日　遊びほうけて　暮らせるんだ！\n
仕事なんて　やりたくねーもんな！

column5:

ジパングを　守ってください\n
ジライアさん！！

Jipang is our home.\n
Please protect it, Ziria-san!

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
大門教を　悪くいう　ふとどきものは\n
ゴーモンさまに　性根を\n
たたき　なおしてもらえば　いいんだ
column6: Goumon-sama should beat the crap out of those fools who speak ill of the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
胎内洞へ　行く前に　とらわれている\n
村人たちを　助けてやってくださいね\n
とくに　若い女を　先にね・・・

Please save the villagers before you go through Innards Grotto.\n
Especially the young ladies...

I almost lost my disguise when you were staring at me!

ごゆっくり　どうぞ

きろく　しますか\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません

Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n

大門教って　インチキなのが　はやって\n
クスリが　売れなくて　まいったぜ

I'm a medicine peddler.\n
I'm having a hard time getting business because of those nasty Daimonists.

column6: House

column5:
ー　ガッチリした　大きな　つづらだ\n
　　　　　　カギが　かかっている　ー
column6:
There is a large, sturdy casket here.\n
It's locked shut.

column5: ー　中で　ゴトゴト　音がする　ー
column6: A rumbling noise comes from within.

column5:
オー！　マイ　ゴッド！！　助かったよ！\n
ワタシ　ホンモノ　ホテイ丸です\n
あんたは　ジライアさん　デスか？
column6:
OH MY GOD! You saved me!\n
I'm the real Hoteimaru.\n
Are you Ziria-san?

column5:
ジライアさん　つれてきて　クダサイ！\n
大事な　ハナシ　あります！
column6:
Ziria-san, let me come with you!\n
I must talk to you!

column5:
おお！　ジライアさん！！　まってたのヨ！\n
大門教　デーモンたちネ！\n
とても　ワルいやつだヨ
column6:
Oh, Ziria-san! I've been waiting for you!\n
The Daimonist demons are very bad!

column5:
デーモン　すごい部下　１３人つれ\n
つぎは　ジパングね！！\n
マサカドの霊力　つかう　つもりね
column6: They have many followers and thirteen leaders! They want to conquer Jipang to revive Masakado!

column5:
あなた　勇者！　あいつ　やっつけるネ！\n
わたしも　いきます
column6:
You are the hero! You will beat them!\n
I'll come with you!

column5: あんたは　ジライアさん　デスか？
column6: Are you Ziria-san?

column5:
オゥ！　忘れるところデシタ・・・\n
コレ　つづらのなかにおちていました\n
わたし　コレいらないから
column6:
Oh, I almost forgot!\n
This was inside the casket.\n
I don't need it.

column5: 自来也さんに　あげます
column6: You can have it.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
ふるい　伝説に　よると\n
火の一族の　勇者たちが　玉の力で\n
マサカドの霊を　封じたとさ
column6: According to an old legend, the heroes of the Fire Clan sealed the soul of Masakado with the power of their orbs.

column5:
勇者は　３人・・・\n
玉は　３つ・・・・
column6:
There are three heroes...\n
And three orbs...

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5: いらっしゃい
column6: Welcome.

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: 少しは遊んだほうがいいよ！ボク！

column6: Namazu Shrine
column7: ZenkiTN: I'm guessing this is unused. This feels like an older version of the Kinta the Tanuki event from the early game.

column5:
わたし　チョット　つかれたデスヨ！\n
自来也さん　わたし　休みたいデス！
column6:
I'm tired!\n
Ziria-san, let me rest!

column5:
バカめー！　ジライア！！ポコポン！！\n
やっと村をはなれ　ふたりになったポン\n
大門教のおそろしさ　みせてやるポン！
column6:
You're a fool, Ziria! Pon pon! I led you away from the village, pon!
#BOXPAUSE()
This is what happens when you oppose the Daimonists, pon!

column5:
\n
ところで　かちましたか？
column6:
\n
So, did you win?

column5:
バカめ！　また　ノコノコ　きたな\n
おとなしく　つくば山でねてろポン！\n
ところで　かちましたか？
column6:
Hah! Back for more?\n
You shoulda stayed in Mount Tsukuba!\n
So, did you win?

column5:
オレは　大タヌキ様の　子分だ\n
ホテイ丸は　つづらに　とじこめた\n
おまえは　ここで　おわりだ　ポン！
column6:
I'm a follower of the Great Tanuki!\n
Hoteimaru is inside the casket.\n
This is your end, pon!

column5: ポン！
column6: Pon!

column5:
へへへ　大門教の　おそろしさ\n
わかったか　ポン！　バカめ　ポン！
column6: Heh heh heh! That'll teach you to mess with the Cult of Daimon! Pon!

column5:
ごめんなさい！　ポンポン！！\n
ホテイ丸は　つづらの中だポン！
column6:
I'm sorry, pon pon!\n
Hoteimaru is inside the casket, pon!

column5:
橋が　こわれていて\n
向こう側に　渡ることは　できない
column6:
The bridge is broken.\n
There is no way to reach the other side.

column5:
とても　大きな木が\n
そびえ立っている
column6: An enormous tree stands tall.

column5:
神木が　たおれて\n
向こう岸まで　届いている\n
木を伝って　渡れそうだ
column6:
The sacred tree fell.\n
Its trunk reaches the opposite shore.\n
You should be able to use it as a bridge.

column5: 磐毛国
column6: Banmou

column5:
あっ！　ジライア！\n
\n
エヘヘヘヘヘ・・・・
column6:
Ah, Ziria!\n
\n
Heeheeheehee...

column5:
ねえ　ねえ！　ジライア！\n
あの　おっさん　ヘンな名前ね！\n
外人のクセに　貝みたいな名前！
column6:
Hey, Ziria!\n
That guy had a weird name, huh?\n
Sounded kinda made-up!

column5:
えーっと　サザエ丸じゃないし\n
アサリ丸じゃないし\n
あ！　思い出した！
column6:
What was it again?\n
Hotty-maru? Otter-maru?

column5:
ホタテ丸さんだ！\n
ほんと　ヘンチクリンな　名前よね！
column6:
Oh yeah! Hotel-maru!\n
What a funny name!
column7: ZenkiTN: in the original text, Tsunade thinks Hoteimaru's name was something about seashells. She first mentions "Sazaemaru" (Sazae being a turban shell), then Asarimaru (Asari being a littleneck clam) before settling on "Hotatemaru" (Hotate being a scallop). The "Hotei" in Hoteimaru however is unrelated to shells, it's the Japanese spelling for the Budai buddha. That's why I went for something else.

column5: 雲切の里３
column6: Kumogiri Hamlet 3

column5:
あっ！　ジライヤさまだ！！\n
ばんもう国の　雲切の里３へ\n
ようこそ！！
column6: Ziria-sama! Welcome to the lands of Banmou! This is Kumogiri Hamlet 3!

column5:
大門教は　この国でも\n
かなり　勢力を　広げてきています！\n
がんばってね　ジライアさま！！
column6: The Daimonists already have great influence here! Do your best, Ziria-sama!

column5:
ツナデは　このへんじゃ\n
いちばんの\n
すげえ　力持ちなんだよ！
column6: You won't find anyone stronger than Tsunade around these parts!

column5:
村の　すもう大会で\n
大おとこを　１００人も\n
なげとばして　優勝したんだよ！
column6: We had a sumo tournament recently, and she beat a hundred opponents in a row by ring out!

column5:
この里の　北にある　ほこらに\n
ナメクジ仙人　というお方が\n
すんでいるそうですよ！
column6: The Slug Hermit lives in a small shrine north from here!

column5:
キツネが　さいきん\n
人を　おそう！！\n
どうしたことだ！！
column6: Lately, the kitsune have been attacking people! I wonder why?
column7: ZenkiTN: I went for "kitsune" because they're not just random foxes, but the ones from Japanese folklore. The same way I used "tanuki" instead of "raccoons".

column5:
この　ばんもう国の　どこかに\n
ふたりめの　火の一族の　勇者が\n
いるというウワサ　なんですよ！
column6: According to rumor, the second hero of the Fire Clan is somewhere here in Banmou!

column5:
火の勇者　３人が\n
その力を　合わせねば\n
マサカドには　立ち向かえませんぞ！
column6: The three Fire Heroes must combine their powers to stand against Masakado!

column5:
ジライアさんでしょ！\n
雲切のおやぶん　から\n
連絡を　受けていますぜ！
column6:
You must be Ziria-san!\n
Chief Kumogiri told us to expect you!

column5:
オレたちも　ジライアさんに\n
命を　あずける覚悟は\n
できてますぜ！！
column6:
We're ready to give our lives for you,\n
Ziria-san!

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
ナメクジ仙人なら\n
ふたりめの　火の勇者が　どこにいるか\n
知ってるかも　しんねえな！
column6: Maybe the Slug Hermit knows where you can find the second Fire Hero!

column5:
どえれえ　長生きしとる　そうだから\n
火の一族のことも　きっと\n
教えてくれるに　ちげえねえよ！
column6: He's lived for a long time. I'm sure he knows a thing or two about the Fire Clan!

column5:
うちの　じじいが　いうには\n
火の一族には　三つの族が\n
あったそうじゃ・・・ということは
column6: My old man told me that the Fire Clan was made of three different tribes.

column5:
ジライアさんの　ガマ族のほかに\n
火の一族には　あとふたつの　族が\n
あるっちゅう　ことかいなあ
column6: That must mean there's two other clans besides your own Toad clan, Ziria!

column5:
けったいな村　だったなあ！\n
じいさんと　ばあさんしか\n
いない村でさあ
column6:
What a weird village that was!\n
There were only old people there!

column5:
川べりの村で\n
たしか　太田村って\n
いったっけなあ
column6:
I think it was called Oota Village.\n
You'll find it along the river.
column7:
CHECK, is this said by the same NPC?
Supper: yes

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　１０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両10 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　１０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両10 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: ナメクジの洞
column6: Slug Shrine

column5:
よく来た　ジライアよ！！　\n
わしが　このほこらに　３００年　\n
住んどる　ナメクジ仙人じゃよ！！
column6:
Well met, Ziria!\n
I'm the Slug Hermit.\n
I've been living here for 300 years!

column5:
おまえの　たたかっとる　大門教は\n
ウソ　おおげさ　まぎらわしい！\n
まったくの　インチキじゃろ！
column6:
The Cult of Daimon is a sham!\n
They're nothing but liars and cheats!
column7: ZenkiTN: that "ウソ　おおげさ　まぎらわしい" is a reference to JARO (Japan Advertising Review Organization), an organization that ensures ads are not misleading (their commercial: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V8hSwbVPul0 ). I'm only noting this because I found this reference.

column5:
やつらは　人びとを　てなずけながら\n
マサカドの復活を　ねらっとる！！
column6: They fool people into becoming their followers, all for the sake of reviving Masakado!

column5:
マサカドが　復活し　やつらが\n
その力を　使えば　この国は　やつらに\n
支配されてしまう　じゃろう！！
column6: If they succeed, they'll use his power to take over the entire country!

column5:
マサカドを　封じ\n
このジパングを　すくえるのは\n
火の勇者の　３人だけなのだ！！
column6: Only the three Fire Heroes can seal Masakado and save Jipang!

column5:
わしの　デシの　ツナデも\n
火の勇者の　ひとりじゃ！！
column6: My pupil Tsunade is a Fire Hero, just like you!

column5:
少しょう　頭は　悪いが\n
すごい　力持ちで\n
とても　かわいいコじゃ！！
column6:
While she's not the brightest girl, she's definitely one of the strongest!\n
And she's as cute as a button!

column5:
ツナデは　今　あしかが学校に　いる！\n
ツナデと　力を合わせて\n
大門教と　たたかうのじゃ！！
column6:
You'll find her at Ashikaga School!\n
Go meet with her, and stand against the Cult of Daimon together!

column5:
おまえのことは\n
ツナデに　はなしてある！！\n
さあ　行け　ジライア！！
column6:
I've already told Tsunade about you.\n
Now go, young Ziria!

column5:
ツナデは　今　あしかが学校に　いる！\n
ツナデと　力を合わせて\n
大門教と　たたかうのじゃ！！
column6:
You'll find her at Ashikaga School!\n
Go meet with her, and stand against the Cult of Daimon together!

column5:
おまえのことは\n
ツナデに　はなしてある！！\n
さあ　行け　ジライア！！
column6:
I've already told Tsunade about you.\n
Now go, young Ziria!

column5:
ツナデと　二人で　力を　あわせよ！\n
行け！　ジライア！！
column6:
You must fight with Tsunade!\n
Go forth, young Ziria!

column5:
みんなで　力を　あわせるのじゃ！\n
行け！　ジライア！！
column6:
You must all fight together!\n
Go forth, young Ziria!

column5:
さあ　あたしの　出番！\n
こんな木　フルスイングで\n
いっぱつだよ！
column6: It's my time to shine! I'm gonna chop this tree down in a single swing!
column7: ZenkiTN: I considered "Heeere's Tsunade!" as a 'The Shining' reference but I figured that might be too much of a western reference in such a Japanese game

column5:
せーの！！\n
ミソ！　ラー！　メン！
column6:
Here goes nothing!\n
Miso! Ra! MEN!
column7: ZenkiTN: This is a reference to a phrase you say in Japan to give yourself the proper timing to swing your golf club. That one is "Chashumen", but Tsunade says "Miso ramen" (a different type of noodle dish)

column5:
神木は　音を立てて　たおれ\n
向こう岸まで　とどいた
column6: The sacred tree falls with a loud {thud,} extending to the other side of the river.

column5: 神木を　切りたおして　橋を作った
column6: You've formed a makeshift bridge with the sacred tree.

column5:
しめなわの　かけられた\n
大きな木が　ある\n
どうやら　この村の　ご神木らしい
column6:
A rope with evil-warding talismans is wrapped around a large tree.
#BOXPAUSE()
This must be the sacred tree of the village.

column5:
神木が　たおれて\n
向こう岸まで　とどいている\n
木を伝って　渡れそうだ
column6:
The sacred tree has fallen, and extends to the other side of the river.\n
You should be able to use it as a bridge.

column5:
橋が　こわされていて\n
向こう岸の　渡れない
column6:
The bridge has been destroyed.\n
It's impossible to reach the other side of the river.

column5: 太田村
column6: Oota Village

column5:
この　太田村も\n
むかしは　ずいぶんと　にぎやか\n
だったんじゃが
column6: Oota Village used to be a lively, bustling place...

column5:
川むこうに　城が　できてから\n
若者は　みんな　町に　あこがれて\n
出て行っちまったんじゃよ
column6: But ever since they built that castle on the other side of the river, all of our young'uns have gone off to live in town.

column5:
大門教の坊主と　キツネが\n
よってたかって\n
橋を　こわして　いきよった！
column6: A group of Daimonist acolytes and kitsune raided our village and destroyed the bridge!

column5:
なんで　こんな\n
としよりばかりの村の\n
橋を　こわさにゃならんのじゃ
column6: Why would they attack a bunch of old coots like us?

column5:
この　ご神木が　たおせれば\n
橋のかわりに\n
できるんじゃがなあ
column6: If we cut down the sacred tree, we could use it as a bridge to reach the other side.

column5:
まさか　ご神木を　切るわけには\n
イカンしなあ・・・\n
なんとか　ならん　もんかいなあ
column6: But...It's a sacred tree. We can't just cut it down, right?

column5:
えれぇ　ことじゃ！！\n
大なんたらが　村の橋を\n
ぶっこわしおった！！
column6: I can't believe those nasty Diamondist whatchamacallits broke the bridge!
column7: ZenkiTN: "Daimonist" is purposely mispronounced, however this may look like a typo in-game. May need a different mispelling.

column5:
もう　川むこうの温泉に　行けん！！\n
もう　ムスコも　帰ってこれん！！\n
どうすれば　いいんじゃ！！！
column6:
Now I can't go to the hot springs!\n
And my son can't visit me!\n
What are we going to do?!

column5:
だいじな　ハナシが　あるのじゃ\n
むかし　むかし　このジパングに\n
えーと　なんでも　すごい
column6:
Listen. This is a very important tale.\n
A long time ago, Jipang almost fell into...something...

column5: えーと　えーと　わすれたわい
column6: Because of...Oh, I forget.
column7: ZenkiTN: It's unclear what story this old man wanted to tell but forgot. I'm assuming it's the same story from the intro.

column5:
ツナデという\n
たいそうな　力持ちが　\n
大門教を　追っ払ってくれたんじゃ
column6: A powerful young lady called Tsunade chased the Daimonists away from our village.

column5:
あのコが　もう少し\n
早く　きてくれたら\n
橋を　こわされずに　すんだんじゃが
column6: If only she had come sooner, maybe they wouldn't have destroyed the bridge...

column5:
神主さんが\n
火の一族を\n
さがしておったぞ！
column6: Our priest is looking for the Fire Hero!

column5:
なにか　頼みたいことが\n
あると　言っておったのう
column6: He said he has something very important to discuss.

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
この村の　西にある\n
あしかが学校の　図書館には\n
たくさん　本が　あんのよ
column6:
Ashikaga School is west of our village.\n
Its library is very well stocked!

column5:
火の一族や　マサカドについても\n
なにか　わかるかもしんないネ！\n
ヒマなら　行けば！
column6: It has books on the Fire Clan and Masakado! You should check it out if you have time!

column5:
よぉ！　よぉ！　よぉ！\n
オレは　橋が　こわされる前に\n
北から　来た　もんだけどよぉ！

column7: ZenkiTN: The literal translation here is something along the lines of: "Women naturally cry crocodile tears when they feel they're weaker than a man. In other words, only if your strength surpasses that of Tsunade will she cry real crocodile tears!" Considering how little sense this makes, I rewrote these lines to better reflect what happens in-game. I'm considering adding somehow the "level 35" requirement but I'm not sure how. Might be worth simply breaking the fourth wall, like that NPC that tells you to hold II to run.

ツナデは　三国一の　オノ使いじゃ\n

column6: Tsunade is the best wielder of axes in the Far East. None can match her skill!
column7: ZenkiTN: I wrote "Far East" as a bit of a reference to the game title (Far East of Eden). The original line mentions 三国一, literally "the best of the three kingdoms", idiomatically "unparalled in Japan, China, and India". "Three Kingdoms" can't refer to the in-game countries because there are way more than 3. I think it's just the Japanese version of "the best gun in the Wild West".

so we should make sure the previous two lines aren't empty and look okay when shown at the same time as this one.

column6:
Hey, friend! Listen!\n
...\n

column7: ZenkiTN: "tomodachinko" is phrase coined by 1986 manga "Obocchama-kun", a gag manga set in a school. "Tomodachi" means "friend", "chinko" means penis. "Tomodachinko" is one of the well known gags from that manga, where instead of shaking hands, you'd shake penises. It's a well refined joke, as you can see. I figured I'd just say "penis" because it's obviously very funny. If you wanted to translate tomodachinko it would be something like "Friendshipenis" or "Friendick", but I figure this would require players to be familiar with Obocchama-kun to even realize it might be a reference. Incidentally, I even watched the first episode of Obocchama-kun just to understand this line. Talk about commitment.

column7: FIXME: there is a minor formatting error with this line in the original game that causes an extra empty box to display at the end, but it only "sticks" on screen if you release the I button quickly (which is probably why no one noticed it). input handling changes in the translation mean that it now always "sticks" and is very noticeable, so we should probably fix it at some point. all that's needed is to replace the BOXPAUSE() with a BOXEND()... but i don't want to modify the spec file by hand for maintainability reasons.
