column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 村長の家
column6: Elder's House

column5:
あんたが　ジライアさん　かね！！\n
わしは　キコリ村の　村長じゃ！！
column6:
Ah, you must be Ziria-san.\n
I'm the elder of Lumberjack Village.

column5:
いやはや　あの　ツナデって娘\n
よく　働いてくれるんじゃが\n
すこし　困っておるんじゃ
column6:
Tsunade is a hard-working girl...\n
Maybe TOO much so!

column5:
メタクソに　木を　切りまくるんで\n
見ての　とおりじゃわい！！
column6: Look around! She's been chopping trees down non-stop!

column5:
どうか　早く\n
連れて行ってくだされ！！
column6: Please, take her with you before we run out of trees!

column5:
この　白光のオノは\n
むかし　ナメクジ仙人から\n
いただいたもの　なんじゃ！！
column6: The Slug Hermit entrusted me with the Byakkou Axe a long time ago.

column5:
わしらには　とても　使えんが\n
ナメクジ族の　ツナデなら\n
使いこなせる　じゃろうて！
column6: We can't lift it, but I'm sure a descendant of the Slug Clan like Tsunade can wield it just fine!

column5:
さあ　これを　持って　行きなされ！！\n
ふたり　力を　合わせ\n
がんばるんじゃぞ！！
column6: Take it with you. Go forth, young heroes!

column5: 白光のオノを　手に入れた\n
column6: Obtained Byakkou Axe.\n

column5:
おまえたちには\n
だいじな　やくめが　あるはずじゃ！\n
さあ　行きなされ！
column6:
You have a great task to accomplish!\n
Go forth, young heroes!

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
白光のオノは\n
ナメクジ族の者が　こさえたんじゃと\n
村長が　いうとったなあ！
column6: The village elder once mentioned that the Byakkou Axe was created by someone from the Slug Clan.

column5: はわい村
column6: Hawai Village

column5:
いい湯だねー！　あっ　ははん！\n
ここは　ばんもう\n
はわい村の湯！　っと！
column6:
These hot springs are fantastic!\n
Welcome to the hot springs of Hawai Village!
column7: ZenkiTN: the Japanese player skips this whole segment in their playthrough, so I have no visual context for this place. I could really use some screenshots of the dialogue for the village and the hot spring inn.

column5:
ここの　温泉で\n
外の国から　来た人が\n
はたらいている　そうだぜ
column6: I heard these hot springs are managed by a group of foreigners.

column5:
温泉やどに　泊まれば\n
体力が　ビンビンになるのよ！！\n
うふふ・・・ガンバッテね
column6: You'll feel much better if you stay at the inn! Trust me!

column5:
宿には　踊り子が　いてよぉ\n
その踊りったら・・・　エヘヘヘ\n
あんなに　見せて　いいのかねぇ
column6: There are dancers at the inn. Their dance is really something else! Are they even allowed to show that? Heh heh heh!

column5:
宇都宮のお城には\n
とても　勇気のある\n
若トノさまが　いるそうよ！！
column6: I heard the lord of Utsunomiya Castle is very young and brave!

column5:
湯船には　温泉の湯が　あった\n
その湯を　浴びると　体に\n
力が　わき上がってきた
column6:
The pool is filled with hot spring water.\n
You feel reinvigorated as soon as you enter.

column5: 温泉宿
column6: Hot Spring Inn

column5:
ここは　温泉やど！！\n
今どき　なんと　タダ！！\n
泊らないとソン！！　泊まる？！
column6:
This is a hot spring inn! It's completely free! You should stay for a while!\n
How about it?
column7: ZenkiTN: at first I thought this was a weird accent because the innkeeper was a foreigner, but this is used for innkeepers that aren't foreigners. I then found out that "泊らないとソン" seems to be a reference to a Japanese beauty salon, 剃らないとソン (Soranai to son).

column5: また　どうぞ
column6: See you soon.

column5: ごゆっくり・・・
column6: Rest well.

column5:
山にそって　西へ　歩くと\n
うつのみや城　だぜ
column6: Follow the mountains west and you'll get to Utsunomiya Castle.

column5:
ああ　いい湯だったな！\n
マサカドの復活の　ウワサなんか\n
湯の中じゃ　忘れちまうもんなあ
column6:
This hot spring is great!\n
Makes you forget that whole business about Masakado returning!

column5:
宇都宮の　若トノさまが\n
なんとかの　勇者に\n
会いたがって　いたわ！
column6: The young lord of Utsunomiya wants to meet some hero!

column5:
フジヤマ！　ゲイシャ！　スキヤキ！\n
シャブシャブ！　テンプラ！　スシ！\n
ジパング　ダイスキ　デース！！
column6:
Mount Fuji! Geisha! Sukiyaki!\n
Shabu-shabu! Tempura! Sushi!\n
I love Jipang!

column5:
ワタシ　クニハ　デーモン教\n
イッパイネ！　ベリィ　オソロシイ！\n
ジパングヲ　ニゲル　キタヨ
column6:
Our country full of demon!\n
Much very scary!\n
We run to Jipang!

column5:
宇都宮に　ヘンな外人が　いたぜ！\n
だれにでも　フレンド　フレンドって\n
つきまとい　やがんだ！！
column6:
There's a funny foreigner in Utsunomiya.\n
He calls everyone {friend.}

column5:
ワタシタチ　ホテイ丸ガ\n
イッショニ　ジパングヲ\n
ワタテ　キタ！
column6: We come to Jipang with Hoteimaru!

column5:
ホテイ丸　ジパングノ\n
ファイヤーファイター\n
サガス　イキマシタ！
column6: Hoteimaru search Fire Fighter in Jipang!
column7: NOTE: I have to wonder if this is actually some kind of deliberate gag, since Hoteimaru teams up with a literal firefighter in Edo to make his earthquake experience room. seems a bit far-fetched, though...

column5:
ワタシタチ　ダンス　ウマイ！\n
ギブ　ミー　マネー！！\n
１０両　ＯＫ？
column6:
Our dance very good!\n
Give money, we dance!\n
両10, okay?

column5:
イッツ　ショーターイムッ！！\n
メクルメク　カンノウノ　ステージ！！\n
サア　レッツ　ダンス！
column6:
It's showtime!\n
Sexy beauty on stage!\n
Now let's dance!

column5:
ハワーイ　ハッワァァァーーイ！！\n
ジライアサン！\n
ホテイ丸ノコト　ヨロシクネェー！
column6:
Hawaiii, Hawaaaiii!\n
Ziria-san!\n
Help friend Hoteimaru!

column5:
ワズカノ　オカネ　オシンデ\n
フレンド　ナクシタヒト\n
ワタシ　シッテイマス
column6: I know story of man who not spend little money. He die alone and sad.

column5:
ワタシタチ　オカネナイ！\n
アナタタチ　オカネナイ！\n
オカネナイ　オナジ　フレンドネ！
column6:
We have no money!\n
You have no money!\n
Even no money, still friend!

column5: 茶店
column6: Tea House

column5:
いらっしゃいませー！\n
ここは　茶店でーす！！\n
ごようは　なあに？
column6:
Welcome to my tea house!\n
How may I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それじゃ　また　きてねー
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: 盗人訓練所
column6: Thieving School

column5:
ここは　大門教を　やっつけるために\n
ぬすっとを　養成する\n
通称　ぬすっと訓練所です！！
column6: This is a Thieving School, where you can improve your thievery in order to help defeat the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
奥の　部屋に　入って\n
教官を　よけて\n
つづらの中の　お金を　とるんです！
column6: Head inside, avoid the instructors, and steal the money from the casket!

column5:
みごと　お金を　とることに\n
成功したら\n
そのお金は　あなたのものです！
column6: If you can steal the money successfully, you get to keep it for yourself!

column5:
まあ　遊びだと　おもって\n
気軽に　たのしんでくださいよ！\n
だけど　マサカド打倒も　お忘れなく！
column6:
Think of it as a game and have fun!\n
But don't forget your quest to defeat Masakado!

column5: 盗人訓練所
column6: Thieving School

column5:
ここは　大門教を　やっつけるために\n
ぬすっとを　養成する\n
通称　ぬすっと訓練所です！！
column6: This is a Thieving School, where you can improve your thievery in order to help defeat the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
奥の　部屋に　入って\n
教官を　よけて\n
つづらの中の　お金を　とるんです！
column6: Head inside, avoid the instructors, and steal the money from the casket!

column5:
みごと　お金を　とることに\n
成功したら\n
そのお金は　あなたのものです！
column6: If you can steal the money successfully, you get to keep it for yourself!

column5:
まあ　遊びだと　おもって\n
気軽に　たのしんでくださいよ！\n
だけど　マサカド打倒も　お忘れなく！
column6:
Think of it as a game and have fun!\n
But don't forget your quest to defeat Masakado!

column5: 宇都宮町
column6: Utsunomiya Town

column5: お願いしますぞ　ジライア殿！！
column6: Good luck, Ziria-dono!

column5:
この　宇都宮には\n
勇気のある　若トノさまが\n
いらっしゃるのよ！！
column6: Utsunomiya Town is protected by our brave, young lord!

column5:
さすがの　大門教も\n
勇気のある　若トノさまを　おそれて\n
この町には　入ってこないわ
column6: Not even the Cult of Daimon dares to approach, fearing our lord's retribution!

column5:
勇気ある　若トノさまは\n
大門教が　でえきれえなんだ！！\n
あんた　大門教じゃ　ないだろうな！？
column6: Our brave, young lord hates the Cult of Daimon! You're not a Daimonist, are you?!

column5:
ジライアってのは　おまえさんかい？\n
城のそばで　ホテイ丸って　外人が\n
おまえさんのことを　きいてたぜ！
column6:
Are you Ziria?\n
I heard about you from Hoteimaru, that foreigner near the castle!

column5:
ジライアってのは　おまえさんかい？\n
ホテイ丸って　外人が\n
おまえさんのことを　きいてたぜ！
column6:
Are you Ziria?\n
I heard about you from that foreigner, Hoteimaru!

column5:
ホテイ丸の　おっちゃんから\n
おもしろい歌を\n
教えてもらっちゃった！
column6: That funny man Hoteimaru taught me a song!

column5:
おわん出せ〜　おわん出せ〜\n
おわん出せの　おはしにィ〜\n
ごはんの　前に　歌うんだよ！
column6:
Oh when the sink! Oh when the sink!\n
Oh when the sink got matching inn!\n
Dunno what it means, but it's catchy!
column7: ZenkiTN: these are misheard lyrics of "When the saints go marching in". Even the original Japanese text is misheard lyrics (it goes "Owan dase, owan dase, owan dase ohashi ni", a common Japanese mishearing of the song (owan and ohashi are the bowl and chopsticks, that's why the kids says he sings them before meals))

column5:
この　ばんもうの国には\n
トウベイという\n
ウデの　いい大工が　いるのじゃ
column6: A great carpenter called Toubei lives here in Banmou.

column5:
宇都宮の城も　白河の城も\n
トウベイの　作品じゃ！！\n
よく　見ていきなされ！
column6: Both the castles of Utsunomiya and Shirakawa are his work! You should go see them if you have the time!

column5:
ジライアさまと　おみうけいたします\n
わたくしは　勇気ある　若トノさまに\n
おつかえしている者で　ござる！
column6:
You must be Ziria-sama.\n
I'm a messenger of the brave, young lord of Utsunomiya!

column5:
若トノさまが\n
ぜひ　ジライアさまに　会いたいと\n
申されて　おります
column6: The young lord wishes to meet you.

column5:
もし　おさしつかえなければ\n
城へ　まいられ\n
若トノさまに　お会いくだされ！！
column6: Please, head to the castle at your earliest convenience!

column5:
若トノさまの　ご依頼を\n
承けてくださり\n
ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you for accepting the young lord's request.

column5:
勇気ある　若トノさまが\n
城の中で　火の勇者を\n
お待ちになって　おられます
column6: The brave, young lord of the castle is waiting for the arrival of the Fire Heroes.

column5:
オオ　フレンド！！ジライアさん\n
ワタシ　ホテイ丸　宣教師デス\n
大門教は　デーモン教！！
column6:
Oh, friend! Ziria-san!\n
This is Hoteimaru! Missionary!\n
Cult of Daimon is cult of demons!

column5:
デーモン　全部で　１３人！\n
マサカド　復活！\n
ジパング　おわりデス！
column6:
Thirteen demons!\n
They revive Masakado and end Jipang!

column5:
あなた　勇者！　マサカド　たおす！\n
わたし　ソレ　おてつだいします！\n
また　会いましょう　バーイ！
column6:
You are hero! You defeat Masakado!\n
I help! See you soon, byeee!

column5:
勇気がある　トノさまなら\n
自分で　助けに　いけばいいのに！！\n
でも　刀　もらえたから　いっか！！
column6: If that lord's so brave, why does he need our help? Oh well, at least we got a free sword!

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
オラあ・・・\n
見ちゃ　いけねえ　ものを・・・\n
見ちまったんだよ！！
column6: I saw it...I saw something I shouldn't have seen.

column5:
そら　おっかねえ　女がよう\n
トウベイさんの　首ねっこ\n
つかんで　引きずってたんだよう
column6:
A scary woman grabbed Toubei-san by the neck and dragged him away...\n
I saw it, I swear!

column5:
大門教の　悪口を　いうと\n
キツネの　タタリが　あるって\n
女たちが　ウワサしてたね
column6: Lately, the women are gossiping about some kind of kitsune curse that hits you if you speak ill of the Cult of Daimon.

column5:
大工の　トウベイが　きえた\n
ま・・・まさか　トウベイが\n
トウメイ人間に　なんちゃって！
column6: Toubei, the famous carpenter, has vanished. He's always made great work, but now he's made like a tree...
column7: ZenkiTN: the original joke is about Toubei becoming a "toumei" (transparent) person. I made a pun using the verb "make".

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　２５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両25 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　２５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両25 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: 武具屋
column6: Armory

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　武具屋です\n
ご用件は　何ですか？
column6:
Welcome to my armory!\n
How can I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それでは　また　ご利用ください
column6: Come back anytime.

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 預かり所
column6: Warehouse

column5: 宇都宮城
column6: Utsunomiya Castle

column5:
ありがとうございました\n
ジライア殿！\n
大トノさまも　目がさめたでしょう
column6:
Thank you, Ziria-dono!\n
Our lord finally sees reason.

column5:
ジライアさまだから　お話しするが\n
白河城は　大門教に\n
支配されてしまったでござる！！
column6: Ziria-sama. The truth is...Shirakawa Castle has already fallen into the hands of the Daimonists.

column5:
白河城の　大トノさまは\n
ご無事で　いらっしゃるのだろうか\n
心配でござる！！
column6:
I'm worried about the lord of Shirakawa...\n
I hope he's safe.

column5:
大工の　トウベイに　きけば\n
白河城の　カラクリの　秘密が\n
わかるはずで　ござる！
column6: Toubei the carpenter could tell you the secret of Shirakawa Castle's mechanism!

column5:
しかし　さいきん\n
とんと　姿が　見えぬ！\n
いったい　どこへ　行ったのやら
column6: Unfortunately, he seems to have gone missing. Where could he be?

column5:
この城だけは　ぜったいに\n
大門教などに　支配させぬ！！\n
わしが　かならず　守るわい
column6: As long as I live, this castle shall never fall to the Daimonists!

column5:
白河城は　若トノさまの\n
父上で　いらっしゃる　大トノさまの\n
お城でござる！！
column6: The lord of Shirakawa Castle is the illustrious father of our young lord.

column5:
しかし　今では\n
大門教の　タマモ姫が　ワガもの顔で\n
城主きどりで　ござる！！
column6: However, Tamamohime of the Cult of Daimon acts as if she owns the place!

column5:
タマモ姫は　大工の　トウベイを\n
おどして　白河城の　地下に\n
巨大な　カラクリ部屋を　作らせた
column6: Tamamohime forced Toubei to create a giant trick system in the dungeons of Shirakawa Castle.
column7: ZenkiTN: I decided to call it a "trick system". Long story short, there are hidden stairways inside specific rooms, and you need to find the secret stairways and go through specific rooms to reach the end. So it's a "trick" because it's tricky.

column5:
そこに　迷いこんだら\n
二度とは　地上に\n
出られんと　いう　ウワサじゃ！！
column6: Rumor is, once you get lost in those dungeons, you'll never get out again!

column5:
わたしが　勇気ある　若トノじゃ！\n
大門教の　タマモ姫は　アクマじゃ\n
父上の　命が　あぶない！！
column6:
I am the brave, young lord of Utsunomiya! Tamamohime is an evil Daimonist.\n
Father is in danger!

column5:
勇者なら　大門教を\n
たおせると　聞いた\n
父上を　助けて　ほしい
column6:
I heard you are the hero who rose up against the Cult of Daimon.\n
I must ask you to save my father.

column5: さすが　勇者である！　勇気があるな！
column6:
I see why they call you a hero!\n
You truly are brave!

column5:
わたしが　たんじょう日に\n
父から　いただいた　剣を　とらす！！
column6: This is the sword Father gave me for my birthday. You may have it!

column5: 若トノさまの　依頼を　引き受けた
column6: You have accepted the young lord's request.

column5:
そうか　ざんねんじゃ！\n
勇者は　勇気があると　\n
思っていたのだが・・・
column6:
I see. That's a shame.\n
I suppose not all heroes are brave...

column5:
父上の　こと\n
よろしく　たのむぞ！
column6: My father's life is in your hands!

column5:
さすが　勇者である！\n
アッパレ　アッパレ！
column6:
You truly are a hero!\n
Huzzah! Huzzah!

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
大工なかまの　トウベイは\n
白河のタマモ姫に　なんか　ヤバそうな\n
仕事を　頼まれた　そうじゃ
column6: Apparently, Tamamohime of Shirakawa asked my fellow carpenter Toubei to do some dangerous work.

column5:
なんでも　城の地下に　どえらい\n
カラクリ部屋を　こさえなきゃなんねい\n
かもしんねいと　いっておったなあ
column6: He said something about making some kind of trick system in the dungeons of the castle.

column5:
おれも　大工なんだが\n
トウベイ先生に　見せていただいた\n
あの図面だけは　さすがに　驚いたね！
column6: I'm a carpenter too, but when Master Toubei showed me those plans, I was utterly speechless!

column5:
同じ形の　部屋が　死ぬほどあって\n
なにが　なんだか　おれなんかにゃ\n
さっぱり　わからなかった！
column6: I'd never be able to make something like that, even if my life depended on it!

column5:
今から　思うと\n
あれが　白河城の　カラクリ部屋の\n
絵図面だったのかも　しれねえな
column6: Come to think of it, those were probably the plans to Shirakawa Castle's trick system.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
宇都宮城の　若トノさまは\n
わたしは　勇気があると\n
ご自身で　おっしゃっているが
column6: The young lord of the castle claims to be brave, but I've never actually seen him do anything heroic!

column5:
その勇気を　しめされたことは\n
今まで　一度もないのじゃよ\n
近頃の　若い者は　クチばっかりでのう
column6: Kids these days are all mouth and no trousers.
column7: ZenkiTN: I never heard this idiom before, but since the speaker is an old woman I figure an old idiom is good. In fact, I should probably use more old idioms.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
ジライアさん！\n
じつは　オレ\n
雲切の里の者　なんですよ！
column6: Ziria-san! I'm from Kumogiri Hamlet!

column5:
山ぞいに　北東へ　行けば\n
雲切の里４が　見えて　きますよ\n
里のものは　ヤル気　マンマンですぜ！
column6: Follow the mountains northeast and you'll see Kumogiri Hamlet 4. Everyone's ready to assist you!

column5: 雲切の里４
column6: Kumogiri Hamlet 4

column5:
お待ちしておりました！　ジライアどの\n
さっそくですが　新しい　大門教の\n
情報を　お知らせします！！
column6:
Ziria-dono! I've been waiting for you!\n
I have new intel on the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
白河城の　トノさまの\n
奥方に　なった　タマモ姫は\n
どうやら　大門教１３人衆の　ひとり！
column6: Tamamohime, the current wife of the lord of Shirakawa Castle, is one of the Thirteen Daimon Cultists!

column5:
白河城は　今や\n
大門教の　悪のそうくつと\n
化しております！！
column6: Alas, Shirakawa Castle has been turned into a den of evil!

column5:
里の　北にある　あぶくま洞に\n
大工の　トウベイさんが\n
連れこまれるのを　見ましたぜ！
column6: I saw the carpenter Toubei-san being dragged inside the Abukuma Caves to the north!

column5:
トウベイさんを　助けに\n
あぶくま洞へ　行った仲間が\n
まっさおな　顔で　戻って来たんです！
column6: Those who went inside the Abukuma Caves to rescue Toubei-san came back looking pale as ghosts!

column5:
あぶくま洞には　一つ目の　化け物が\n
ウヨウヨしていて　トウベイさん\n
どころじゃ　なかったそうです！！
column6:
The Abukuma Caves are swarming with one-eyed monsters!\n
They're no place for poor Toubei-san!

column5:
あぶくま洞の　中は\n
底なし沼だらけで\n
歩ける　ところのほうが　少ないだよ！
column6: The Abukuma Caves are filled with bottomless bogs. There's little room to walk!

column5:
白河城の　スケベ　大トノは\n
父と娘ほども　トシの　はなれた　\n
タマモ姫と　結婚してから
column6:
That old pervert lord of Shirakawa Castle married Tamamohime.\n
He's old enough to be her father!

column5:
すっかり　ホネぬきに　されやがって\n
タマモ姫の　ワガママなら\n
ホイホイ　きいちまいやがる！！
column6: She has him wrapped around her little finger. He fulfills her every whim!

column5:
あの　大トノのスケベ根性は\n
一生　なおらんだろうな
column6: I doubt that old pervert lord will ever drop his debauched ways.

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
大門教の　連中ときたら\n
土や水から　怪物を\n
作り出す　魔法が　使えるらしい
column6: It seems the Daimonists can use spells to create monsters out of soil, water, and the like.

column5:
きっと　あぶくま洞に\n
出るという　化け物も　タマモ姫が\n
沼のドロから　作ったに　ちがいない！
column6: I bet Tamamohime made the creatures roaming the Abukuma Caves from the bogs!

column5:
この里の　ずっと　北の　なこその関は\n
大トノさまの　命令により\n
閉じられて　しまった！
column6: The Nakoso barrier, far north of our hamlet, was sealed by order of the lord of Shirakawa.

column5:
なんでも　タマモ姫の　ワガママで\n
そうなったと　いうが\n
めいわくな　はなしじゃ！
column6: I heard it was Tamamohime who asked him to do that. Whatever the case, it's a problem for everyone!

column5:
大トノさまも　心を入れかえられた\n
ことじゃろうて
column6: The old lord must have finally seen reason.

column5:
となりの人の　いうことが　本当なら\n
その　ドロの　化け物ってのも\n
ふびんな　やつだな！
column6:
I pity those bog creatures roaming the Abukuma Caves, you know?\n
Their lives must be really sad.

column5:
いっそ　たたきころして\n
沼のドロに　戻してやるほうが\n
やつも　しあわせだと　オラァ　思うね
column6: If I was a creature made of stagnant water, I'd rather die and return to my bog.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　１０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両10 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　１０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両10 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5:
ジライアさま！　このあたりには\n
毒をふく　怪物が　おりますぞ\n
毒に　おかされると　大変です！
column6: Ziria-sama! There are creatures nearby that can spew poison from their mouths.

column5:
どくけしを　用意して\n
いきなされ！
column6: You should stock up on antidotes before you venture forth!

column5: 賭場
column6: Gambling Den

column5:
ジライアさん　じゃないですかぁ！\n
こんな所で　遊んでいて　いいんですか\n
まっ　たまには　息ぬきしないとね
column6:
My, if it isn't Ziria-san!\n
Should you really be here?\n
Eh, I guess it's fine every once in a while!

column5:
ツボふりの　ネエちゃん　きれいだろ！\n
もう　ちょっとで\n
見えそう　なんだけどなあ！！
column6:
The dice lady is a real babe!\n
When I play, I'm not exactly looking at the dice, if you catch my drift!

column5:
二つの　サイコロの目を　たして\n
偶数なら　「丁」で\n
奇数なら　「半」だ！
column6:
It's a simple game!\n
Just bet whether the sum of the two dice will be even or odd!

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　ガマの油が　入っていた

You look inside the casket.\n
There is toad oil inside.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　なにも　入っていなかった
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is nothing inside.

column6: Abukuma Caves

ひとけの　ないところに　つれてきて\n
あたしに　気が　あるんじゃない！
column6:
Oh my, Ziria! What's the big idea, bringing me out to this deserted place?\n
You gonna make a move on me?

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n

column6: Abukuma Caves

あっしは　大工のトウベイです！！\n
白河城の　絵図面を　かくしたので\n
タマモに　とじこめられてました
column6:
I'm Toubei the carpenter.\n
Tamamo locked me in here after I hid the plans to Shirakawa Castle.

column5:
白河城の　絵図面は\n
ここから　西の　犬神村の\n
コマ犬の前に　うめてあります
column6: You'll find them buried under one of the Komainu statues in Inugami Village to the west.

column5:
絵図面にある　×印を　\n
しらべてください　地下への\n
かくし階段が　あるはずです
column6: Check the spot marked by an X on the plans. You'll find a hidden stairway leading down below.

column5:
あっしは　だいじょうぶですから\n
白河城の　地下にいる　\n
大トノさまを　助けて下さい
column6: I'll be fine on my own. Please, rescue the lord of Shirakawa Castle.

木製の　さくのようなもので\n
かぎは　かかっていない・・・と\n
いうより　ついていません

There is a wooden fence.\n
It's unlocked...or rather, it doesn't even have a lock in the first place.

column5: あっけなく　開きました！！
column6: It opens easily.

中には　雷光の巻物が　入っていた

You look inside the casket.\n

やっぱり　なにもなかった\n
シクシク・・・
column6:
There really was nothing...\n
That's just sad.

column5:
何か　重たいものを\n
引きずった　跡が　つづいている
column6: There are signs of a heavy object being dragged here.

column5:
赤地に　黄色い文字で\n
「大」と　しるされた　大きな石がある
column6: There is a large red stone marked with a yellow 大 symbol.

column5: なにもありませんでした
column6: You find nothing.

column5: 犬神村
column6: Inugami Village

column5:
だ　だ　大門教が\n
白イヌさまを　石に変えてしまった！\n
こ　こ　この犬神村は　おしまいだ！！
column6:
Th-Th-The Cult of Daimon turned the sacred White Dog to stone!\n
I-I-It's the end of Inugami Village!

column5:
石にされた　白イヌさまも　心配だけど\n
さらわれた　トウベイさんの　ほうが\n
わたしは　ずっと　心配なのよ！
column6: Everyone's worrying about the sacred White Dog, but I'm more worried about Toubei-san's disappearance!

column5:
トウベイさんを　助けてくれたのね\n
ありがとう　ジライアさん！
column6:
You saved Toubei-san, didn't you?\n
Thank you, Ziria-san!

column5:
そういえば　トウベイさんが\n
コマ犬の　前に\n
なんか　うめてたようだなぁ
column6: Come to think of it, I saw Toubei-san bury something under one of the Komainu statues.

column5:
おそろしや　おそろしや\n
白イヌさまが　石に　されてしまった！\n
大門教の　大たわけめが！！
column6: How could they turn the sacred White Dog to stone?! A pox on those Daimonist fools!

column5:
タマモ姫の　悪グチを　言ったばかりに\n
このうちの　奥さんは\n
とんでもないことに　なってしまった
column6: Something terrible happened to the woman of this house the moment she spoke ill of Tamamohime.

column5:
白イヌさまは　人を\n
うつくしい　夢の世界へ　いざなう\n
神通力を　おもちなのじゃ！！
column6: The sacred White Dog has the power to lull you into the most beautiful of dreams!

column5:
わしも　苦しいとき\n
何度か　そのお力に\n
すがったことが　あるですじゃ！
column6: In times of suffering, I would ask him to make me fall asleep so that I would forget my pain!

column5:
その　おやさしい　白イヌさまを\n
こんな姿に　かえるとは\n
大門教は　なんて　ひどいやつらじゃ！
column6: How could the Cult of Daimon treat so gentle a creature with such disrespect?!

column5:
村に　次から次に\n
恐ろしいことが　起きてるのに\n
あのイタズラこぞうと　きたら！！
column6:
We already have too many problems!\n
We can't deal with that naughty kid's mischief too!
column7: ZenkiTN: this is about the kid who moved the statues from their original location (in front of the shrine) to the village's entrance.

column5:
うおおん！　まさか　ふたたび\n
よみがえることが　できようとは\n
ありがとう　火の勇者よ！
column6:
Aroooo!\n
I was starting to lose hope of being set free! Thank you, Fire Hero!

column5:
われわれ　神獣は　神のおおせで\n
何千年の　昔より　このジパングで\n
邪悪な　霊から　民を　守ってきたのだ
column6: We divine beasts were sent by the Gods thousands of years ago to protect Jipang from evil spirits.

column5:
われら　神獣は　霊力のかぎりをつくし\n
大門教と戦ったが・・・\n
マサカドの怨念の前に　敗れさった
column6: We used every bit of our spiritual energy to fight the Cult of Daimon...But we were no match for Masakado's grudge.

column5:
勇者よ！　おまえが　さいごの　望みだ\n
わしの　神通力をしるした\n
この　月寝の巻物を　さずけよう！！
column6:
You are our last hope, young hero!\n
I shall bestow upon you the scroll of Tsukine, which contains my divine power!

column5:
月寝の巻物は　月さえも\n
まどろませるほど　強い　睡魔が\n
敵の一人を　おそう技じゃ！
column6:
The Tsukine jutsu will lull a single opponent into a deep slumber.\n
Not even the moon itself could resist!

column5:
大門教を　たおせ！！\n
マサカドを　復活させては　ならぬ！\n
行け！　ジライア！！
column6:
Defeat the Cult of Daimon!\n
Masakado must not be revived!\n
Go forth, young Ziria!

column5: 神獣白イヌの　封印を　解き放った

Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 神社
column6: Shrine

column5:
ジライアさま！　おたすけくだされ！\n
白イヌさまが　大門教の手に　かかり\n
石に　封印されてしまいました
column6:
Ziria-sama, we need your help!\n
The Cult of Daimon has sealed our sacred White Dog inside a boulder!

column5:
白イヌさまが　いらっしゃらないと\n
この村の民は　生きる希望を\n
失って　しまいます！！
column6: Without his divine protection, the residents are losing their will to live!

column5:
どうぞ　わたしたちに\n
火の一族の　お力を\n
おしめしください！
column6: Please, lend us the power of the Fire Clan!

column5:
白イヌさまを　おすくいくださり\n
ありがとうございました\n
これで　安心です
column6: Thank you for saving our sacred White Dog. We can finally rest easy.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
ボクは　力持ちの\n
イタズラ　こぞうだよ〜ん！
column6: I'm the toughest troublemaker around!

column5:
ボクは　力持ちの\n
イタズラ　こぞうだよ〜ん！
column6: I'm the toughest troublemaker around!

column5:
神社の前に　あった　コマ犬を\n
村の入口まで　ズリズリって\n
うごかしちゃたんだよ〜ん！！
column6: The Komainu statues were in front of the shrine, but I pushed them to the village's entrance!

column5: 民家
column6: House

コン　コオーン\n
　　　　　　　　コン　コオーン\n
　　　コン　コオーン　　　えへへへ

column5:
えへへ　へへコン　コオーンえへへへへ\n
えへへへ　へへ　へへコン　コオーンへ\n
えへへへへ　へへ　へへコン　コオーン
column6:
Heeheehee! Heehee yip yiip heeheehee!\n
Heeheehee! Heehee...Heehee yip yiip!\n
Heeheeheehee! Heehee...Heehee yip yiiip!
column7: ZenkiTN: this is a woman possessed by a kitsune. She laughs and barks (?) like a fox.

column5:
あわわわ・・・タマモ姫の　悪グチを\n
言ったばかりに　ウチの女房に\n
キツネが　とりついて　しまった！！
column6: Oh no...My wife was possessed by a kitsune the instant she spoke ill of Tamamohime!

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
チャイナには　妖怪が　姫に化けて\n
千人の王の　首を\n
はねたと　いう話が　あるそうじゃ
column6: There is an ancient Chinese tale of a youkai disguised as a princess who brought death to hundreds of kings.
column7: ZenkiTN: interesting to note that the Japanese text writes "チャイナ" (chaina), the western reading of China (instead of the usual 中国, chuugoku)

column5:
この話が　なんとのう\n
白河の　タマモ姫に　似とるような\n
気がしてならんのじゃ
column6: Doesn't it sort of remind you of Tamamohime of Shirakawa?

column5:
えっ？　やっぱりじゃったか\n
では　早く倒してくだされ\n
ジライアさま
column6:
Huh? So I'm right?\n
Then you'd better deal with her as soon as possible, Ziria-sama.
column7: NOTE: this is an unusual case where the game appends new dialogue to an existing message once you meet certain conditions (in this case, after defeating tamamohime). the previous two boxes of text continue to display when you talk to this character, but these two are then added afterward.

column5:
あぁ？　もう　倒された？！\n
さすが　ジライアさまじゃ
column6:
Oh, you already beat her?!\n
You're amazing!

column5: 白河町
column6: Shirakawa Town

column5:
白河城に　はいるのは　やめなされ！！\n
悪いことは　いわん！\n
命がいくつ　あっても　たりんぞえ
column6:
Don't enter Shirakawa Castle!\n
I'm telling you this for your own good!\n
You only live once!

column5:
ジライアさま！\n
あっしは　雲切の里の者です
column6: Ziria-sama, I'm from Kumogiri Hamlet.

column5:
この白河町には\n
大工の　トウベイさんの　デシが\n
住んで　いるはずです
column6: One of the apprentices of Toubei the carpenter lives in this town.

column5:
そいつから　なにか　役に立つ話が\n
きけるやも　しれません\n
ぜひ　おたずねください！！
column6: You should talk to him. He has useful insight about the castle's secret!

column5:
わたし　大門教に　はいりました\n
だって　キツネに　とりつかれるより\n
ましだもの！！
column6:
I joined the Cult of Daimon.\n
It's better than the alternative:\n
being possessed by a kitsune!

column5:
さいきん\n
大トノさまの　お姿を\n
拝見しないなあ
column6: You know, I haven't seen our lord in a while.

column5:
それに　お城には　無数のキツネが\n
住みついている　ようだし\n
いったい　どうなってしまうんだろう！
column6:
What's more, endless hordes of kitsune have started living in the castle.\n
What the heck's going on?!

column5:
となりの　奥さんも　娘さんも\n
キツネに　とりつかれてしまった！！\n
あたしも　ああなってしまうのかしら
column6:
The wife and daughter of our neighbor were possessed by kitsune!\n
Will I suffer the same fate?

column5:
大トノさまの\n
女好きにも\n
限度というものが　あるわい！！
column6: We all know our lord loves the ladies, but enough is enough!

column5:
あんな　おそろしい女を\n
城に　入れるなんて\n
なにを　考えとるんじゃ！！
column6: What was he thinking, bringing that dangerous woman into the castle?!

column5:
あのねぇ\n
調べる時は　自分の足下じゃなくて\n
目の前を　調べるんだよ
column6: Just a reminder: when you {Check,} you're inspecting the area in front of you, not what's under your feet!
column7: ZenkiTN: they keep reminding the player because otherwise you might fail to find the hidden stairways.

column5: 武具屋
column6: Armory

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　武具屋です\n
ご用件は　何ですか？
column6:
Welcome to my armory!\n
How can I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それでは　また　ご利用ください
column6: Come back anytime.

column5: 本殿
column6: Sanctuary

column5:
いらっしゃいませ\n
効き目のたしかな\n
お札やお守りはいかが
column6: Welcome. Would you like to buy charms and talismans that actually work?

column5: どうもありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: またどうぞ
column6: Come back anytime.

column5:
十三港はひどいありさまのようじゃの\n
十三港のためにいのりますかの
column6:
I hear Tosa Harbor is in a terrible state.\n
Let us pray...

column5:
カシコミカシコミ・・\n
ヤオヨロズノカミガミニ・・・\n
ダーッツ！！
column6: Oh Gods of all creation, listen to my plea...DAAAH!

column5:
おまえの願いはかなえられた\n
十三港へ戻るがよい\n
お前の徳は以前に増して上がるだろう
column6: Your prayers have been answered. Return to Tosa Harbor and your Virtue shall rise.

column5:
では　さびしいお前の心を\n
神が慰めてくれるよう\n
祈ろうとするかのう
column6: In that case, I will pray for your lonely soul...

column5: 五重の塔
column6: Pagoda

column5:
ナメクジはヘビに勝ち\n
ヘビはガマに勝ち\n
ガマはナメクジに勝つ
column6:
Slug beats Snake,\n
Snake beats Toad,\n
Toad beats Slug.

column5: これを３すくみという
column6: That is the three-way deadlock.

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 預かり所
column6: Warehouse

column5: 多賀
column6: Taga

column5:
白河関は殺硝石がふさいでいて\n
近寄ると命が縮ってしまう\n
白河には近寄らぬ方がいいですよ
column6: Shirakawa barrier is blocked by the Sesshou-seki. Stand too close and you might die. You should stay away.

column5:
この殺硝石をこわすには\n
米沢の坊さんがもっている\n
大カナヅチがいいらしい
column6: Only the Great Hammer kept by the monks of Yonezawa can destroy the Sesshou-seki.

column5:
達谷窟の悪路王というオニがとつぜん\n
おそってきてこのありさま・・・\n
旅の人、早く立ち去りなさい
column6:
An Oni called Akuro-Ou came from Takkoku-no-Iwaya and attacked us...\n
You should leave at once, traveler.

column5:
達谷窟は平泉の西にありますじゃ\n
平泉もどうなっておることか・・・
column6:
Takkoku-no-Iwaya is west of Hiraizumi.\n
I wonder what happened to them...

column5:
さあさあこの多賀城を復興させるため\n
あなたも　ひとはだぬぎませんか
column6: How about you do something to restore Taga Castle?

column5:
悪路王も退治されたと言う話だ\n
さあ　いちから出直しだー
column6:
I heard Akuro-Ou was defeated.\n
Now we need to rebuild.

column5: 店はまだやっていないよ
column6: The store isn't open yet.

column5:
悪路王が暴れて逃げていた人達も\n
ようやく町へ戻ってきはじめた\n
よかった　よかった
column6:
Those who fled when Akuro-Ou attacked are finally coming back.\n
Things are looking up.

column5:
離ればなれになったお母ちゃんに\n
会えたんだ！悪路王をやっつけた人に\n
お礼を言いたいな〜
column6: I can see my mother again! I'd like to shake hands with whoever killed Akuro-Ou!

column5:
お城からときどき\n
笛の音が聞こえて来ます\n
ずいぶん重悲しい音色で気味が悪いわ〜
column6: Sometimes I can hear a flute playing from the castle. It's a heart-wrenching melody...

column5:
鬼がいなくなり\n
これでサムライたちがもどってこなきゃ\n
言うことないんだがね
column6: Now that the Oni is gone, I'd be okay with the samurai not coming back.

column5:
大名の世界も厳しいんものよ\n
米沢城の伊達の殿様も\n
ショーグンのくらいを狙ったんで
column6: The world of Daimyo is a harsh one. It seems Lord Date of Yonezawa Castle wanted to become the next Shogun.

column5:
ショーグンみずから仁木弾正を\n
そそのかして\n
クーデターを起こさせたってはなしだ
column6: In retaliation, the Shogun himself instigated Nikki Danjou to stage a coup.

column5:
しけた町だな\n
三戸のトバにでも行くか
column6: This town is depressing. I think I'll go to Sannohe's gambling den.

column5: 大門教会
column6: Daimon Church

column5:
大門教に　入会すると\n
不老不死に　なれるわよ
column6: If you join the Cult of Daimon, you'll become immortal.

column5:
大門教の　人は　みんな\n
あわてて　城に　いったわ\n
どうしたの　かしら
column6:
All the members of the Cult of Daimon retreated to the castle in a hurry.\n
I wonder what happened?

column5: 板が少し浮いている
column6: The boards are loose here.

column5: 板をはがすと　隠し階段があった
column6: You remove the boards and find a hidden stairway.

column5: 白河城
column6: Shirakawa Castle

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　縄わらじが　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is a pair of rope sandals inside.

column5: 縄わらじを　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Rope Sandals.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　なにも　入っていなかった
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is nothing inside.

column5: 板が少し浮いている
column6: The boards are loose here.

column5: 板をはがすと　隠し階段があった
column6: You remove the boards and find a hidden stairway.

column5: 白河城
column6: Shirakawa Castle

column5:
このたびの　はたらき　アッパレ！\n
ワシも　目が　さめたワイ
column6:
I've finally come to my senses.\n
Well done, young hero!

column5:
なに・・・・\n
そうか　それでは白河の関は通れぬな！
column6: I see...So the Shirakawa barrier is impassable.

column5:
よし！　なこその関から行くがよい\n
そう　伝えておくぞ！
column6: Very well, you may go through the Nakoso barrier! I'll send word ahead!
column7: NOTE: fun fact, you don't actually have to talk to him to be able to go through the barrier

column5: アッパレ　アッパレ！
column6: Well done, well done!

column5:
若トノさまより　よろしくとの　こと\n
ジライア殿　ありがとう　ござった
column6:
Thank you, Ziria-dono.\n
The young lord sends his regards.

column5:
ありがとうござった　ジライア殿！\n
この城の　北にある　白河の関から\n
りくう国に　いかれるが　よかろう
column6: Thank you, Ziria-dono! You may now cross the Shirakawa barrier north of this castle and reach the lands of Rikuu.

column5:
これで　ばんもう国も\n
よい国に　なるでしょう\n
よかった　よかった
column6: The lands of Banmou can finally return to their former glory.

column5: 板が少し浮いている
column6: The boards are loose here.

column5: 板をはがすと　隠し階段があった
column6: You remove the boards and find a hidden stairway.

column5: 白河城
column6: Shirakawa Castle

column5:
ワシは　この城の　大トノじゃ！\n
あの女に　ダマされて　おった\n
関所は　とおれるように　しよう！
column6: I am the lord of the castle! That woman played me for a fool. I grant you permission to cross the checkpoint!

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　落花の巻物が　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
You find the scroll of Rakka.

column5: 落花の巻物を　手に入れた\n
column6: Obtained Scroll of Rakka.\n

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　なにも　入っていなかった
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is nothing inside.

column5: 白河城
column6: Shirakawa Castle

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　金　２００両が　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There are 両200 inside.

column5: 金　２００両を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained 両200.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　ガマの油が　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is toad oil inside.

column5: ガマの油を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Toad Oil.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　白ヘビの石が　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is a White Snake stone inside.

column5: 白ヘビの石を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained White Snake Stone.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　なにも　入っていなかった
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is nothing inside.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
大トノの　スケベにも　こまったわい\n
タマモの　うなじをみて　ムラムラして\n
けっこんしたそうな！　わかいのう
column6: Tamamo only had to show the lord a little nape to get him to marry her! Today's youth can only think with their pants!

column5:
タマモ姫は　東のほうへ\n
いったぞよ！
column6: I saw Tamamohime heading eastward!

column5:
あぶくま洞から　かえってきた\n
タマモ姫が　いかり　くるって\n
城に入って　いったのう
column6: Tamamohime just returned from the Abukuma Caves. She looked livid as she headed inside the castle.

かみさんと　娘が　こんなときに\n
かぜ　こじらしちまって\n
ふんだり　けったりだよ！！
column6: I have some nasty hiccups. My wife and daughter seem to have caught them as well.
column7: ZenkiTN: in the original text he has a cold (so he's coughing), but a cough doesn't work with the way I wrote the fox sounds. In Japanese, foxes go "kon kon", but I wrote "yip yip" after looking for a good onomatopoeia for a fox. "kon kon" would work as a cough (a bit of a stretch), "yip yip" wouldn't. So I went for hiccups (I think it works). The joke here is that the old man is convinced his wife and daughter aren't possessed by evil kitsune. To be clear, his wife and daughter ARE possessed, since they also laugh creepily.

column6: House

I'm Master Toubei's apprentice!\n
The castle's dungeons are full of similar-looking rooms. It's rough going!

There are two checkpoints to the lands of Rikuu.

The Shirakawa barrier is north of the castle, while the Nakoso barrier is north of Inugami Village.

How am I supposed to do business like this?! I'm a merchant, for gods' sake!
column7: ZenkiTN: "gods' sake" because it's plural (though to be fair, I've been writing Gods, plural, but that was just my assumption. CHECK whether it's singular or plural when possible.)

column6: They are heroes of justice who live in the mountains, sent by the Gods to protect Jipang.

column5:
いると　つたえられるが\n
ほんとうの　ことは　わからない
column6:
It is said that there are three tribes:\n
Toad, Slug, and Snake.\n
However, little is known about them.

column5:
大門教とは\n
ちかごろ　江戸を　中心に　広がった\n
あたらしい　しゅうきょうだ
column6: The Cult of Daimon is a religion from abroad that recently took root in Edo.

column5:
入会すると　不老不死に　なれると\n
せんでん　されているが\n
インチキくさい
column6: They claim that you'll become immortal if you join them, but that is nothing more than an empty promise.

column5: くわしい　ことは　わかって　いない
column6: I'm afraid there isn't much to say.

column5:
マサカドとは\n
むかし　むかし　ジパングを　支配\n
しようとした　オニ族の王　である
column6: Masakado was a king of the Oni Clan who attempted to conquer Jipang a long time ago.

column5:
しかし　神々の　いかりに　ふれて\n
聖なる玉を　あたえられた　火の一族に\n
江戸の　地下へ　封じられた　らしい
column6: The Gods then bestowed upon the Fire Clan the sacred orbs, and Masakado was sealed away deep under the town of Edo.

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
１０両でございますが\n
おとまりですか？
column6:
Welcome!\n
It's 両10 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　どうぞ
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　どうぞ
column6: See you soon.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
わしは　うらない師じゃ　どれどれ\n
うむ！　おまえさんたちの　行く手には\n
おそろしい　敵が　いっぱいじゃ！
column6:
I'm a fortune-teller!\n
Let me look into your future...I see...\n
Your path is filled with enemies!

column5:
敵は　強い！　ものすごく　強い！！\n
くじけたら　まけるぞ！\n
がんばり　なされよ！
column6:
Many enemies! Powerful enemies!\n
But you must not give up!\n
Hang in there, boy!

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5: いらっしゃい
column6: Welcome.

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: 少しは遊んだほうがいいよ！ボク！
column6: It's okay to stop and relax from time to time!

column5: 村長の家
column6: Elder's House

column5:
あんた　ジライアさん　だね！\n
わしが　キコリ村の　村長じゃ\n
村にいる　ツナデを　つれてくるのじゃ
column6:
You must be Ziria-san!\n
I'm the elder of Lumberjack Village.\n
Please, take Tsunade with you.

column5:
この　神のオノは　むかし\n
ナメクジ仙人から　もらったのじゃが\n
ツナデなら　つかえる　はずじゃ
column6: The Slug Hermit left the God Axe in our care. I'm sure Tsunade can wield it.

column5: －ツナデは　神のオノを　得た－
column6: Tsunade has received the God Axe.

column5:
おまえたちには　だいじな\n
やくめが　あるはずだ\n
さあ　行きなさい！
column6:
You must accomplish your mission.\n
Good luck!

column5: 土産屋
column6: Souvenir Shop

column5:
いらっしゃいませ\n
巻物はいかがですか
column6:
Welcome.\n
Would you like a scroll?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: またどうぞ
column6: Come back anytime.

column5: 本殿
column6: Sanctuary

column5:
ここは飯綱神社じゃ\n
戸隠神社の西の方じゃよ
column6:
This is Iizuna Shrine.\n
Tokugashi Shrine is to the west.

column5: 本殿
column6: Sanctuary

column5:
いらっしゃいませ\n
効き目のたしかな\n
お札やお守りはいかが
column6: Welcome. Would you like to buy charms and talismans that actually work?

column5: どうもありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: またどうぞ
column6: Come back anytime.

column5: 酒屋
column6: Liquor Store

column5:
忍の上杉氏と鎌倉のショーグンが\n
江戸を攻める準備をしているそうだ
column6: Rumor is that Uesugi of Shinobu and the Shogun of Kamakura are preparing to attack Edo.

column5:
江戸の滝川はタイクーン方だって話だ\n
はさみ打ちにされちゃ\n
ひとたまりもあるまいよ
column6: Takigawa of Edo is a Taikun. He won't stand a chance against a pincer attack.
column7: ZenkiTN: I'm not sure exactly what タイクーン方 is supposed to mean, but since this line is probably unused I guess it's not worth losing my mind over it.

column5:
赤地　黄色い文字で\n
「大」と　しるされた　大きな石がある
column6: There is a large red stone marked with a yellow 大 symbol.

column5: なにもありませんでした
column6: You find nothing.

column5:
溶岩が　激しく吹き出しいる\n
もはや　米沢城には　入れない
column6:
Lava is gushing out violently.\n
There's no returning to Yonezawa Castle.

column5: 陸羽国
column6: Rikuu

column5:
うにゃ！　光が・・　光がまぶしい\n
ああ　とても　長いこと\n
眠っていたような　気がします
column6:
Meowr...It's so bright...\n
How long have I been sleeping?

column5:
大門教に　石に　封じ込められて以来\n
ジパングの　行く末を　思っては\n
ひとり　涙に　くれておりました
column6: Ever since the Cult of Daimon sealed me inside this boulder, I've been crying, thinking about the future of Jipang.

column5:
だが　もう　悲しむことはない\n
火の勇者が　立ち上がったのですから！\n
今度は　われわれが　反撃する　番です
column6:
But the time for tears is over, for the Fire Heroes have come!\n
Now we fight back!

column5:
ジライアよ！　おまえに\n
ダンジョウの魔法を　封じる\n
この　禁印の巻物を　さずけましょう
column6: Ziria! I bestow upon you the power to seal Danjou's magic: the Scroll of Kinin!

column5:
禁印の術は　おまえの　念じる心が\n
敵の　魔力に　うちかったとき\n
敵の一人の魔法を　封じ込める術です！
column6: If an opponent casts a spell on you while you are chanting the Kinin jutsu, their magic will be sealed!
column7: NOTE: pretty sure this is incorrect and it just seals the opponent's magic as long as it doesn't fail

column5:
大門教を　たおすのです！\n
マサカドを　復活させては　なりません\n
行くのです！　ジライア！
column6:
Take down the Cult of Daimon!\n
Do not allow them to revive Masakado!\n
Go forth, young Ziria!

column5: 神獣白ネコの　封印を　解き放った
column6: You have broken the seal of the divine beast White Cat.

column5: 禁印の巻物を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Scroll of Kinin.

column5:
禁印の術は　おまえの　念じる心が\n
敵の　魔力に　うちかったとき\n
敵の一人の魔法を　封じ込める術です！
column6: If an opponent casts a spell on you while you are chanting the Kinin jutsu, their magic will be sealed!

column5:
大門教を　たおすのです！\n
マサカドを　復活させては　なりません\n
行くのです！　ジライア！
column6:
Take down the Cult of Daimon!\n
Do not allow them to revive Masakado!\n
Go forth, young Ziria!

column5:
よくやりました　ジライア！\n
私はあなたの活躍を　影で\n
見守っていました
column6:
Well done, Ziria!\n
I've been observing your exploits in secret.

column5:
あなたが　死んだと思っている\n
あくろう王は\n

column6: Know that King Akurou is not dead, for I have saved him.

column5:
さぁ・・・　勇者の力で\n
大門教をたおすのです
column6: Young hero...Do not stop until the Cult of Daimon is no more.

column5:
もはや　すべての橋は渡れるはず・・\n
行くのです！　ジライア！！
column6: You should be able to cross all the bridges now. Go forth, Ziria!

column5:
オニさんも　子どもも\n
みんな　助かって　よかったね！\n
わたし　こういうの　よわいんだ！
column6: I'm so glad Oni Guy and the little tyke are okay! Man, happy endings always get me!

column5: グッスン！
column6: (sniff)

column5:
よく来てくれた　ジライアよ\n
わたしは　神の使い　白トカゲだ\n
かならず　来ると　思っていたよ
column6:
I've been expecting you, Ziria.\n
I am the White Lizard, a messenger of the divine.

column5:
ジパングに　危きが　おとずれたとき\n
いずこともなく　現れる！\n
それが　火の勇者の　宿命なのだ！！
column6:
Whenever a threat looms over Jipang, the Fire Heroes shall appear...\n
So has it been foretold.

column5:
ジライアよ！　マサカドは\n
目覚めずとも　その怨念の力は\n
言語を　絶して　おそろしい
column6: Listen! Though Masakado himself may not have been revived yet, the might of his grudge defies all logic!

column5:
風は荒れ　大地はくさり　海は干上がる\n
われわれ神獣も　そのまえに\n
屈したのだ！
column6: The wind howls, the earth splits, the seas dry. We divine beasts are forced to yield!
column7: ZenkiTN: this is paraphrasing the intro

column5:
ジライアよ！　おまえに\n
わたしの　神通力を　しるした\n
この　涼風の巻物を　さずけよう！
column6: Ziria! I bestow upon you the scroll of Suzukaze, which contains my divine power!

column5:
涼風の術は　さわやかな\n
風が　体を　吹きぬけ\n
体内の　毒素を　消しさる技だ！
column6: The Suzukaze jutsu releases a refreshing breeze that sweeps poison from your body!

column5:
よいか！　マサカドを　ふたたび\n
目覚めることのない　深い眠りに\n
つけるのだ！　たのむぞ　ジライア！
column6: Young Ziria! Do what you must to prevent Masakado from waking from his slumber!

column5: 神獣白トカゲの　封印を　解き放った
column6: You have broken the seal of the divine beast White Lizard.

column5: 涼風の巻物を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Scroll of Suzukaze.

column5:
涼風の術は　さわやかな\n
風が　体を　吹きぬけ\n
体内の毒素を　消しさる技だ！
column6: Ziria! I bestow upon you the scroll of Suzukaze, which contains my divine power!

column5:
よいか！　マサカドを　ふたたび\n
目覚めることのない　深い眠りに\n
つけるのだ！　たのむぞ　ジライア！
column6: Young Ziria! Do what you must to prevent Masakado from waking from his slumber!

column5: 雲切の里５
column6: Kumogiri Hamlet 5

column5:
ジライアさま　ですね！！\n
りくう国の　雲切の里５へ\n
ようこそ　おいでくださいました
column6:
You must be Ziria-sama!\n
Welcome to Kumogiri Hamlet 5 in Rikuu.

column5:
この里は　あまり\n
あなたの　お役に　立てませんが\n
いっしょうけんめい　オーエンします！
column6: I'm afraid we won't be able to help you much, but we'll be cheering you on!

column5:
北の橋を　わたると　\n
オニの大将　あくろう王がいる\n
多賀城が　あります
column6: Cross the bridge to the north and you'll reach Taga Castle, ruled by the Oni general, King Akurou.

column5:
おっ！\n
これは　ジライアさま！！\n
たいへんな　ことに　なりましたぞ！！
column6: The situation is dire, Ziria-sama!

column5:
オニの大将　あくろう王が\n
なんと　大門教の味方に\n
加わって　しまいましたぞ！
column6: The Oni general, King Akurou, has joined the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
あの男は　異様に　強い！！！\n
ジライアさまの　力を　もってしても\n
倒せるかどうか！！
column6:
His strength is out of this world!\n
I don't know if you can defeat him!

column5:
この　りくう国じゃ\n
深刻な　米不足が\n
続いて　おりますじゃ！！
column6: The lands of Rikuu are suffering from a rice shortage!

column5:
かぞえきれぬ　くらいの　ネズミが\n
米のひほつぶまへ　残さず\n
喰い荒らひて　ほるのへすじゃ！
column6: Rats beyond number run rampant across the country, ruining the fields and eating up every bit of grain!

column5:
オラも　三日前はら\n
なにも　くふてほらんのへ\n
力がぬけへ　ひたへすじゃ
column6:
I haven't had a good meal in three days...\n
I can barely stand...

column5:
あくろう王は　りくう国の　オニたちに\n
わるいことを　させないように\n
まとめていた　たいしたやつ　だったが
column6: King Akurou used to be a great man who kept the Oni in the lands of Rikuu from evil ways.

column5:
なんで　また　大門教なんかに\n
入会しちまったんだ！！\n
おれには　信じられん！！！
column6: But he went and joined the Cult of Daimon! Why would he do that?!

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
あくろう王は　もとは　りくう国の王で\n
いいやつ　だったんだが\n
大門教に　入会しちまってよ・・・
column6: King Akurou used to be the just ruler of Rikuu, but then he joined the Cult of Daimon...

column5:
あくろう王は　大門教に　なにか\n
弱味を　にぎられているんだわ\n
ほんとうは　とても　いいひとなのよ！
column6: I bet the Daimonists are blackmailing King Akurou. He's really a good man!

column5:
いやはや　りくう国には\n
川と橋が　多くて　土地のもんでも\n
迷うて　しまいますわ！
column6: The lands of Rikuu are full of rivers and bridges. Even the locals get lost!

column5:
あくろう王が　大門教に　くだった　今\n
りくう国は　大門教に\n
支配されたと　いっても　よいでしょう
column6: With King Akurou on their side, the Cult of Daimon has control over Rikuu.

column5:
火の勇者　ジライアさま！！\n
この国を　すくえるのは　もはや\n
あなたさま　だけです！
column6:
Ziria-sama, the Fire Hero!\n
Only you can save these lands!

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　１５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両15 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　１５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両15 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5:
ここは　温泉やど！！\n
今どき　なんと　タダ！！\n
泊らないとソン！！　泊まる？！
column6:
This is a hot spring inn! It's completely free! You should stay for a while!\n
How about it?

column5: また　おいで！！
column6: Come back!

column5: ごゆっくり！！
column6: Rest well!

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 賭場
column6: Gambling Den

column5:
ジライアさん　じゃないですかぁ！\n
こんな所で　遊んでいて　いいんですか\n
まっ　たまには　息ぬきしないとね
column6:
My, if it isn't Ziria-san!\n
Should you really be here?\n
Eh, I guess it's fine every once in a while!

column5:
ツボふりの　ネエちゃん　きれいだろ！\n
もう　ちょっとで\n
見えそう　なんだけどなあ！！
column6:
The dice lady is a real babe!\n
When I play, I'm not exactly looking at the dice, if you catch my drift!

column5:
二つの　サイコロの目を　たして\n
偶数なら　「丁」で\n
奇数なら　「半」だ！
column6:
It's a simple game!\n
Just bet whether the sum of the two dice will be even or odd!

column5:
足もとに　なにか落ちている\n
新月刀だ！！
column6:
There is something on the ground.\n
It's a New Moon Sword!
column7: NOTE: just for reference, if you walk on the path behind the shrine and to the end of the dead end, you get this

column5: 新月刀を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained New Moon Sword.

column5: 新月刀を　手渡した
column6: You hand over the New Moon Sword.

column5: 多賀町
column6: Taga Town

column5:
あくろう王さまは　人が変わられた！！\n
この　多賀町で　あまり\n
ウロウロしないほうが　いいよ
column6: King Akurou is like a different person now! You'd best not tarry here in Taga!

column5:
ジライアさま\n
あくろう王さまと　お子さまのこと\n
くれぐれも　よろしく　おねがいします
column6: Ziria-sama, please take care of King Akurou and his son.

column5:
あくろう王さまは　むかしは\n
そりゃ　とっても　よい人　だったのに\n
どうしたの　かしら
column6:
King Akurou used to be a good man.\n
I wonder what happened?

column5:
そういえば　ちかごろ\n
お子さんの　お姿も　おみうけしないわ\n
なにか　関係があるのかしら
column6: Come to think of it, I haven't seen his son around lately. Maybe there's a connection?

column5:
ダンジョウに　お子さまを\n
人質に　とられていたなんて・・・\n
大門教は　なんて　ひきょうなのかしら
column6: So Danjou kidnapped King Akurou's son...How low can the Daimonists stoop?

column5:
しょうぼう車　みてえな　やつが\n
新月刀を　ほしがっていたぞ！\n
本当に　困ったら　あげろ！！
column6:
The guy wailing like a fire truck over by the castle wants a New Moon Sword.\n
Just give him one before I lose my mind!

column5: ウー　ウー！　ウー　ウー！
column6: Weeee-oooow! Weeee-oooow!

column5:
本当に　困った　やつだな！\n
島[color]<$00>と[color]<$01>橋[color]<$00>の[color]<$01>迷路[color]<$00>は　[color]<$01>木[color]<$00>を　目印にして\n
歩けば　いいんだよ
column6:
Sheesh, you guys are hopeless!\n
Just keep your eye on the [color]<$01>trees[color]<$00>, and the [color]<$01>maze[color]<$00> of [color]<$01>islands[color]<$00> and [color]<$01>bridges[color]<$00> is nothing!
column7:
CHECK, these two lines uses color codes in the text, but it looks like the box itself has a color code. I'm not 100% sure this will work properly.
Supper: oh, apparently there's an error in the script dumper where the first color code in a box will always get placed at the start, even if it's in the middle. i never realized because this seems to be the only box in the entire game where a single color doesn't apply to the whole box. huh.

So much for being a [color]<$01>maze[color]<$00>!\n
The [color]<$01>trees[color]<$00> show how to go through those [color]<$01>mountains[color]<$00> and [color]<$01>bridges[color]<$00>! It's so easy!

column5:
ただし　その途中の　雲切の里６[color]<$00>には\n
かならず　寄れよ！\n
本当に　困った　やつだ！！
column6:
But make sure you remember to stop by [color]<$01>Kumogiri Hamlet 6[color]<$00> along the way!\n
Sheesh, what a piece of work you are!

column5:
りくうの国は\n
大きな川によって　たくさんの小島に\n
分けられている国じゃ
column6: The lands of Rikuu are divided into numerous small islands by a large river.

column5:
そのため　かぞえきれないくらい\n
たくさんの　橋が　かけられている\n
ぜひ　地図を　お買いなされ！
column6:
That's why there are so many bridges.\n
You'd better bring a map with you before you get lost!

column5:
ただでさえ　橋が　多くて\n
迷いやすいのに　大門教の　バカどもが\n
橋に　魔法を　かけおった！！
column6: Walking through these lands is hard enough as it is, but those Daimonist jerks cast a spell on the bridges, too!

column5:
渡ろうとすると　引きもどされる\n
そこで　ついた　名前が　ズッコロ橋！\n
渡れそうで　渡れない橋じゃ！！
column6:
When you cross certain bridges, you get pulled back to the start!\n
It's like being on a darn slide!
column7:
ZenkiTN: the original text calls them ズッコロ橋 (zukkorobashi), which is something that I can't really translate since it won't make sense for western players, but I'd like to explain it here. Basically this is a reference to a counting song (something like "Eeny, meeny, miny, moe"). There is a connection with the plot of this part of the game, since this song also talks about rats stealing rice and eating it. But I feel like I simply cannot convey this in English in a way that won't feel forced. You can find some info by googling "zukkorobashi".
Supper: oh don't worry, I'm plenty familiar with it (thank you yumimi)

column5:
ジライア　おにいちゃんだね\n
雲切りの里の人に\n
伝えてくれって　頼まれたんだ！
column6:
Hey, big guy! You're Ziria, right?\n
I bring a message from Kumogiri Hamlet!

column5:
米沢城の　ダンジョウが\n
橋で　待ち伏せしている　そうだよ\n
気をつけてね！　おにいちゃん！
column6: Danjou of Yonezawa Castle is going to ambush you at the bridge! Be careful!

column5:
ネズミに　米を　ぬすまれたわ！\n
あくろう王さまが\n
しっかり　しないからよ！　まったく！
column6: Rats stole all our rice! Why isn't King Akurou doing anything?!

column5:
あくろう王さまは　城の中さ・・・\n
会っても　しかたないと　思うけど\n
まあ　行くだけ　行って　みなされ
column6: King Akurou is inside. I doubt he'll be willing to talk, but...Well, go ahead.

column5:
あくろう王さまの　お心が　戻ったのは\n
ジライアさまの　おかげです\n
ありがとうございました
column6:
King Akurou finally came to his senses.\n
Thank you, Ziria-sama.

column5:
あくろう王さまは\n
オニ族を　まとめ　人々の　平和を\n
つくって　いたのに・・・
column6: King Akurou once brought peace between Oni and humans.

column5:
あくろう王さまは　\n
かわって　しまわれたから・・・
column6: But now, he's like a different person altogether...

column5:
ジライアさま\n
あくろう王さまと　力を合わせて\n
ダンジョウを　倒してください
column6: Ziria-sama, please help King Akurou defeat Danjou.

column5:
いいかい　他の人に　物を\n
渡したきゃ　その人の　そばで\n
［どうぐ］→［つかう］だよ
column6: To give something to someone else, stand in front of them and select {Items,} then {Use.}
column7:
CHECK, confirm these are the correct menu terms.
Supper: yep. ...until i decided to change them later on.

column6: Inn

ここは　宿屋でございます

column5:
ひと晩　３０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両30 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　３０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両30 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5:
小耳に　はさんだんだが\n
ねこま村の　白ネコさまが\n
大門教の　手に　かかったそうだ！
column6: I heard that the Cult of Daimon has captured the sacred White Cat of Nekoma Village!

column5:
ネコなら　ネズミに\n
勝てると　思ったんだがな\n

column6:
Rats overpowering a cat...\n
This world is really falling apart!
column7: ZenkiTN: Danjou's true form is a giant rat, but there are also rat-like common enemies (like there are kitsune in the previous country)

column5:
ジライアさま！！\n
わたしは　この国の　南西のはずれの\n
ねこま村の　神社の者で　ございます！
column6: Ziria-sama! I come from the Nekoma Village shrine, on the southwest corner of these lands.

column5:
お願いがあって　まいりました\n
大門教の　封印を　とき\n
白ネコさまを　お救いください
column6: Please save our sacred White Cat, I beg you!

column5:
白ネコさまなら　きっと\n
大門教の　ダンジョウを\n
こらしめる　すべを　ごぞんじのはず！
column6: I'm sure the White Cat knows how to defeat Danjou of the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
白ネコさまを　お助けいただき\n
ありがとうございました
column6: Thank you for rescuing our sacred White Cat.

column5: 武具屋
column6: Armory

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　武具屋です\n
ご用件は　何ですか？

Welcome to my armory!\n
How can I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それでは　また　ご利用ください
column6: Come back anytime.

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 預かり所
column6: Warehouse

column5: 神社
column6: Shrine

column5:
火の一族のかたと　おみうけいたします\n
あくろう王さまとの　たたかいは\n
さけられないことかも　しれません
column6: You must be the descendant of the Fire Clan. A clash between you and King Akurou may be inevitable now.

column5:
しかし　その前に\n
伝えておきたいことが　あります
column6: However, I'd like to tell you something first.

column5:
この神社は　あくろう王さまが\n
町の民を　思い\n
お建てになったものです
column6: King Akurou erected this very shrine for the good of the people of Taga.

column5:
そんな　おやさしい　あくろう王さまが\n
自らの意志で　大門教に　入ったとは\n
とても　思えないのです
column6:
A kind and gentle soul like him would never willingly join the Cult of Daimon.\n
That is my belief.

column5:
ありがとうございました\n
ジライアさま！！\n
多賀の町の民も　感謝しております
column6: Thank you, Ziria-sama. You have earned the gratitude of the people of Taga.

column5: 鉄のとびらが閉まった
column6: The iron gate closes.
column7: NOTE: most people would never see this, but if you try to leave the castle after beating akurou but before accepting his request, the gates shut and block you. real benevolent guy.

column5:
鉄のとびらが　ある\n
がっちりと　カギが　かかっている
column6:
There is an iron gate here.\n
It's locked tight.

column5: なにもありませんでした
column6: You find nothing.

column5: 多賀城
column6: Taga Castle

column5:
あなたは　もしや　ジライア殿？！\n
あの　うわさの　火の一族の勇者\n
ジライア殿　なのですね！！
column6: Could you be Ziria-dono, the famed hero of the Fire Clan?!

column5:
おねがいです　あくろう王さまの\n
むすこさまを　大門教のやつらから\n
とりかえして　ください！
column6: Please, you must rescue the Young Master from the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
そうすれば　あくろう王さまは\n
きっと　むかしのように\n
やさしい　王さまに　もどられるはず！
column6: Once his son is back, King Akurou will return to his normal kind self!

column5:
あくろう王さま　とて\n
きっと　大門教の　手先になどに\n
なりたくは　ないので　ござる！！
column6: King Akurou would never willingly join the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
だが　お子さまを　人質に！\n
クソッ！　大門教め！\n
なんて　ひきょうな　やつらなんだ！！
column6: But they've kidnapped the Young Master! Damn those Daimonist cowards!

column5:
あくろう王さま　とて\n
きっと　大門教の　手先になどに\n
なりたくは　なかったので　ござる！！
column6: King Akurou never wanted to join the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
だが　お子さまを　人質に！\n
クソッ！　大門教め！\n
なんて　ひきょうな　やつらなんだ！！
column6: But they've kidnapped the Young Master! Damn those Daimonist cowards!

column5:
しかた　ないのじゃ\n
あくろう王様の　お子さまが\n
大門教に　ゆうかいされて・・・
column6: The Cult of Daimon has kidnapped the Young Master. We have no choice...

column5:
あくろう王さまは　火の勇者を\n
多賀城から　先に　行かせないように\n
ダンジョウに　命令されています！
column6: Danjou ordered King Akurou to stop the Fire Hero from crossing Taga!

column5:
あくろう王さまは　ジライアさまを\n
多賀城から　先に　行かせないように\n
ダンジョウに　命令されていたんです！
column6: Danjou ordered King Akurou not to let you cross Taga!

column5:
じつは　おれの　子どもが\n
大門教の　ダンジョウに\n
人質に　とられている
column6: The truth is, Danjou of the Cult of Daimon is holding my son hostage.

column5:
そのために　ききたくもない\n
ダンジョウの　命令を\n
きいていたのだ！！
column6: That is the only reason I've been following his orders!

column5:
勇者ジライアよ！！\n
おれの　子どもを　その力で\n
助け出してくれないか
column6:
Brave Ziria!\n
I beg of you to rescue my son!

column5:
さすが　勇者だ！！\n
おれの　命は　あずけよう\n
いっしょに　ダンジョウと　戦うぞ！
column6:
You truly are a hero!\n
My life is yours.\n
Let us face Danjou together!

column5: あくろう王の　依頼を　引き受けた
column6: You have accepted King Akurou's request.

column5:
あくろう王が\n
仲間に　くわわった
column6: King Akurou has joined your party.

column5:
たのむ！きいてくれ！\n
それまでは\n
ここを　うごくわけには　いかぬ！
column6: I need your help! You won't be going anywhere until you agree!
column7: NOTE as mentioned above, you're locked inside the castle until you agree

column5:
オニさんが　ついてきて\n
くれるなら　こころづよいね\n
ジライア！！
column6:
It's so cool that Oni Guy joined us!\n
Right, Ziria?

column5:
おれは　オニさんではない！\n
オニ族の大将　あくろう王だ！！
column6:
I am NOT {Oni Guy}!\n
I'm the Oni general, King Akurou!

column5:
だって　あくとうみたいじゃん\n
オニさんのほうが　かわいいよ！！\n
さっ！　子どもを　助けにいこ
column6:
Nah, that sounds like a villain name.\n
I'm sticking with {Oni Guy}!\n
C'mon, let's go save the kid!

column5:
おれは　白ネコさまに　助けられた！\n
りくう国と　人々のために\n
オニ族を　まとめ　はたらくさ
column6:
I was saved by the White Cat!\n
I'll do my best to bring the Oni and the humans of Rikuu together.

column5:
おわかれだ　ジライア！！\n
この　鬼はちがねを　やろう\n
おれだと　おもってくれ！
column6:
I bid you farewell, Ziria!\n
Here, take this Oni Headguard as a keepsake!

column5: 鬼はちがねを　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Oni Headguard.

column5:
おれは　白ネコさまに　助けられた！\n
りくう国と　人々のために\n
オニ族を　まとめ　はたらくさ！
column6:
I was saved by the White Cat!\n
I'll do my best to bring the Oni and the humans of Rikuu together!

column5:
ありがとう　ございました\n
ジライアさんと　戦ったことは\n
父の　じまん　なんですよ
column6:
Thank you, Ziria-san.\n
Father was proud to fight alongside you.

column5:
われらも　りくう国の　ために\n
はたらきます
column6: We'll work hard for the sake of Rikuu.

column5:
大門教を　たおし\n
マサカドの　復活を\n
阻止してください
column6: You must defeat the Cult of Daimon and prevent Masakado's resurrection.

column5:
オニ族と　りくう国には\n
あくろう王さまの　お力が\n
どうしても　ひつようなんです
column6: The Oni and the lands of Rikuu need King Akurou.

column5:
われわれも　あくろう王さまと　ともに\n
りくう国の　再建のために\n
がんばる　つもりです！！
column6: We'll do all we can to restore Rikuu to its former glory!

column5:
あくろう王さまは\n
しかたなく　のこるのです！\n
わかってください！
column6: I'm sorry, but we need King Akurou here!

column5:
ほんとうは　ジライアさんたちと\n
大門教打倒のために\n
たたかいたいのです！
column6: The truth is, he'd love nothing more than to follow you on your quest to defeat the Cult of Daimon!

column5: 雲切の里６
column6: Kumogiri Hamlet 6

column5:
里の者　みんなで\n
大門教を　なんとかせねばと\n
たたかったのですが
column6: Everyone from our hamlet fought hard against the Cult of Daimon...

column5:
大門教　１３人衆の　３番手\n
ダンジョウの　使う　魔法に\n
ことごとく　やられてしまいました
column6: But in the end, we couldn't overcome the spells of Danjou, the third of the Thirteen Daimon Cultists.

column5:
ダンジョウって　やつは　魔神像の力で\n
なんどでも　復活しちまうんです！\n
おれたちじゃ　たおせません！！
column6: The Demon Statue revives Danjou as soon as he's killed! He's basically immortal!

column5:

ちがいないわ！！
column6: Danjou must be waiting in ambush on the bridge to Hiraizumi Village. I'm sure of it!

column5:
ダンジョウを　たおす力を\n

あの橋を　渡らないでください！！
column6: Please -- don't cross that bridge until you have the means to defeat him!

column5:
おわん出せ〜　おわん出せ〜\n
おわん出せ〜の　おはしに〜
column6:
Oh when the sink! Oh when the sink!\n
Oh when the sink got matching inn!
column7: ZenkiTN: again, this is "When the saints go marching in" but misheard

column5:
ホテイ丸って　いう人が\n
ジライアさんに　よろしくって\n
えーと　ねこま村に　行くってさ！！
column6: I learned that from a funny man called Hoteimaru! He sends his regards! Oh, and he said you should go to Nekoma Village!

村の米を　ネズミが\n
みんな　食っちまって
column6: Hiraizumi Village to the west is suffering heavily under a rice shortage.

村人は　食うもんが　のうて\n
そこらに　はえとる　草まで\n
食うとるそうじゃ！！
column6:
The rats keep eating all the grain.\n
The residents are forced to feed on grass to survive!

すいません！\n
つまらないもの　なんですが\n
もし　よかったら
column6:
Hey, friend!\n
I have something that might interest you!

column5:
たすけると　おもって\n
安くして　おきますから\n
買って　いただけませんかねぇ
column6: It's not exactly cheap, but I'm willing to negotiate. Trust me, it's worth every coin!

column5:
ヘンな品物では　ないんです！\n
名のある大僧正が　お作りになられた\n
由緒正しき　大カナヅチ！！
column6: I'm talking about a sacred object made by the Buddhist Daisoujou: the famous Great Hammer! This isn't a scam!

column5:
どんなタタリも　くだけちる\n
大僧正の法力つき！！\n
いまならたったの　３０万両だ！
column6: This baby can channel the power of Buddha and crush any curse in a single swing! And it's yours for only 両300,000!

column5: どうする　買うかい？
column6: How about it?

column5:
じゃあ　２０万両だ！！\n
どうする　買うかい？
column6: No? Well, how about 両200,000?

column5:
くそー　じゃあ　１０万両だ！！\n
どうする　買うかい？
column6:
You drive a hard bargain, friend!\n
両100,000! Can't go lower than this!

column5: やっぱり　買うかい！
column6: Why, thank you!

column5:
おや？\n
金がないやつには　売れないな！
column6: Hang on, you don't have enough money!

column5: この野郎！　もってきやがれ！！
column6: Screw it! Just take it and go!

column5: 大カナヅチを手に入れた！！
column6: Obtained Great Hammer!

column5: この　ドロボウ野郎！！
column6: Don't talk to me, you thief!

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
白ネコさまの　神通力は\n
悪しき　魔法を　封じる力を\n
もっていると　きいたことがあります
column6: I heard that the sacred White Cat has the power to seal evil magic.

column5:
ネズミたいじは　ねこま神社と\n
聞いたが　どこに　あるんだろう？
column6:
The Nekoma Shrine is supposed to be great for eliminating rats.\n
But where could it be?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　１５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両15 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　１５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両15 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5:
ここは　温泉やど！！\n
今どき　なんと　タダ！！\n
泊らないとソン！！　泊まる？！
column6:
This is a hot spring inn! It's completely free! You should stay for a while!\n
How about it?

column5: また　おいで！！
column6: Come back!

column5: ごゆっくり！！
column6: Rest well!

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 賭場
column6: Gambling Den

column5:
ジライアさん　じゃないですかぁ！\n
こんな所で　遊んでいて　いいんですか\n
まっ　たまには　息ぬきしないとね
column6:
My, if it isn't Ziria-san!\n
Should you really be here?\n
Eh, I guess it's fine every once in a while!

column5:
ツボふりの　ネエちゃん　きれいだろ！\n
もう　ちょっとで\n
見えそう　なんだけどなあ！！
column6:
The dice lady is a real babe!\n
When I play, I'm not exactly looking at the dice, if you catch my drift!

二つの　サイコロの目を　たして\n

奇数なら　「半」だ！

Just bet whether the sum of the two dice will be even or odd!

オクに　つづく階段が　見える

column5: ねこま村
column6: Nekoma Village

column5:
もう　だめだ！\n
白ネコさまが\n
石に　かえられちまっただ！！
column6:
We're done for!\n
Our sacred White Cat has been turned to stone!

column5:
村の　守り神さ　いなくなっては\n
この　ねこま村も　おしまいだ！
column6: Without his divine protection, we're as good as dead!

column5:
よそものには\n
白ネコさまを　まつっとる\n
