よそものに　白ネコさまの島への\n
ぬけ道を　教えたばかりに\n
白ネコさまは　石にされちまっただ！！
column6: We told a stranger how to find the secret path to the island of the White Cat, and he was turned to stone soon after!

column5:
二度と　よそものに\n
ぬけ道さ　教えないように\n
村中で　決めただ！！
column6: We've decided never to tell any other strangers how to reach the island!

column5:
白ネコさまを　お助けいただき\n
ありがとうございました
column6: Thank you for rescuing our sacred White Cat.

column5:
この村の　北の湖の　まんなかに\n
浮かぶ小島に　白ネコさまを\n
まつってあっただに！
column6: Our sacred White Cat is enshrined in the small island in the middle of the northern lake.

column5:
大門教の　たわけ者め！！\n
バチが　あたれば　いいんじゃ！！
column6: How could those Daimonist fools turn him to stone...? May the Gods punish them!

column5:
あっ　ジライアさんでねえか？！\n
ヘンな外人が　「城が上乗せの木」へ\n
来てくれと　いっとたども

きっと　村の南東の方さ　ある\n
白河の関の　りくう国がわのことば\n
いいたかったんだべな
column6: I think he meant our side of the Shirakawa barrier, southeast from here.

column5:
雲切の里６で　大カナヅチちゅう\n
みょうちくりんな　もんを\n
買わされそうに　なったども
column6: A man in Kumogiri Hamlet 6 tried to sell me a {big hammer} or something.

column5:
あんな\n
タタリ石　くだくしか　役だたんもん\n
だれか　買うやつ　おるんかのう？
column6:
Apparently, it can break any curse stone in a single swing.\n
Like, who's gonna believe that?

column5:
むかしは　この村の南東にある\n
白河の関を　通れば\n
すぐに　白河城へ　いけたのだが
column6: Shirakawa Castle used to be a short trek away. It's just beyond the Shirakawa barrier southeast from here.

column5:
なんでも　でっかい石が　降ってきて\n
関所を　ふさいでしまったらしい
column6:
But a giant boulder came down from the sky and blocked the way.\n
How did that happen?

column5:
ジライアさん！　雲切の里のものです\n
ホテイ丸さんからの\n
伝言を　お伝えしやす
column6:
Ziria-san! I'm from Kumogiri Hamlet.\n
I bring a message from Hoteimaru.

column5:
魔神像を　はかいする道具を\n
作るためには　殺生石のカケラと\n
大カナヅチが　いるとのことです
column6: To destroy the Demon Statue, you need a fragment of the Sesshou-seki, which can only be broken with the Great Hammer.

column5:
ところで　ここの北東にある\n
雲切の里へは　行かれやしたか？\n
ぜひ　よって　くだせぇ
column6:
By the way, have you been to the Kumogiri Hamlet northeast from here?\n
Please do so if you haven't.

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
白ネコさまの　神通力があれば\n
ダンジョウの　奇っ怪な魔法を\n
封じることが　できるかもしれない！
column6: I bet the sacred White Cat could use his divine power to seal Danjou's magic!

column5:
村の　北にある　湖に面した岬は\n
まるで　ネコの　顔のような　かたちを\n
しているよ！　見て来てごらん
column6: Did you know that the shore of the lake north of the village is in the shape of a cat's head? Go and see for yourself!

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　３０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両30 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　３０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両30 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 神社
column6: Shrine

column5:
火の勇者　ジライアさまですね\n
わたしの　使いの者とは\n
お会い　いただけましたか？
column6: You must be Ziria-sama, the Fire Hero. Have you spoken with my messenger?

column5:
白ネコさまの　島へ続く\n
ぬけ道を　お教えしたいのは\n
やまやまなのですが
column6: I wish I could show you the way to the island of the sacred White Cat, but...

column5:
村人との　約束で\n
たとえ　ジライアさまと　いえども\n
お教えする　わけには　まいりません！
column6: I've promised the residents I wouldn't tell anyone. Not even you, Ziria-sama!

column5:
そこで　とうとつ　ですが\n
これから　ひとりごとを　いいますから\n
耳を　おふさぎください
column6: Now, please excuse me and pay no attention as I talk to myself.

column5:
「ネコの　クチへ　飛び込みなさい！」\n
白ネコさまのことを　くれぐれも\n
よろしく　お願いいたします！！
column6:
{Jump inside the cat's mouth!}\n
Send my regards to the sacred White Cat!

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
白ネコさまが\n
封印されて　しまったのも\n
おそろしい　ことじゃが
column6: Our sacred White Cat has been sealed inside a boulder. This is terrible...

column5:
ワシは　マサカドの　復活のほうが\n
もっと　おそろしいわ！！\n
くわばら　くわばら・・・
column6:
But you know what would be even worse?\n
If Masakado were to return!\n
May the Gods have mercy...

column5:
白ネコさまを　お助けいただき\n
ありがとう　ございました
column6: Thank you for rescuing our sacred White Cat.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
もの　わすれが\n
さいきん　激しゅうてのう\n
この話は　もう　したかのう
column6: Not many people remember this fact, but...

column5:
火の一族の　勇者が\n
はなしかけると\n
悪しき封印は　とけるのじゃ！
column6: The voice of the hero of the Fire Clan can break evil seals!

column5: 白ネコの洞
column6: White Cat Cave

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
どうして　大門教の連中だけが\n
米を　たくさん　もっているんだ！\n
ヘンじゃねえか
column6: How is it only the Daimonists have rice? Ain't that weird?

column5:
やはり　大門教の連中が\n
うしろで　糸を引いてたんですね！
column6: I knew it! Those Daimonists were behind everything!

column5:
この村の　大門教会に\n
オニの　子どもが\n
連れ込まれるのを　見たぜ！
column6: I saw a little Oni kid being dragged inside the Daimon church!

column5:
そういや\n
お連れさんに　そっくりだったなあ
column6: Come to think of it, he looked a lot like that big guy following you.

column5:
やはり　大門教の連中が\n
うしろで　糸を引いてたんですね！
column6: I knew it! Those Daimonists were behind everything!

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　３５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両35 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　３５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両35 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: 武具屋
column6: Armory

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　武具屋です\n
ご用件は　何ですか？
column6:
Welcome to my armory!\n
How can I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それでは　また　ご利用ください
column6: Come back anytime.

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 預かり所
column6: Warehouse

column5: いかにも怪しい　カーテンがある
column6: There are some highly suspicious curtains here.

column5: 隠された通路が　現れました
column6:
You open the curtains.\n
There is a hallway behind them.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
ねずみカギを　見つけた！
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
You found the Rat Key!

column5: ねずみカギを　手に入れた\n
column6: Obtained Rat Key.\n

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　なにも　入っていなかった
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is nothing inside.

column5: 大門教会
column6: Daimon Church

column5:
大門教　バンザイ！\n
めし　食える　バンザイ！！\n
はら　いっぱいだ　バンザーイ！！！
column6:
I love eating food!\n
I LOVE having a full belly!!\n
I LOVE THE CULT OF DAIMON!!!

column5:
みんな　大門教会に\n
入会さすれば　ええだに\n
米さ　もらえる　だにな
column6: It's not that hard. If you're hungry, join the Cult of Daimon.

column5:
ダンジョウさまは\n
米さ　めぐんで　くれる\n
神さま　みてえな人ね！
column6: Bow to Danjou-sama and he blesses you with rice! He's like a god!

column5:
楽しみに　しとるんじゃ\n
明日は　北の　米沢城に\n
米さ　もらいにいく日じゃ！！
column6:
I'm so happy!\n
Tomorrow is the day I go to Yonezawa Castle up north to get my ration of rice!

column5:
ダンジョウの　やつが\n
ネズミさ　あやつって\n
米ば　ぬすませとっただ！！
column6: It was Danjou all along! He's the one ordering rats to steal our rice!

column5:
その米さ　つかって\n
信者に　めぐんどったん　ですだ！\n
ひどい　はなしだべ！！
column6: He uses the rice to bait people into joining the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
その上　米やるっちゅうては\n
米沢城さ　連れてって\n
たましいさ　ぬいとったんじゃ！
column6: He forces you to go to Yonezawa Castle to get your ration, and that's when he steals your soul!

column5:
オラは　みんな　見てしもたんで\n
こっただとこ　いれられただ！
column6:
I saw everything!\n
That's why he locked me in here!

column5:
ありがとう　ジライアさん！\n
ほんだら　みなのしゅうに\n
米さ　返してくるだ！
column6:
Thank you, Ziria-san!\n
I'll return the rice to its rightful owners!

column5:
おとうさん！　助けて　くれたんだね！\n
ダンジョウは　米沢城の地下に\n
戻ったに　ちがいないよ！
column6:
Father! You came to rescue me!\n
Danjou must have retreated to the dungeons of Yonezawa Castle!

column5:
魔神像の　パワーを　もらっているんだ\n
ボクは　だいじょうぶ　だよ・・・\n
早く行って　ダンジョウを　やっつけて
column6:
He has the power of the Demon Statue on his side. I'll be fine on my own...\n
You have to stop him!

column5:
かならず　ダンジョウを　たおしてね\n
おとうさん　ジライアさん
column6: Father! Ziria-san! I know you can defeat Danjou once and for all!

column5:
ジライアさん！\n
ボク　おとうさんを\n
尊敬しているんだ
column6:
Ziria-san.\n
I have the utmost respect for my father.

column5:
ボク　だいじょうぶ　だよ・・・\n
はやく　行って\n
ダンジョウを　やっつけて！！
column6:
I'll be fine on my own.\n
You must go and stop Danjou!

column5:
めしに　つられて\n
あやうく　たましいを\n
ぬかれるところだった
column6: I can't believe I almost lost my soul over food...

column5:
話は　きいただ！　ジライアさん！\n
オラ　あぶなく\n
だまされるところだっただ！
column6: I fell for it hook, line, and sinker!

column5:
お米を　えさにして\n
たましいを　とるなんて\n
ダンジョウは　まるで　アクマね！
column6: You go get your rice and Danjou steals your soul...He's like the Devil!

column5:
ジライアさんの　おかげで\n
たましいを　とられずに\n
すんだのじゃ！
column6: If it wasn't for you, I would have lost my soul!

column5: ありがとうごぜえますだ
column6: Thank you so much!

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
米が　食いたくて\n
大門教に　ころぶ者が\n
増えておりますじゃ
column6: More and more people are joining the Cult of Daimon just to get a ration of rice.

column5:
火の勇者さまを　まえにして\n
こんなことを　いうのも\n
なんなんじゃが・・・
column6: I'm ashamed to admit this to you, but...

column5:
ワシも　いつまで\n
ガマンできるか\n
自信が　ないですじゃ
column6: I don't know how long I'll be able to resist the temptation myself.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
あんまし　はらが　たったんで\n
ネズミの　やつらを\n
追っかけてった　ことが　あるだよ
column6: One day I got so mad that I started chasing those rats to give 'em what's what.

column5:
そったら　大門教会の\n
奥のカーテンの中に\n
入っていっただよ
column6: That's when I saw 'em go behind the curtains at the back of the Daimon church.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
米沢城の　ダンジョウが\n
ときどき　この村の大門教会に\n
やって　くるだ
column6: Danjou sometimes comes from Yonezawa Castle to visit the Daimon church.

column5:
いやらしそうで　ずるがしこくって\n
とっても　クサイ　顔してたべさ\n
アタイ　あっただ人　好かん
column6: He always has that creepy, slimy grin on his face. I hate him so much.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
えーとねぇ　３人の　火の勇者が\n
うーんと・・３つの　聖なる玉を\n
つかって　マサカドを　やっつけたって
column6: My grandpa often tells me a story about the Fire Heroes...How'd it go it again?

column5:
むかし　じっちゃんが\n
しゃべって　いたんだーい！\n
ほんとだよ！！
column6:
The three Fire Heroes used the three sacred orbs to beat Masakado...somehow.\n
Grandpa said it, so it must be true!

column5:
そうだ！　３つの　聖なる玉は\n
いろんなとこに　ちらばったって\n
じっちゃんは　いってたよ！
column6: Oh yeah! He also said that the three orbs have been scattered across Jipang!

column5: 平泉村
column6: Hiraizumi Village

column5:
はらへった・・・米が　食いたい\n
ネズミが　みんな　米　食っちまうんで\n
おれら　食うもんが　ない
column6:
I'm starving...We have no rice left.\n
Those rats ate everything...

column5:
大門教に　入会するだけで\n
お米が　もらえるのよ\n
ラッキー！！！
column6: They gave me rice as soon as I agreed to join the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
たべるものが　ないなら\n
さっさと　大門教に\n
入会して　ハッピー！！！！
column6:
If you want a full belly, just join them!\n
It's that easy!

column5:
ネズミの　やろう\n
オラが　いっしょうけんめいに\n
雨のふるなか　田植えして
column6:
Those blasted rats...\n
I planted rice under the rain, pulled weeds under the sun...

column5:
おてんとうさまの下　クサぬいて\n
汗水たらして　刈り入れた\n
オラの　米さ　けえせ！！
column6:
And they took it all away from me!\n
Give back my rice, you vermin!

column5:
ネズミさえ　たいじできれば・・・\n
でもよ！　どこからあんなに\n
ネズミが　わいてくるんだ！！
column6:
If only we could kill those rats...\n
But there's too many of them!\n
Where do they even come from?

column5:
せめて　子どもに　だけは\n
米を　食わしてやりてーだよ
column6: They should let the children eat, at least!

column5:
大門教に　入会すれば\n
お米が　もらえるのは　しっとるが\n
わしゃ　死んでも　イヤじゃ！
column6: You'll be given rice if you join the Cult of Daimon...but I'd rather starve!

column5:
ジライアさんですね！\n
ホテイ丸って　外人さんから\n
伝言を　ことづかっていますよ
column6:
You must be Ziria-san!\n
I bring a message from a foreigner called Hoteimaru.

column5:
ダンジョウの力の源　魔神像を\n
はかいする方法を　伝えたいので\n
白河の関まで　来てほしいとのこと！
column6: He's waiting for you at the Shirakawa barrier to tell you how to destroy the Demon Statue, Danjou's source of power.

column5: もう　会われましたか？
column6: Have you met him yet?

column5: ありがとうございました
column6: You have our gratitude.

column5:
大門教の　魔神の形をした像がある\n
像は　不気味な光を　放っている
column6:
There is a statue of the Demon God of the Cult of Daimon.\n
The statue emits an eerie light.

column5: なにもありませんでした
column6: You find nothing.

column5: 米沢城
column6: Yonezawa Castle

column5:
く・・・くそ！！　おまえたちが\n
これほど　強いとは・・・！！\n
だが　まだ　負けたわけでは　ないぞ！
column6:
Urgh...\n
I didn't expect you to be this strong...\n
But I have one last trick up my sleeve!

column5:
ワシの　さいごの　力を　見せてやる！\n
おまえたちも\n
地獄の　みちづれじゃ！！
column6: I'll use what's left of my powers to take you down with me!!

column5:
ジライア！　たいへんよ\n
今の　地震で\n
溶岩が　流れ出してきたわ！！
column6: Ziria! That earthquake made the lava overflow! It's coming this way!!

column5:
ジライアよ　ほんとうに　あいつを\n
たおしちまったな・・・\n
これで　子供も　この国も　救われた！
column6:
You've actually done it, Ziria...\n
You've saved my son and these lands!

column5:
この　溶岩流は　わしが　止める！\n
せめてもの　罪ほろぼしだ\n
さあ　行くのじゃ　勇者よ！！
column6:
I'll stop the lava!\n
It's my way of atoning for my sins.\n
Go forth, young hero!

column5:
わしを　ムダに　死なすのか！\n
おまえたちには\n
大きな　使命があるはずだ！
column6:
Don't let my sacrifice be for naught!\n
You still have a great task to accomplish!

column5:
おまえらと　いっしょに　戦えて\n
おれは　うれしかった！\n
さあ！　はやく行け！　ジライア！
column6: Fighting alongside you was my greatest honor! Now go, Ziria!

column5:
魔神像に\n
かみなり玉を　仕掛けた
column6: You light the Thunder Orb and place it under the Demon Statue.

column5:
鉄のとびらが　ある\n
がっちりと　カギが　かかっている
column6:
There is an iron gate here.\n
It's locked tight.

column5: なにもありませんでした
column6: You find nothing.

column5: とびらが　開いた
column6: You open the gate.

column5: 米沢城
column6: Yonezawa Castle

column5: 賭場
column6: Gambling Den

column5: ちょう！
column6: Even!

column5: 半っっ！
column6: Odd!

column5: もうスッカラカンだぜ
column6: I'm all out...

column5: おや、おまえさんやるのかい
column6: Are you here to play?

column5: 回船問屋
column6: Shipping Agency

column5:
帰った帰った！\n
ここは小売はしてないよ
column6:
Scram, kid!\n
We don't do business with the general public!

column5:
まだいたのか！\n
さっさと出て行かないと\n
奉行所を呼ぶぞ！
column6:
Are you still here?\n
Get going before I report you to the magistrate!

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　侍の刀が　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is a samurai sword inside.

column5: 侍の刀を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Samurai Sword.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　なにも　入っていなかった
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is nothing inside.

column5: 米沢城
column6: Yonezawa Castle

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　白ツルの羽が　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is a White Crane plume inside.

column5: 白ツルの羽を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained White Crane Plume.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　なにも　入っていなかった
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is nothing inside.

column5: 米沢城
column6: Yonezawa Castle

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　白ヘビの石が　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is a White Snake stone inside.

column5: 白ヘビの石を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained White Snake Stone.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　なにも　入っていなかった
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is nothing inside.

column5: 米沢城
column6: Yonezawa Castle

column5:
ジライア！　オニさんの命\n
ムダに　しないためにも\n
早く　ここから　逃げよう
column6: Ziria! We can't waste Oni Guy's sacrifice! Let's hurry!

column5:
うう〜　苦しいよ〜\n
はやく　楽にしてくれ〜
column6:
Urgh...I'm suffering...\n
Please, deliver me from this pain...

column5:
ダンジョウに\n
米をくれるって　いわれたのに\n
だまされた・・・
column6: I thought Danjou would give me rice...

column5:
人の　恨みや　憎しみの　こもった\n
たましいほど　マサカドは\n
よろこぶって　いうんだ
column6: Masakado delights in souls filled with regret and hatred...

column5:
ここにいる　たましいは　みんな\n
マサカドに　喰われちまうんだ\n
つぎは　おれの番かもしれない
column6: Masakado consumes the souls that end up here...It could be my turn next...

column5:
はやく　わたしたちを\n
もとの姿に　もどしてください！
column6: Please, return us to our bodies!

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　忍かたびらが　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is a shinobi katabira inside.

column5: 忍かたびらを　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Shinobi Katabira.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　ガマの油が　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is toad oil inside.

column5: ガマの油を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Toad Oil.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　なにも　入っていなかった
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is nothing inside.

column5: 米沢城
column6: Yonezawa Castle

column5:
ジライア！　オニさんの命\n
ムダに　しないためにも\n
早く　ここから　逃げよう
column6: Ziria! We can't waste Oni Guy's sacrifice! Let's hurry!

column5:
うう〜　苦しいよ〜\n
はやく　楽にしてくれ〜
column6:
Urgh...I'm suffering...\n
Please, deliver me from this pain...

column5:
死ぬほど　拷問されてよ\n
恐怖が　絶頂になった　しゅんかんに\n
たましいを　引きぬかれた！
column6:
I was tortured to death...\n
The moment your fear is at its peak, you lose your soul!

column5:
人の　恨みや　憎しみの　こもった\n
たましいほど　マサカドは\n
よろこぶって　いうんだ
column6: Masakado delights in souls filled with regret and hatred...

column5:
ここにいる　たましいは　みんな\n
マサカドに　喰われちまうんだ\n
つぎは　おれの番かもしれない
column6: Masakado consumes the souls that end up here...It could be my turn next...

column5:
はやく　わたしたちを\n
もとの姿に　もどしてください！
column6: Please, return us to our bodies!

column5:
湯船には　温泉の湯が　あった\n
その湯を　浴びると　体に\n
力が　わき上がってきた
column6:
The pool is filled with hot spring water.\n
You feel reinvigorated as soon as you enter.

column5: 温泉宿
column6: Hot Spring Inn

column5:
あんたたち　火の勇者ね\n
オロチ丸さんを　さがしてるの？\n
あの人　伝説なんて　信じないわよ！
column6:
You must be the Fire Heroes.\n
Are you looking for Orochimaru-san?\n
That man doesn't believe in silly legends!

column5:
エッ！　ヤダー！　ウッソー！\n
あたしが　オロチ丸ですって？\n
そんな　バカな　ハハハ
column6: Eh? No way! You think I'M Orochimaru? That's just silly! Hahaha!

column5:
チェッ！　しつこいヤツだ\n
しょうが　ねえな！
column6: Tch! You sure are stubborn. So be it!

column5:
おれが　オロチ丸だ！！\n
ごくろうなことだな！\n
そいつが　ウワサの　ヘビ玉かい
column6:
It's true. I am Orochimaru!\n
So this is the infamous Snake Orb, huh?\n
Nice work.

column5:
それを　おれに　見せれば\n
おれが　仲間に　なるとでも\n
白ヘビに　ふきこまれたのか
column6: Let me guess -- the White Snake told you I'd join you on the spot if you showed it to me?

column5:
ハハハハ　あいにくだったな！\n
おれは　ショーグンさまの忍者だ\n
おまえたちとは　ちがうのさ
column6: Hahaha! Sorry to disappoint you, but I'm not like you guys. I'm a loyal ninja in the service of the Shogun!

column5:
ショーグンさまは　大門教の信者だ！\n
そして　おれの　大切な育ての親\n
うらぎるわけには　いかないのさ
column6: The Shogun has joined the Cult of Daimon. Why would I ever betray my beloved foster father?

column5:
じゃ　おれは　ショーグンさまの\n
しごとが　あるんでな！\n
アバヨ！！
column6:
Now, you'll have to excuse me. I'm about the Shogun's business!\n
See ya!

column5:
オロチ丸は\n
ヘビの玉をもったまま\n
目の前から　消えてしまった
column6: Orochimaru took the Snake Orb and vanished before your very eyes.

column5:
うへー！　女に　へんそうするなんて\n
気持ちわるーい！！\n
あのひと　ほんとうに　火の勇者なの？
column6: Sheesh! So he was just hanging out here, disguised as a woman? Talk about creepy! Is he really one of the Fire Heroes?

column5:
あたらしい　カンバン娘は\n
いい　おんなでね！\n
あたし　プロポーズしてるんですよ！
column6:
The new poster girl is gorgeous!\n
I'm gonna ask her out!
column7: ZenkiTN: "poster girl" in the sense of a girl at the entrance of a store (usually a pub) asking men to come inside. Incidentally, the girl is actually Orochimaru in disguise.

column5:
ヒェーッ！　アワワワ\n
お　おとこ　だったなんて\n
あたしが　バカだった！！
column6:
Argh! I can't believe it!\n
He was a man all along!

column5:
ジライアさんですね！\n
ご無事で　いらっしゃいましたか\n
あっしは　雲切の里の者です
column6: Ah, Ziria-san! I'm from Kumogiri Hamlet. Nice to see you well.

column5:
この温泉の東に\n
雲切の里７が　あるんですぜ！\n
ぜひ　お役立て　くだせえ！！
column6: Kumogiri Hamlet 7 is east of these hot springs. We're all ready to help!

column5:
ジパングの　トノさまの中で\n
一番エラい　江戸の　ショーグンさまが\n
大門教に　入ったんですってよ！
column6: There's no lord greater than the Shogun of Edo, but he went and joined the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
これじゃ　ジパングは\n
お先　まっくらだわ！\n
どうして　くれるのよ！　まったく！！
column6:
Why would he do that?!\n
The future of Jipang is looking really grim!

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　１０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両10 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます\n
お客さま！
column6: Welcome to our inn, dear guest!

column5:
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6: Feel free to come back when you wish to stay!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5:
ここは　温泉やど！！\n
今どき　なんと　タダ！！\n
泊らないとソン！！　泊まる？！
column6:
This is a hot spring inn! It's completely free! You should stay for a while!\n
How about it?

column5: また　おいで！！
column6: Come back!

column5: ごゆっくり！！
column6: Rest well!

column5: 茶店
column6: Tea House

column5:
いらっしゃいませー！\n
ここは　茶店でーす！！\n
ごようは　なあに？
column6:
Welcome to my tea house!\n
How may I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それじゃ　また　きてねー
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: ムサシの道場
column6: Musashi's Dojo

column5:
せっしゃが　ムサシでござる！\n
せっしゃとの　てあわせを\n
おのぞみでござるかな？
column6:
My name is Musashi!\n
Do you seek to challenge me?

column5:
それも　よかろう！\n
剣の道は　一つでは　ござらん\n
おぬしは　おぬしの　道を　行くがよい
column6: As you wish! There are many forks in the way of the sword. Do what feels right.

column5:
ちかごろ　ふぬけた　武士どもばかりで\n
ウデが　なまって　おったところだ！！\n
おぬしは　どうかな？　では　ゆくぞ！
column6:
I haven't faced any real challenges lately.\n
I was starting to lose my edge! Hopefully you shall prove worthy...Have at you!

column5:
おぬしは　すでに　せっしゃを　こえた\n
もう！　おしえることは　なにもない！\n
行け！　ジライア！！
column6:
You have already surpassed me.\n
There is nothing more I can teach you!\n
Go forth, young Ziria!

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
ワシも　男だからのう\n
あの美人の　カンバン娘のことを\n
思うと　ウッ　血管が・・・
column6: I used to be quite the playboy. A beautiful lady always gets my blood flowing, if you catch my drift.
column7: ZenkiTN: the original line is about "blood vessels" (not) popping. It's a Japanese euphemism for getting an erection. I changed it mostly because it just sounds weird in English.

column5:
切れん！！　切れん？？\n
おかしいのう　ヘンじゃのう\n
あのカンバン娘は　あやしいのう！！
column6: Whenever I look at the new poster girl at the hot spring inn...I feel nothing. There's something off about her. Trust me.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
伝説によれば　マサカドを　封じたのは\n
ガマ　ヘビ　ナメクジ族の\n
三人の　火の勇者！！
column6: According to legend, Masakado was sealed away by the three Fire Heroes from the Toad, Snake, and Slug clans.

column5:
そして　そのとき　使いしものは\n
ガマ　ヘビ　ナメクジの\n
三つの　聖なる　宝玉じゃ！
column6: They were able to do it with the power of three sacred orbs, one for each clan!

column5: すがゆ温泉
column6: Sugayu Hot Spring

column5:
ここは　すがゆ温泉だよ\n
大門教は　まだ　来てないんだよ\n
でも　旅人も　来なくなっちゃたんだ
column6:
This is Sugayu Hot Spring.\n
The Cult of Daimon hasn't come here yet. But we don't get travelers either.

column5:
この　近くにも　大門教が\n
ウロついて　いるから　\n
こわいのかな！！
column6: Maybe people are scared because of all the monsters around!

column5:
温泉宿の　あたらしい　カンバン娘は\n
えれえ　ベッピンさんだべ！！\n
また　見に　いっか
column6:
The new poster girl at the hot spring inn is one heck of a babe!\n
I'm definitely going there again!

column5:
ククク・・・大門教の　バーカどもが\n
がん首そろえて　東のほうへ\n
行くのを　みたんじゃ！
column6: Heh heh heh. I saw those Daimonist morons make their way east!

column5:
ありゃ　きっと\n
じゃせん洞の　白ヘビさまを\n
封印しに　行ったに　ちがいない！
column6: I bet they're heading to the Snake Hermit Cave to seal the sacred White Snake.

column5:
じゃが　白ヘビさまは\n
このすがゆ温泉に　おられるのじゃ\n
バーカめらが！　ワハハハハ！！
column6: But those idiots don't know that the White Snake is here in Sugayu! Wahahaha!

column5:
あの　剣ごうのムサシどのが\n
この　すがゆに　おられるそうじゃ\n
ぜひお手あわせ　願いたいもんじゃ！
column6: The master fencer Musashi-dono is here in Sugayu. You should try challenging him!

column5:
ジライアさんですね！\n
白ヘビさまが　村の北の橋の上で\n
ひと月も　待ってらっしゃいます！！
column6: You must be Ziria-san! The sacred White Snake has been waiting for you on the north bridge for an entire month!

column5:
ジライアさん\n
オロチ丸さんのことを　伝えたいって\n
白ヘビさまが　いってたわよ
column6: Ziria-san. The sacred White Snake wants to talk to you about Orochimaru-san.

column5:
白ヘビさまは　蛇仙洞へ\n
戻られました
column6: The sacred White Snake has returned to Snake Hermit Cave.

column5:
ムサシさんは　とっても　強いんだよ！\n
オイラも　修行して\n
強くなるんだ！
column6:
Musashi-san is very strong!\n
I'm gonna train and get stronger!

column5:
わたしは　神の使い　白ヘビです\n
火の一族　三人目の勇者　オロチ丸は\n
この　すがゆ温泉に　きています
column6: I am the White Snake, messenger of the divine. Orochimaru, the third hero of the Fire Clan, is here in Sugayu.

column5:
しかし　オロチ丸は\n
育ての親である　江戸の　ショーグンが\n
大門教に　入ったため
column6: But ever since his foster father, the Shogun of Edo, joined the Cult of Daimon...

column5:
自分が　火の一族として\n
マサカドと　たたかうことを\n
ためらっているのです
column6: Orochimaru has begun to doubt his duty to fight against Masakado as a descendant of the Fire Clan.

column5:
東のじゃせん洞に　行って\n
ヘビ玉を　とってきなさい\n
そして　オロチ丸に　見せるのです！
column6: You must head to Snake Hermit Cave, retrieve the Snake Orb, and show it to him.

column5:
あの玉を　見れば\n
オロチ丸も　火の一族の　使命に\n
きっと　めざめるでしょう
column6: Gazing upon the sacred orb should stir his sense of duty.

column5:
オロチ丸は　橋をこえて\n
むつ国へ　行きました\n
勇者の伝説を　信じないのです
column6:
Orochimaru has crossed the bridge and made his way to the lands of Mutsu.\n
He does not believe in the old legends.

column5:
３人そろわねば\n
ジパングを　すくえないのに
column6: Alas, Jipang can only be saved if the three heroes join forces...

column5: これは　オロチ丸からの　手紙です
column6: This is a letter from Orochimaru.

column5: 盗人宿
column6: Kumogiri Inn
column7: ZenkiTN: the tag here is "Thief Inn", but I feel like this is a name they forgot to change, since every other Kumogiri Hamlet inn is just "Inn". Instead of "Thief Inn" I went for Kumogiri Inn.

column5:
すがゆ温泉に　泊まってたときに\n
あそこの　カンバン娘を\n
くどこうと　おもったんだが
column6: You know that cute girl at the Sugayu Hot Spring inn? I considered asking her out during my stay.

column5:
彼女　毎日　江戸に　手紙を\n
出してるんで　あきらめたんだ\n
江戸に　彼氏でも　いるんだろうなあ
column6:
But I gave up when I realized she was sending letters to Edo every single day.\n
It's obvious she has a boyfriend.
column7: ZenkiTN: the "girl" is Orochimaru in disguise.

column5:
火の勇者の　ジライアさまですね！！\n
オラが　あの夜　じゃせん洞へ\n
ていさつさ　行ったもんだべ！！
column6:
You must be Ziria-sama, the Fire Hero!\n
I witnessed the events that occurred at Snake Hermit Cave!

column5:
オラの　見て来たことを\n
ちょっくら　長くなるけんど\n
残らず　お伝えしてえだよ
column6: I'm not skipping any details, so it's a bit of a long story!

column5: きいて　くれるだか？
column6: Do you want me to tell you?

column5:
そんなら　また\n
時間さ　あるとき　ゆっくり\n
はなしを　きいてけろ！
column6: Let's do this when you have more time, then!

column5:
あれは　１０日ほど前の　ことだよ\n
オラ　いつも　みてえに\n
メシさ　食って　寝てただよ
column6: This happened about ten days ago. I went to bed after dinner, just like every other day.

column5:
なんか　外が　さわがしいだで\n
起きだして　みっと\n
東ん空が　燃えとるで　ねえか！
column6: But a strange noise awoke me. When I looked outside, what should I see but the eastern skies burning red!

column5:
いや　目ん玉　とびでそうに　なっただ\n
なんせ　あげな空　生まれてこんかた\n
オラ　みたこと　なかったべ！
column6:
My eyes almost popped out of my head!\n
I'd never seen the sky like that in my entire life!

column5:
そんで　里のオサさまに\n
「オメ　ちょう　見て来」　言われたで\n
東さ　向かって　走っただよ！
column6: The elder told me to go and take a closer look, so I started running east!

column5:
オラ　走っただよ！\n
足ん　ちぎれるくれえ　走っただよ\n
んで　見ただ！　見てしまっただ！
column6:
I ran, and ran, and ran!\n
I ran like I've never run before!\n
And then, I saw it!

column5:
手に　たいまつ　持った\n
大門僧さ　百人くれえで\n
じゃせん洞に　火　つけてただよ！！
column6: A hundred Daimonists, carrying torches, setting the Snake Hermit Cave ablaze!

column5:
いや　目ん玉　とびでそうに　なっただ\n
その炎ったら　空の雲さ　こがすくれ\n
高く　上がって　まるで　地獄だわ！！
column6:
My eyes almost popped out of my head!\n
Flames so tall they were burning the clouds! A sight out of Hell!

column5:
そればかりで　ねえだ！\n
これからが　オラのはなしの\n
おもしろいとこだで　ジライアさん！！
column6: But that's not all! Wait until you hear this, Ziria-san!

column5:
その火の中に　動くもんが　いただよ！\n
なんだと　思う？　ジライアさん！\n
それが　大ムカデだよ　大ムカデ！！
column6:
There was something moving inside the fire! Can you guess what it was, Ziria-san?
#BOXPAUSE()
It was an insect! It was a giant centipede!!

column5:
いや　目ん玉　とびでそうに　なっただ\n
その大ムカデの　頭ん上で\n
大門教のやつら　大声あげとるでねえか
column6:
My eyes almost popped out of my head!\n
There were the Daimonists, on top of its head, having the time of their lives!

column5:
笑う者やら　歌う者\n
ムカデの頭の上で　酒飲みながら\n
踊っとる者まで　おっただ！
column6:
Some were laughing, some were singing!\n
Some were drinking, while others were dancing!

column5:
いや　目ん玉　とびでそうに　なっただ\n
あいつら　物こわしたり　人殺すのが\n
楽しゅうて　しょうがない　だよ！
column6:
My eyes almost popped out of my head!\n
They utterly delight in death and destruction!

column5:
あげなやつら　人間じゃ　ねえだよ！\n
ジライアさん　大門教さ\n
やっつけて　くれだ！！
column6:
They are monsters in human form!\n
Ziria-san, you must take down the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
ジライアさん！\n
よく　わかっただか？
column6:
That's my story!\n
Did you get all the details?

column5:
そったら　大門教さ　かならず\n
こらしめて　くんろ！！\n
たのみますだ　ジライアさん！！
column6:
They must pay for their actions!\n
We're counting on you, Ziria-san!

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　１５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両15 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　１５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両15 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5:
ここは　温泉やど！！\n
今どき　なんと　タダ！！\n
泊らないとソン！！　泊まる？！
column6:
This is a hot spring inn! It's completely free! You should stay for a while!\n
How about it?

column5: また　おいで！！
column6: Come back!

column5: ごゆっくり！！
column6: Rest well!

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 雲切の里７
column6: Kumogiri Hamlet 7

column5:
おまちしてました！　ジライアさま！！\n
１０日ほど前の　晩のことですが\n
東の空が　まっかに　染まったのです！
column6: We've been waiting for you, Ziria-sama! About ten days ago, the eastern night skies were burning red!

column5:
里の者に　探りに　行かせました\n
くわしいことは\n
その者に　おききください！！
column6: We sent one of our men to take a closer look. He's at the inn if you want to talk to him!

column5:
じゃせん洞の　白ヘビさまを\n
西の　すがゆ温泉で　お見かけした\n
ジライア殿は　お会いになりましたか？
column6: The sacred White Snake is currently in Sugayu. Have you met?

column5:
白ヘビさまは　じゃせん洞へ\n
お帰りに　なられました
column6: The sacred White Snake has returned to Snake Hermit Cave.

column5:
探りにいったものの　話によると\n
大門教の連中が　じゃせん洞に\n
火を　はなっていたらしいぜ！！
column6: According to an eyewitness, the Daimonists have set the Snake Hermit Cave ablaze!

column5:
東の空が　まっかに　見えたほどだから\n
よっぽど　すごい\n
炎だったんだろうな
column6:
It must have been a terrible fire.\n
He said the eastern skies were burning red!

column5:
じゃせん洞を　おそったのは\n
ものすごく　でっかい\n
大門教のあやつる　ムカデらしいぜ！！
column6: I heard the Daimonists were controlling a giant centipede when they raided the Snake Hermit Cave!

column5:
じゃせん洞の大門教は\n
退治できたんですね
column6: I heard you drove the Daimonists out of the Snake Hermit Cave.

column5:
じゃせん洞を　おそう前に\n
大門教は　白キジさまを\n
石に　封印していったようだ！！
column6: Before attacking the Snake Hermit Cave, the Daimonists turned the sacred White Pheasant to stone!

column5: 白キジさまは　救われたのですね！
column6: Thank you for rescuing the sacred White Pheasant!

column5:
あの夜　探りに　行った人なら\n
宿で　休んでるわよ\n
でも　少し　話が　くどいのよ
column6: The man who saw it all is at the inn. But let me warn you...His stories are loooong!

column5: 神社
column6: Shrine

column5:
大門教によって　わが神社の\n
守護神であられる　白キジさまが\n
石に　封印されてしまったのです！
column6: The Cult of Daimon has sealed the sacred White Pheasant, protector of this shrine, inside a boulder!

column5:
火の勇者　ジライアさま！\n
どうか　白キジさまを　お救いください\n
でも　お気を　つけください
column6:
O Fire Hero!\n
You must exercise caution!

column5:
この　神社のけいだいには\n
ジライアさまの　命を　狙って\n
大門教の手先が　待ち伏せています！！
column6: Daimonist minions will attempt to ambush you, even in these sacred grounds!

column5:
ジライアさま！\n
白キジさまのこと\n
どうか　お願い　いたします
column6:
I beg you, Ziria-sama!\n
Rescue the White Pheasant!

column5:
白キジさまを　お救いくださり\n
ありがとうございました\n
ジライアさま！
column6: Thank you so much for rescuing the sacred White Pheasant, Ziria-sama!

column5:
赤地　黄色い文字で\n
「大」と　しるされた　大きな石がある
column6: There is a large red stone marked with a yellow 大 symbol.

column5: なにもありませんでした
column6: You find nothing.

column5: 白キジ神社
column6: White Pheasant Shrine

column5:
ケンケン！　この封印を\n
解くことが　できるとは\n
おまえは　火の一族なのですね
column6:
Kaw kaw!\n
You've broken the seal! You must be a descendant of the Fire Clan.

column5:
火の一族の　子どもたちよ！\n
はるか昔　この地に\n
マサカドが　現れたとき
column6:
Children of the Fire Clan!\n
A long time ago, when Masakado first appeared in these lands,

column5:
わたしたち神獣は　おまえたちの\n
祖先である　火の勇者と　共に戦い\n
マサカドを　ヤミに　封じ込めました
column6: we divine beasts stood alongside your ancestors, the original Fire Heroes. Together, we were able to seal him away.

column5:
今　ふたたび　マサカドは\n
地の底から　よみがえらんとしています\n
今度は　おまえたちが　戦うのです！
column6:
Alas, Masakado is making his return.\n
It is up to you to stop him once again!

column5:
さあ　火の一族の　子どもたちよ！\n
わたしの　神通力を　与えましょう！！\n
泥虫の巻物です！
column6: Children of the Fire Clan! I bestow upon you the scroll of Doromushi, which contains my divine power!

column5:
泥虫の術は　すべての　敵を\n
泥の中に　落ちた　虫のごとく　変え\n
すばやさを　うばう術なのです
column6: The Doromushi jutsu will reduce the speed of your opponents. They will be like insects in a mud puddle!

column5:
さあ　急ぎなさい！！\n
わたしは　ここから　祈っています\n
ジパングに　平和の　戻らんことを
column6:
I shall pray for your victory.\n
Bring peace back to Jipang!\n
Go forth, young heroes!

column5: 神獣白キジの　封印を　解き放った\n
column6: You have broken the seal of the divine beast White Pheasant.\n

column5: 泥虫の巻物を　手に入れた\n
column6: Obtained Scroll of Doromushi.\n

column5:
泥虫の術は　すべての　敵を\n
泥の中に　落ちた　虫のごとく　変え\n
すばやさを　うばう術なのです
column6: The Doromushi jutsu will reduce the speed of your opponents. They will be like insects in a mud puddle!

column5:
さあ　急ぎなさい！！\n
わたしは　ここから　祈っています\n
ジパングに　平和の　戻らんことを
column6:
I shall pray for your victory.\n
Bring peace back to Jipang!\n
Go forth, young heroes!

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　迅雷の巻物が　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
You find the scroll of Jinrai.

column5: 迅雷の巻物を　手に入れた\n
column6: Obtained Scroll of Jinrai.\n

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　なにも　入っていなかった
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is nothing inside.

column5: じゃせん洞
column6: Snake Hermit Cave

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　ガマの油が　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is toad oil inside.

column5: ガマの油を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Toad Oil.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　なにも　入っていなかった
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is nothing inside.

column5: じゃせん洞
column6: Snake Hermit Cave

column5:
つづらを　調べた\n
中から　まばゆい光が　あふれだした！
column6: When you open the casket, a dazzling light comes pouring out!

column5: 伝説の　ヘビ玉を　見つけた！！
column6: You found the legendary Snake Orb!

column5:
火の勇者が　持つべき玉の　ひとつ！\n
ヘビ玉を　手に入れた
column6: You have obtained the Snake Orb, one of the sacred treasures of the Fire Heroes!

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　なにも　入っていなかった
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is nothing inside.

column5:
ムカデのからだが　短くて\n
島まで　届いていない
column6: The centipede's corpse is too short to reach the island.

column5: じゃせん洞
column6: Snake Hermit Cave

column5:
やっと　じゃせん洞に　もどれました\n
さあ　いそいで　オロチ丸を追うのです
column6: I'm finally back in the Snake Hermit Cave. You must hurry and find Orochimaru.

column5: 行け！！　ジライア！！
column6: Go forth, young Ziria!

column5: 盗人訓練所
column6: Thieving School

column5:
ここは　大門教を　やっつけるために\n
ぬすっとを　養成する\n
通称　ぬすっと訓練所です！！
column6: This is a Thieving School, where you can improve your thievery in order to help defeat the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
奥の　部屋に　入って\n
教官を　よけて\n
つづらの中の　お金を　とるんです！
column6: Head inside, avoid the instructors, and steal the money from the casket!

column5:
みごと　お金を　とることに\n
成功したら\n
そのお金は　あなたのものです！
column6: If you can steal the money successfully, you get to keep it for yourself!

column5:
まあ　遊びだと　おもって\n
気軽に　たのしんでくださいよ！\n
だけど　マサカド打倒も　お忘れなく！
column6:
Think of it as a game and have fun!\n
But don't forget your quest to defeat Masakado!

column5: 盗人訓練所
column6: Thieving School

column5:
ここは　大門教を　やっつけるために\n
ぬすっとを　養成する\n
通称　ぬすっと訓練所です！！
column6: This is a Thieving School, where you can improve your thievery in order to help defeat the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
奥の　部屋に　入って\n
教官を　よけて\n
つづらの中の　お金を　とるんです！
column6: Head inside, avoid the instructors, and steal the money from the casket!

column5:
みごと　お金を　とることに\n
成功したら\n
そのお金は　あなたのものです！
column6: If you can steal the money successfully, you get to keep it for yourself!

column5:
まあ　遊びだと　おもって\n
気軽に　たのしんでくださいよ！\n
だけど　マサカド打倒も　お忘れなく！
column6:
Think of it as a game and have fun!\n
But don't forget your quest to defeat Masakado!

column5: 盗人訓練所
column6: Thieving School

column5:
ここは　大門教を　やっつけるために\n
ぬすっとを　養成すまる\n
通称　ぬすっと訓練所です！！
column6: This is the Thieving School, where you will learn a useful skill to help you in your quest to defeat the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
奥の　部屋に　入って\n
教官を　よけて\n
つづらの中の　お金を　とるんです！
column6: Head inside, avoid the instructors, and steal the money from the casket!

column5:
みごと　お金を　とることに\n
成功したら\n
そのお金は　あなたのものです！
column6: If you can steal the money successfully, you get to keep it for yourself!

column5:
まあ　遊びだと　おもって\n
気軽に　たのしんでくださいよ！\n
だけど　マサカド打倒も　お忘れなく！
column6:
Think of it as a game and have fun!\n
But don't forget your quest to defeat Masakado!

column5: 蛇泉洞
column6: Snake Spring Cave

column5: 蛇泉洞
column6: Snake Spring Cave

column5: 蛇泉洞
column6: Snake Spring Cave

column5: 達谷窟
column6: Takkoku-no-Iwaya
column7: ZenkiTN: I think most of the text from here to the next big map (map 0x2FA8) is unused text from the previous version of the game. The "Snake Spring Cave" has been renamed "Snake Hermit Cave", and Takkoku-no-Iwaya was where King Akurou (who was depicted as an evil warlord) came from.

column5: ギャオーン！！
column6: ROAAAR!

column5: 黒塚
column6: Kurozuka

column5: ケッコウコケコ　コケコケコ
column6: Cluck! Cluck! Cock-a-doodle-doo!

column5: 蛇泉洞
column6: Snake Spring Cave

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5: 多賀
column6: Taga

column5:
この町は　大門教のものだ\n
近づくな！
column6: This town belongs to the Cult of Daimon. Stay back!

column5:
この町も　もう長くはもつまい\n
礼ははずむぞ\n
悪路王を倒してくれい
column6:
This town is almost done for.\n
I want you to kill Akuro-Ou.\n
I'll make it worth your while!

column5:
よくやってくれた！\n
礼をいうぞ\n
ホレ　受け取れい
column6:
Well done!\n
Here you go, as promised.

column5: ２０両手に入れた\n
column6: Obtained 両20.\n

column5:
なにっ？　少ないとな・・\n
ガマンせい！
column6:
What? It's a pittance?\n
Well, that's all I can spare!

column5:
さあさあこの多賀城を復興させるため\n
あなたも　ひとはだぬぎませんか
column6: How about you do something to restore Taga Castle?

column5:
悪路王も退治されたと言う話だ\n
さあ　いちから出直しだー
column6:
I heard Akuro-Ou was defeated.\n
Now we need to rebuild.

column5:
城の殿様が自来也っていう奴に\n
お礼の品をだすっていっていたぜ\n
おれも　欲しいもんだ
column6:
I heard the lord of the castle gave some guy called Ziria a wonderful reward.\n
Man, I'm so jealous!

column5:
悪路王が暴れて逃げていた人達も\n
ようやく町へ戻ってきはじめた\n
よかった　よかった
column6:
Those who fled when Akuro-Ou attacked are finally coming back.\n
Things are looking up.

column5:
離ればなれになったお母ちゃんに\n
会えたんだ！悪路王をやっつけた人に\n
お礼を言いたいな〜
column6: I can see my mother again! I'd like to shake hands with whoever killed Akuro-Ou!

column5:
もしかしたら　自来也さんじゃない\n
お城の殿様がお礼をしたいと\n
いっていたわよ
column6:
Are you Ziria-san?\n
The lord of the castle has a reward for you.

column5:
η税[f7]<$F1>バショウじゃよ\n
悪路王退治の活躍みごとなものじゃ！\n
ここからみる松島　美しい景色よな
column6:
Good job defeating Akuro-Ou!\n
You can see Matsushima from here.\n
It's beautiful, isn't it?
column7: ZenkiTN: I can't understand the first line, but this whole part is unused as far as I know, so it doesn't really matter, does it?

column5:
一句　読もうかのう\n
－松島や　ああ松島や　松島や－\n
鬼達もあわれなことじゃ・・・
column6:
I will recite a few verses. Matsushima, Matsushima, beautiful Matsushima.\n
Those Oni got their just deserts...

column5:
西にある米沢にいる　お坊さんが\n
面白いものを持っているそうだ
column6: One of the monks of Yonezawa, to the west, has something interesting.

column5:
大名の世界も厳しいんものよ\n
米沢城の伊達の殿様も\n
ショーグンの位を狙ったんで
column6: The world of Daimyo is a harsh one. It seems Lord Date of Yonezawa Castle wanted to become the next Shogun.

column5:
ショーグンみずから仁木弾正を\n
そそのかして\n
クーデターを起こさせたってはなしだ
column6: In retaliation, the Shogun himself instigated Nikki Danjou to stage a coup.

column5:
ケッ！　しけた町だな\n
米沢の町で一儲けするか
column6: This town is depressing. I think I'll go to Yonezawa.

column5: 米沢
column6: Yonezawa

column5:
はじめまして　私があの有名な大門教の\n
教祖、簡単にいうとボスキャラの弾正と\n
いうものです
column6:
Hello there. I'm Danjou, the founder of the renowned Cult of Daimon.\n
You can think of me as a boss character.

column5:
ここでは　私は無敵です\n
死んでね・・・
column6:
Right now, I'm invincible.\n
Now die.

column5:
はじめまして　私があの有名な大門教の\n
教祖、簡単にいうとボスキャラの弾正と\n
いうものです
column6:
Hello there. I'm Danjou, the founder of the renowned Cult of Daimon.\n
You can think of me as a boss character.

column5: ここでは　私は無敵ではありません
column6: I guess I'm not invincible now.

column5:
しかし　あなたは「猫の術」なるものを\n
持っていないので残念ですが\n
勝つことはできません　あしからず
column6: Too bad you can't win, since you don't have the {Cat jutsu.}

column5:
あなたは「猫の術」を持っていますね！\n
バトルです\n
勝つことができますが
column6:
I see you have the {Cat jutsu}!\n
Now you have a chance to win.

column5: 勝ちたいですか？
column6: Do you want to win?

column5: 勝ちました
column6: You won.

column5: 負けました
column6: You lost.

column5: 陸羽
column6: Rikuu

column5:
－　封印が　とけて\n
　　　　　白いネコが\n
　　　　あらわれた　－
column6:
You break the seal.\n
The White Cat appears.

column5:
ありがとニャン！　火の一族よ！！\n
お礼に　ネズミの　術を　やぶる\n
この　ネコの巻物を　あげよう
column6: Thanks, meow! I'll give you the Scroll of Cat! It'll break the spell of the Rat!

column5: 行け！　ジライアよ！
column6: Go, Ziria!

column5:
よくやりました　ジライア！\n
私はあなたの活躍を　影で\n
見守っていました
column6:
Well done, Ziria!\n
I've been observing your exploits in secret.

column5:
あなたが死んだと思っている\n
悪路王と　その子供は\n
私が助けました
column6: I saved Akuro-Ou and his child from certain death.

column5:
さぁ・・・　勇者の力で\n
大門教をたおすのです
column6: Young hero...Do not stop until the Cult of Daimon is no more.

column5:
もはや　すべての橋は渡れるはず・・\n
行きなさい　ジライア！！
column6:
Now you can cross every bridge.\n
Go forth, Ziria!

column5: 盗人村
column6: Thief Village

column5:
かつやく　してなさるね　ジライアさん\n
りくうの国の　盗人村へ\n
ようこそ・・・
column6: You've been working hard, Ziria-san. Welcome to the Thief Village of Rikuu.

column5:
北の　橋を　わたると　たが城だぜ\n
オニより　こわい　あくろう王が\n
いるんだ・・・
column6: Cross the northern bridge and you'll reach Taga Castle. King Akurou is scarier than the Oni...
x

column5: 盗人宿
column6: Kumogiri Inn

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
＊＊両でございますが\n
おとまりですか？
column6:
Welcome! It's 両** for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　どうぞ
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　どうぞ
column6: See you soon.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
あくろう王は　もとは　りくう国の王で\n
いいやつ　だったんだが\n
大門教に　入会しちまってよ・・・
column6: King Akurou used to be the just ruler of Rikuu, but then he joined the Cult of Daimon...
x

column5:

I was so surprised I started foaming!

江戸へ　向かってください　とのこと！

column5:

大門教を　必ず　打倒してくださいね！

column6: Inn

ミコさまが　何人も　いますよ！！
column6: The priestesses of Mount Osore up north are very good at telling fortunes!

しきりに　大門教のことを　きいてたな\n
北のとさ港に　行くって　いってたぜ
column6: A man stopped by yesterday. He kept asking about the Cult of Daimon, and then headed north, toward Tosa Harbor.

いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　２０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両20 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　２０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両20 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 茶店
column6: Tea House

column5:
いらっしゃいませー！\n
ここは　茶店でーす！！\n
ごようは　なあに？
column6:
Welcome to my tea house!\n
How may I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それじゃ　また　きてねー
column6: Come back anytime!

column5:
北の　おそれ山にいる　ミコに\n
けっこん　できるか　占ってほしいわ
column6: I should ask the priestesses of Mount Osore up north whether I'll ever find a husband...
column7: ZenkiTN: I made this into "husband" and the next one into "wife" because this character is a lady and the next one is a man. Their line is basically the same, so the joke is that they're both asking for the same thing (to get married), not knowing that there is someone on the other side of the mountain having the same thought.

column5: 茶店
column6: Tea House

column5:
いらっしゃいませー！\n
ここは　茶店でーす！！\n
ごようは　なあに？
column6:
Welcome to my tea house!\n
How may I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それじゃ　また　きてねー
column6: Come back anytime!

column5:
北の　おそれ山にいる　ミコに\n
けっこん　できるか　占ってほしいな
column6: I should ask the priestesses of Mount Osore up north whether I'll ever find a wife...

column5: 神社
column6: Shrine

column5:
大門教が　白カメさまを\n
石に　してしまったのだ！\n
火の勇者　ジライアさま！！
column6: The Cult of Daimon has turned our sacred White Turtle to stone!

column5:
どうか　その　お力で\n
白カメさまを\n
そして　この村を　お救いください！！

column5:
ありがとう　ございました！！\n
これで　この村は　だいじょうぶです

column5:
でも　山むこうの　白ツル村は\n
どうなって　いるでしょうか\n
わたしは　心配です
column6:
I'm worried about the White Crane Village on the other side of the mountain.\n
I'll pray for them.

column5: 神社
column6: Shrine

この村を　守っていた　白ツルさまが\n
大門教に　石に変えられてしまった！！\n
いったい　どうしたら　よいものか
column6:
The Cult of Daimon has turned our guardian, the White Crane, to stone!\n
What should we do?!

column5:
ほんとうに　ありがとう　ございました\n
白ツルさまが　もとの姿に　戻られて\n
村人たちも　安心したようです！
column6: Thank you so much for rescuing the sacred White Crane!

column5:
でも　山むこうの　白カメ村は\n
どうなって　いるでしょうか\n
わたしは　心配です
column6:
I'm worried about the White Turtle Village on the other side of the mountain.\n
I'll pray for them.

column5:
赤地に　黄色い文字で\n
「大」と　しるされた　大きな石がある
column6: There is a large red stone marked with a yellow 大 symbol.

column5: なにもありませんでした
column6: You find nothing.

column5: ツルカメ神社
column6: Tsurukame Shrine
column7: ZenkiTN: I was going to call it "Crane Turtle Shrine", but Tsurukame Shrine (鶴亀神社) is a real place.

column5:
大門教に　白カメさまが\n
石に　されてしまった！\n
どうしたら　いいの・・・シクシク
column6:
The Cult of Daimon has turned our sacred White Turtle to stone...\n
This is terrible...

column5:
白カメさまを　お救いくださり\n
ありがとうございました
column6: Thank you for rescuing our sacred White Turtle.

column5:
山の反対がわにある　ツル村の\n
白ツルさまも　大門教の　やからに\n
石に　されてしまっただ
column6: The White Crane lives in the shrine on the other side of the mountain, but those Daimonists turned him to stone!

column5:
ミイラは　人をおそっちゃあ\n
たましいを　ぬいていくってよ！\n
おっかねえ　はなしだよ！　まったく
column6: Those mummies will steal your soul if they catch you! It's straight out of a horror tale!

column5:
ここは　白カメ村じゃ！\n
山の反対がわに　あるのが\n
白ツルさまの　白ツル村じゃ！
column6:
This is White Turtle Village!\n
White Crane Village is on the other side of the mountain!

column5:
白カメ村と　白ツル村は\n
近くて　遠い　双子の村じゃ！！
column6: Our two villages are so close, yet so far away!

column5:
おそれ山の　占いオババは\n
よく　あたるのよー！
column6: The fortune-tellers of Mount Osore are very accurate!

column5:
「オババの　愛の　星占い」って本も\n
出した　そーなの！
column6: I always read their weekly love horoscope!
column7: ZenkiTN: the original line is about a "old lady love fortune telling" book they've published. It might be a reference to something (I've found some old manga with a similar name), but since it's not something you'd find in the west, I changed this to a similarly anachronistic "weekly love horoscope". It's supposed to be a joke about something modern in this old setting, and I think a weekly horoscope fits the bill.

column5:
わしは　白カメ！　年令１００００才！\n
Ａ型の　水ガメ座！　水泳が　しゅみの\n
ちょっぴり　センチな　はにかみやじゃ
column6:
I'm the White Turtle! Age: 10,000!\n
An Aquarius, blood type A! My hobby is swimming! I'm an old-fashioned romantic!

column5:
こんな　か弱い　年寄を\n
石にするとは　大門教は　なんとまあ\n
ひどい　やつらなのじゃ！
column6: Can you believe those Daimonists went out of their way to turn little old me to stone?

column5:
わしと　白ツルが　封じられたのを\n
いいことに　月山の　ミイラを\n
よび覚まして　民を　苦しめておる！
column6: With the White Crane and I sealed, they've tormented the people by waking up the mummies of Mount Tsukiyama!

column5:
ジライアよ！　民を　救え！\n
それが　できるのは　おまえしかおらん\n
おまえに　火天の巻物を　さずけよう
column6:
You're the only one who can save them!\n
I bestow upon you the scroll of Katen!

column5:
火天の術は　天をも　焦がす\n
じごくの　炎を　敵の一人に\n
あびせかける術じゃ！！
column6: The Katen jutsu will rain scorching hellfire upon one of your enemies!

column5:
行け　ジライア！　大門教を　たおせ！\n
わしは　夢みる　白カメちゃん！\n
ちょっと　おちゃめな　１００００才！
column6:
Go forth, young Ziria! Defeat the Cult of Daimon!
#BOXPAUSE()
I'm the White Turtle, age 10,000! I'm a dreamer with a bit of a naughty side!

column5: 神獣白カメの　封印を　解き放った
column6: You have broken the seal of the divine beast White Turtle.

column5: 火天の巻物を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Scroll of Katen.

column5:
火天の術は　天をも　焦がす\n
じごくの　炎を　敵の一人に\n
あびせかける術じゃ！！
column6: The Katen jutsu will rain scorching hellfire upon one of your enemies!

column5:
行け　ジライア！　大門教を　たおせ！\n
わしは　夢みる　白カメちゃん！\n
ちょっと　おちゃめな　１００００才！
column6:
Go forth, young Ziria! Defeat the Cult of Daimon!
#BOXPAUSE()
I'm the White Turtle, age 10,000! I'm a dreamer with a bit of a naughty side!

column5:
大門教が　白ツルさまを\n
石に　しやがった！！\n
どうすれば　もどるのだろう！！
column6:
The Cult of Daimon has turned our beloved White Crane to stone!\n
Is there a way to break the curse?!

column5:
白ツルさまを　お救いくださり\n
ありがとうございました
column6: Thank you for rescuing our beloved White Crane.

column5:
山の反対がわの　白カメさまは\n
どうなって　いるのでしょう
column6: The sacred White Turtle is on the other side of the mountain. I hope nothing bad happened to him.

column5:
月山には　即身仏に　なられた\n
エライ　お坊さまがたの　ミイラが\n
納められているって　いうけど
column6: The monks that underwent mummification through asceticism are resting in Mount Tsukiyama.

column5:
ま　まっ　まさか！\n
いま　村を　おそっているのは\n
その　お坊さまがたの　ミイラなのか！
column6: There's...There's no way the mummies attacking us are those very monks, is there?

column5:
大門教を　必ず　倒して下さい\n
ジライアさま！！
column6: Ziria-sama! Please defeat those Daimonists!

column5:
月山の　ふもとにある　古寺から\n
ミイラが　ウヨウヨ出て来るのを\n
オラ見ただよお
column6:
I saw it with my own two eyes.\n
The mummies are swarming out of the old temple at the foot of Mount Tsukiyama.

column5:
ミイラたちは　大門僧に\n
いんそつされて　まるで\n
墓場の　遠足みたいだっただ！
column6: They were being led by Daimon acolytes, like it was some kind of guided tour of the graveyard!

column5:
白ツルさまが　白ツルさまが\n
石に　されちまっただ！\n
この村も　長くねえじゃ！
column6: Our sacred White Crane has been turned to stone! This is the end for our village!

column5:
クークー！　よく　ここまで\n
やって来ましたね　ジライア！\n
わたしは　神の使い　白ツルです
column6:
Kaw kaw! Well met, Ziria!\n
I am the White Crane, messenger of the divine.

column5:
ジパングに　さまよう　亡霊たちを\n
天上界に　みちびいてゆくのが\n
私の　役目なのです
column6: My duty is to guide the spirits roaming Jipang to Heaven.

column5:
わたしは　争いは　好みませんが\n
大門教の　行ないを　このまま\n
見ていることは　できません
column6: As much as I loathe conflict, I cannot stand idly and watch as the Cult of Daimon spreads pain and destruction.

column5:
わたしの持つ　神通力は　人々の\n
苦しみを　やわらげるためのもの\n
その力　清水の巻物を　さずけましょう
column6: My divine power exists to alleviate the suffering of mankind. I shall bestow it upon you as the scroll of Kiyomizu.

column5:
清水の術は　毒水の上を　歩くときに\n
お使いなさい！　清水の　せせらぎが\n
あなたを　毒から　守るでしょう
column6: The Kiyomizu jutsu will release a stream of clean water that will protect you as you traverse toxic waters.

column5:
さあ　行きなさい　ジライア！\n
ジパングに　ふたたび\n
平和を　取り戻すのです！
column6:
Go forth, young Ziria!\n
Bring peace back to our beautiful Jipang!

column5: 神獣白ツルの　封印を　解き放った
column6: You have broken the seal of the divine beast White Crane.

column5: 清水の巻物を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Scroll of Kiyomizu.

column5:
清水の術は　毒水の上を　歩くときに\n
お使いなさい！　清水の　せせらぎが\n
あなたを　毒から　守るでしょう
column6: The Kiyomizu jutsu will release a stream of clean water that will protect you as you traverse toxic waters.

column5:
さあ　行きなさい　ジライア！\n
ジパングに　ふたたび\n
平和を　取り戻すのです！
column6:
Go forth, young Ziria!\n
Bring peace back to our beautiful Jipang!

column5:
湯船には　温泉の湯が　あった\n
その湯を　浴びると　体に\n
力が　わき上がってきた
column6:
The pool is filled with hot spring water.\n
You feel reinvigorated as soon as you enter.

column5: 温泉宿
column6: Hot Spring Inn

column5:
ここは　温泉やど！！\n
今どき　なんと　タダ！！\n
泊らないとソン！！　泊まる？！
column6:
This is a hot spring inn! It's completely free! You should stay for a while!\n
How about it?

column5: また　おいで！！
column6: Come back!

column5: ごゆっくり！！
column6: Rest well!

column5:
おいらは　魚売りだ！\n
とさ港の　魚は　毒水にやられて\n
売りもんに　なんねえだ！
column6: I'm a fishmonger! But I've been out of business ever since the waters of Tosa Harbor became toxic!

column5:
ジライアさん！\n
あたし　こう　見えても\n
雲切の里の者なのよ！！
column6: Ziria-san, I'm from Kumogiri Hamlet!

column5:
どうやら　このミイラ騒ぎも\n
大門教が　うしろで\n
糸を　ひいてる　みたいだわ
column6: It seems the Cult of Daimon is pulling the strings of this whole mummy business!

column5: 恐山
column6: Mount Osore

column5:
ここが　有名な　おそれ山だ\n
どんな　ことでも　占ってくれる
column6:
This is the famous Mount Osore.\n
You can have the priestesses read your fortune about anything!

column5:
人生に　悩みが　あるんでしょ！！！\n
占い屋の　オババの　ところへ\n
行けば　いいわ
column6:
Is something on your mind?\n
Then ask the priestesses to read your fortune!

column5:
マサカドが　復活するっちゅうて\n
ウワサ　広まってから\n
占いしてもらいに　来る人さ　増えただ
column6: Since word has spread about Masakado's imminent return, more and more people are coming to have their fortunes read.

column5:
南の　白カメさまと　白ツルさまを\n
大門教が　石にしたってのは\n
ほんとうかい？
column6: I heard that the White Turtle and the White Crane south from here have been turned to stone. Is it true?

column5:
西の橋を　渡って\n
そのまま　西に　行くと\n
漁師の村　とさ港に　つくよ
column6: If you cross the western bridge and keep walking, you'll reach Tosa Harbor, the fishermen village.

column5:
まちがっても　とさ港の南の\n
枯れ木の森には　近づくなよ！\n
あそこは　ミイラが　でるらしいぜ！
column6: But don't walk into the withered forest south from there! That place is teeming with mummies!

column5:
あたる　かもね・・・\n
あたらぬ　かもね・・・\n
占うかえ？
column6: I could be right, or I could be wrong...Should I read your fortune?

column5: どうするね？\n
column6: How about it?\n

column5:
おお！\n
おまえさんの　行く手を\n
外の国の　ミイラが・・・
column6: Ohhh! A foreign mummy blocks the path...

column5:
ううう・・・　ジャマを　しているぞ！\n
まず　かんざし　じゃ　かんざし！\n
かんざしが　ミイラの・・・　ううう
column6:
Ahhh...It stands in your way!\n
You'll need a hairpin! With that hairpin, the mummy can...Ahhh...

column5: ざんねんじゃのう・・・
column6: That's too bad.

column5: よーく　あたるぞ！　ヒヒヒヒ
column6:
My predictions are often right.\n
Hee hee hee!

column5: 占うかい？\n
column6: Should I read your fortune?\n

column5:
うーむ・・・　見えるぞ\n
おまえは　ヘビ族の　勇者を\n
さがして　いるな
column6:
Hmmm...Yes, I see it.\n
You're looking for the hero of the Snake clan.

column5:
ううう・・・　待つことじゃ\n
しんぼうが　かんじんじゃよ！
column6:
Hmmm...You must wait.\n
Patience is a virtue!

column5:
そうか　また　いらっしゃい\n
ヒヒヒヒ・・・・
column6:
I see. That's too bad.\n
Hee hee hee...

column5:
あたるも　はっけ\n
あたらぬも　はっけ・・よいよい\n
へへへ
column6:
My predictions may not always be right, but they're never wrong.\n
Heh heh heh!

column5: 占うかい？\n
column6: Should I read your fortune?\n

column5:
大門教が・・・ミイラが・・・\n
つき山が・・・ミスが・・・\n
古寺が・・・・オロチ丸が・・・
column6:
Cult of Daimon...Mummies...\n
Mount Tsukiyama...Miss...\n
Old temple...Orochimaru...
column7: ZenkiTN: "Miss" refers to "Miss Tosa Harbor", the character who gives you the hairpin.

column5:
白スズメが・・・かんざしが・・・\n
毒水が・・・坊さんが・・・\n
マサカドが・・・関西弁が・・・
column6:
White Sparrow...Hairpin...\n
Toxic water...Monk...\n
Masakado...Foreigner...
column7: ZenkiTN: I changed that "関西弁" (Kansai-ben) to "Foreigner" because it refers to Khamen Khamen (the Daimon Cultist of this part of the game), who speaks in Kansai-ben in Japanese. Another line calls him a "foreign mummy" already, so I figured it would work. The fortune is supposed to be ambiguous (I think one of the divine beasts you free also speaks in Kansai-ben), so "foreigner" should fit the bill (you might think it's Hoteimaru).

column5: ロマンのないやつじゃ！
column6: Sheesh, live a little!

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
西の大きな川を　越えてゆくと\n
土崎の町が　あります
column6: Cross the western river and you'll reach the town of Tsuchizaki.

column5:
あそこは　毒水の　被害の\n
もっとも　ひどいところで\n
毎日の　飲み水さえ　ないそうですよ
column6: This toxic water business is hitting them even harder than us. They can't even afford to drink water every day!

column5:
ジライアさま！　ありがとう\n
これで　もとのように\n
くらすことが　できるでしょう
column6:
Thank you, Ziria-sama!\n
We can return to our livelihood!

column5:
今じゃ　枯れ木に　なっとる\n
南の森を　ぬけて　さらに下ると\n
月山の　ふもとに　出るですじゃ
column6: Go south, beyond the withered forest, and you'll be at the foot of Mount Tsukiyama.

column5:
そこには　むかし　エライお坊さまらが\n
即身仏に　なるために　修行したと\n
いわれる　古いお寺が　ありますじゃ
column6: The monks of the old temple there were so devoted to asceticism that they became mummies while still alive!
column7: ZenkiTN: the term used here is "sokushinbutsu", but I figured explaining what the term means was more important than keeping the term (expecially since "mummies" is the theme of this part of the game)

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　４０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両40 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　４０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両40 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: 武具屋
column6: Armory

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　武具屋です\n
ご用件は　何ですか？
column6:
Welcome to my armory!\n
How can I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それでは　また　ご利用ください
column6: Come back anytime.

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
あんただけに　教えるが\n
土崎の坊さんは\n
不思議なかんざしを　もってんだ
column6:
Just between you and me...\n
The monk of Tsuchizaki is keeping some kind of special hairpin.

column5:
なんでも　その　かんざしが　あれば\n
ミイラなんか　ヘッチャラだって\n
いうから　すげえじゃねか！
column6: Apparently, that trinket can bring mummies down for good! Now, ain't that something?

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
月山には　三つの　山が　あってのう\n
むかしから　そこには　毒の水が\n
わき出ておって
column6: Mount Tsukiyama has three peaks. According to old tales, toxic water would flow down from there.

column5:
その　毒水に　触れると\n
命が　縮まると　いわれておる！\n
くわばら　くわばら！
column6: Touching that water would halve your lifespan! Gods have mercy!

column5: とさ港
column6: Tosa Harbor

column5:
ずるずる　エーンエーン\n
ずるずるずる　エーンエーン\n
ずるずるずるずる　チーーーーーン！
column6:
Sob, sob...\n
Waaah...\n
Sniff...Sniff...

column5:
この村は　もう　おしまいだわ\n
食べられる　お魚が　とれなくなっちゃ\n
漁師は　くらしていけないわ！
column6:
We're done for...\n
How are fishermen supposed to make a living if none of the fish are edible?!

column5:
ありがとうございます\n
また　魚が取れるようになるでしょう
column6:
We can catch fish again!\n
Thank you so much!

column5:
ミスとさ港を　みんなで　決めたころは\n
魚も　たんと　とれて\n
豊かな村　だったん　じゃがのう
column6:
When we crowned Miss Tosa Harbor, our village was so bright and cheerful.\n
Oh, the fishes we caught back then!

column5:
月山のほうから\n
毒水が　流れてくるように　なって\n
わしらの海は　死んだんじゃ！
column6:
But now, toxic waters are flowing down from Mount Tsukiyama...\n
Our beloved sea is dead!

column5:
ジライアさま！　ありがとう\n
これで　もとの　きれいな海に\n
もどるでしょう
column6:
Thank you so much, Ziria-sama!\n
The sea is clean and teeming with life!

column5:
魚を　とっても　しょうがねえよ\n
みんな　くさっちまってる！！\n
もう　はたらくの　やめた　やめた！！
column6:
Why do I even keep trying?\n
All the fish are rotten! That's it, I give up!

column5: ありがとう　ジライアさま！
column6: Thank you, Ziria-sama!

column5:
あたし　おカヨって　いいます\n
ミスとさ港　なのよ
column6:
My name is Okayo.\n
I'm Miss Tosa Harbor!

column5:
あなたに　かんざしを　あげたら\n
ミイラを　たいじ　してくれるって\n
オロチ丸さんから　きいたわ！
column6: Orochimaru-san told me you'd drive the mummies away if I gave you the hairpin.

column5: ほんとうに　たいじ　してくれる？\n
column6: Is it true? Will you drive them away?\n

column5:
ミイラが　いなくなれば\n
いつだって　おぼうさんに　あえるわね\n
がんばってね！　ジライアさん！
column6:
With the mummies gone, I'll be able to see Monk-san whenever I want!\n
Good luck, Ziria-san!
column7:
ZenkiTN: I don't really like just calling him "the monk". I'm considering "Mr. Monk" or "Sir Monk".
Supper: well, I say why not take the easy way out and just call him "Monk-san". it's sort of literal...I guess?

column5: かんざしを　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Hairpin.

column5:
いやよ！　いや！　いや！　いや！\n
かんざしが　なくちゃ　ミイラを\n
たおせないのよ！　おねがい！
column6:
But there's no other way! You can't beat the mummies without the hairpin!\n
Please, do it for us!

column5:
ジライアさん！\n
ホントに　あ・り・が・と！\n
お坊さんと　また　デート　できるわ
column6:
Oh, thank you SO much, Ziria-san!\n
Now I can go on dates with Monk-san again!

column5:
ミスとさ港の　おカヨのところに\n
土崎の坊さんが　ときどき会いに\n
来てやがるんだぜ！！
column6: A monk often comes from Tsuchizaki to see Okayo, this year's Miss Tosa Harbor.
column7: ZenkiTN: I added the "this year's" part because I thought it made clearer that "Miss" is in the sense of the winner of a beauty pageant.

column5:
仏の道を　きわめるはずの者が\n
スケベの道を　きわめるとは\n
うーむ　あやかりたい！
column6: That sly dog! So much for renouncing worldly thoughts, huh?

column5:
くさった魚しか　とれねえんじゃ\n
家族を　どう　やしなえばいいんだ！！\n
もう　首を　つるしかねえじゃねか
column6:
Every fish I catch is rotten! How am I supposed to provide for my family?!\n
I should just hang myself!

column5:
ここより　土崎の町のほうが\n
もっと　もっと　ヒサンなのよ！！\n
毒水のせいで　水も　飲めないらしいわ
column6: The town of Tsuchizaki has it even worse than us. They don't even have clean water to drink!

column5:
きっと　土崎のおトノさまも\n
これには　たいそう\n
お困りに　なっていると　思うわ
column6: Their lord must be out of his head with worry.

column5:
舟が　こんなに　あるのに\n
だれも　魚を　とりに　行かない\n
みんな　毒水が　悪いんだ！
column6: So many boats, not a single one sailing! The toxic waters have made fishing impossible!

column5: 土崎町
column6: Tsuchizaki Town

column5:
火の勇者さま　お助けくだせえ\n
毒水にやられて　この土崎には\n
もう　一てきの水も　ないですじゃ！
column6:
Please save us, Fire Hero!\n
We don't have a single drop of drinking water left!

column5:
ずいぶん　まえの　話だけど\n
とさ港の　おカヨが　すごく\n
かんざしを　ほしがって　いたわ
column6: Days ago, everyone was gossiping about how much Okayo of Tosa Harbor wanted an ornate hairpin.

column5:
お坊さんと\n
とさ港の　おカヨは\n
恋人どうし　なんですって
column6: Apparently, the monk and Okayo of Tosa Harbor are going out.

column5:
お坊さんに　会えば\n
わかると　思うけれど\n
おカヨって　そうとう　イイしゅみよ！
column6: Okayo must have some...interesting tastes, to say the least. You'll know what I mean when you meet the monk.

column5:
ゲホ　ゲホ・・・\n
お城の　とのさまが\n
火の勇者を　さがしているそうじゃ
column6:
Cough, cough...\n
The lord of the castle is looking for the Fire Heroes.

column5:
この町に　たった　一つだけあった\n
井戸まで　大門教の　外道が\n
こわしていったの！
column6: Those evil Daimonists went so far as to demolish our only water well!

column5:
わたし　くやしくて　くやしくて\n
でも　体中　カラカラで\n
もう　涙も　でないわ！
column6: I'm so parched, I can't even shed tears anymore...

column5:
ありがとう　ございました\n
まだ　川の水は　飲めませんが\n
新しい井戸は　できました
column6: Thank you so much. We can't drink from the river yet, but at least we have a new water well!

column5:
とさ港で　とれる魚は　\n
みんな　くさっておる　そうじゃ\n
魚も食えん　水も飲めん！
column6:
The fish of Tosa Harbor are all rotten.\n
We can neither eat fish nor drink water!

column5:
もう　なんの　楽しみもねえ！\n
月山からの　毒水のせえじゃ！！
column6: There's nothing left for us to enjoy! And it's all because of that toxic water from Mount Tsukiyama!

column5:
毒水は　東の川の　上流にある\n
月山のほうから　流れてくるが\n
ミイラが　こわくて　調べにも　行けん
column6: The eastern river is carrying toxic water down from Mount Tsukiyama, but we can't investigate with the mummies around.

column5:
ジライアさんで　ゲスな！\n
ミイラを　たおすには\n
かんざしが　ないと　苦労するって
column6:
You must be Ziria-san!\n
A handsome samurai called Orochimaru left a message for you.

column5:
オロチ丸とかいう\n
若ざむらいが　いってたでゲスよ！\n
たしかに　伝えたでゲスよ！！
column6:
Taking down mummies without the hairpin is almost impossible.\n
That's it!

column5:
トノさまの命令で\n
ミイラが　町に入って来ぬよう\n
みはりを　しているのでござる
column6: By order of the lord of Tsuchizaki, no mummy shall enter our town!

column5:
火の勇者ジライアさまですね\n
おトノさまが　お待ちです\n
どうぞ　おはいり　ください
column6:
You must be Ziria-sama, the Fire Hero.\n
Our lord is waiting for you inside.\n
Please, come on in.

column5:
おまちして　いました\n
さあ　奥へ　どうぞ
column6:
We've been expecting you.\n
Please, come on in.

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
即身仏に　なられた\n
お坊さまの　ミイラを\n
おなぐさめ　するために
column6: Back in the day, many monks became mummies through ascetic practices.

column5:
むかし　この国では\n
かんざしを　作る　ならわしが\n
あったらしいですよ
column6: So people used to make special hairpins to appease their spirits. It's a shame this tradition has been lost to time.
column7: ZenkiTN: I've reworded this part a little since I couldn't make it flow naturally. The literal translation is something along the lines of "In order to console the mummies of the monks that underwent sokushinbutsu, people of this country had a tradition of making hairpins"

column5:
月山を　ぬけると\n
しなの国は　すぐですよ
column6: Cross Mount Tsukiyama and you'll be close to the lands of Shinano.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　４０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両40 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　４０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両40 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: 武具屋
column6: Armory

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　武具屋です\n
ご用件は　何ですか？
column6:
Welcome to my armory!\n
How can I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それでは　また　ご利用ください
column6: Come back anytime.

column5: 武具屋
column6: Armory

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　武具屋です\n
ご用件は　何ですか？
column6:
Welcome to my armory!\n
How can I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それでは　また　ご利用ください
column6: Come back anytime.

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 預かり所
column6: Warehouse

column5: かんざし寺
column6: Hairpin Temple

column5:
ナンマイダー\n
ナンマイダー\n
なんだ　ジャマを　しないでくれ
column6:
Namo Amitabha...\n
Namo Amitabha...\n
Ahem. You're interrupting my prayers.
column7: ZenkiTN: "Namo Amitabha" is the Sanskrit writing for the prayer "Namu Amidabutsu".

column5:
おカヨが　ミスとさ港に　なったんで\n
ほしがっていた　あのかんざしを\n
あげてしまったのだ！
column6: Okayo, the new Miss Tosa Harbor, wanted an ornate hairpin, so I gave her our sacred relic!
column7: NOTE: this guy's voice is a cameo role by "tv comedian, actor, and radio personality" Makoto Ootake, which is presumably why it sounds very phoned in in terms of both delivery and audio quality. seriously, it sounds so poorly recorded i think he may have quite literally phoned it in.

column5:
おかげで　とさ港へ　かよえなくなった\n
ミイラさえ　いなくなればと\n
オロチ丸って人にも　はなしたんだ！！
column6:
But I can't go to Tosa Harbor without it.\n
I'll tell you what I told that Orochimaru: {If only the mummies were gone!}
column7: NOTE: at least I think this is what he's saying. we know that Orochimaru tells Okayo to give you the hairpin, so I think the implication is that Orochimaru came here, found out about the situation, then went to Tosa and talked to Okayo. it's still a bit odd, though...

column5:
ジライアさん！　ありがとう！\n
これで　また　おカヨに\n
あいに　行けます！
column6:
Thank you so much, Ziria-san!\n
Now I can see my Okayo again!

column5: 土崎城
column6: Tsuchizaki Castle

column5: トノさまは　二階で　ございます
column6: Our lord is on the second floor.

column5:
だれが　ミイラを　たいじに\n
いくのやら・・・
column6: If only someone would deal with those mummies...

column5: ありがとう　ございました
column6: You have our gratitude.

column5: 土崎城
column6: Tsuchizaki Castle

column5:
おぬしは　火の一族じゃな　たのむ\n
たのむ　わが国に　すみついた\n
かいぶつを　たおして　くれぬか？
column6: You must be descendants of the Fire Clan. I have a request. Will you save my lands from these terrible creatures?

column5:
大門教の　かいぶつは\n
月山の　ふるい寺に　すみついて\n
この国を　ねらっておる
column6: A monster from the Cult of Daimon has taken over the old temple on Mount Tsukiyama and invaded this country.

column5:
外の国の　かいぶつで　名前を\n
カーメン　カーメンと　いうらしい\n
そいつが　ミイラを　あやつっている
column6: He's a creature from foreign lands, and his name is Khamen Khamen. He is the one controlling the mummies.

column5:
てごわい　あいてだが　たのむぞ！！\n
この剣を　やろう　これで\n
カーメン　カーメンを　たおすのじゃ！
column6: I know he's a fearsome foe. I hope this sword can assist you in your quest!

column5:
大門教の　かいぶつは\n
月山の　ふるい寺に　すみついて\n
この国を　ねらっておる
column6: A monster from the Cult of Daimon has taken over the old temple on Mount Tsukiyama and invaded this country.

column5:
外の国の　かいぶつで　名前を\n
カーメン　カーメンと　いうらしい\n
そいつが　ミイラを　あやつっている
column6: He's a creature from foreign lands, and his name is Khamen Khamen. He is the one controlling the mummies.

column5:
そうか　ならば　しかたがない\n
しかし　南の国を　めざすなら\n
大門教を　たおさねば　ならぬぞ
column6: I see...That's a shame. However, you cannot reach our southern neighbors without defeating the Daimonists first!

column5:
これで　この国も　あんしんじゃ\n
アッパレ！　アッパレ！！
column6:
My lands are finally safe!\n
Well done, well done!

column5:
大門教の　かいぶつは\n
月山の　ふるい寺に　すみついて\n
この国を　ねらっておる
column6: A monster from the Cult of Daimon has taken over the old temple on Mount Tsukiyama and invaded this country.

column5:
外の国の　かいぶつで　名前を\n
カーメン　カーメンと　いうらしい\n
そいつが　ミイラを　あやつっている
column6: He's a creature from foreign lands, and his name is Khamen Khamen. He is the one controlling the mummies.

column5:
土崎城の　トノさまの\n
依頼を　引き受けた
column6: You have accepted the request of the lord of Tsuchizaki.

column5: 旋風刀を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Whirlwind Sword.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
ある日　南の湖が\n
むらさき色に　変わった\n
次の日には　南の森が　枯れた
column6: One day, the southern lake turned purple. The next day, the trees of the forest withered.

column5:
三日目には　土崎の水が　死に\n
五日目には　とさ港に　魚が　浮いた\n
みんな　毒水のせいじゃった
column6:
On the third day, all of the water in Tsuchizaki became undrinkable.
#BOXPAUSE()
On the fifth day, the fish of Tosa Harbor were floating belly up. The toxic waters are to blame for it all.
column7: ZenkiTN: I split this to spread the words better in multiple boxes.

column5: ありがとうございました
column6: You have our gratitude.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
ホントの　こと　言って！！\n
ボクって　クサい？\n
何日も　お風呂　入ってないんだ！
column6:
Please, be honest. Do I stink?\n
I haven't taken a bath in weeks!

column5:
ありがとう！\n
でも　本当は　ボク\n
お風呂が　きらいなんだ
column6:
Thanks for everything!\n
But the truth is...I don't like taking baths.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
この国の　白ツルさまは\n
毒水から　体を守る\n
神通力を　おもちのはずです
column6: The divine power of the sacred White Crane can protect you from toxic water.

column5:
でも　白ツルさまの　ところへ\n
行くには　あの　枯れ木の森を\n
越えなければ　なりません
column6: But you'll have to cross the withered forest to reach him.

column5: 月山の古寺
column6: Tsukiyama Temple

column5:
台の上に　見たことが　ない\n
南蛮カラクリが　あります\n
赤や　緑に　点滅している！！[color]<$00>
column6: An unidentifiable device is mounted on the pedestal. Red and green lights blink on and off.[color]<$00>

column5:
ジライア！\n
なんか　光ってるよ\n
ポチッと・・
column6: Ziria, look! This thingamabob is blinking. Boink!

column5:
光っているものに　触れると\n
祭だんの　後ろの像が　動き出した
column6: As soon as the blinking protrusion is pushed, the statue on the altar rumbles.

column5: 像の中に入る　階段が　現れた！
column6: It opens up, revealing a staircase!

column5:
わけがわかりませんが　とにかく\n
南蛮カラクリが　うごいています
column6: The exotic device, though totally incomprehensible, appears to be active.

column5:
台の上に　見たことがない\n
南蛮カラクリが　あります\n
赤や　緑に　点滅している！！
column6: An unidentifiable device is mounted on the pedestal. Red and green lights blink on and off.

column5: 寺
column6: Temple

column5:
ここは　月山の　大本山や！\n
おお！　あんさんにゃ　アクマが\n
ついてまんがな　おそろしいおます！
column6: Howdy doodle, and welcome to the main temple of Mount Tsukiyama! Monsters got ya quakin' in your boots, eh?
column7:
ZenkiTN: Khamen Khamen speaks in Kansai-ben (as predicted by the fortune-teller of Mount Osore), but since there's no way to convey "kansai-ben" in English, I just said he was a foreigner (as Khamen Khamen is referred to as a "mummy from a foreign country" multiple times in the script). I gave him a bit of an accent, but this is more of an example accent.

This here's the main temple of Mount Tsukiyama! Those monsters are scary, eh?

column5:
わるいこと　いいまへんがな\n
ワテも　入会しとる　大門教に\n
はいりなはれ
column6:
Just a li'l word of advice, neighbor:\n
Join the Cult of Daimon!
column7: Take my advice, kiddo: join the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
あんさんかて\n
入会したいん　やろ？
column6: So, how 'bout it? Ya gonna join?

column5:
あんさん　アホやなあ　これ　ワナや！\n
ワテは　大門教１３人衆の　４番手\n
カーメン　カーメンや！
column6:
C'mon, ya schmuck! It's a trap!\n
I'm the fourth of the Thirteen Daimon Cultists, Khamen Khamen!

column5:
カメヘン　カメヘンて　今までの\n
こたあ　水に　ながして　やるさかい\n
大門教に　入りなはれ
column6: C'mon, c'mon! Ya gotta learn to forgive 'n' forget, y'know? Ya'd best join up now!
column7: ZenkiTN: "カメヘン　カメヘン" is Khamen Khamen's catchphrase. It's a typical Kansai-ben phrase which means "It doesn't matter". The joke here is that "kamahen kamahen" sounds very similar to "Khamen Khamen", which is why I went for "C'mon, c'mon".

column5:
だいじょうぶ　やて\n
そんでも　イヤや　ゆうんやったら\n
ドついてでも　入れたるで
column6: If ya ain't comin' on yer own terms, I'm gonna hafta beat some sense into you!

column5:
きいて　おどろくな\n
ワテは　大門教１３人衆の　４番手\n
カーメン　カーメンや！
column6:
Hope ya like surprises, 'cause...\n
I'm actually the fourth of the Thirteen Daimon Cultists, Khamen Khamen!

column5: またきたのか　カメヘン　カメヘン
column6: Back for more? C'mon, c'mon!
column7: NOTE: lol that they didn't voice act this, i bet they forgot to account for the scenario of having to come back after a defeat and had to throw it in at the last minute during testing

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　金　３００両が　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There are 両300 inside.

column5: 金　３００両を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained 両300.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　なにもなかった
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is nothing inside.

column6: Mount Tsukiyama

There is a cloth katabira inside.

中には　なにもなかった

中には　どくけしが　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is an antidote inside.

column5: どくけしを　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Antidote.

column5: 月山
column6: Mount Tsukiyama

column5: 月山大門教会
column6: Daimon Church
column7: NOTE: should be "Tsukiyama Daimon Church", but that's too long and gets squished to near-unreadability. no other daimon church gets its own label like this, so it's not too big a deal.

column5:
やっと　ここまで　きおったな！\n
どうや　毒の水は　うまかろう\n
さいごに　たっぷり　のましたる
column6:
Here ya are! Sure kept me waitin'!\n
Didja enjoy all that delicious toxic water? C'mon, have a taste!

column5:
また　きおったな！\n
しつこいやっちゃなぁ・・・
column6: Back for more? There's a stubborn fella!

column5:
どうや　毒の水は　うまかろう\n
さいごに　たっぷり　のましたる
column6: Didja enjoy all that delicious toxic water? C'mon, have a taste!

column5:
うう〜　苦しいよ〜\n
はやく　楽にしてくれ〜
column6:
Urgh...I'm suffering...\n
Please, deliver me from this pain...

column5:
人の　恨みや　憎しみの　こもった\n
たましいほど　マサカドは\n
よろこぶって　いうんだ
column6: Masakado delights in souls filled with regret and hatred...

column5:
ここにいる　たましいは　みんな\n
マサカドに　喰われちまうんだ\n
つぎは　おれの番かもしれない
column6: Masakado consumes the souls that end up here...It could be my turn next...

column5:
はやく　わたしたちを\n
もとの姿に　もどしてください！
column6: Please, return us to our bodies!

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　落葉の巻物が　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
You find the scroll of Rakuyou.

column5: 落葉の巻物を　手に入れた\n
column6: Obtained Scroll of Rakuyou.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n

column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
