column5: 月山
column6: Mount Tsukiyama

column5: 雲切の里９
column6: Kumogiri Hamlet 9

column5:
クックックク\n
きいてくださいよ\n
ジライアさん
column6: Hahaha! You have to hear this, Ziria-san!

column5:
今度の　大門教のボスは\n
大バカなんですよ！
column6: The latest Daimonist leader is the world's greatest fool!

column5:
わたしら　アイツを\n
バカ・マントーと　呼んでるんです
column6: His name is Manto, but most of us just call him {chimp brain.}
column7: ZenkiTN: "Manto is an idiot" is the running joke in this segment of the game. Manto himself is a recurring character in the series from what I could tell. People here call him "Baka Manto", so I went for something a little more unique. As for why I went for "chimp" and not "monkey", that's because the divine beast here is the White Monkey, so I didn't want to use "monkey" as an insult.

column5:
南へ　行くと\n
もがみの渡しよ\n
そこから　しなの国へ　行けるのよ
column6: Head south and you'll find the Mogami ferry. Cross the river and you'll be in the lands of Shinano.

column5:
もがみの渡しの　女の子が\n
バカ・マントーに\n
さらわれたの
column6: Manto kidnapped the daughter of the Mogami ferryman.

column5:
だけど　ジライアさんなら\n
助け出すのは　カンタンよ！
column6: But I can't imagine you having trouble dealing with that chimp brain, Ziria-san!

column5:
このあたりは　白サルさまが　\n
守っていたんだが　ちかごろは\n
バカ・マントーが　サルの　おやぶんさ
column6: The sacred White Monkey used to protect this area, but recently, that chimp brain Manto became the new monkey leader.

column5:
里の者たちは　宿に集まって\n
マントーが　どんなに　バカかってこと\n
話して　楽しんでるんです
column6: There's a meeting in progress at the inn. We're coming up with new ways to insult Manto!

column5:
ジライアさん！\n
かならず　大門教の奴らを\n
やっつけてください
column6: Please take down the Cult of Daimon, Ziria-san!

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
わたしたちは　毎日　ここに\n
あつまって　バカ・マントーの話に\n
花を　咲かせているのです
column6: Every day, we gather here to find new ways to describe Manto's lack of intelligence.
column7: ZenkiTN: I'm going to translate these more or less literally, but I think these could be rewritten using some of the most popular "Yo mama so dumb" jokes (with Manto as the subject). I feel like trying to keep the original meaning is just going to feel awkward in English.

column5:
ちなみに　わたしに　いわせれば\n
あいつは「　死んで　花実も\n
咲かない　バカ　」です
column6: Today, I came up with {He's so dumb, he tried to drown a fish.}
column7: ZenkiTN: this is a play on the quote "死んで花実が咲くものか" (something along the lines of "if you die, what can you do other than fertilizing the ground?", or less literally "once you're dead, it's over"). It's a little morbid if translated literally, which I don't think is the point of the original line.

column5:
マントーのバカは　サルに　化けて\n
村人を　だましてる　つもりなんだぜ！\n
もう　みんなに　正体ばれてるのによ！
column6: That chimp brain thinks he can fool us by transforming into a monkey, but he's only making a fool of himself!

column5:
ほんっとに　バカだぜ　あの野郎は！\n
「生涯一バカ」っていう　肩書きが\n
これほど　似合うやつも　めずらしいな
column6: If there was a contest for the world's greatest idiot, he'd win without even joining!
column7: ZenkiTN: literally this is "the title of 'lifetime idiot' was made for him", but it sounds too awkward.

column5:
あいつには　一生バカで　いてほしいぜ\n
バカは　死ななきゃ　なおらない\n
とは　よくいうが
column6: It's so fun to come up with new Manto jokes.
column7: ZenkiTN: the original one is about "not even death can cure stupidity"

column5:
「死んでもバカ」っていうのも\n
なさけなくて　いいな！　あ！\n
「戒名　バカ」っていうのが　最高！
column6: Here's one: Manto's so dumb, he brings a ruler to bed to see how long he sleeps.
column7: ZenkiTN: so it follows with "stupid in death" and "posthumous name: baka" (posthumous names are a Buddhism thing)

column5:
マントーの　バカはのう\n
サルを　あやつって　村人の\n
ゲタや　ふんどしを　ぬすむんじゃよ
column6: Manto is such a fool. He has a monkey army at his disposal, but he only orders them to steal sandals and loincloths.

column5:
そんなもん　持って行って\n
なんの　意味が　あるんじゃろうか\n
まったく　おめでたい　やつじゃわい！
column6: What's the dang point? Silly chimp!

column5:
いうてみれば　あやつは\n
「桜咲くバカ」じゃな！
column6: I've got a few Manto jokes. He's so dumb, he threw away a jigsaw because he thought it was broken.

column5:
「ばら色のバカ」という　フレーズも\n
なかなか　ビューチフルじゃ！
column6: He's so dumb, he brings a cake to bed to have sweet dreams.

column5:
じゃが　やはり　一番は　これじゃな\n
　　　　「バカ満開！」\n
これこそ　あやつに　ふさわしいわい！
column6: He's so dumb, he puts lipstick on his forehead to make up his mind.
column7: Baka-mankai (full-blossom moron). The closest would be "Fool blossom", but at this point I stopped using the Japanese text as basis.

column5:
わたし　この前　見ちゃったんだけど\n
マントーのやつ　村人を　ハメるために\n
村の裏手に　落し穴　掘ってたのよ
column6: The other day I saw Manto digging a hole at the back of the village. I guess he thought he could use it to trap people.

column5:
だけど　足を　すべらせて\n
自分が　落ちてんの　それで　サルに\n
助けてもらってんだから　世話ないわ
column6: But he slipped and fell inside. He had to ask his monkey minions to help him out!

column5:
まったく　悲しくなるほど　バカね！\n
ああいうのを　名づけて\n
「天かけるバカ」っていうのよ！
column6: Manto's so dumb, he bought bird seed and asked how long it takes for birds to grow!

column5:
なんとなく　おしゃれでしょ！\n
まだ　あるのよ\n
「白馬に乗ったバカ」！
column6: He's so dumb, he once got hit by a parked cart!
column7: Hakuba ni notta baka (white horse-riding idiot)

column5:
さらに　すごいのが\n
「イルカに乗ったバカ」！\n
わけ　わかんないけど　すごいじゃない
column6: He's so dumb, if you give him 両1 for his thoughts, you get a refund!

column5:
まあ　いってみれば　マントーは\n
「はてしのないバカ」だな！
column6: He's so dumb, he challenged a mirror to a staring contest and lost!

column5:
さらにいえば\n
「奥の深いバカ」だな！
column6: He's so dumb, he thought eggs came from eggplants!
column7: Oku no fukai baka (very deep idiot)

column5:
「後光のさすバカ」「神々しいバカ」\n
「新しいバカ」「かんぺきなバカ」\n
すべて　当てはまるな　こりゃ！
column6: He's so dumb, he'd stay up all night trying to catch some sleep!
column7:
Gokou no sasu baka (halo-emitting idiot)
Kougoushii baka (divine idiot)
Atarashii baka (new kind of idiot)
Kanpeki baka (perfect idiot)

column5:
マントーって　あんなに　バカなのに\n
なんで　生きていられるんだろうな\n
あいつを　見てると　まるで　この世に
column6: Life must be hard when you're as dumb as Manto.

column5:
「職業・バカ」というのが　あって\n
それで　オマンマ　食ってるような\n
気がして　ならねえ！
column6: He's so dumb, when the barkeep told him {drinks are on the house,} he left and came back with a ladder!

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　２０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両20 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　２０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両20 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 賭場
column6: Gambling Den

column5:
ジライアさん　じゃないですかぁ！\n
こんな所で　遊んでいて　いいんですか\n
まっ　たまには　息ぬきしないとね
column6:
My, if it isn't Ziria-san!\n
Should you really be here?\n
Eh, I guess it's fine every once in a while!

column5:
ツボふりの　ネエちゃん　きれいだろ！\n
もう　ちょっとで\n
見えそう　なんだけどなあ！！
column6:
The dice lady is a real babe!\n
When I play, I'm not exactly looking at the dice, if you catch my drift!

column5:
二つの　サイコロの目を　たして\n
偶数なら　「丁」で\n
奇数なら　「半」だ！
column6:
It's a simple game!\n
Just bet whether the sum of the two dice will be even or odd!

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
サルたちが　あばれているのは\n
きっと　大門教の　せいさ！\n
ヤツラの　やりそうな　ことだ
column6: I bet the Cult of Daimon is behind the monkeys' rampage. I mean, that's just the kind of thing they'd do, right?

column5:
サルが　出なくなったのは\n
あんたの　おかげかい\n
ありがとよ
column6: You solved that whole monkey business, huh? Thanks!

column5:
船頭が　いないんで\n
ここで　足止めを　くっているでさぁ
column6: Without the ferryman, we're pretty much stranded here.

column5:
船頭が　もどったって！？\n
さあ　出発だ！
column6:
The ferryman's back? Well, alriiiight!\n
Time to leave!

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます

column5:

おとまりになりますか？

Will you stay?

Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column6: Please come again.

お気をつけて　ジライアさま

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
ジライアさんですね！\n
あっしは　雲切の里の者です
column6:
You must be Ziria-san!\n
I'm from Kumogiri Hamlet.

column5:
マントーは　ざおう温泉に　います\n
ざおう温泉の場所は　この村を　[color]<$01>×[color]<$00>　\n
ざおう温泉を　[color]<$01>△[color]<$00>　とすると
column6:
Manto is currently at Zao Hot Spring.\n
Here, let me draw you a quick map.\n
This village is [color]<$01>×[color]<$00> while Zao is [color]<$01>△[color]<$00>.

column5:
・△　\n
　　　　　　・　　　[color]<$00>こんな　感じに　\n
[color]<$01>×・・・・・　　　[color]<$00>行った　ところです
column6:
[space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px]・△\n
[space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px]・[space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][color]<$00>It's kinda\n
[space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][color]<$01>×・・・・・[space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][color]<$00>like this.

column5:
よく　あんな　地図で\n
わかりましたね\n
さすが　火の勇者　ジライアさまだ！！
column6:
You actually understood my map?\n
Now that's the Fire Hero for you!

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
大門教の　やつらが\n
おサエを　さらったんじゃ！\n
サルのボスは　大門教の怪物じゃ！
column6: Those evil Daimonists kidnapped little Osae! The monkey boss is a Daimonist monster!

column5:
そして　さるた神社の\n
白サルさまを　石にしたのも\n
あやつらに　ちがい　あるまい！
column6: I bet they're also responsible for turning the sacred White Monkey of Saruta Shrine to stone!

column5: ありがとうございました
column6: You have our gratitude.

column5: もがみの渡し
column6: Mogami Ferry

column5:
ここは\n
むつ国と　しなの国を結ぶ\n
もがみの渡し　です
column6: This is Mogami Ferry, which connects Mutsu and Shinano.

column5:
でも　今は　この村で\n
誘拐事件が　おこったので\n
舟が　出てないんですよ
column6: But no boats are going to be setting out until the kidnapping case is solved.

column5:
ここは\n
むつ国と　しなの国を結ぶ\n
もがみの渡し　です
column6: This is Mogami Ferry, which connects Mutsu and Shinano.

column5:
どうして　女だって　わかったの？\n
こまるわ　これじゃあ\n
サルの　ボスに　さらわれちゃう
column6:
H-How did you know I'm a woman?\n
Please keep it a secret! I don't want the monkey boss to kidnap me!

column5:
もう　ヘタな　へんそうを\n
しなくても　すむわ\n
どうも　ありがとう
column6:
Thank you so much.\n
I don't have to disguise myself anymore.

column5:
たいへんだ！！\n
船頭さんとこの　おサエちゃんが\n
ボスザルに　さらわれた！
column6: This is terrible! The monkey boss kidnapped Osae-chan, the ferryman's daughter!

column5:
おサエちゃんも\n
ぶじ　帰ってきた　そうだ\n
よかった　よかった
column6: Looks like Osae-chan is safe and sound. All's well that ends well.

column5:
東へ　行くと　白サルさまを\n
おまつりした　さるた神社が\n
ありますが　行かんほうが　いい！
column6:
If you go east, you'll find Saruta Shrine, home of the sacred White Monkey.\n
I don't recommend going there, though!

column5:
さいきんは　白サルさまの\n
おさめていた　サルたちが\n
人を　おそうんです
column6: Lately, the monkeys under his care have been assaulting people.

column5:
白サルさまは　だれかに\n
石にされた　そうだ\n
それで　サルが　あばれてるのかも
column6: The sacred White Monkey has been turned to stone. That's why the monkeys are misbehaving.

column5:
これで　村も　もとどおりになる\n
ありがとう　ジライアさん
column6: The situation will go back to normal soon. Thank you, Ziria-san.

column5:
船頭さんは　一人娘のおサエちゃんを\n
目に　入れても　痛くないくらいの\n
かわいがりようだったから
column6: The ferryman loves his daughter Osae-chan more than anything else in the world.

column5:
そりゃー　もう\n
ヒドイ　とりみだしようで\n
「オレが　助け出すんだ」って
column6: You should have seen him after he found out she'd been kidnapped.

column5:
サルの後を　追って\n
山のほうへ\n
いきり　とんでったぜ
column6:
{I'll save her myself!} he yelled.\n
And then he ran off after the monkeys, towards the mountains.

column5:
舟は　もう　出てる　はずだよ\n
船頭さんも　戻って来たしな\n
はやく　いってみな
column6: The ferryman's back, so you can cross the river whenever you like.

column5:
船頭さんなら　いないよ\n
娘を捜しに　どこかへ\n
行ったらしい
column6:
The ferryman? He's not here.\n
He's somewhere out there, looking for his daughter.

column5: もうすぐ　舟が　でるぞー！
column6: The boat is ready to leave! All aboard!

column5:
あぶない　ところを\n
ありがとうございました！\n
これで　安心して　くらせます
column6:
Thank you again for saving me!\n
Now we can live without fear!

column5:
ありがとう　ごぜえやした！！\n
おかげで　おサエが　助かりやした！！\n
しなの国へ　いかれるとか
column6:
Thank you so much for saving my Osae!\n
I owe you big time!\n
Are you headed to Shinano?

column5:
どうぞ　舟に　乗って　くだせえ\n
しなの国まで　送りやしょう
column6: Hop in the boat! I'll take you there!

column5:
ありがとう　ごぜえやした！！\n
おかげで　おサエが　助かりやした！！\n
しなの国へ　いかれるとか
column6:
Thank you so much for saving my Osae!\n
I owe you big time!\n
Are you headed to Shinano?

column5:
どうぞ　舟に　乗って　くだせえ\n
しなの国まで　送りやしょう
column6: Hop in the boat! I'll take you there!

column5:
そうそう　ざおう温泉の\n
カンバン娘から　ジライアさんへの\n
手紙を　あずかって　やすぜ！！
column6: Oh, that's right. Zao Hot Spring's poster girl asked me to give you this letter.

column5:
ジライアさんも　\n
すみに　おけませんな
column6:
She's quite the catch.\n
Way to go, Ziria-san!

column5: 手紙２を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Second Letter.

column5: 神社
column6: Shrine

column5:
大門教のやからが\n
わが神社の　白サルさまを\n
石に　封じ込めてしまった
column6: The Cult of Daimon has sealed our sacred White Monkey within a boulder!

column5:
おまけに　サルたちを　だまして\n
ボスに　なりすまし\n
悪の　限りをつくしている
column6: Then they tricked the monkeys into making one of them their leader, and he's forcing them to perform evil deeds.

column5:
白サルさまが　もとに　もどれば\n
サルたちも　あのボスが\n
悪者だと　気がつくはずです！
column6: Once the White Monkey is freed from the curse, the monkeys will realize the truth about their new boss!

column5:
ぜひとも　白サルさまを\n
お救いください！！
column6: Please, rescue our beloved White Monkey!

column5:
ありがとう　ございます\n
これで　すべてが　\n
もとに　もどります
column6: Thank you so much. The situation should return to normal soon.

column5:
サルたちも\n
かんしゃ　している　ようすです
column6: The little monkeys are grateful for your help.

column5:
サルのボスは　サル酒に\n
めが　ないらしいですよ
column6: The boss of the monkeys only seems to care about drinking monkey booze.

column5:
赤地に　黄色い文字で\n
「大」と　しるされた　大きな石がある
column6: There is a large red stone marked with a yellow 大 symbol.

column5: なにもありませんでした
column6: You find nothing.

column5: さるた神社
column6: Saruta Shrine

column5:
ウキッキッキ！　ウキキー！\n
ここは　さるた神社だよ！
column6:
Oop oop oop! Oop chee!\n
This is Saruta Shrine!
column7: ZenkiTN: if you're wondering, I used Monkey Island 4's monkeys as reference for the monkey verses.

column5:
ウキャキャキャキキキッ！\n
白サルさまが　石に　なってから\n
あたらしい　ボスが　きたんだ
column6:
Oop oop chee chee!\n
Since the White Monkey was turned to stone, we have a new boss.

column5:
ウキッキッキ！　ウフォッウフォ！\n
あたらしい　ボスは\n
すごく　らんぼう　なんだ
column6:
Oop chee chee! Whooh ooh ooh!\n
The new boss is very violent.

column5:
ウキキー！　キッキキー！\n
あたらしい　ボスは　ヒドイ！\n
村人を　いじめてキー！
column6:
Oop oop! Chee chee chee!\n
I hate the new boss!\n
He torments the nice people, oop oop!

column5:
キャキャキャ！　ウキャウキャキャー！\n
あたらしい　ボスザルは\n
サル酒に　めが　ないんだ
column6:
Oop oop ack! Ack chee chee!\n
The new monkey boss only cares about monkey booze!

column5:
あたらしい　ボスザルは\n
もがみの渡しから　むすめを　さらって\n
いまは　ざおう温泉に　いるキー
column6:
The new monkey boss kidnapped the daughter of Mogami's ferryman.\n
He's at Zao Hot Spring, oop oop!

column5: ざおう温泉は　北に　あるキー
column6: Zao Hot Spring is to the north, oop oop!

column5:
ウィーキッキキ！\n
白サルさまを　助けてくださったら\n
お礼に　いいもいのを　あげましょう！
column6:
Oop chee chee!\n
Once you rescue the White Monkey, I'll give you something nice!

column5:
ウィッキャ！　ウィキャ！\n
白サルさまを　助けたら\n
もういちど　来て下さい
column6:
Oop ack! Oop ack!\n
Just talk to me again after you save him!

column5:
キャ！　キャ！　キャ！　キキッキー\n
ざおう温泉は　北に　あるキー
column6:
Ack ack ack! Chee! Chee chee!\n
Zao Hot Spring is to the north, oop oop!

column5:
ウィキキキーッ！\n
ありがとうございました\n
白サルさまが　戻りました
column6:
Oop chee chee!\n
Thank you for rescuing the sacred White Monkey.

column5:
ウキ！　ウキ！　ウキッキキー！\n
この村も　平和になります\n
おれいに　サル酒を　あげましょう！
column6:
Oop oop! Ack chee chee!\n
Soon everything will be okay!\n
Here, you can have this monkey booze!

column5:
ウキッ！　ウキキッ！　ウキキキキッ！\n
ウキウキ！　ウッキッキ！　ウッキー！\n
ウキャキャキャキャ！　ウキャー！
column6:
Oop! Oop ack ack!\n
Ack, chee chee! Oop chee!\n
Oop oop ack ack! Ack chee!

column5:
ウホ！？　おおっ！　こりゃスマン！\n
サル語で　話しておったわい！\n
わしが　神の使い　白サルでござる！
column6:
Oh, sorry! I was speaking Simian!\n
As I was saying, I am the White Monkey, messenger of the divine!

column5:
わしが　石にされている間に\n
大門教のマントーとかいう　バカが\n
サルたちの　ボスになったらしいな
column6: It seems that idiot Manto became the monkey boss while I was sealed inside this boulder.

column5:
サルは　本来　陽気で\n
平和好きな　動物じゃ！\n
人間を　おそうなど　考えられんよ！
column6: Monkeys are cheerful, peace-loving creatures! They'd never attack people normally!

column5:
サルたちが　迷惑をかけた\n
おわびと　いっては　なんだが\n
おまえに　息吹の巻物を　さずけよう！
column6: As a token of apology, I'll bestow upon you the scroll of Ibuki, which contains my divine power!

column5:
息吹の術は　体力を　回復する術\n
大きな　キズでも\n
たちどころに　なおるじゃろう！
column6: The Ibuki jutsu is capable of mending serious wounds in but a few instants!

column5:
ジライアよ！　罪のない　動物を\n
利用する　ヒレツな　大門教の\n
野望をかならずや　くだくのじゃ！！
column6: Ziria! Those despicable Daimonists would even abuse innocent creatures to pursue their goals! You must stop them!

column5: 神獣白サルの　封印を　解き放った\n
column6: You have broken the seal of the divine beast White Monkey.\n

column5: 息吹の巻物を　手に入れた\n
column6: Obtained Scroll of Ibuki.\n

column5:
息吹の術は　体力を　回復する術\n
大きな　キズでも\n
たちどころに　なおるじゃろう！
column6: The Ibuki jutsu is capable of mending serious wounds in but a few instants!

column5:
ジライアよ！　罪のない　動物を\n
利用する　ヒレツな　大門教の\n
野望をかならずや　くだくのじゃ！！
column6: Ziria! Those despicable Daimonists would even abuse innocent creatures to pursue their goals! You must stop them!

column5:
ウキャキャーア！\n
白いサルさま　解放してくれて\n
ありがとう
column6:
Oop chee chee!\n
Thank you for rescuing the White Monkey!

column5:
キャ！　キャ！　キャ！\n
ジライアさん\n
ほんとに　ありがとう
column6:
Ack! Ack! Ack!\n
Thank you so much, Ziria-san!

column5:
ウキャキャキャキャ！　ウキャー！\n
火の勇者さん！\n
がんばってください！
column6:
Oop ack ack ack! Ack chee!\n
Good luck, Fire Hero!

column5: サル酒を　手に入れた\n
column6: Obtained Monkey Booze.\n

column5: ざおう温泉
column6: Zao Hot Spring

column5:
ここが　有名な　ざおう温泉だ！\n
ゆっくり　湯に　つかれば\n
つかれも　ふっとぶよ
column6:
This is the famous Zao Hot Spring!\n
Our thermal bath will melt your fatigue away!

column5:
ちかごろ　サルが　多くてねえ\n
女を　さらうから　あぶなくって
column6: We've had a major monkey problem lately. They're even kidnapping women.

column5: ありがとね
column6: Thank you.

column5:
サルの　ボスが　娘を　さらって\n
神社のほうへ　走って行ったぞ！
column6: I saw the monkey boss kidnap a girl and run towards the shrine!

column5: むすめさんは　ぶじだったかい？
column6: Was the girl all right?

column5:
あたらしくきた　宿屋の\n
カンバン娘は　とっても\n
ビジン　だって　いうぜ！！
column6: I keep hearing about that new poster girl at the hot spring inn.

column5:
これから　顔を\n
おがみに　行くんだ！
column6: I'm going there to see her for myself!

column5:
カンバン娘が\n
いなくなっちゃった\n
グスン！！
column6: Aww, man. That cute poster girl is gone!

column5:
温泉宿の　ビジンの　カンバン娘に\n
背中でも　流してもらって\n
ひとつ　若返ってくるかのう
column6: That lovely poster girl at the hot spring washed my back. I feel ten years younger!

column5:
温泉宿の　ビジンの　カンバン娘は\n
いったい　どこへ\n
いったのかのぉ
column6: I wonder where that lovely poster girl went?

column5:
カンバン娘を　みるために\n
温泉に　入りに　行くとするか・・・・\n
・・・・・・今日だけで　１６回目だ！
column6: I keep visiting the hot spring because they have that cute poster girl...I've already been there sixteen times. Today.

column5:
温泉へ　いく　たのしみが\n
なくなっちゃった
column6: I don't feel like going to the hot spring anymore.

column5:
お・・おれは　みちゃった\n
宿屋の　カンバン　娘には\n
のどぼとけがあるー！！
column6: Nobody wants to believe me, but I saw it...That new poster girl at the hot spring inn has an Adam's apple!
column7: ZenkiTN: because it's Orochimaru in disguise again

column5:
ねぇ　あのマントーってやつ\n
どうして　よりによって\n
サルに　化けたんだろうね？
column6:
You know, I've been wondering.\n
Why did Manto transform into a monkey in the first place?

column5:
湯船には　温泉の湯が　あった\n
その湯を　浴びると　体に\n
力が　わき上がってきた
column6:
The pool is filled with hot spring water.\n
You feel reinvigorated as soon as you enter.

column5: 温泉宿
column6: Hot Spring Inn

column5:
カンバン娘を\n
ひとめ　見ようと思って来たんだけど\n
こう　人が多くちゃあ　話もできない
column6: I wanted to chat with the new poster girl, but you have to get in line just to get a glimpse!

column5:
あんたも　カンバン娘を\n
見に来たのかい？
column6: Are you here to see the poster girl?

column5: カンバン娘は　どこにいるんだろ？
column6: Where's that cute poster girl?

column5:
ここの　カンバン娘は　きれいじゃろ\n
わしが　もうちょっと若ければのぉ・・\n
ウヒ・・ウヒヒヒ・・・
column6:
The new poster girl is lovely!\n
Let me tell you, if I was but a couple years younger...Hee hee hee...

column5:
ブチッ！\n
ウッ！　血管がきれた！！
column6: Agh! M-My blood pressure!
column7: ZenkiTN: the original line is about a "blood vein popping", but I think your blood pressure getting too high is more understandable for Western audiences.

column5:
この温泉は　リウマチに\n
よく　きくんじゃ
column6: These hot springs are the best cure for back pain!

column5:
よっ！　ジライアのアニキ！！\n
さすが　火の勇者！！\n
ウワサには　早いねぇ！
column6: Yo, Ziria! Here to check out the hot springs?

column5:
せっしゃ\n
マントーなる　妖怪変化を\n
成敗しに　まいったのじゃが・・・
column6: I came to Zao to punish the wicked Manto for his evil deeds...

column5:
女のいろけに　つられてしまった\n
せっしゃも　まだまだ　修行がたりんな\n
ワハハハハハ・・・
column6: But I was lured here by that charming young lady. It appears I require more training. Hahaha!

column5:
この村の　男の人たちが\n
あんまり　さわぐんで\n
あたしが　ちょっと　見に来たのよ
column6: The guys have been raising a ruckus about this lady, so I came here to see her for myself.

column5:
だけど　思っていたほどじゃないわね\n
ほんと　さいきんの男は\n
みるめが　ないわね
column6:
You know what? She's nothing special!\n
These men have poor taste in women!

column5:
いやー　こんど　入った\n
カンバン娘のおかげで\n
大ハンジョウですよ！
column6: We're making a killing thanks to that new poster girl!

column5:
笑いが　止まりませんね\n
ワハハハハ・・・\n
　　　ウヒッ・・　ウヒヒッ・・・
column6:
We're literally raking it in!\n
Wahahaha! Hee hee hee!
column7: ZenkiTN: this character laughs like the guy from my previous note. Is this the same character? I thought he was a customer, but this line makes it sound like he's the owner.

column5:
うちの　カンバン娘は\n
大門教の　マントーだかが\n
いなくなったって　きいたとたん
column6: Our poster girl left all of a sudden, right after you beat Manto.

column5:
理由も　いわずに\n
やめて　行って　しまったんだよ
column6: She didn't even give us a reason.

column5: おかげで　この　ありさまだよ
column6: We were doing so well...Sigh.

column5:
あなたは　ジライアさんね\n
ウワサは　きいて　いるわ\n
じつは　サルのボスって　大門教なのよ
column6: Ziria-san, I presume? I've heard an interesting rumor. Apparently, the new monkey boss is a Daimonist.

column5:
なまえは　マントーって　いうの\n
うら山の　神社の　鏡のまえで\n
サル酒を　つかうと　でてくるわ！
column6: His name is Manto. Use monkey alcohol in front of the mirror in the shrine at the back of the village to lure him out!

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　５０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両50 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます\n
お客さま！
column6: Welcome to our inn, dear guest!

column5:
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6: Feel free to come back when you wish to stay!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5:
ここは　温泉やど！！\n
今どき　なんと　タダ！！\n
泊らないとソン！！　泊まる？！
column6:
This is a hot spring inn! It's completely free! You should stay for a while!\n
How about it?

column5: また　おいで！！
column6: Come back!

column5: ごゆっくり！！
column6: Rest well!

column5: 茶店
column6: Tea House

column5:
いらっしゃいませー！\n
ここは　茶店でーす！！\n
ごようは　なあに？
column6:
Welcome to my tea house!\n
How may I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それじゃ　また　きてねー
column6: Come back anytime!

column5:
鏡が　おいてある\n
おや？　鏡の中に\n
サルの怪物と　少女が　写っている
column6:
It's a mirror.\n
Hold on...The reflection shows a monkey monster and a young lady.

column5: 鏡が　おいてある
column6: It's a mirror.

column5: 神社
column6: Shrine

column5:
わたしは　もがみの渡しの\n
船頭の娘　おサエです
column6: My name is Osae. I'm the daughter of Mogami's ferryman.

column5:
やっと　マントーから\n
かいほう　されました
column6: I'm finally free from Manto's clutches!

column5:
ありがとう　ございました\n
これで　もがみへ　帰れます
column6: Thank you so much. Now I can go back to Mogami!

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
うちの　ジジイは\n
温泉宿に　カンバン娘を　見に\n
毎日　通って　おる！
column6: My husband visits the hot spring every day, just to check out the poster girl.

column5:
いい年　こいて　エロジジイが！！\n
若い　オナゴに\n
ウツツを　ぬかしおって！
column6: His lust will be the death of him, I tell you...

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
大門教の　マントーか？\n
この村の　神社に　隠れておるぞ！
column6:
Manto the Daimonist?\n
He's hiding inside the shrine!

column5:
おぬしら　散歩のついでに\n
ちょっと　神社へよって\n
マントーを　たおしてきなされ
column6: Since you're visiting, why don't you go there and beat him up real quick?

column5: 盗人訓練所
column6: Thieving School

column5:
ここは　大門教を　やっつけるために\n
ぬすっとを　養成する\n
通称　ぬすっと訓練所です！！
column6: This is a Thieving School, where you can improve your thievery in order to help defeat the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
奥の　部屋に　入って\n
教官を　よけて\n
つづらの中の　お金を　とるんです！
column6: Head inside, avoid the instructors, and steal the money from the casket!

column5:
みごと　お金を　とることに\n
成功したら\n
そのお金は　あなたのものです！
column6: If you can steal the money successfully, you get to keep it for yourself!

column5:
まあ　遊びだと　おもって\n
気軽に　たのしんでくださいよ！\n
だけど　マサカド打倒も　お忘れなく！
column6:
Think of it as a game and have fun!\n
But don't forget your quest to defeat Masakado!

column5: 盗人訓練所
column6: Thieving School

column5:
ここは　大門教を　やっつけるために\n
ぬすっとを　養成する\n
通称　ぬすっと訓練所です！！
column6: This is a Thieving School, where you can improve your thievery in order to help defeat the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
奥の　部屋に　入って\n
教官を　よけて\n
つづらの中の　お金を　とるんです！
column6: Head inside, avoid the instructors, and steal the money from the casket!

column5:
みごと　お金を　とることに\n
成功したら\n
そのお金は　あなたのものです！
column6: If you can steal the money successfully, you get to keep it for yourself!

column5:
まあ　遊びだと　おもって\n
気軽に　たのしんでくださいよ！\n
だけど　マサカド打倒も　お忘れなく！
column6:
Think of it as a game and have fun!\n
But don't forget your quest to defeat Masakado!

column5: 神社
column6: Shrine

column5:
大門教が　白カメさまを　石に・・・\n
勇者が　話しかければ\n
封印は　とけるのですが
column6: The Cult of Daimon has turned the White Turtle to stone...Only the voice of the hero can break the seal.

column5:
ありがとう　ございました\n
山むこうの　白ツルさまは\n
どうなって　いるのでしょうか
column6:
Thank you so much.\n
I wonder what happened to the White Crane, on the other side of the mountain.

column5: 神社
column6: Shrine

column5:
大門教が　白ツルさまを　石に・・・\n
いったい　どうしたら　よいものか
column6: The Cult of Daimon has turned the White Crane to stone. What are we going to do...?

column5:
ありがとう　ございました\n
・・・山むこうの　白カメさまは\n
どうなって　いるのでしょうか
column6:
Thank you very much.\n
But what about the White Turtle, on the other side of the mountain?

column5: 白亀神社
column6: White Turtle Shrine

column5:
神社の　白カメさまが　石に　なった\n
どうして　かしら　シクシク
column6: Our shrine's White Turtle was turned to stone. Why would they do that? Sob...

column5:
山むこうの　ツル村の　白ツルさまも\n
石に　なったとさ
column6: Even the White Crane from the village on the other side of the mountain was turned to stone.

column5:
つき山の　ミイラが　ふっかつして\n
ウロウロ　していると　きいたが・・・
column6: I heard the mummies of Mount Tsukiyama have been revived, and now they're roaming the lands...

column5:
ここは　カメ村じゃ\n
１００００年の　れきし　ある　村じゃ
column6: This is Turtle Village. We have a long history spanning over 10,000 years.

column5:
おかげで　たすかったぞ　ジライア\n
おれいに　＊＊のまきものを　やろう\n
ワシを　石にした　大門教を　倒すのだ
column6: Thank you, Ziria. Please accept this scroll of **. Make the Cult of Daimon pay for turning me to stone.

column5:
－　ジライアは　＊＊のまきものを\n
　　手にいれた　　　　　　　　　　－
column6: Ziria obtained the Scroll of **.

column5:
大門教を　たおすのだ\n
行け！　ジライア！
column6: Defeat the Cult of Daimon, Ziria!

column5:
大門教が　白ツルさまを\n
石に　しやがった\n
どうすれば　もどるのだろう
column6: The Cult of Daimon turned the sacred White Crane to stone. How can we turn him back?

column5:
山むこうの　白カメ様は　\n
どうなって　いるのでしょう
column6: I wonder what happened to the White Turtle on the other side of the mountain.

column5:
北に　ある　おそれ山には\n
ミコが　いるらしい
column6: There are priestesses on Mount Osore, to the north.

column5:
ミイラが　でるんで\n
おちおち　たびにも　でれんよ
column6: It's hard to travel with all those mummies around.

column5:
ここは　ツル村じゃ\n
１０００年の　れきしある　村じゃ
column6: This is Crane Village. We have a long history, spanning over 10,000 years.

column5:
ありがとう　ジライア\n
この　巻物を　あげましょう\n
大門教から　ジパングを　守るのです
column6: Thank you, Ziria. Please accept this scroll of **. Protect Jipang from the Cult of Daimon.

column5:
－　ジライアは　＊＊の巻物を\n
　　手にいれた　　　　　　　　　　－
column6: Ziria obtained the Scroll of **.

column5:
こまっている　人が　たくさん　います\n
はやく　行きなさい　ジライア
column6:
There are many who need your help.\n
Go forth, Ziria.

column5: 温泉宿
column6: Hot Spring Inn

column5:
ようこそ　おとまりは　＊＊両です\n
よろしいですか？
column6:
Welcome! It's 両** for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
では　宿帳に　きろくいたします\n
どうぞ　ごゆっくり
column6:
I'll register you in the guest book.\n
Have a nice stay.

column5: また　どうぞ
column6: See you soon.

column5:
西の　とさ港からきた　魚うりだ\n
つき山の　ミイラが　魚を\n
くさらせるんだ　クソッ！！
column6: I'm a fishmonger from Tosa Harbor in the west. The mummies from Mount Tsukiyama make the fish go bad!

column5:
つき山の　ミイラが　ふっかつしたのは\n
どうも　大門教の　しわざ　らしいわ
column6: The Cult of Daimon has been raising the mummies of Mount Tsukiyama.

column5: 恐山
column6: Mount Osore

column5:
ここが　有名な　おそれ山だ\n
どんな　ことでも　占ってくれる
column6:
This is the famous Mount Osore.\n
You can have the priestesses read your fortune about anything!

column5:
占って　ほしいんでしょ？\n
占い屋の　オババの　ところへ\n
いけば　いいわ
column6: Do you want to know your future? Then ask the fortune-tellers!

column5:
ここは　占い屋と　温泉宿しか　ない\n
ところだけど　占って　ほしい　人が\n
あつまって　くるんだ
column6: We only have fortune-tellers and hot springs. Luckily, people flock here to have their fortunes told.

column5:
南の　白カメさまと　白ツルさまを\n
大門教が　石にしたってのは\n
ほうとうかい？
column6: I heard that the White Turtle and the White Crane, south from here, have been turned to stone. Is it true?

column5:
西の　橋を　わたって　行くと\n
とさ港　だぜ
column6: If you cross the western bridge and keep walking, you'll reach Tosa Harbor.

column5:
あたる　かもね・・・\n
あたらぬ　かもね・・・\n
占うかえ？
column6: I could be right, or I could be wrong...Should I read your fortune?

column5:
おお！\n
おまえさんの　行く手を\n
外の国の　ミイラが・・・
column6: Ohhh! A foreign mummy blocks the path...

column5:
ううう・・・　ジャマを　しているぞ\n
まず　かんざしじゃ　かんざし！\n
かんざしが　みいらの・・・　ううう
column6:
Ahhh...It stands in your way!\n
You'll need a hairpin! With that hairpin, the mummy can...Ahhh...

column5: ざんねんじゃのう・・・
column6: That's too bad.

column5:
よーく　あたるぞ！　ヒヒヒヒ\n
占うかい？
column6: My predictions are often right, heeheehee! Should I read your fortune?

column5:
うーむ・・・　見えるぞ\n
おまえは　ヘビ族の　勇者を\n
さがして　いるな
column6:
Hmmm...Yes, I see it.\n
You're looking for the hero of the Snake clan.

column5:
ううう・・・　まつことじゃ\n
しんぼうが　かんじんじゃよ！
column6:
Hmmm...You must wait.\n
Patience is a virtue!

column5:
そうか　また　いらっしゃい\n
ヒヒヒヒ・・・・
column6:
I see. That's too bad.\n
Hee hee hee...

column5:
あたるも　はっけ\n
あたらぬも　はっけ・・よいよい\n
へへへ　占うかい？
column6:
My predictions may not always be right, but they're never wrong, hehehe!\n
Should I read your fortune?

column5:
大門教が　つき山の　ぼうさんに\n
ばけて　ミイラを　ふっかつさせ\n
みんなを　くるしめておる
column6: A Daimon Cultist, disguised as a monk, has revived the mummies of Mount Tsukiyama to torment the people.

column5:
うーん・・　ミイラ　ミイラを\n
たおさねば　みんな　\n
くさってしまうぞ　おそろしや
column6: Ohhh...If the mummies aren't stopped, the whole land will start to decay...

column5:
大門教を　たおさねば\n
ジパングは　ほろびてしまう
column6: Unless the Cult of Daimon is stopped, our beautiful Jipang shall perish...

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
ようこそ　おとまりは　＊＊両です\n
よろしいですか？
column6:
Welcome! It's 両** for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
では　宿帳に　きろくいたします\n
どうぞ　ごゆっくり
column6:
I'll register you in the guest book.\n
Have a nice stay.

column5: また　どうぞ
column6: See you soon.

column5:
西の　橋を　わたると　つちざき城だ\n
まちがっても　南の　橋を\n
わたるんじゃあ　ないよ
column6: Cross the bridge to the west and you'll find Tsuchizaki Castle. But don't take the bridge to the south!

column5:
南の　橋を　わたると　めいろじゃ\n
そこには　ミイラが　たくさん\n
でるそうじゃ　近よらんほうが　いい
column6: The bridge to the south leads to a maze teeming with mummies. You should keep your distance.

column5: 武具屋
column6: Armory

column5: いらっしゃい
column6: Welcome.

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: 少しは遊んだほうがいいよ！ボク！
column6: It's okay to stop and relax from time to time!

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5: いらっしゃい
column6: Welcome.

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: 少しは遊んだほうがいいよ！ボク！
column6: It's okay to stop and relax from time to time!

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
あんた　だけに　おしえるが\n
かんざしは　つちざき城の\n
ぼうさんが　もっているのさ
column6:
Let me tell you a secret.\n
The monk from Tsuchizaki Castle has a special hairpin.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
つき山には　３つの　山が　あってのう\n
むかしから　そこに　どくの水が\n
わきでていると　いわれておる
column6: Mount Tsukiyama has three peaks. According to old tales, toxic water would flow down from there.

column5: 十三港
column6: Tosa Harbor

column5:
ここは　とさ港\n
りょう師の　村よ
column6: This is Tosa Harbor, the village of fishermen.

column5:
ミス　とさ港は　村の　アイドルじゃ\n
村の　外に　出すわけには　いかん
column6: Miss Tosa Harbor is our idol. We can't let her go outside the village.

column5:
魚を　とっても　しょうがねえよ\n
みんな　くさっちまうぜ・・・\n
もう　はたらくの　やめた　やめた！！
column6:
Why do I even keep trying?\n
All the fishes are rotten! That's it, I give up!

column5:
あたし　おカヨって　いいます\n
ミス　とさ港なのよ
column6:
My name is Okayo.\n
I'm Miss Tosa Harbor!

column5:
オロチ丸さんから　聞いたけど\n
あなたに　かんざしを　あげたら\n
ミイラを　だいじ　してくれるって
column6: Orochimaru-san told me you'd drive the mummies away if I gave you the hairpin.

column5: ほんとう？
column6: Will you really?

column5:
ミイラが　いなくなれば\n
いつだって　おぼうさんに　あえるのね\n
がんばってね！　ジライアさん！
column6:
Without the mummies, I can see Monk-san whenever I want!\n
Good luck, Ziria-san!

column5: －　かんざしを　えた　－
column6: Obtained Hairpin.

column5:
いやよ！　いや！　いや！　いや！\n
かんざしが　なくちゃ　ミイラを\n
たおせないのよ・・・　おねがい！
column6:
But there's no other way! You can't beat the mummies without the hairpin!\n
Please, do it for us!

column5:
ミス　とさ港の　ところに\n
つちざき城の　ぼうさんが　どきどき\n
会いに　きてるって　うわさだぜ
column6: A monk often comes from Tsuchizaki to see Okayo, this year's Miss Tosa Harbor.

column5:
ミイラは　つき山から\n
でてくるらしいって\n
たびの人から　きいたが・・・
column6: Rumor is, the mummies are coming from Mount Tsukiyama.

column5:
つちざき城には　えらーい\n
とのさまが　いるんですって
column6: I heard the lord of Tsuchizaki Castle is a great man.

column5:
舟が　こんなに　あるのに\n
だれも　魚を　とりに　いかない\n
みんな　ミイラが　わるいんだ！
column6: So many boats, and not a single one sailing. It's all because of those mummies!

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
ようこそ　おとまりは　＊＊両です\n
よろしいですか？
column6:
Welcome! It's 両** for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
では　宿帳に　きろくいたします\n
どうぞ　ごゆっくり
column6:
I'll register you in the guest book.\n
Have a nice stay.

column5: また　どうぞ
column6: See you soon.

column5:
つき山には　ミイラが　たくさんいるし\n
どくの水も　あるから\n
それより　南には　いけないのだ
column6: Between the mummies from Mount Tsukiyama and the toxic waters, it's just impossible to head south right now.

column5:
川ぞいに　南へ　いった　さきの　橋は\n
つき山に　つうじている\n
そこが　南へ　ぬける道　だけど
column6: Follow the river to the south and you'll find a bridge leading to Mount Tsukiyama. That's the only way south, by the way.

column5: 武具屋
column6: Armory

column5: いらっしゃい
column6: Welcome.

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: 少しは遊んだほうがいいよ！ボク！
column6: It's okay to stop and relax from time to time!

column5: 武具屋
column6: Armory

column5: いらっしゃい
column6: Welcome.

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: 少しは遊んだほうがいいよ！ボク！
column6: It's okay to stop and relax from time to time!

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5: いらっしゃい
column6: Welcome.

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: 少しは遊んだほうがいいよ！ボク！
column6: It's okay to stop and relax from time to time!

column5: 預かり所
column6: Warehouse

column5: いらっしゃい
column6: Welcome.

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: 少しは遊んだほうがいいよ！ボク！
column6: It's okay to stop and relax from time to time!

column5:
赤地の　黄色い文字で\n
「大」と　しるされた　大きな石がある
column6: There is a large red stone marked with a yellow 大 symbol.

column5: なにもありませんでした
column6: You find nothing.

column5: 信濃国
column6: Shinano

column5:
ホーホー！　ね・・・ねむい！！\n
わしゃ　神の使い　白フクロウじゃ！\n
わしゃ　夜行性動物なんじゃぞ！
column6:
Hoot-hoot! So...So sleepy...\n
I am the White Owl, messenger of the divine!

column5:
昼間は　ねむくて　かなわんわい！\n
グウグウグウ・・・・・・・・・
column6:
You see, I'm a nocturnal creature.\n
I usually sleep during the day!\n
...Zzz...

column5:
ジライアよ！\n
グウグウグウ・・・・
column6:
Ziria, listen!\n
...Zzz...

column5:
ジライアよ！\n
グウグウグウ・・・・\n
グウグウグウ・・・・
column6:
As I was saying, listen!\n
...Zzz...\n
...Zzz...

column5:
わしゃ　なにを　話してたんだっけ！？\n
グウグウ・・・
column6:
Err, what was I talking about again?\n
...Zzz...

column5:
グウグウグ・・・・\n
グウグウグ・・・・\n
グウグウグ・・・・

グウグウグ・・・・\n
グウグウグ・・・・\n
グウグウグ・・・・

おおっ！　わしゃ　今\n
エッチな　夢をみたぞ！\n
ホーホー！　ホッホー！
column6:
Ohhh, I was having a dirty dream!\n
Hoot-hoot! Hoot-hoot!

column5:
夢の続きを　みるために\n
わしゃ　また　ねるぞ！！\n
おおっ！　そうじゃ　ジライア！
column6:
I just HAVE to go back to sleep now!\n
Ah yes, before I forget!

column5:
おまえに　わしの\n
神通力をしるした　淡雲の巻物を\n
さずけねば　ならんのう
column6: I'll bestow upon you the scroll of Awagumo, which contains my divine power.

column5:
淡雲の術は　全ての敵を\n
うすい雲で　包み　幻を見せて\n
目を　くらます術じゃ！
column6: The Awagumo jutsu will wrap all of your enemies in a thin fog that will show them illusions, blocking their sight!

column5:
ジライアよ！　おまえの　けんとうを\n
祈っておるぞ！　それじゃ　わしは\n
また　ねる！　ムニャムニャ
column6:
I'll pray for your victory, Ziria.\n
And now, back to sleep!\n
...Zzz...

column5: 神獣白フクロウの　封印を　解き放った
column6: You have broken the seal of the divine beast White Owl.

column5: 淡雲の巻物を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Scroll of Awagumo.

column5:
淡雲の術は　全ての　敵を\n
うすい雲で　包み　幻を見せて\n
目を　くらます術じゃ！
column6: The Awagumo jutsu will wrap all of your enemies in a thin fog that will show them illusions, blocking their sight!

column5:
ジライアよ！　おまえの　けんとうを\n
祈っておるぞ！　それじゃ　わしは\n
また　ねる！　ムニャムニャ
column6:
I'll pray for your victory, Ziria.\n
And now, back to sleep!\n
...Zzz...

column5:
キャーッ！　ナメクジの　神さまに\n
あえたなんて　夢みたい！！\n
サイン　もらっとけば　よかったなあ！
column6: Eeek! I can't believe I met THE Divine Slug! That was SO COOL! Aww man, I shoulda asked for an autograph!

column5: 船つき場
column6: Harbor

column5:
ここは　しなの国\n
舟で渡れば　むつ国だ
column6:
This is Shinano.\n
Cross the river and you'll be in Mutsu.

column5:
こまった人を　助ける\n
雲切の里が\n
ここの西にあるぜ
column6:
The people of Kumogiri Hamlet are always ready to help those in need.\n
It's just west from here.

column5:
船頭の　はなしじゃ\n
娘が　助けられたのを\n
カンバン娘から　きいたそうな
column6: You rescued the daughter of the ferryman, right? I heard from a traveling poster girl.

column5: 茶店
column6: Tea House

column5:
いらっしゃいませー！\n
ここは　茶店でーす！！\n
ごようは　なあに？
column6:
Welcome to my tea house!\n
How may I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それじゃ　また　きてねー
column6: Come back anytime!

column5:
３００年前　しなの国を　まとめ\n
人々の　平和を　おつくりになった\n
とても　いだいな　トノさま・・・
column6:
There was a great lord who brought peace to Shinano 300 years ago...\n
Shingen-sama.

column5:
あの信玄さまが　松本城に\n
また　トノさまとして　復活したの！\n
信じられないけど　ホントよ！！
column6: And now, that great lord has come back to life! Shingen-sama is again the lord of Matsumoto Castle! I'm serious!

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
しなの国には　マサカドを封じた\n
聖なる玉の　ひとつ\n
ナメクジ玉が　あるらしいのです
column6: The Slug Orb, one of the sacred items used to seal Masakado, should be hidden somewhere here in Shinano.

column5:
こないだ　ベッピンさんが　泊まってな\n
これから　かみこうち村さ　行って\n
宿屋で　はたらくって　いうとったぞ
column6: A charming lady stopped by some time ago. She said she was going to work at Kamikouchi Village's inn.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　２５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両25 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　２５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両25 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 雲切の里１０
column6: Kumogiri Hamlet 10

column5:
てぇへんだ　てぇへんだ！\n
信じられねえことが　起こったぜ！\n
信玄公が　生き返っちまった！！
column6:
Listen! Something incredible happened!\n
Lord Shingen came back to life!

column5:
何百年も　むかしの　トノさんが\n
今さら　生きけえるなんて\n
おかしいじゃねえか！！！
column6:
There's no way a lord from hundreds of years ago can just come back.\n
Something's definitely up!

column5:
ジライアさま！\n
どうも　復活した　信玄さまは\n
大門教と　つながっている　ようですぜ
column6: Ziria-sama! It seems the Cult of Daimon is somehow connected to Shigen-sama's return.

column5:
やはり　ニセものでしたか\n
大門教は　なんて汚いマネを\n
しやがるんだ
column6: So he was an impostor...This is low, even for the Cult of Daimon.

column5:
南に　三つの岩に　囲まれた\n
とがくし神社が　ありますじゃ
column6: Togakushi Shrine, to the south, is surrounded by three hills.

column5:
その神社こそが　ナメクジ族ゆかりの\n
神の使い　白ナメクジさまを\n
まつっておる　ところで　ごぜえます
column6: That is where you'll find the sacred White Slug. As you can imagine, he has a strong connection to the Slug clan.

column5:
しなの国で　信玄さま　ちゃあー\n
神さんと　おんなじくれえ\n
たいせつな　おかたじゃ
column6: Shingen-sama is almost like a god for the people of these lands.

column5:
３００年くれえ　むかしのことじゃ\n
まだ　どの村も\n
まずしかったころ
column6: Shinano used to be a very poor country, back 300 years ago.

column5:
信玄さまさ　川の水を　ひいて\n
田畑を　つぐって　村々を\n
とても　ゆたかに　してくれただ
column6: Then, Shingen-sama revolutionized agriculture with his waterworks and connected rice fields.

column5:
そんで　いくさのねえ\n
平和な　しなの国さ　\n
つぐってくれただ！
column6: He brought peace and prosperity without shedding a single drop of blood!

column5:
んだから　しなの国の衆は\n
信玄さまと　きいただけで\n
手を合わせて　しまうだ
column6: You can understand why his name alone is enough to convince the people of Shinano to follow him.

column5:
ごぞんじの通り　火の勇者は\n
３人　そろわなければ\n
マサカドには　立ち向かえないのです！
column6: As you know, the three Fire Heroes must join forces to stand a chance against Masakado.

column5:
さいごの　おひとりは\n
ヘビ族の　オロチ丸さまと\n
うかがって　います
column6: The last hero is Orochimaru of the Snake clan.

column5:
ツナデさまが\n
お持ちになるべき　ナメクジ玉は\n
白ナメクジさまの　ところに　あるはず
column6: The Slug Orb, meant for Tsunade-sama, should be in the care of the sacred White Slug.

column5:
あそこにも　大門教の　魔の手が\n
のびていないとも　限りません\n
とがくし神社に　お急ぎください！
column6: The Cult of Daimon will surely make its move...You must hurry to Togakushi Shrine!

column5:
かみこうち村じゃあ\n
どえれぇ　つえぇ　風が　ふいてきて\n
家が　なんげんも　飛ばされたそうな！
column6: The winds of Kamikouchi Village are sometimes so strong that even the buildings get blown away!

column5:
赤地の　黄色い文字で\n
「大」と　しるされた　大きな石がある
column6: There is a large red stone marked with a yellow 大 symbol.

column5: なにもありませんでした
column6: You find nothing.

column5: とがくし神社
column6: Togakushi Shrine

column5:
あたし　遠くから　来たのよ！\n
それも　歩いて　来たのよ\n
お金も　たくさん　かかったのよ
column6: I came from very far away. Do you have any idea how far I had to walk? How much I had to spend to come all the way here?!

column5:
なのに　白ナメクジさまったら\n
勝手に　石なんかに　なっちゃって\n
ジライアさん　早く　戻してよ！
column6: And the White Slug got himself turned to stone! Ziria-san, please break that curse before I lose my mind!

column5:
東の　かみこうち村を\n
とんでもない　突風が　おそって\n
飛ばされた家まで　あるらしいよ
column6:
Kamikouchi Village is to the east.\n
Apparently, the wind over there is so strong that even houses are blown away.

column5:
白ナメクジさまを\n
大門教が　石にしてしまった！\n
なんて　ひどいことを　するんだ！！
column6: The Cult of Daimon turned our beloved White Slug to stone! How dare they?!

column5:
よろこんでくれ！　白ナメクジさまが\n
もとに　もどったんだ！
column6: Great news! Our beloved White Slug has been freed from that curse!

column5:
信玄さまが　ふっかつしただと！！\n
おかしいぜ！！　死んだ　やつが　\n
生きかえるかよ！　バカくせえェ
column6:
What? Shingen-sama is back?\n
There's no way! The dead can't come back! This has {scam} written all over it!

column5:
大門教の　やつらは\n
白ナメクジさまを　石にして\n
おまけに　なにか　ぬすんだらしいのよ
column6: On top of turning the sacred White Slug to stone, those Daimonists also stole something.

column5:
ジパングの宝　ナメクジ玉が\n
大門教の手に　渡ってしまった！\n
もう　ダメじゃ！
column6:
The Cult of Daimon stole the Slug Orb, one of Jipang's holy treasures!\n
W-We're done for!!

column5:
この神社の　南の森は\n
白フクロウさまの\n
おウチなのに
column6: The sacred White Owl lives in the shrine in the southern forest.

column5:
このごろ　ホーホーという\n
お声が　きこえて　来ないよー\n
どうしたのかな？　さびしいな
column6: He's usually hoot-hooting, but he hasn't been doing that lately. Is something wrong with him? I miss his hoot-hoots.

column5:
白フクロウさまを\n
助けてくれたんだね\n
ありがとー
column6: Thank you so much for rescuing the White Owl!

column5:
ヌメヌメ！　ぷはー　新鮮な空気は\n
お肌に　うるおいを　与えるわい！\n
わしは　神獣　白ナメクジじゃ！
column6: Slurp slurp! Finally, some sweet moisture on my skin! I am the White Slug, messenger of the divine!

column5:
ジパングに　巣食う　魔物どもを\n
封印するのが　わしの使命なのじゃが\n
大門教に　逆に　封印されてしまった！
column6: My duty is to seal away the demons that haunt Jipang, but I ended up being sealed away myself!

column5:
いやはや　めんぼくない！\n
じゃが　それだけ\n
大門教の力が　強かったのじゃ！
column6:
A shameful display, I must admit...\n
It goes to show just how dangerous the Cult of Daimon is.

column5:
大門教は　われら　神獣を　石に変え\n
マサカドの霊力を　封じる\n
ナメクジ玉を　ぬすみよった
column6: While I was turned to stone, they took away the Slug Orb, one of the sacred items used to seal Masakado's spirit.

column5:
止め金の　はずれた　マサカドは\n
今ごろ　地の底で\n
うごめいておるに　ちがいない！
column6: They have removed one of the chains binding him. Masakado must be starting to stir as we speak!

column5:
勇者よ　はよ　玉を　取り戻すのじゃ！\n
ジライアに　星寝の巻物を\n
ツナデに　力のオノを　さずけるぞ
column6: You must reclaim the sacred orb at once! I'll bestow upon Ziria the scroll of Hoshine, and give Tsunade the Power Axe.

column5:
星寝の術は　満天の星を\n
暗雲が　おおい隠すが　ごとく\n
すべての　敵を　眠らせる術じゃ！
column6: The Hoshine jutsu will lull all your enemies into a slumber, just as the stars in the sky close their eyes on a cloudy night!

column5:
マサカドを　封じられるのは\n
神の力の　宿った　三つの玉だけじゃ！\n
なによりも　まず　玉を　そろえよ！
column6:
Only the divine power dwelling within the three sacred orbs can seal Masakado!\n
You must gather them without fail!

column5:
わしの一族の　末えいの　ツナデよ！\n
おまえは　ドジで　アホで　マヌケだが\n
しっかり　がんばるのじゃよ！！
column6: Tsunade, my descendant! You may be a clumsy airhead without a lick of sense, but I have faith in you! Good luck!

column5: 神獣白ナメクジの　封印を　解き放った
column6: You have broken the seal of the divine beast White Slug.

column5: 星寝の巻物を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Scroll of Hoshine.

column5: 力のオノを　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Power Axe.

column5:
星寝の術は　満天の星を\n
暗雲が　おおい隠すが　ごとく\n
すべての　敵を　眠らせる術じゃ！
column6: The Hoshine jutsu will lull all your enemies into a slumber, just as the stars in the sky close their eyes on a cloudy night!

column5:
マサカドを　封じられるのは\n
神の力の　宿った　三つの玉だけじゃ！
column6: Only the divine power dwelling within the three sacred orbs can seal Masakado!

column5:
ジライアさま\n
大門教を　必ず\n
やっつけてくださいね
column6: Ziria-sama, please defeat the Cult of Daimon!

column5: 神社
column6: Shrine

column5:
おお！　やっと　来てくれましたね！\n
お願いします！\n
火の一族の　勇者どの！！
column6: Oooh! You're finally here, hero of the Fire Clan!

column5:
白ナメクジさまを\n
もとの　お姿に\n
戻してください！！
column6: Please, rescue our sacred White Slug!

column5:
ありがとう　ございました！\n
これからも　ジパングのために\n
がんばってください！
column6: Thank you so much! Please, keep fighting for the sake of our beautiful Jipang!

column5: かみこうち村
column6: Kamikouchi Village

column5:
この　かみこうち村に\n
おそろしゅう強い　風ば　吹きあれて\n
たくさんの家が　こわれちまっただ
column6: Our village is plagued by terrible winds that blow the buildings away.

column5:
やっとこさ　ざんがいの\n
かたづけば　終わらせたとこだべ
column6: We just finished cleaning up the most recent damage.

column5:
東さ　行きゃあ\n
白ウシさまの　長野村が　ありますだ\n
えらい　ごりやくが　あるだ！
column6:
Go east and you'll be in Nagano Village, where the sacred White Ox lives.\n
You should go and get your blessing!

column5:
新しく来た　宿屋の　カンバン娘は\n
すんごく　かわいいだす\n
あんたも　行けばいいだす！
column6:
There's a new poster girl at the inn...\n
She's so cute! Go see her for yourself!

column5:
宿屋の　新しい　カンバン娘は\n
ときどき　男みたいに　話すのじゃ\n
それも　また　魅力でござる！
column6:
The new poster girl at the inn talks like a man from time to time.\n
I think it's part of her charm!

column5:
復活した　信玄さまの　タカは　\n
ウシを　ひとのみに　するらしいわ\n
おそろしい！！
column6:
I heard Shingen-sama's hawk can swallow an entire cow in a single gulp!\n
Th-There's no way, right?!

column5:
信玄さまが　復活したと\n
ウソじゃ！　ウソ！　ウソ！\n
死んだもんが　生き返るわけないわ！
column6:
Shingen-sama is back?\n
That's a load of bull!\n
The dead can't come back!

column5:
ジライアさん！\n
大門教を　必ず　倒してくださいね
column6: Please take down the Cult of Daimon, Ziria-san!

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
いらっしゃいませー！\n
あたしは　宿屋の　カンバン娘\n
そんなに　ジロジロ　見ないでよ！
column6:
Welcome! I'm the inn's poster girl.\n
Hey now, don't stare at me like that!

column5:
あんた　強そうね・・・　そうだ！\n
松本城の　おそろしい　ヌエを\n
やっつけて　くれる？
column6:
You know, you look pretty strong.\n
Would you take care of that scary Nue inside Matsumoto Castle?

column5:
そんなに　ジロジロ　見ないでよ！\n
松本城の　おそろしい　ヌエを\n
やっつけてよ　早く！
column6:
Don't stare at me like that!\n
Please hurry up and take down that horrible Nue inside Matsumoto Castle!

column5:
じゃあ　これをあげるわ！\n
ヌエを　やっつける\n
ヘビの弓矢よ！　ジライアさん
column6:
Then you can have this, Ziria-san!\n
This is the Snake Bow, a weapon capable of killing a Nue.

column5: ヘビの弓矢を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Snake Bow.

column5: ヘビの弓矢を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Snake Bow.

column5:
なーんだ　勇気が　ないのね！\n
そんなんじゃ　オロチ丸さんは\n
仲間に　ならないわよ！
column6:
Oh my! You're quite the coward.\n
I don't think Orochimaru-san is going to join you like this!

column5:
長野村も　大門教に\n
やられた　そうじゃないか\n
おちおち　旅にも　出れねえぜ！
column6: Those Daimonists got to Nagano Village, too. Can't even go on a trip now!

column5:
ジライアさん！！\n
江戸のショーグンさまが　大門教の\n
とうばつに　立ち上がったそうですぞ！
column6: Ziria-san! I heard the Shogun of Edo is raising an army to fight the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
やはり　ショーグンさまは\n
かしこい　おかた！！\n
大門教の　悪事に　お気づきなさった
column6: That's the Shogun for you! He's not gonna stand for those evil Daimonists!

column5:
これで　このジパングも\n
もう　大丈夫！！　ジライアさんも\n
かたの荷が　おりましたな　ハハハハ
column6: Jipang is all but saved! That's one major load off your shoulders, right, Ziria-san? Hahahaha!

column5:
お・・・おれは　見ちまった！！\n
ここの宿屋の　カンバン娘には\n
す・・すねげが　はえているー！
column6:
I...I saw it!\n
That new poster girl's legs...\n
...are covered in hair!

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　５０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両50 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　５０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両50 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
と・・・とにかく　すごい　タカ！\n
もう・・・ビックリギョウテン！！\n
あれは　バケモノです！！
column6:
That hawk was terrifying!\n
It was a monster, I tell you!

column5:
信玄さまの　タカに　家を\n
ふきとばされちまった\n
ありゃあ　タカじゃねえ！！
column6: Shingen-sama's hawk blew away a house with its wings...That is no normal bird!

column5:
タカを　たいじしてくれたので\n
もう　家をとばされる\n
心配が　なくなりました
column6: Now that the hawk is gone, we won't have to live in fear of losing our house.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
この　しなの国の　いいつたえ　では\n
ヌエっちゅう　バケモンは\n
ヘビの弓矢に　よわいと　いう
column6: There is an ancient tale handed down in Shinano about the Snake Bow, a weapon lethal to creatures known as Nue.

column5: 武具屋
column6: Armory

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　武具屋です\n
ご用件は　何ですか？
column6:
Welcome to my armory!\n
How can I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それでは　また　ご利用ください
column6: Come back anytime.

column5:
赤地の　黄色い文字で\n
「大」と　しるされた　大きな石がある
column6: There is a large red stone marked with a yellow 大 symbol.

column5: なにもありませんでした
column6: You find nothing.

column5: 長野村
column6: Nagano Village

column5:
白ウシさまが　石に　されて\n
この　長野村も\n
滅びるのを　待つばかりです
column6: Our sacred White Ox has been turned to stone. This is the end of Nagano Village...

column5: ありがとうございました
column6: You have our gratitude.

column5:
大きい　こえじゃ　いえねえが\n
ジライアって　やつがよ　大門教を\n
やっつけるってさ　うれしいね
column6:
Don't tell anyone...\n
I heard a guy called Ziria is fighting the Cult of Daimon. Isn't that awesome?

column5:
そこの石段を\n
上がって　行くと\n
ぜんこう寺って　いう寺が　あるよ
column6: Go up the stone steps and you'll find a temple called Zenkou-ji.

column5:
でも　白ウシさまが\n
石に　封印されて　しまったから\n
ごりやくは　保証できないよ
column6: But I'm not sure they'll give you a blessing now that the sacred White Ox has been sealed...

column5:
南の　松本の町に　帰りたいが\n
あそこは　大門教徒ばかりで\n
ふつうの者には　住みにくい！
column6: I wish I could go south and return to Matsumoto Town, but the whole place is full of Daimonists now!

column5:
松本の町の　人々も\n
改心したでしょう
column6: The people of Matsumoto Town are back to normal.

column5:
こっちじゃねえ！　茶店のウラ路を\n
上がって行かないと　白ウシさまが\n
封印された　石へは　行けねえよ！
column6: No, not here! Take the path behind the tea house! That's where our beloved White Ox has been sealed!

column5:
白ウシさまを　お救いくださり\n
ありがとうございました
column6: Thank you for saving our beloved White Ox.

column5:
火の一族というのは\n
それぞれが　武器の　使い手として\n
よく　知られておる
column6: It is common knowledge that the three tribes of the Fire Clan are experts in different weapons.

column5:
ガマ族は剣　ナメクジ族はオノ！\n
そして　ヘビ族は\n
弓の使い手として　有名なのじゃ！
column6: The Toad clan uses swords, the Slug clan uses axes, and the Snake clan uses bows!

column5:
よばれて　とびでて\n
ウモモモモー！\n
オラが　神の使いの　白ウシだべさ
column6:
Moooo! Just holler, an'...Presto-bammo!\n
Ah'm the White Ox, messenger o' the divine!
column7: ZenkiTN: I think the White Ox speaks in Koushuu-ben (and this is my first time seeing this accent). I think the connection is that Koshu is famous for its beef. The よばれてとびでて part should be a reference to an old anime called Hakushon Daimaoh ("The Genie Family" in the west). When you yawn, Akubi-chan is summoned and she says that line. It doesn't really work with how I'm writing him, but I reckon I'd mention it.

column5:
こないだは　火の勇者が\n
おらんかったと　大門教に　負けて\n
石さ　閉じ込められちまったがよ
column6: 'Bout a day or ten ago, them Daimonists came 'round 'n' sealed me up tight inside this here rock.
column7: ZenkiTN: I'm not very good at this, but I think the right idea is write the White Ox like a cowboy (it's a male cow, after all). He does have an accent in the first place.

column5:
こんどは　おまんら勇者が　おるけん\n
南蛮渡来の　魔術なんぞ\n
いちもうだじん　だっぺやあ！
column6: Ah'm mighty pleased y'all're here t' rustle 'em up 'n' send 'em packin'!

column5:
オラも　おまんらと　いっしょに\n
戦いたいやが　長野村を\n
守らにゃならんけん　動けんくさ！
column6: Ah'd love t' throw down with 'em varmints with y'all, but Ah gotta keep Nagano Village outta harm's way!

column5:
せめて　オラの　ずん通力を\n
しるした　春光の巻物を\n
さずけるだっぺやあ！
column6: Ah reckon what Ah'm fixin' t' give ya oughter help, though: this here scroll o' Shunkou holdin' mah divine power!

column5:
春光の術さ　春の光を　敵の一人に\n
あびせて　わるい力を　弱め\n
敵の　攻撃力を　下げるっぺや
column6: The Shunkou jutsu douses a lone varmint with the light o' spring, makin' their attacks as feeble as a newborn calf.

column5:
オラたつ　神獣は\n
みんな　おまえの　みかたくさ\n
行くずら　ジライア！
column6:
Us divine beasts are rootin' for ya.\n
So saddle up 'n' ride on, young Ziria!

column5: 神獣白ウシの　封印を　解き放った
column6: You have broken the seal of the divine beast White Ox.

column5: 春光の巻物を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Scroll of Shunkou.

column5:
春光の術さ　春の光を　敵の一人に\n
あびせて　わるい力を　弱め\n
敵の　攻撃力を　下げるっぺや
column6: The Shunkou jutsu douses a lone varmint with the light o' spring, makin' their attacks as feeble as a newborn calf.

column5:
オラたつ　神獣は\n
みんな　おまえの　みかたくさ\n
行くずら　ジライア！
column6:
Us divine beasts are rootin' for ya.\n
So saddle up 'n' ride on, young Ziria!

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

ニセモノだって　ウワサだぜ\n
また　大門教かねぇ
column6:
Rumor is the Shingen-sama in Matsumoto Castle is an impostor.\n
The Cult of Daimon is at it again, huh?

column5:
信玄さまは　ナメクジ玉って\n
たいそうな宝を　\n
手に入れたらしいよ
column6: Shingen-sama recently found an amazing treasure. It's called the {Slug Orb.}

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　５０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両50 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　５０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両50 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: 茶店
column6: Tea House

column5:
いらっしゃいませー！\n
ここは　茶店でーす！！\n
ごようは　なあに？
column6:
Welcome to my tea house!\n
How may I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それじゃ　また　きてねー
column6: Come back anytime!

column5:
白ウシさまが　いらっしゃるのは\n
このうらよ
column6: Follow the path behind our store and you'll find the sacred White Ox.

column5: 寺
column6: Temple

column5:
火の勇者　ジライアさまだべ？\n
長野村の　守り神　白ウシさまがよ\n
大門教に　石に　されただっぺやあ！
column6:
You must be Ziria-sama, the Fire Hero!\n
The sacred White Ox, guardian of Nagano, has been turned to stone!
column7: ZenkiTN: I should mention that the priest here also speaks in Koushuu-ben like the White Ox. I don't think I should give him a cowboy accent though.

column5:
あの封印を　解ぐこと　できるんは\n
おめえさま　ただ　ひとり　だっぺ\n
白ウシさまさ　お救いくだせえまし！！
column6: Only the Fire Clan can break the curse. Please, you must rescue our beloved White Ox!

column5:
ありがとう　ごぜえますだ\n
ジライアさま\n
こんで　長野村も　救うわれただっぺ！
column6:
Thank you so much, Ziria-sama.\n
You've saved our village!

column5: うひょひょひょひょ・・・
column6: Hyo hyo hyo...
column7:
ZenkiTN: what triggers this line anyway? Unless a new character pops out after you finish this part of the game, the priest is alone inside the temple
Supper: talk to the guy with ($2711 & 0x08) nonzero, and also ($2711 & 0x20) nonzero. what does that mean? don't ask me. the former is set by something on map 0x3A9D, and the latter on map 0x4ACD (note that map 0x4ACD is unused and the flag's meaning may have changed since that map was made). so basically, it's probably unused unless there's a special hardcoded cheat for it, and i'm not quite that invested in this.

column5: 松本町
column6: Matsumoto Town

column5:
大門教の　おかげで　この　松本城に\n
信玄さまが　復活なされた！\n
こんなに　めでたいことは　ない！
column6: Thanks to the Cult of Daimon, Shingen-sama has returned to Matsumoto Castle! We couldn't be happier!

column5:
火の一族のものだな！\n
信玄さまが　首を　長くして\n
待っておられるぞ！
column6:
Ah, a descendant of the Fire Clan!\n
Shingen-sama is eager to meet you!

column5:
信玄さまは　ナメクジ玉を　使って\n
大悪人　ジライアを\n
おびき　よせるんですって　サスガ！！
column6: Shingen-sama is using the Slug Orb to lure the evil Ziria into a trap. How ingenious!

column5:
わたし　大門教に\n
だまされて　いたんだわ
column6: I can't believe I fell for the Daimonists' lies...

column5:
信玄さまの　タカは\n
ものすっごい　力を　もった\n
大門教の　守り神さ！
column6: Shingen-sama's hawk is the strongest! That's why it's the guardian of the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
なんか　夢を　見てたようだ\n
また　はたらくぞ！
column6: I feel like I just woke up from a long sleep. Well, back to work!

column5:
この国の　南にある　こうふ城には\n
信玄さまの　血を引くとは\n
思えないような　オロカな子孫が　おる
column6: The lord of Koufu Castle to the south is a descendant of Shingen-sama.

column5:
名前を　グロヌシというが\n
ナマイキにも\n
信玄さまに　たてついておるわ！
column6: But you'd never believe that foolish Guronushi is related to him! How dare he oppose his venerable ancestor?!

column5:
大門教に　だまされておった！\n
グロヌシさまに　がんばって\n
いただかねば　のう！
column6:
The Cult of Daimon lied to me!\n
I wholeheartedly support Guronushi-sama!

column5:
信玄さまに　大悪人　ジライアを\n
やっつけて　いただかねば！\n
ジライアって　どんな　やつだろう
column6:
Ziria? Of course I know him!\n
He's the villain that Shingen-sama will save us from!
column7: ZenkiTN: the original line was more along the lines of "Soon, Shingen-sama will bring down Ziria, the greatest villain of our times! ...I wonder who Ziria is.", but after translating the next line I had an idea for this gag about the line being similar

column5:
ジライアって　勇者が\n
この町を　ニセ信玄から\n
すくって　くれたんだぜ！
column6:
Ziria? Of course I know him!\n
He's the hero who saved us from that false Shingen!

column5:
信玄さまが　グロヌシを　やっつけて\n
はやく　この国を\n
統一すれば　いいのよ！！
column6: Shingen-sama should just kill Guronushi and unite the land!

column5:
あたしが　バカだったわ\n
大門教を　信じるなんて・・・
column6: I was so stupid...How could I ever believe the Cult of Daimon?

column5:
大門教徒以外のものは\n
これよりさき\n
行かすわけには　いかぬ！！
column6: Only loyal Daimon acolytes may pass!

column5:
信玄さまが　よみがえったそうな！！\n
シンゲン　あけまして　おめでとう！
column6:
Shingen-sama came back to life!\n
Let's all wish him a happy rebirthday!
column7: ZenkiTN: the original joke is about the similarity between "Shinnen akemashite omedetou" (Happy new year) and Shingen. I figured I'd go for a birthday/rebirth pun

column5:
身のほど知らずの　ショーグンが\n
わしら　大門教に\n
はむかって　いるそうじゃ！
column6: The Shogun thinks he can stand against the Cult of Daimon. What a fool!

column5:
じゃが　マサカドさまの\n
めざめも　近いことじゃから\n
大門教は　大丈夫じゃ！！
column6: Masakado-sama will soon come back to life. Then the Shogun will realize the error of his ways!

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

町中　大門教徒ばかりでよ\n
毎日のように　勧誘に　くるんだ！

This town is going to the dogs.\n
There's Daimonists everywhere.\n
They keep trying to convert me!

南門の番兵を　どけてくれぃ！

column5:
ありがとう！\n
これで　やっと\n
上すわ村へ　行けます
column6:
Thank you!\n
Now I can go to North Suwa Village!

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます

おとまりになりますか？

お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！

Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください

column5: また　おこしください

いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま

いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません

Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column6: Armory

いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　武具屋です\n
ご用件は　何ですか？

Welcome to my armory!\n
How can I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それでは　また　ご利用ください
column6: Come back anytime.

column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column6: Warehouse

column6: Daimon Church

column5:
大門教会に　入会すれば\n
みんな　不老不死に　なれる！！\n
これこそが　理想郷だ！！
column6: Once you join the Cult of Daimon, you'll live forever! This is the real utopia!

column5:
大門教は　正義で　ある！\n
なにも　かんがえないで\n
ただ　信じれば　よろしい！
column6:
The Cult of Daimon is always right!\n
No need to think! Just trust them!

column5:
大悪人の　ジライアを　やっつけろ！！\n
こうふ城の　グロヌシも　悪い！！\n
大門教だけを　信じなさい！！
column6:
Death to Ziria, the great villain!\n
Take down Guronushi, the evil lord!\n
Believe in the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
不老不死は　大門教！\n
みんなの　みかた　大門教！\n
あなたの　しあわせ　大門教！
column6:
The Cult of Daimon brings immortality!\n
The Cult of Daimon is your friend!\n
The Cult of Daimon makes you happy!

column5:
ジライアさんですね！\n
わたしは　雲切の里の者です\n
いま　大門教徒に化けて　潜入中です
column6:
You must be Ziria-san!\n
I'm from Kumogiri Hamlet.\n
I'm undercover, disguised as an acolyte.

column5:
いまのところ　情報は　ありません\n
オーエンだけでも\n
させてください
column6:
Unfortunately, I don't have any intel.\n
The only thing I can do is cheer for you.

column5:
こんなところですから\n
大きな声を　出せないんで\n
小さな声で　いいます
column6: But I'll have to be quiet, or they'll catch me. Ahem...

column5:
ぇぃ　ぇぃ　ぉぅ　ぇぃ　ぇぃ　ぉぅ\n
えい・・・おっと　あぶない\n
がんばってください　ジライアさん！
column6:
Z, i, r-i-a...Go, Ziria!\n
Whoops. I almost got carried away.\n
Anyway, good luck!

column5:
やつた　やつた　ジライアさん\n
こんどは　大きな声で\n
オーエンします
column6:
You did it, Ziria-san!\n
Now I don't have to be quiet!

column5:
しようりに　向かつて\n
かつせ　かつせ　ジライア！\n
つい　いらんとこまで　力が入った！
column6:
Ziria, Ziria, GO! Ziria, Ziria, GO!\n
Z, I, R-I-A! GOOO...ZIRIAAA!\n
Hahaha, this feels great!
column7: ZenkiTN: for reference, this isn't a woman. I do think he's doing sports cheer, like you'd do in a stadium, but making him do a cheerleader song seemed funnier (and easier for me to come up with)

column5: 松本城
column6: Matsumoto Castle

column5: 松本城
column6: Matsumoto Castle

column5: 松本城
column6: Matsumoto Castle

column5:
ここまで　やってきたか\n
ジライア！
column6: Congratulations are in order, Ziria!

column5:
わしが　信玄に　化けていた\n
大門教１３人衆の　６番手　\n
ドーマンじゃ！
column6: As you may have guessed, I am not the real Shingen. I am Douman, the sixth of the Thirteen Daimon Cultists!

column5:
おまえの旅は　ここで　終わりじゃ\n
ジ・エンド！\n
わしのタカに　かわいがってもらえ！
column6:
This is the end of your journey.\n
Go on, play with my cute little bird!

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
大門教は　ええぞ！\n
年寄りには　不老不死が　なによりじゃ\n
さすがは　信玄さまじゃ！
column6:
The Cult of Daimon is the best!\n
Shingen-sama has promised us immortality!

column5:
あんたらも　若いうちに\n
大門教に　入って\n
永遠の青春を　楽しみなされ
column6:
You should join the Cult of Daimon while you're young.\n
Wouldn't you like eternal youth?

column5: 大門教に　だまされておった
column6: Those Daimonists are a bunch of liars.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
みんな　大門教を　信じてるけど\n
あたしには　わからない・・・\n
むかしの　ほうが　自由だったわ
column6: Everyone seems to love the Cult of Daimon, but I don't know...I think we had more freedom before them.

column5:
ありがとう　ジライアさま\n
大門教を信じていた　人々も\n
目が　さめたことでしょう
column6:
Thank you, Ziria-sama.\n
My friends have come to their senses.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
ニィさん　筑波の出身だってね\n
おれも　筑波には\n
しんせきが　いるろさ　ウィ
column6:
Hey friend. You from Tsukuba?\n
I gots relatives there...(hic)
column7: ZenkiTN: this character is supposed to be very drunk

column5:
ニィさんろころは　きいへるよ　\n
火の勇者の\n
ジライアさんらろ　ウィ！
column6:
I heards 'bout you.\n
You the Fire Hero Ziria-san, yeah? (hic)

column5:
おりゃ　よう\n
そろろ　松本城ろ　作っらのら\n
ろうら！　スゲエらろ　ウィ
column6: You see Matsumoto Castle? I builded it! Amazing, right?? (hic)

column5:
いいころ　教えれらるろぉ\n
松本城は　まら　作りかけらあ\n
秘密の　落し穴を　ふさいでねぇ　ウィ
column6: I'm tell you somethin' cool. The castle isn't finished. We haven't covered the secret pitfalls yet! (hic)

column5:
がんばれよ　火の勇者　ジライア！\n
がんばれろ　へのふうしゃ　ジラりア！\n
げんべれろ　へもむうりゃ　りらりら！
column6:
Hurrah for Ziria, the Fire Hero!\n
Hurrah foh Riria, the Fire Fero!\n
Hurrah foh firia fa fifefiro! (hic)

column5:
がんばれよ　火の勇者　ジライア！\n
がんばれろ　へのふうしゃ　ジラりア！\n
げんべれろ　へもむうりゃ　りらりら！
column6:
Hurrah for Ziria, the Fire Hero!\n
Hurrah foh Riria, the Fire Fero!\n
Hurrah foh firia fa fifefiro! (hic)

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
信玄さまの　タカの正体は\n
この　しなの国に　古くより\n
住みついている　妖怪　ヌエなのじゃ
column6: Shingen-sama's hawk is actually a Nue, a youkai living in Shinano since ancient times.

column5:
ジライアさま！！\n
くれぐれも\n
お気をつけてくだされ
column6: You must be careful, Ziria-sama!

column5:
ジライアさん！\n
大門教を　倒してください
column6: Ziria-san, please take down the Cult of Daimon!

column5: 十兵衛の家
column6: Juubei's House

column5:
おぬしが　ジライアか！？\n
ちかごろ　ちまたで　チヤホヤされて\n
つけあがっとる　うつけものめが
column6: So you're Ziria...You must love all the attention you're getting these days, huh? You spoiled brat!

column5:
火の勇者など　この　ジュウベイの\n
必殺剣が　打ちくだいて　くれるわ！\n
いざ　勝負じゃ！！
column6: The so-called {Fire Hero} will never be able to stand against my lethal technique! Have at you!

column5:
フッフッフッ！　それみたことか！\n
火の一族など　しょせん\n
おくびょうもの　集まり！
column6:
Hah! I knew it!\n
The Fire Clan is nothing but a lot of pathetic cowards!

column5:
大門教を　たおせるのは　おぬししか\n
おらん！　まよわず　自分の道を\n
ゆくのじゃ　ジライアよ！
column6: Only you can stop the Cult of Daimon. Keep following your path with unwavering confidence, Ziria!

column5:
氷の鏡から　光が　伸びて\n
すわ湖の上に　氷の橋を　作った！！
column6: The Ice Mirror shines. The surface of Lake Suwa freezes, creating an ice bridge!

column5:
とびらを　調べた！\n
たしかに　とびらにみえる\n
しかし　入ることは　できない！！
column6:
You inspect the door.\n
It definitely looks like a door, but it feels like a wall!

column5:
やかたのカベを　調べた\n
カベの中から　ひかりがもれている\n
ここから　中に　入れそうだ！
column6:
You inspect the wall of the building.\n
There is a faint light leaking out. You should be able to go through!

column5:
石台が　湖に張り出している\n
対岸にも　同じような　石台が見える
column6:
A stone step faces the lake.\n
You see a similar platform on the opposite shore.

column5: すわ湖の村
column6: Suwako Village

column5: 必ず　大門教を倒してください
column6: Please defeat the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
たいへんなのよ！！\n
大門僧が　村の舟を\n
みんな　沈めてしまったの！
column6: This is terrible! Daimonists showed up and sank all of our boats!

column5:
これじゃ　すわ湖は　渡れないわ！\n
対岸の　下すわ村の　恋人には\n
冬まで　会いに　行けないのね！！
column6:
There's no way to cross Lake Suwa now!\n
I'll have to wait until winter to see my boyfriend!

column5:
ありがとう　ジライアさん\n
これで　下すわの\n
彼のところへ　いけるわ
column6:
Thank you, Ziria-san.\n
Now I can go see my boyfriend in South Suwa!

column5:
湖を　わたると　しもすわ村じゃよ\n
さむくなれば　氷がはって　湖を\n
歩いて　渡れるんじゃ！
column6: Cross the lake and you'll be in South Suwa. The lake freezes over when it gets cold. You can just walk over there!

column5:
おお　湖に　氷が　はった！\n
しもすわ村に　行けるわい！\n
こりゃ　うれしや・・　うれしや！
column6:
The lake has frozen!\n
We can finally go to South Suwa!\n
Thank you! Oh, thank you!

column5:
鏡のやかたに　入った人は\n
二度と　出て　来れないそうよ\n
村の人は　だれも　近づかないわ
column6:
It's said that those who enter the Mirror Palace never leave again...\n
That's why we all keep our distance.

column5:
ここが　鏡のやかた　らしいのだが\n
どうしても　入れねえんだよ！\n
まったく　妙な　やかただぜ！
column6:
This is the Mirror Palace.\n
What's up with the door? I can't get through!

column5:
この村の西で　お侍さんが\n
必殺剣を　あみだそうと\n
修行を　なさっています！
column6: A samurai lives in a house west from here. I heard he's trying to come up with his own special technique!

column5:
ジライアよ！\n
鏡の　まえで　右手を上げてみよ\n
鏡の中の手は　どちらが上がるか
column6:
Ziria! Raise your right hand in front of a mirror and notice which hand your reflection moves.
#BOXPAUSE()
Think closely about that!

column5:
よく　考えるのだ！って\n
オロチ丸って人が　ジライアさんに\n
正確に伝えてくれと　いったのよ
column6: ...A man called Orochimaru asked me to give you this message, Ziria-san!

column5:
ここは　下すわ村です\n
湖の　向こうが　上すわ村よ
column6:
This is South Suwa.\n
North Suwa is on the other side of the lake.

column5:
悪い大門教の　坊さんに\n
おとうが　さらわれたとき\n
グロヌシさまが　助けてくれたんだ
column6: Guronushi-sama saved my dad after he was kidnapped by the bad Daimonists!

column5:
橋が　かかったので\n
上すわの彼女が　これるように\n
なりました
column6: Now that there's a bridge, I can go see my girlfriend in North Suwa!

column5:
こうふ城の　グロヌシさまが\n
いくら　がんばっても\n
大門教は　強すぎるわ！
column6: Guronushi-sama is the lord of Koufu Castle. He opposes the Cult of Daimon, but they're just too strong!

column5:
しずかに　くらしてた　オニたちが\n
大門教に　あやつられて\n
人を　おそうように　なった
column6: The Oni used to live in peace and quiet, but now the Cult of Daimon is controlling them and forcing them to kidnap people.

column5:
ジライアさん！　雲切りの里の者です\n
江戸のショーグンさまが\n
大門教に　捕らえられてしまいました
column6:
Ziria-san! I'm from Kumogiri Hamlet.\n
The Shogun of Edo has been captured by the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
ショーグンさまは　大門教トウバツに\n
一万の兵を　さしむけたのですが\n
大敗されて　しまったのです
column6: The Shogun led 10,000 soldiers to subdue the Daimonists, but they were completely annihilated!

column5:
江戸は　もう　完全に\n
大門教のものに\n
なってしまいました
column6:
I'm sorry, Ziria-san!\n
Edo has fallen to the Cult of Daimon!

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
湖の向こうに　こうふ城が　ある\n
トノの　グロヌシさまは\n
大門教が　大キライ　なんだ
column6: Koufu Castle is on the other side of the lake. Its lord, Guronushi-sama, is openly opposing the Cult of Daimon.

column5:
下すわ村に　行きたいが\n
湖が　こおるまで　待つしかないのかよ\n
大門教の　ゲスめ！
column6: I want to go to South Suwa, but now I'll have to wait until the lake freezes in winter. Damn those Daimonists!

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　５５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両55 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　５５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両55 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 神社
column6: Shrine

column5:
わしは　上すわ神社の　神主じゃ\n
あんた　大門教の　人か？
column6:
I am the priest of North Suwa Shrine.\n
Are you a Daimonist?

column5:
ここは　ジパングの　神様の場所！\n
ええい　出てけ！　出てけ！！
column6: This shrine belongs to the Gods of Jipang! Begone! BEGONE!!

column5:
ごかいして　すいませんでした！\n
おわびに　ヒミツを\n
お教えしましょう
column6: Forgive me for doubting you. As a way of apologizing, I will tell you a secret.

column5:
氷の鏡を　湖の前で　使うのです！\n
すると　いつでも　湖に\n
氷が　はって　渡れるのですが
column6: Use the Ice Mirror in front of the lake and its surface will freeze, allowing you to cross.

column5:
氷の鏡は　鏡のやかたの　中に\n
納められていて\n
だれも　中に入れないのです
column6: The Ice Mirror is stored inside the Mirror Palace, but...nobody has been able to go inside.

column5:
鏡のやかたの　どこかに\n
入口があることだけは\n
確かなんですが！！
column6: One thing is certain: there is definitely an entrance somewhere on the palace!
column7: ZenkiTN: this is about the fact that the "door" of the palace can't be crossed, because it's actually a wall. You have to walk into the "wall", because that's the real door. It's "mirrored", see?

column5:
おお！　まさしく　氷の鏡！\n
その鏡を持ち　すわ湖に面した\n
石台の上で使えば　氷の橋がかかるはず
column6:
Oooh! That is certainly the Ice Mirror!\n
Use it on top of the stone step in front of the lake and you will create an ice bridge.

column5:
これで　上すわ村と　下すわ村は\n
ふたたび　むすばれた\n
ありがとうございました
column6:
North Suwa and South Suwa are connected once more.\n
You have our gratitude.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
すわ湖に　まつわる　伝説じゃ\n
むかしの人は　氷の鏡を使って\n
いつでも　湖を　渡れたそうな
column6: According to old tales, the people of Suwako would use something called the {ice mirror} to cross the lake.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　氷の鏡が　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
You find the Ice Mirror.

column5: 氷の鏡を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Ice Mirror.

column5: 氷の鏡を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Ice Mirror.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　なにも　入っていなかった
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is nothing inside.

column6: Mirror Palace

column5: 下諏訪
column6: South Suwa

column5:
ここは　しもすわ村です\n
湖の　むこうが　かみすわ村よ
column6:
This is South Suwa.\n
North Suwa is on the other side of the lake.

column5:
大門教に　おとうが　いじめられた\n
シクシク　でも　勇者が　くれば\n
大門教を　やっつけて　くれる
column6: The bad Daimonists were mean to my dad! But you're a hero. You'll punish the bad Daimonists, right?

column5:
西に　行くと　盗人たちの　村が\n
あるって　うわさだよ
column6: I heard there's a village of thieves west from here.

column5:
こうふ城の　グロヌシ様が\n
いくら　がんばっても　大門教は\n
つよすぎるわ
column6: Guronushi-sama is the lord of Koufu Castle. He opposes the Cult of Daimon, but they're just too strong!

column5:
しずかに　くらしてた　オニたちが\n
大門教に　あやつられて　人を\n
おそうように　なった
column6: The Oni used to live in peace and quiet, but now the Cult of Daimon is controlling them and forcing them to kidnap people.

column5:
ええい　うるさい！　おらあ　はたけが\n
ありゃ　いいだ！　あっちへ　行け！\n
かかわり　あいたく　ねえだよ！
column6:
Shut up! I don't wanna get involved!\n
I have my crops, and that's all I care about! Go! Just leave me alone!

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
こうふ城の　グロヌシさまが\n
勇者に会いてえ！　勇者に会いてえ！\n
と　ネゴトに　いっているとさ
column6: I heard that Lord Guronushi of Koufu Castle wants to meet the heroes so badly that he even talks about it in his sleep!

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　５５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両55 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column6: General Store
