おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 神社
column6: Shrine

column5:
ここは　下すわの神社です\n
あなた　湖に　氷をはった　人ですね！\n
グロヌシさまが　捜していた　勇者かも
column6:
This is South Suwa Shrine.\n
You're the one who created the ice bridge over the lake, aren't you?

column5:
うむ！　そうじゃ　あんた　勇者じゃ！\n
さあ　早く　こうふ城に　行って\n
グロヌシさまに　お会いなさい
column6: You must be the hero Guronushi-sama is seeking! Please head to Koufu Castle and meet him at once!

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
古い　伝説に　よると\n
マサカドは　三つの　玉の力で\n
封じられるのじゃ
column6: According to ancient legends, Masakado was sealed using the power of three sacred orbs.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
むかし　この　しなの国に\n
信玄さまと　いう　とても\n
りっぱな　トノさまが　いたんじゃ
column6: A long time ago, Shinano was ruled by Shingen-sama, a great lord with a noble heart.

column5:
松本に　出た　信玄さまは\n
大門教の　ニセモノだった　そうじゃ\n
やはりのう
column6: The Shingen in Matsumoto was just an impostor sent by the Cult of Daimon.

column5: 雲切の里１１
column6: Kumogiri Hamlet 11

column5:
この　雲切の里１１では\n
こうふ城の　グロヌシさまと　ともに\n
大門教と　戦っております
column6:
This is Kumogiri Hamlet 11.\n
We stand with Lord Guronushi of Koufu Castle against the Cult of Daimon.

column5:
まあ！　ジライアさまですね！\n
ホテイ丸という　外人さんが\n
しばらく前　ここに　来られて
column6:
My! You must be Ziria-sama!\n
A funny foreigner called Hoteimaru came by some days ago.

column5:
ジライアさまが　もし　いらしたら\n
こうふ城の　グロヌシさまの　ところに\n
いると　つたえて　いかれました
column6: He left a message for you: He'll be waiting at Guronushi-sama's castle, in Koufu!

column5:
グロヌシさまの　いらっしゃる\n
こうふの町は　この里の南です
column6: Guronushi-sama is in Koufu Town, south from here.

column5:
ジライアさん　グロヌシさまは\n
とても　りっぱな　トノさまです\n
ぜひ　おたずねください
column6: He's a very good man. Please lend him your help, Ziria-san.

column5:
こうふ城の　グロヌシさまが\n
ジライアさまに　あいたがって\n
おりましたぞ！
column6: Ziria-sama! Guronushi-sama is waiting for you in Koufu Castle!

column5:
なにか　とても　だいじな\n
はなしが　あるとか・・・\n
いっておりました
column6: I don't know the specifics, but he has a very important matter to discuss.

column5:
昔から　火の一族たちは\n
それぞれに　ことなった\n
得意な武器を　使っていたのじゃ！
column6: Each tribe of the Fire Clan specializes in a different weapon.

column5:
ガマ族は　剣！\n
ヘビ族は　弓！\n
ナメクジ族は　オノじゃ！
column6:
The Toad clan is master of the sword!\n
The Slug clan is master of the axe!\n
The Snake clan is master of the bow!

column5: はっ？　さんさん？　七拍子か？
column6:
What? Sport?\n
Sorry, I'm too old to play!
column7: ZenkiTN: The joke here is that the old lady is mishearing "enzan", which I've translated as "Salt Pyramid".

column5: はっ？　変身？　トォー！！
column6:
What? Short?\n
I suppose I am on the short side!
column7: ZenkiTN: this one was a Kamen Rider reference ("Henshin... TOH!", it's a classic)

column5: はっ？　見参？　勝負するのか？
column6:
What? Fault?\n
Did I do something wrong?

column5: はっ？　源さん？　おーい　源さん！！
column6:
What? Assault?\n
Why would you do that?

column5:
はっ？　えんざん？　塩山か！！！\n
塩山なら　こうふ町の　東じゃぞ！
column6:
What? Salt?\n
Ohhh, the Salt Pyramid!\n
It's east of Koufu Town!

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
こうふ城の　グロヌシさまに\n
塩を　売りに　いったら\n
おこられちゃいました
column6: I went to Koufu Castle to sell salt to Guronushi-sama, but they got really mad at me.

column5:
グロヌシさまが\n
塩の　アレルギーだとはネ\n
まったく　知りませんでしたよ
column6: It turns out that Guronushi-sama is allergic to salt. I swear I didn't know that!
column7: ZenkiTN: it's possible that Guronushi is a descendant of the Slug clan, as Tsunade cannot enter the Salt Pyramid for a similar reason (that slugs are naturally weak to salt)

おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n

column6: Have a nice day.

column5:
全身　黒ずくめの男が　立っている\n
どうやら　敵意は　ないようだ
column6: A man completely covered in black stands before you. He doesn't seem to bear any ill will.

column5: なにもありませんでした
column6: You find nothing.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　板のよろいが　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is a plate armor inside.

column5: 板のよろいを　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Plate Armor.

中には　仙丹が　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is an elixir inside.

column5: 仙丹を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Elixir.

つづらの中を　調べた\n

column6: Salt Pyramid

column5:
あなたが　ウワサの勇者ですね！\n
ドーマンは　この奥にいます\n
わたしも　戦いますよ　ジライアさん！
column6:
You must be the famous hero!\n
Douman is hiding inside.\n
Allow me to assist, Ziria-san!

column5: 黒い影の男が　仲間に　加わった
column6: The shadowy man has joined you.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中から　まばゆい光が　あふれだした！
column6: When you open the casket, a dazzling light comes pouring out!

column5: 伝説の　ナメクジ玉を　見つけた！
column6: You found the legendary Slug Orb!

column5: ナメクジ玉を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Slug Orb.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　なにも　入っていなかった
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is nothing inside.

column6: You find nothing.

column5: 塩山
column6: Salt Pyramid

column5:
クククク・・・　きたな　ジライア！\n
大門教１３人衆の　６番手\n
この　ドーマンを　おこらせたな！
column6: Heh heh...I've been waiting for you, Ziria! You've incurred the wrath of Douman, the sixth of the Thirteen Daimon Cultists!

column5:
かかってこい　ジライア！\n
そして　そこの男！\n
正体は　バレているぞ！　オロチ丸！！
column6:
Prepare to die, Ziria!\n
And the same goes for you!\n
I know who you are...Orochimaru!

column5:
そうさ！　オロチ丸だ！\n
きさまら　大門教の　きたない\n
やりかた　しらべたぞ！
column6:
That's right! I am Orochimaru!\n
I've learned all about the evil caused by the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
わたしも　火の勇者として\n
きさまらと　戦う！
column6:
Henceforth, I pledge to fight you...\n
as one of the Fire Heroes!

column5: オロチ丸が　仲間に　加わった
column6: Orochimaru has joined you!
column7: NOTE: they forgot the blue text again...

column5: 塩山
column6: Salt Pyramid

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　禁呪の巻物が　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
You find the Scroll of Kinju.

column5: 禁呪の巻物を　手に入れた\n
column6: Obtained Scroll of Kinju.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　なにも　入っていなかった
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is nothing inside.

column5: 塩山
column6: Salt Pyramid

column5:
ちょっと　ジライア！\n
どこ行くのよぉ！\n
あたしも　ついてくからね
column6:
Where are you going, Ziria?\n
I'm coming with you!

column5:
ねえ！　ナメクジ玉が　ないと\n
マサカドは　たおせないよ！
column6: Hey, you know we can't beat Masakado without the Slug Orb, right?

column5:
ここで　待っているから\n
ジライア　ひとりで　\n
ナメクジ玉を　とりかえしてきてネ！
column6:
You'll have to go by yourself.\n
Bring me the Slug Orb, okay?

column5:
塩が　水で　溶かされた　あとがある\n
たたくと　中へ　くずれた\n
中は　通路が　続いている
column6:
The water is dissolving the salt wall.\n
You hit the wall and it crumbles, revealing a passage.

column5:
どうやら\n
ここから　塩山の中に　入れそうだ
column6: You should be able to enter the Salt Pyramid from here.

column5:
入口がくずれている\n
中に入ることはできないようだ
column6:
The entrance has caved in.\n
You can no longer go inside.

column5: 塩山
column6: Salt Pyramid

column5:
ジライア！\n
あたし　この山には　入れない！\n
ナメクジ族は　塩が　ニガテなの！
column6:
Sorry, Ziria! I can't go in there!\n
I'm really bad with salt.\n
You know, Slug clan and all that.

column5:
ここで　待っているから\n
ジライア　ひとりで　\n
ナメクジ玉を　とりかえしてきてネ！
column6:
You'll have to go by yourself.\n
Bring me the Slug Orb, okay?

column5:
やったー！　ジライア！　さすがぁ！\n
ナメクジ玉が　あれば\n
あたし　もっと　強くなれるね！
column6:
The Slug Orb! You did it, Ziria!\n
Wow, I feel stronger already!

column5:
あれー！　うしろの人は？\n
あっ！　あんた　キムチ丸ね！
column6:
Hey, who's that behind you?\n
...Oh yeah, I remember now!\n
You're that guy! Kimchi Maru!
column7:
ZenkiTN: she calls him "Kimchimaru" in Japanese, for reference. Kimchi is a Korean dish, but I'm not sure it's popular enough to work as a joke
Supper: it's reasonably well known, I think. I hear (non-Korean) people talk about it, anyway. let's just go with it.

column5:
やったー！　これで　火の勇者が\n
ぜんぶ　そろったじゃん！\n
もう　こわいものなしよね！！
column6:
That's all the Fire Heroes together!\n
We're totally unstoppable now!

column5:
さあ！　ジライア！　キムチ丸！！\n
行こうよ！！
column6:
C'mon, Ziria, Kimchi Maru!\n
Let's go!

column5:
今の　地震で\n
塩山の入口が　くずれ落ちてしまった\n
もう　中へは　入れない！
column6:
The ground trembles, and the entrance to the Salt Pyramid caves in.\n
You can no longer go inside!

column5: 甲府町
column6: Koufu Town

column5:
ここは　大門教と　戦う\n
グロヌシさまの　こうふ城よ！！
column6:
This is Koufu Town.\n
Our lord, Guronushi-sama, stands against the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
グロヌシさまを　中心に\n
町イチガンと　なって\n
大門教と　戦っているんだ！！！！
column6: We're all ready to follow Guronushi-sama to battle against the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
東に　いくと　塩山よ\n
塩山は　ぜーんぶ\n
塩で　できた山　なのよ！！
column6: Keep going east and you'll reach the Salt Pyramid. It's not just a name: it's completely made of salt!

column5:
オロチ丸って　いい男がさ\n
東に　行ったわ\n
もう　一度　会いたいわ！！
column6:
A handsome man called Orochimaru came through here on his way east.\n
How I wish I could see him once more!

column5:
変な　外人が　グロヌシさまの城で\n
はたらいて　いるよ！\n
おれ　フレンドに　なったんだ！
column6: There's a funny foreigner in Guronushi-sama's castle! We're friends!

column5:
おれのフレンドは\n
大門教と　戦っているんだ
column6: My friend is fighting against the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
大門教め！　信玄さまに　化けるとは\n
とんでもねえ！！　グロヌシさまに\n
やっつけて　もらわねば！！！！
column6: How could those Daimonists impersonate Shingen-sama?! Guronushi-sama should make them pay!

column5:
ありがとうございました\n
でも　まだ大門教は　ジパングに\n
広がっています
column6: Thank you. But the Cult of Daimon still has a strong hold on Jipang.

column5:
私たちも　グロヌシさまと共に\n
大門教と戦います！\n
ジライアさんも　がんばってください
column6: We'll keep fighting alongside Guronushi-sama. Good luck, Ziria-san!

column5:
グロヌシさまは　大門教から\n
この　こうふ町を　守って　いるのだ！\n
オラも　がんばらねば！！！！
column6:
Guronushi-sama is fighting to protect Koufu from the Cult of Daimon!\n
We must all do our part for his sake!

column5:
大門教が　来たら\n
みんなで　戦うんだぞ！！！！！
column6:
Let those Daimonists come!\n
We'll teach 'em a lesson they'll never forget!

column5:
不老不死だ　なんて　大ウソよ！\n
なんで　あんな　大門教を\n
信じちゃうの　かしら！！！
column6: Nobody can live forever! Why would anyone believe the Daimonists' lies?!

column5:
ここが　グロヌシさまの城じゃ！\n
大門教が　きたら　おれが\n
うちとって　やるんだ！！！！
column6: This is Guronushi-sama's castle! If the Daimonists approach, I'll cut them all down!

column5:
もし　ボクが　火の勇者だったら\n
わるい大門教を　倒して\n
とうちゃんたちを　助けてやるのになあ
column6: If I was the Fire Hero, I'd beat up the bad Daimonists and save everyone!

column5:
大門教は　ジパングを　めちゃくちゃに\n
かいめつさせるために\n
マサカドを　利用するつもりなのじゃ
column6: The Cult of Daimon wants to revive Masakado and bring ruin to Jipang!

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
なんでも　江戸城の　トノさまが\n
大門教に　とらえられてるってさ\n
おそろしい　ことだ
column6: Have you heard? The lord of Edo Castle was captured! Yeah, it's terrible...

column5:
塩山に　行くのか？\n
けんこうのために　塩分の\n
とりすぎには　注意しろよ！！
column6:
Are you going to the Salt Pyramid?\n
Remember that too much salt is bad for your health!

column5:
なんだなあ　この町の人たちは\n
やたら　イセエが　いいな！\n
なんだか　うれしく　なっちまうぜ！！
column6:
The people here are so full of life!\n
Really brings a smile to your face, right?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　５５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両55 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　５５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両55 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: 武具屋
column6: Armory

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　武具屋です\n
ご用件は　何ですか？
column6:
Welcome to my armory!\n
How can I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それでは　また　ご利用ください
column6: Come back anytime.

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 預かり所
column6: Warehouse

column5: 甲府城
column6: Koufu Castle

column5:
ジライア殿　ホテイ丸から　きいてます\n
さあ　おくで　グロヌシさまが\n
お待ちして　おります！！
column6: Ziria-dono! Hoteimaru told us about you. Guronushi-sama is waiting for you inside!

column5:
ホテイ丸は　ジパングの　ヒミツを\n
調べるとか　いって　穴を　ぬけて\n
ふじ国へ　行きました
column6:
Hoteimaru crossed the tunnel to Fuji.\n
He said something about looking for the secret of Jipang.

column5:
あなたが　勇者ですか\n
ホテイ丸から　きいて　おります\n
ともに　がんばりましょう！！
column6: Hoteimaru told us about you, young hero! We stand together against the Daimonists!

column5:
これで　安心は　できません！\n
大門教は　すでに　江戸城を\n
おさえたと　ききました
column6:
There's no time to celebrate!\n
Reports say that the Cult of Daimon has occupied Edo Castle!

column5:
グロヌシさまの　命令で\n
塩山の　北の堤防を　きって\n
水浸しに　してやりました！！
column6: Under Guronushi-sama's orders, we built an embankment north of the Salt Pyramid and launched a flood attack!

column5:
大門教を　たおす　ためなら\n
なんでもやる　かくごです！！！！
column6: We're not pulling any punches in our battle against the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
わしが　タケダ一族の　グロヌシだ！\n
やっと　来て　くれたな！\n
火の勇者！　待ちわびておったぞ！！
column6:
I am Guronushi of the Takeda Clan!\n
I've been waiting for you, Fire Hero!

column5:
わしは　このジパングを　愛しとる！！\n
だから　大門教と　戦っているのだが\n
すこしばかり　根性が　たりんのじゃ！
column6: I love Jipang! That is why I stand against the Cult of Daimon...But alas, my will is not quite strong enough!

column5:
どうも　塩が　にがてで　塩山に\n
行けぬ！！　ニセ信玄の　ドーマンの\n
かくれがが　その　塩山だというのに！
column6: Due to my salt allergy, I cannot chase Shingen's impersonator, Douman, inside the Salt Pyramid!

column5:
塩山の北のスミを　くずしておいた！\n
そこから　なかに　入れるはずじゃ！！\n
たのむ　ドーマンを　たおしてくれ！！
column6: We've broken through the pyramid's north wall. You should be able to enter from there. Please, take down Douman!

column5:
塩山の北のスミを　くずしておいた！\n
そこから　なかに　入れるはずじゃ！！\n
たのむ　ドーマンを　たおしてくれ！！
column6: We've broken through the pyramid's north wall. You should be able to enter from there. Please, take down Douman!

column5:
うむ！　伝説は　ほんとう　だった！！\n
やはり　火の勇者だけの　ことはある
column6: The tales were true: you ARE the Fire Heroes!
column7:
ZenkiTN: this is used when you talk to Guronushi after defeating Douman
Supper: as a random aside, if you beat Douman and get the Slug Orb, then die and get sent back without retrieving Tsunade, you'll still get this dialogue...but the tunnel remains incomplete, so you can't move on without her.

column5:
わしが　つくらせた　ぬけ穴から\n
ジパングの　ヒミツが　かくされた\n
富士国へ　ぬけられる
column6: You can use the tunnel to reach the lands of Fuji, where the secret of Jipang is hidden.

column5:
ホテイ丸は　先に　いったぞ！！\n
さあ　行きなされ　火の勇者たちよ！
column6:
Hoteimaru already left.\n
Go forth, young Fire Heroes!

column5:
うむ！　伝説は　ほんとう　だった！！\n
やはり　火の勇者だけの　ことはある
column6: The tales were true: you ARE the Fire Heroes!

column5: ぬけ道
column6: Tunnel

column5:
おっかちゃんのためなら　エーンヤコラ\n
グロヌシさまのためなら\n
エーンヤコーラア！！
column6: I dig, dig, dig, dig, dig, dig, dig, I dig for mom and dad! I dig, dig, dig, dig, dig, dig, dig, I do it for my lord!
column7:
ZenkiTN: エンヤコラ is something you say to give yourself the right timing to do something (like digging, pushing, etc).
I based this on the Seven Dwarves' song from the famous Snow White cartoon.

column5:
それ　ホレ！　やれ　ホレ！！\n
どんどん　ホレ！　もっと　ホレ！！\n
えんやさ　のさ！
column6:
We will make a tunnel\n
with our dig, dig, digging,\n
we can work all day!
column7: ZenkiTN: I took inspiration from a nursery rhyme called "Dig dig digging"

column5:
穴ほりゃ！　向こうは　富士の国！\n
ジパングのため　大門教打倒のため\n
全身全霊を　かけて　掘ってます！
column6: We're opening a tunnel to the lands of Fuji! For the sake of Jipang, we're going to dig with everything we've got!

column5:
ザクっと　ザクっと　ザックっと\n
ザクっと　ザクっと　ザックっと\n
ザクっと　ザクっと　ザックっとな！
column6:
Dig, and dig, and dig,\n
and dig, and dig, and dig,\n
and dig some more!

column5:
ホーレホレ！　ホーレホレ！\n
もひとつ　おまけに！\n
ホーレホレ！　ホーレホレ！！
column6:
Dig, dig, dig, goes the shovel,\n
dig, dig, digging all day long...
column7: ZenkiTN: I based this one on a children song called "Dig dig dig goes the digger".

column5:
ちかれたー！　\n
あと　どのくらい　掘ればいいんだろ！\n
急がないと！　ヨイショ！
column6:
So TIRED! Are we there yet?!\n
...No, I have to keep it together.\n
Back to digging!

column5:
オー！　フレンド！　ジライアさん！\n
ゴメンね！　ワタシよ！　ホテイ丸ヨ！\n
いろいろ　ベリーベリー　いそがしいネ
column6:
Oh, friend! Ziria-san!\n
Sorry! It is me! Hoteimaru!\n
Now am very very busy!

column5:
大門教が　かなり　ひろまってるヨ！\n
ワタシ　ここでも　大門教　やっつける\n
てつだいネ！　がんばってるんダヨ！
column6:
Cult of Daimon, everywhere!\n
Am here to help beat Cult of Daimon!\n
Work hard!

column5:
富士国に　ぬける穴　ほってマス！\n
富士国　ジパングの　たいせつネ！\n
あんた　グロヌシさんに　あうヨロシ！
column6:
Dig tunnel to Fuji!\n
Fuji, important to Jipang!\n
Say hi to Guronushi-san!

column5:
富士国に　ぬける穴　ほってマス！\n
富士国　ジパングの　たいせつネ！\n
あんた　グロヌシさんに　あうヨロシ！
column6:
Dig tunnel to Fuji!\n
Fuji, important to Jipang!\n
Say hi to Guronushi-san!

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
なんでも　塩山の　中は\n
くずれやすく　なっていて\n
すぐ　落っこちる　らしいぞな！！
column6:
The Salt Pyramid is very brittle inside.\n
Tread carefully, or you might fall into a pit!

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
グロヌシさまは\n
信玄さまと　おなじ\n
タケダ一族の　血が流れて　おる
column6: Guronushi-sama is a descendant of Shingen-sama's Takeda clan.

column5:
グロヌシさまが　ニセ信玄に\n
おいかりになるのも　あたりまえじゃ\n
ワシでも　ハラが立つ！！！
column6: He was livid when that Shingen impostor showed up. I was furious myself!

column5: 徐福の社
column6: Jofuku Shrine

column5: 金沢文庫
column6: Kanazawa Bunko

column5:
富士の裾野に広がる木の海って\n
樹海とよばれています\n
迷い込むと一大事ですよ
column6:
There is a thick forest known as the Sea of Trees at the foot of Mount Fuji.\n
It's easy to get lost in there!

column5:
ここは金沢文庫です\n
図書館があるんだよ
column6:
This is Kanazawa Bunko.\n
You should check out the library.

column5:
鎌倉は大門教徒の巣みたいに\n
なってしまっている\n
教徒でなければ暮らせないね
column6: Kamakura has become a veritable nest for Daimonists. Only acolytes get to live there.

column5:
鎌倉には鎌倉スタジアムってのが\n
できたらしいね\n
見に行ったかい
column6: I heard they made a stadium in Kamakura. I'd love to see it.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
大門教らしい　やつがよ\n
塩山の中に　入ってったんだ\n
きれいな　玉をもってたぞ！！！
column6: I saw a Daimonist enter the Salt Pyramid. He was carrying a shiny orb of some kind.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
ああ　つかれた！　つかれた！\n
大門教と　戦うため　城の地下に\n
ふじ国に　ぬける穴を　堀っているんだ
column6: Whew! I'm pooped! We've been digging a tunnel to Fuji inside the castle as part of the anti-Daimonist strategy.

column5: 盗人訓練所
column6: Thieving School

column5:
ここは　大門教を　やっつけるために\n
ぬすっとを　養成する\n
通称　ぬすっと訓練所です！！
column6: This is a Thieving School, where you can improve your thievery in order to help defeat the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
奥の　部屋に　入って\n
教官を　よけて\n
つづらの中の　お金を　とるんです！
column6: Head inside, avoid the instructors, and steal the money from the casket!

column5:
みごと　お金を　とることに\n
成功したら\n
そのお金は　あなたのものです！
column6: If you can steal the money successfully, you get to keep it for yourself!

column5:
まあ　遊びだと　おもって\n
気軽に　たのしんでくださいよ！\n
だけど　マサカド打倒も　お忘れなく！
column6:
Think of it as a game and have fun!\n
But don't forget your quest to defeat Masakado!

column5: 盗人訓練所
column6: Thieving School

column5:
ここは　大門教を　やっつけるために\n
ぬすっとを　養成する\n
通称　ぬすっと訓練所です！！
column6: This is a Thieving School, where you can improve your thievery in order to help defeat the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
奥の　部屋に　入って\n
教官を　よけて\n
つづらの中の　お金を　とるんです！
column6: Head inside, avoid the instructors, and steal the money from the casket!

column5:
みごと　お金を　とることに\n
成功したら\n
そのお金は　あなたのものです！
column6: If you can steal the money successfully, you get to keep it for yourself!

column5:
まあ　遊びだと　おもって\n
気軽に　たのしんでくださいよ！\n
だけど　マサカド打倒も　お忘れなく！
column6:
Think of it as a game and have fun!\n
But don't forget your quest to defeat Masakado!

column5:
なにか　やさしい光が\n
広がっている
column6: A gentle light spreads all over.
column7: NOTE: message for examining the warp spots in the forest (which few people are likely to do since they just look like regular trees)

column5: 富士国
column6: Fuji

column5:
温泉が　わき出している\n
その　湯を　体に　浴びると\n
体力が　回復した
column6:
The pool is filled with hot spring water.\n
You feel reinvigorated as soon as you enter.

column5: 浅間神社
column6: Asama Shrine

column5:
この　あさま神社は\n
神主と　ミコだけが　いる\n
とくべつな　ところじゃ
column6: Only priests and shrine maidens live here in Asama Shrine.

column5:
やっと　来ましたね　ジライア！\n
神は　この地に　おりられ\n
神獣を　お創りに　なったのです
column6: Welcome, Ziria! This is where the Gods descended to create the divine beasts.

column5:
富士山の　地下には\n
白リュウさまが　おられるのじゃ
column6: The sacred White Dragon dwells deep within Mount Fuji.

column5:
あなたが　大門教から　たすけた\n
神獣たちは　とくべつの日\n
この　富士に　あつまるのじゃ
column6: The divine beasts you free from the Daimonists' clutches will gather in Fuji on a special day.

column5:
神聖な　富士山を　大門教が　けがし\n
クモで　いっぱいに・・・\n
聖なる　山を　取り戻すのじゃ！！
column6: I can't believe those Daimonist spiders would defile the sacred Mount Fuji...Please, free it from this evil presence!

column5:
よくやった　ジライア！！\n
これからも　ジパングのために\n
戦うのじゃ！！
column6:
Well done, Ziria!\n
Keep up the good fight for the sake of Jipang!

column5:
神獣は　よい力を　はぐくみ\n
この国を　正しく　\n
みちびいて　いるのじゃ！
column6: The divine beasts nurture the power of good, leading Jipang down the right path!

column5:
富士山の　火口の底には\n
白リュウさまの\n
九つの神殿が　あるのじゃ
column6: Deep inside the crater of Mount Fuji are the Nine Temples of the White Dragon.

column5:
そこへ行くには\n
富士山のふもとの　鳥居から\n
頂上めざし　火口に入ればよい
column6: To enter the crater, first cross the sacred archway at the bottom of Mount Fuji and make your way to its summit.
column7: ZenkiTN: the specific term is "torii", but since this is the only time it's mentioned in the game, I figured calling it a "sacred archway" would be easier to understand for the players.

column5:
ジパングの民が　あやうき　とき\n
つねに　火の一族の勇者が\n
立ち上がって　きたのじゃ
column6: Whenever a threat looms over Jipang, the Fire Heroes shall rise.

column5:
白リュウさまは　富士の奥底で\n
火の勇者の為に　三つの巻物を\n
お守りになっておるのじゃ
column6: The sacred White Dragon is safeguarding three scrolls deep within Fuji.

column5:
白リュウさまは　九つの神殿の\n
中央の大神殿に\n
いらっしゃいます
column6: The sacred White Dragon is inside the Great Temple, at the center of the Nine Temples.
column7: ZenkiTN: I think the point is that the Great Temple is the central temple of the Nine Temples, not an additional tenth temple.

column5:
待っておったぞ　ジライア！\n
白リュウさまの神殿を\n
大門教のイト姫が　つきとめたのじゃ
column6:
We've been waiting for you, Ziria!\n
Itohime of the Cult of Daimon found the location of the White Dragon's temple.

column5:
いそがれよ　火の勇者たち！！\n
白リュウさまを　お救いするのじゃ
column6: You must hurry, Fire Heroes!

column5:
ジュカイは　神獣たちの　道じゃ！\n
かれらは　ジュカイを　ぬけ\n
それぞれの地に　戻るのじゃ
column6: The Sea of Trees is a mystical forest that leads to the dwellings of every divine beast.
column7: ZenkiTN: this is the only hint that you can walk on certain spots in the Sea of Trees to warp to each divine beast shrine. Walk in those trees between the mountains and you'll warp to the red boulders where the beasts are sealed.

column5:
大門教のイト姫の　あやつるクモどもに\n
白リュウさまも　封印されて\n
しまうやもしれん
column6: Itohime's army of spiders is attempting to seal the sacred White Dragon.

column5:
はやく　富士の神殿に行くのじゃ\n
いそがれよ　火の勇者たち！！
column6: Fire Heroes! You must hurry to the temples of Fuji!

column5:
ジライアよ！\n
大神主の　オズノさまが\n
神社の　なかで　お待ちじゃ！
column6: Ziria! Chief Priest Ozuno-sama is expecting you!

column5:
おまえが　富士山へ　向かった後\n
オズノさまは　リュウとなり\n
天に　のぼられた
column6: After you left for Mount Fuji, Ozuno-sama became a dragon and ascended to the heavens.
column7: ZenkiTN: the yukkuri playthrough remarked this fact. I think Ozuno himself was the White Dragon, which is the reason the Church of Daimon couldn't seal it: because it wasn't in its temple yet. Once you start making your way, Ozuno turns into a dragon, flies up, and probably flies down Fuji's crater to land in his temple. Of course, this is the only hint you get about this plot point, lol

column5: 神社
column6: Shrine

column5:
おまえたち　火の一族の　勇者にしか\n
すでに　この　ジパングは\n
すくえぬじゃろう
column6: Only you, the heroes of the Fire Clan, can save Jipang.

column5:
おまえの　おこないを\n
きろく　するかえ？
column6: Would you like me to keep a record of your deeds?

column5:
きろく　するぞえ\n
がんばりなされ
column6:
So it shall be done.\n
Good luck.

column5: がんばるのじゃぞ
column6: Good luck.

column5:
ふぁふぁふぁ　わしが　３００年も\n
生きておる　大神主の　オズノ　じゃ！\n
よく　来たのう　ジライア！
column6: Hoh hoh hoh! I am Chief Priest Ozuno, who has lived for 300 years! Well met, Ziria!

column5:
神々の　神聖な　神殿が\n
大門教に　けがされたのじゃ！\n
あそこには　わしらも　入れんのじゃ
column6: The Cult of Daimon is defiling the temple of the Gods! Alas, we cannot tread those sacred grounds!

column5:
神々が　しゅくふくした　火の一族の\n
勇者なら　神殿に　入れる！\n
たすけて　くれぬか？
column6:
Only the heroes of the Fire Clan, blessed by the Gods, may do so!\n
Will you help us?

column5:
うむ！　さすが　火の一族の　勇者！\n
神殿は　富士山の　地下じゃ\n
行ってくれ！！
column6:
Well said, hero of the Fire Clan!\n
The temple is under Mount Fuji.\n
I will pray for your fortune!

column5: オズノの　依頼を　引き受けた
column6: You have accepted Ozuno's request.

column5:
それは　こまった！\n
このままでは\n
ジパングが　ほろびてしまう
column6:
Ah, that is a terrible shame...\n
Then Jipang is doomed.

column5:
火口は\n
富士山の奥へと　続いている\n
中へ　入って　行けそうだ
column6: The crater leads deep inside Mount Fuji. You should be able to enter from here.

column5: 富士山
column6: Mount Fuji

column5:
ジライアは　空に向かって　叫んだ！！\n
\n
ようし！　江戸へ　行くぞ！！
column6:
Ziria yelled towards the sky:\n
\n
Edo, here I come!

column5:
やまびこが　かえって来た\n
\n
[color]<$00>いけ〜　いけ〜
column6:
A voice echoed back:\n
\n
[color]<$00>Go! Go!

column5: 富士地下
column6: Fuji Underground

column5: 富士地下都市
column6: Fuji Underground City

column5:
わたしは　イト姫！！\n
大門教の力は　人びとを\n
不老不死に　します！！
column6:
My name is Itohime.\n
The Cult of Daimon shall gift mankind with eternal life!

column5:
ジライアよ　おぬしは　大門教が\n
ジパングを　すばらしい　国にすると\n
信じて　くれますね？
column6: Ziria, do you believe we can turn Jipang into a paradise?

column5:
うれしいです！　さあ　ジライア！\n
大門教が　すばらしいと\n
せんでんして　いらっしゃい
column6:
That is wonderful! Now go, Ziria!\n
Spread the gospel of the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
つけあがり　おって　ジライア！\n
われこそは　大門教の　１３人衆！\n
７番手　タランチェじゃ！！
column6:
Show some respect, Ziria!\n
I am none other than the seventh of the Thirteen Daimon Cultists, Tarantul!

column5: 富士地下道
column6: Fuji Underground Path

column5: 富士地下
column6: Fuji Underground

column5:
いやあ　たすかった！\n
おれたち　大門教に　この穴を\n
作らされて　いたんだ
column6: We're free! The Cult of Daimon was forcing us to dig this tunnel!

column5:
ありがとう　やつら　マサカドの\n
霊力を　もっと　つよくすると\n
いってました
column6: Thank you. Those Daimonists said they were going to increase Masakado's spiritual power.

column5:
この　富士山を　支配すれば\n
神の力が　弱まり　マサカドの復活が\n
早まると　いってただ
column6: The Daimonists said that by conquering Mount Fuji, they'd weaken the power of the Gods and speed up Masakado's return.

column5:
神獣の力さ　完全に　封じ込めるため\n
この　富士の山を\n
くずす　つもり　だったようだべ！！
column6: They were trying to demolish Mount Fuji to completely seal away the divine beasts!

column5:
白リュウさまは　中央の大神殿に\n
いらっしゃるはずです
column6: The sacred White Dragon should be in the central temple.

column5:
まだ　お会いになっていないのでしたら\n
いまからでも　遅くはありません\n
ぜひ　お会いになってください
column6: It'd be a good idea to talk to him if you haven't done so already.

column5:
もう　だめかと　思っただ！\n
たすかった・・・\n
ありがとう　ございます！
column6:
I thought we were done for!\n
Thank you so much!

column5:
ありがとう　ございます！\n
ありがとう　ございます！
column6: Thank you! Oh, thank you!

column5:
イト姫は　溶岩の中に\n
神殿さ　しずめようと\n
考えとった　ようだべ
column6: Itohime was probably trying to cover the temples in lava.

column5:
みんな　よろこんで　います\n
あなたたちの　おかげです\n
ありがとう
column6: You're the reason we can smile again! Thank you!

column5:
これで　ごてんば村に　けえれます！\n
ごおんは　けっして\n
わすれませんよ！
column6:
Now I can go back to Gotenba Village!\n
I'll forever be in your debt!

column5:
この　地下を　ぬけると\n
ごてんば村　ですぜ
column6: Leave the tunnel and you'll see Gotenba Village.

column5:
ほってー　ほってー　また　ほって！\n
おかあちゃんの　ためなら　エーンヤ\n
・・・え！　もうほらなくていいの？
column6: I dig, dig, dig, dig, dig, dig, dig, I dig for mom and dad! I dig, dig, dig, dig, dig, dig...Huh? I can stop digging?

column5: 富士地下
column6: Fuji Underground

column5: 富士地下
column6: Fuji Underground

column5: 富士地下
column6: Fuji Underground

column5: 富士地下
column6: Fuji Underground

column6: Fuji Underground

column5: 中には　何も　入っていなかった
column6: There is nothing inside.

column5: つづらの中を　調べた
column6: You inspect the casket.

column5: 中には天地のオノが入っていた
column6: You find a Tenchi axe.
column7: ZenkiTN: it's "a" Tenchi axe because you can buy these in shops.

column5: かぎがかかっている
column6: It's locked.

column5: 天地のオノを　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Tenchi Axe.

column5: 神殿
column6: Temple

column5: 中には　何も　入っていなかった
column6: There is nothing inside.

column5: つづらの中を　調べた
column6: You inspect the casket.

column5: 中には天雷の巻物が入っていた
column6: You find the scroll of Tenrai.

column5: かぎがかかっている
column6: It's locked.

column5: 天雷の巻物を　手に入れた\n
column6: Obtained Scroll of Tenrai.\n

column6: Temple

column6: There is nothing inside.

column5: つづらの中を　調べた
column6: You inspect the casket.

column5: 中には紅の弓が入っていた
column6: You find a crimson bow.

column5: かぎがかかっている
column6: It's locked.

column5: 紅の弓を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Crimson Bow.

column5: 神殿
column6: Temple

column5: 中には　何も　入っていなかった
column6: There is nothing inside.

column5: つづらの中を　調べた
column6: You inspect the casket.

column5: 中には仙丹が入っていた
column6: There is an elixir inside.

column5: かぎがかかっている
column6: It's locked.

column5: 仙丹を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Elixir.

column5: 神殿
column6: Temple

column5: 中には　何も　入っていなかった
column6: There is nothing inside.

column5: つづらの中を　調べた
column6: You inspect the casket.

column5: 中には仙丹が入っていた
column6: There is an elixir inside.

column5: かぎがかかっている
column6: It's locked.

column5: 仙丹を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Elixir.

column5: 神殿
column6: Temple

column5: 中には　何も　入っていなかった
column6: There is nothing inside.

column5: つづらの中を　調べた
column6: You inspect the casket.

column5: 中には神炎の巻物が入っていた
column6: You find the scroll of Jinen.

column5: かぎがかかっている
column6: It's locked.

column5: 神炎の巻物を　手に入れた\n
column6: Obtained Scroll of Jinen.\n

column5: 神殿
column6: Temple

column5: 中には　何も　入っていなかった
column6: There is nothing inside.

column5: つづらの中を　調べた
column6: You inspect the casket.

column5: 中には妖刀村正が入っていた
column6: You find the Demon Sword Muramasa.
column7: NOTE: this is actually not a one-off item. I know some enemies drop them, and maybe there's even a shop with it somewhere? but I think calling it "the" Muramasa still makes the most sense here.

column5: かぎがかかっている
column6: It's locked.

column5: 妖刀村正を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Muramasa.

column5: 神殿
column6: Temple

column5: 中には　何も　入っていなかった
column6: There is nothing inside.

column5: つづらの中を　調べた
column6: You inspect the casket.

column5: 中には影衣の巻物が入っていた
column6: You find the scroll of Kageginu.

column5: かぎがかかっている
column6: It's locked.

column5: 影衣の巻物を　手に入れた\n
column6: Obtained Scroll of Kageginu.\n

column5: 神殿
column6: Temple

column5: 大神殿
column6: Great Temple

column5:
待っていたぞ　火の勇者よ\n
わたしは　白リュウ！\n
全ての　神獣を　統率する　神の使いだ
column6:
I've been waiting for you, Fire Hero!\n
I am the White Dragon, leader of the divine beasts!

column5:
われら神獣は　大門教に　やぶれたが\n
わたしは　この地に　身をかくし\n
火の勇者を　待ち続けていたのだ
column6: After the Cult of Daimon defeated us, I secreted myself in these lands, waiting for your arrival.

column5:
地下に　身を　ひそめていた　とはいえ\n
おまえたちの　活躍は\n
いつも　見ていた
column6: I've been observing your journey, young heroes.

column5:
いくつもの　苦難を　のりこえて\n
おまえたちは　見ちがえるほど\n
たくましくなった！
column6: In overcoming each and every hardship, you have grown much stronger than you realize!

column5:
愛と　勇気と　根性の　心も\n
十分に　つちかわれておる！\n
その気持ちを　忘れんようにな！
column6:
Your heart is overflowing with love, courage, and determination.\n
Never let go of those feelings!

column5:
八つの神殿に　納められている\n
つづらの　封印を　解こう！\n
好きな　ものを　もって　行くがよい！
column6:
I have released the seal on the caskets of the eight temples.\n
Their contents are yours!

column5:
愛と　勇気と　根性の　心も\n
十分に　つちかわれておる！\n
その気持ちを　忘れんようにな！
column6:
Your heart is overflowing with love, courage, and determination.\n
Never let go of those feelings!

column5:
八つの神殿に　納められている\n
つづらの　封印を　解こう！\n
好きな　ものを　もって　行くがよい！
column6:
I have released the seal on the caskets of the eight temples.\n
Their contents are yours!

column5:
温泉が　わき出している\n
その　湯を　体に　浴びると\n
体力が　回復した
column6:
The pool is filled with hot spring water.\n
You feel reinvigorated as soon as you enter.

column5: ごてんば村
column6: Gotenba Village

column5:
ジライアさん！\n
うちの　とうちゃん\n
助けてくれて　ありがとう
column6: Thank you for rescuing my father, Ziria-san!

column5:
村の　おくに\n
温泉が　わいたのよ！
column6: We have a hot spring in our village!

column5:
温泉の　わいている場所を\n
さがして　しらべて！\n
体力が　回復するわよ
column6: Once you find the spring, inspect it and you'll recover your health!

column5:
大門教に　連れてかれた\n
村の男たちが　帰って　来れたのは\n
ジライアさんの　おかげ　なんですって
column6: Some time ago, a group of Daimonists showed up and took the men away.

column5:
ほんとうに　どうもありがとう\n
ジライアさんは　この村の　恩人です
column6:
You're the one who freed them, aren't you? Thank you, Ziria-san.\n
You're the savior of our village!

column5:
南の橋を　わたると　ぬまづ村だっぺ\n
あすこには　有名な　剣ゴウの\n
千葉シュウサク先生の　道場があるだす
column6: Cross the bridge to the south and you'll reach Numazu Village. The famous fencer Chiba Shuusaku opened a dojo there.

column5:
ホテイ丸って　外人が\n
うちに　住みついてしまったですじゃ
column6: A foreigner called Hoteimaru is staying at my place.

column5:
子どもたちが　変なコトバを\n
おぼえるんで　ホトホト\n
困っておるの　ですじゃ
column6:
The kids are starting to talk like him...\n
It's a little concerning, honestly.

column5:
ホテイ丸って　外人さんは\n
ジライアさんの　お手伝いをすると\n
いって　出ていったですじゃ
column6:
That funny foreigner Hoteimaru left.\n
He said he was going to do something to help you.

column5:
さっきは　ありがとう\n
やつら　マサカドの霊力を\n
もっと　強くすると　いってたべよ
column6:
Thanks for everything, Ziria-san.\n
Those Daimonists said they were going to increase Masakado's spiritual power.

column5:
助けて　いただいて　まことに\n
ありがとうございまーす！！\n
ありがとうございまーす！！
column6:
Thank you a thousand times!\n
Thank you! Thank you!\n
Thank you! Thank you!

column5:
ありがとうございまーす！！\n
ありがとうございまーす！！\n
ありがとうございまーす！！
column6:
Thank you! Thank you!\n
Thank you! Thank you!

column5:
ありがとうございまーす！！\n
ありがとうございまーす！！\n
ありがとうございまーす！！
column6:
Thank you! Thank you!\n
Thank you! Thank you!

column5:
ありがとうございまーす！！\n
ありがとうございまーす！！\n
ありがとうございまーす！！
column6:
Thank you! Thank you!\n
Thank you! Thank you!

column5:
ありがとうございまーす！！\n
いつもより　多く\n
いわせて　いただいて　おります！！
column6:
Thank you! Thank you!\n
I'll never stop thanking you!

column5:
この村の　娘っこは\n
ジライアさんの　活躍を　きいて\n
みんな　おまえさんの　ふぁん　じゃ！
column6: After hearing about your exploits, the girls of the village decided to open a fan club!

column5:
とくに　この家の\n
マリコと　チサという\n
ビジン姉妹は　熱狂的じゃ！！
column6:
Your most hardcore fans are the beautiful sisters Mariko and Chisa!\n
They live in this house!
column7: ZenkiTN: my understanding is that Mariko and Chisa are guest roles by two singers/voice actresses, Mariko Nagai and Chisa Yokoyama. Chisa especially is very prolific (you might recognize her as Galactic Fraulein Yuna's main character)

column5:
ちょっと　顔でも\n
見てって　やってくだされ！！
column6:
Why don't you go inside?\n
They'd be thrilled to talk to you!

column5:
ジライアさんの　かつやくを\n
オレに　きろくさせてください\n
きろくしますか？
column6: Would you let me record your deeds, Ziria-san?

column5: じゃあ　きろくするね
column6: I'm all ears.

column5:
残念だな\n
また　いつでも　きてくれよ
column6: That's a shame. Maybe next time.

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
オー！　フレンド　ジライアさん！\n
ひさしぶりネ\n
ワタシよ！　ホテイ丸ネ！！
column6:
Oh, friend! Ziria-san!\n
Long time! It is me! Hoteimaru!

column5:
いま　スゴイこと　考えてます\n
大門教　やっつける\n
カラクリの　兵隊さん　デス！
column6:
Come up with great idea!\n
Mechanic soldier to fight Cult of Daimon!

column5:
ざんねんダキド\n
もう少し　時間かかります！\n
ジライアさんも　がんばってクダサイ！
column6:
But need more time!\n
Ziria-san, you work hard too!

column5:
オー！　フレンド　ジライアさん！\n
ひさしぶりネ\n
ワタシよ！　ホテイ丸ネ！！
column6:
Oh, friend! Ziria-san!\n
Long time! It is me! Hoteimaru!

column5:
いま　スゴイこと　考えてます\n
大門教　やっつける\n
カラクリの　兵隊さん　デス！
column6:
Come up with great idea!\n
Mechanic soldier to fight Cult of Daimon!

column5:
ざんねんダキド\n
もう少し　時間かかります！\n
ジライアさんも　がんばってクダサイ！
column6:
But need more time!\n
Ziria-san, you work hard too!

column5:
おわん出せ〜　おわん出せ〜\n
おわんだせ〜の　おはしにぃー
column6:
Oh when the sink! Oh when the sink!\n
Oh when the sink got matching inn!
column7: ZenkiTN: the joke here is that the kids are starting to talk with a weird foreign accent like Hoteimaru

column5:
このサング　ホテイ丸さんに　\n
教えて　もらったデース！
column6: This song, learned from Hoteimaru!

column5:
ウチの　にいちゃんは\n
発音が　わるい　デース！\n
ミーが　ちゃんと　歌いマース！！
column6: Brother pronounce bad! I sing better!

column5:
Ｏｈ　Ｗｈｅｎ　Ｔｈｅ　Ｓａｉｎｔ\n
Ｏｈ　Ｗｈｅｎ　Ｔｈｅ　Ｓａｉｎｔ\n
Ｇｏ　Ｍａｒｃｈｉｎｇ　Ｉｎ
column6:
Oh when the saints! Oh when the saints!\n
Oh when the saints go marching in!

column5:
フレンド　ホテイ丸に　お返しに\n
ジパングの　歌　おしえたデース！\n
ふーじーは　ひろいーな　おっきーな！
column6:
I teach friend Hoteimaru song too!\n
Mooount Fuuuji iiis the hiiigheeest mountain ooof Jipaaang!
column7:
ZenkiTN: in the original line, the kid is singing a song called "Umi" (the sea), but it's replacing Umi with Fuji. Since I doubt anyone in the west can appreciate this difference, I let him quote a different song that is actually centered on Mount Fuji. Incidentally, if you want to let him say that in Japanese, it would be "Fuji wa nippon'ichi no yama" (swap Nippon for Jipangu for make it more game-lore-accurate)
This is the part I'm using, if you're curious: https://youtu.be/za1d5eaEPzE?t=40
This is the original song the game is quoting, but swapping "umi" for "fuji": https://youtu.be/WQUPzcB1xT0?t=8

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
あっ！　ジライアさん！　わたしです\n
富士山の　地下で　助けて　もらった\n
男ですよ！　ごおんは　忘れてません
column6: Ziria-san! I'm one of the men you rescued from Mount Fuji! I'll always be grateful!

column5:
こうして　娘たちと\n
くらせるのも　あなたのおかげ！\n
家宝の　神風のくつを　さしあげます！
column6: You're the reason my daughters still have a father! Here, I want you to have our family's heirloom, the Shinpuu shoes!
column7: ZenkiTN: the original name was "Kamikaze Shoes", but I changed the item's name. This isn't really "censorship" or anything, but it's because "Kamikaze" carries the meaning of suicide in the west, but these shoes have nothing to do with that. "Shinpuu" is the alternate reading of the kanji. The alternative would be "Divine Wind", a straight translation.

column5: 神風のくつを　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Shinpuu Shoes.

column5:
がんばってください\n
ジライアさま！！\n
うちの娘たちも　オーエンしています！
column6: Good luck, Ziria-sama! We're all cheering for you, especially my daughters!

column5:
なんという幸せ！　ジライアさまと\n
こうして　お会いできるなんて！\n
わたし　チサの姉の　マリコといいます
column6: I'm talking to Ziria-sama! This is a dream come true! I'm Chisa's older sister, Mariko.
column7: ZenkiTN: as I mentioned earlier, this character is voiced by Mariko Nagai in a guest performance.

column5:
ガマ族の　勇者である　ジライアさま\n
父を　助けて　いただいて\n
本当に　ありがとう　ございました
column6: Brave Ziria-sama of the Toad clan, thank you so much for rescuing our father.

column5:
いまの　この世を　すくえるのは\n
あなたをおいて　他には　いないと\n
いつも　父が　申しておりました
column6: Dad always tells us how you're the only one who can save the world from this chaos.

column5:
マリコと　チサは　おうえんすること\n
くらいしか　できませんけど\n
さいごまで　がんばってください！
column6: The only thing Chisa and I can do is cheer you on. Please, keep fighting until the end!

column5:
りりしいお姿を　ふたたび　はいけん\n
できる日を　楽しみに　しております\n
いつでも　あそびに　きてくださいネ！
column6:
I look forward to the day we will be able to see your gallant face again.\n
Come visit us whenever you like!

column5:
ようこそ　いらっしゃいました\n
ジライアさま\n
わたしは　マリコの妹の　チサです
column6:
Welcome, Ziria-sama.\n
I'm Mariko's younger sister, Chisa.
column7: ZenkiTN: as I mentioned earlier, this character is voiced by Chisa Yokoyama in a guest performance.

column5:
このたびは　父を　大門教の\n
まの手から　すくっていただいて\n
ありがとう　ございました
column6: Thank you for rescuing our father from the clutches of the Cult of Daimon.

column5:
やっと　これで　親子３人　水入らずで\n
仲よく　くらしていくことができます\n
本当に　お礼の　ことばも　ありません
column6: Words can't describe how grateful we are to you for allowing us to live together as a family.

column5:
マサカドの霊を　一日でも　早く\n
たおしてください\n
ジパングの　真の　平和のために
column6: We hope you can defeat Masakado's spirit and bring true peace back to Jipang as soon as possible.

column5:
チサも　かげながら　姉と　いっしょに\n
ジライアさまの　ファンクラブを\n
つくって　おうえんする　つもりです
column6: That's why my sister and I opened a fan club dedicated to you, Ziria-sama.

column5:
さいごまで　あきらめずに\n
がんばって　くださいね\n
それでは　ばびょ〜ん！！
column6:
Please, never give up.\n
See you soon. Boyoyoing!
column7: ZenkiTN: apparently, ばびょーん was one of her "things" in this period. It's the onomatopoeia for a jack-in-the-box opening. So it would be like, "boyoyoing". Honestly I never heard of this and I can't find any clear info about it outside Japanese wikipedia, but she clearly says it here, and it's voice acted, so.

column5: ぬまづ村
column6: Numazu Village

column5:
しゅぜん寺村に　南蛮屋が　できてから\n
この　富士国も　だんだん\n
住みにくく　なってきたぜ！
column6: It's been hard living in Fuji ever since that merchant settled in Shuzenji Village!

column5:
旅の　途中で　カゼひいてよ\n
ナンギしてたらよ　雲切の里の人たちが\n
助けて　くれたんでさあ！！
column6:
I caught a cold on my way here.\n
I would have died if it weren't for the nice people of Kumogiri Hamlet!

column5:
しゅぜん寺村の　南蛮屋は\n
金のためなら　どんな　あくどい\n
商売でも　するって　ウワサよ
column6: There's an overseas merchant in Shuzenji Village who stops at nothing to make a profit.

column5:
ごてんば村に　温泉が　わいたって？\n
大門教の連中が　ウロつかなくなったら\n
一度　行ってみてえ　もんだ！
column6:
There's a hot spring in Gotenba Village?\n
I wish those Daimonists would leave already. I want to go there!

column5:
ぶっそうな　世の中だぜ\n
東のほうじゃ　大門教が　ものスゲエ\n
いきおいで　ひろまってるってよ
column6:
The Cult of Daimon is spreading like crazy in the east.\n
What's the world coming to?

column5:
みんな　こわがってたけど\n
ホテイ丸って　いいヤツだよ\n
ボク　フレンドなんだ！
column6: I don't know why people are scared of Hoteimaru. He's so cool! We're friends!

column5:
勇者　ジライアって\n
カッコイイ人なんだって！\n
あってみたいわ
column6: Apparently, the hero Ziria is cool and handsome! I want to meet him!

column5:
あくろう王って人が　オニたちを\n
しずめてるんだって\n
りくう国が　うらやましいわ！！
column6: King Akurou managed to pacify the Oni of Rikuu. Must be nice living there!

column5:
東の　三島村には\n
白タカさまが　まつられて　おるのじゃ\n
いちど　おまいりしたい　ものよのう
column6: The sacred White Hawk lives in Mishima Village. I'd like to visit him one day!

column5:
おれ　外人と　フレンドなんだ！\n
そいつ　いそいで　ごてんば村に\n
行っちゃったよ
column6:
I made friends with a foreigner!\n
He went to Gotenba Village!

column5:
この村に　剣術を　教える\n
千葉シュウサク先生の\n
道場が　あるわよ
column6: Master fencer Chiba Shuusaku opened a dojo in our village.

column5:
マサカドを　復活させるために\n
大門教の　連中は　あらゆる手段で\n
人の　たましいを　あつめているんだ
column6: The Cult of Daimon uses all sorts of tricks to steal people's souls, all so they can revive Masakado.

column5:
ありがとう　ジライアさん\n
これで　富士国の大門教の力が\n
弱まるでしょう！！
column6:
Thank you, Ziria-san.\n
The Cult of Daimon is losing its hold on Fuji!

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
しゅぜん寺村は　ひでえ　とこさ\n
村人が　みんな　金の亡者さ！！\n
あんなとこ　行くもんじゃねえ！！
column6:
Shuzenji Village is a terrible place.\n
It's full of money-grubbers!

column5:
金の亡者は　いなくなったんですね\n
ジライアさん！
column6: The money-grubbers are gone, Ziria-san!

column5:
しゅぜん寺村？！\n
あそこは　なにかというと\n
金　金　金　金　なんでも　金だ！！！
column6:
Shuzenji Village?\n
That place is all about the money!

column5:
勇者　ジライアって　スゲエやつでよ\n
おれは　あったんだけど\n
とにかく　でっかくて　ツエーのよ！
column6: Ziria is awesome. I met him once, you know? He's as tall as two men, and got the strength of a hundred!

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　６０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両60 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　６０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両60 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: 武具屋
column6: Armory

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　武具屋です\n
ご用件は　何ですか？
column6:
Welcome to my armory!\n
How can I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それでは　また　ご利用ください
column6: Come back anytime.

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 預かり所
column6: Warehouse

column5: 周作の道場
column6: Shuusaku's Dojo

column5:
千葉シューサク先生は\n
ふるさとの　千葉国に\n
お帰りに　なられました
column6: Master Shuusaku has returned to his homeland of Chiba.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
古い　伝説に　よると\n
富士山に　神々が　おりられ\n
このジパングを　おつくりになられ
column6: According to ancient legend, the Gods came down from Mount Fuji to create Jipang.

column5:
そして　悪しき者より\n
この国を　守るため\n
神獣を　つかわされた　そうじゃ
column6: Then they dispatched their divine beasts to protect the lands from evil.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
ふるい　伝説に　よると\n
ガマ　ヘビ　ナメクジの玉は\n
聖なる力を　ひめておる
column6: According to the old legends, the sacred Toad, Snake, and Slug orbs are filled with divine power.

column5:
悪しき者との　戦いに\n
この玉を　使えば　神の力が　\n
それを打ち砕く！！　といわれておる！
column6: When facing evil, the orbs will unleash their holy energy to crush it -- or so they say!

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
南蛮屋は　しゅぜん寺村に\n
ふたつも　大門教会を\n
寄進した　らしいのよ
column6: That merchant had two Daimon churches built in Shuzenji Village.

column5:
教会の　建設にかかった　お金は\n
みんな　人をだまして\n
もうけた　お金に　決まっているわ！！
column6: Of course, he built those churches with the money he scammed out of people.

column5:
ジライアさん\n
大門教を　必ず\n
たおして下さい
column6: Please take down the Cult of Daimon, Ziria-san.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
しゅぜん寺村の　南蛮屋は\n
あきんどの　風上にも\n
おけないやつだ！！
column6: That merchant in Shuzenji Village is a disgrace to all merchants!

column5:
家に　火をつけて　家を　売りつける！\n
舟を　しずめて　舟を　売りつける！\n
橋を　こわして　橋を　売りつける！！
column6: He'd set houses on fire, sink boats, break bridges, all so he can sell new ones!

column5:
あいつの　商売のやりかたは\n
イチジがバンジ　この調子だ\n
しょうねの　くさりきった　やつだ！
column6: He'd go to any length just to make a little profit. He's as corrupt as they come!

column5:
ジライアさん\n
南蛮屋の商品は　おもしろいですよ\n
ぜひ　一度　買ってみてください
column6: That merchant had some interesting goods. You should buy some!

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 賭場
column6: Gambling Den

column5:
ジライアさん　じゃないですかぁ！\n
こんな所で　遊んでいて　いいんですか\n
まっ　たまには　息ぬきしないとね
column6:
My, if it isn't Ziria-san!\n
Should you really be here?\n
Eh, I guess it's fine every once in a while!

column5:
ツボふりの　ネエちゃん　きれいだろ！\n
もう　ちょっとで\n
見えそう　なんだけどなあ！！
column6:
The dice lady is a real babe!\n
When I play, I'm not exactly looking at the dice, if you catch my drift!

column5:
二つの　サイコロの目を　たして\n
偶数なら　「丁」で\n
奇数なら　「半」だ！
column6:
It's a simple game!\n
Just bet whether the sum of the two dice will be even or odd!

column5: 雲切の里１２
column6: Kumogiri Hamlet 12

column5:
三人の火の勇者の力で　一刻も\n
はやく　大門教を倒して下さい
column6: Fire Heroes, please defeat the Cult of Daimon as soon as possible.

column5:
このまま　大門教が　のさばれば\n
いずれ　マサカドが　復活してしまう！\n
ああ　どうすればいいのだ
column6: The Cult of Daimon is close to reviving Masakado! What should we do?!

column5:
三島村の　白タカさまが\n
大門教に　石に　封印されてしまった\n
ジライアさま　お急ぎください！！
column6:
The sacred White Hawk of Mishima Village has been turned to stone!\n
Ziria-sama, you must hurry!

column5:
三島村は　この村の東！！\n
湖の　そばで　ございます！！！
column6: Mishima Village is east of here, right next to the lake!

column5:
しゅぜん寺村では　南蛮屋の　おかげで\n
村人が　ふたつに　分かれて\n
対立しています
column6: That merchant has split the people of Shuzenji Village into two opposing sides.

column5:
大門教に　入った村人と\n
入っていない村人との間で\n
争いが　起こりかねない　ようすです
column6: He's stirring up a conflict between those who've joined the Cult of Daimon and those who haven't.

column5:
ジライアさま　お急ぎください！！\n
しゅぜん寺村は　この村の南！！\n
山のすそで　ございます！！！
column6:
Please hurry, Ziria-sama!\n
Shuzenji Village is south from here, at the foot of the mountains!

column5:
南蛮屋は　お金を　愛してるんですって\n
それ以外　信じて　ないんですって\n
人の命よりも　大切なんですって！
column6: That merchant loves money more than anything else in the world, even more than human life!

column5:
あんなやつ　お金の服をきて\n
お金を食べて　お金のフトンで\n
ずっと　寝てればいいのよ
column6: If he loves money so much, he should just marry it.

column5:
あんたさまを　お助けできる\n
雲切の里は　富士国で\n
ここにしか　あらんのです
column6: This is the only Kumogiri Hamlet in Fuji.

column5:
じゅうぶん　やすんでから\n
おでかけくだせいまし！
column6: You should rest properly before leaving!

column5:
東の湖のわきに\n
うつくしい　三島村が　ある
column6: Mishima Village, to the east, overlooks the lake. It's a beautiful place.

column5:
クソッ！\n
カッパにまで　お金を　とられた！
column6: Damn it! A kappa stole my purse!

column5:
南蛮屋といい　カッパといい\n
この国の　大門教は\n
金に　いじきたねぇ　やつらばかりだ！
column6: What's with all the money-grubbing Daimonists around here?!

column5:
南蛮屋は　お金に　困った人たちに\n
「大門教に入れば　助けますよ」と\n
いって　入会を　すすめてるんでさあ！
column6: That merchant tells those in need that he'll give them money if they join the Cult of Daimon.

column5:
人の　弱味に　つけこみやがって\n
なんて　ヒキョウな　連中なんだ！！
column6: Taking advantage of a moment of weakness...He's the lowest of the low!

column5:
カネ　カネ　カネの　世の中で\n
泣くのは　弱い　ものばかり！\n
せちがらい　世の中で　ござんす！
column6:
This world is all about the money!\n
You won't survive long if you're poor!

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
東の　さがみの国に　行きてえが\n
箱根の関が　閉まってて\n
ここに　足止めよ！！
column6: I was on my way to the lands of Sagami, to the east, but the Hakone barrier is closed. Now I'm stuck here!

column5:
箱根の関は　開きました\n
マサカドの眠る\n
江戸へ　お急ぎ下さい
column6: The Hakone barrier is open. You must hurry to Edo, where Masakado is sealed!

column5:
箱根の関は　南蛮屋が\n
通れなく　してるんだって\n
お金の力　だろうね
column6: The merchant had the Hakone barrier closed. I guess you can do anything with money.

column5:
南蛮屋は　お金が　命だって\n
ウワサだよ
column6: Rumor has it that money is life for that overseas merchant.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　３０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両30 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　３０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両30 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5:
赤地に　黄色い文字で\n
「大」と　しるされた　大きな石がある
column6: There is a large red stone marked with a yellow 大 symbol.

column5: なにもありませんでした
column6: You find nothing.

column5: 三島村
column6: Mishima Village

column5:
白タカさまを　お助けいただき\n
ありがとうございました
column6: Thank you so much for rescuing our sacred White Hawk.

column5:
ありがとうございます\n
しゅぜん寺村も　もとに戻りました
column6: Things are finally back to normal in Shuzenji Village. Thank you.

column5:
この　三島神社には\n
うつくしい　白タカさまが\n
いらっしゃるのですが
column6: Our beloved White Hawk lives at the Mishima Shrine, but the Cult of Daimon turned him to stone...

column5:
大門教によって　あのような\n
あわれな　お姿に　されてしまいました\n
ジライアさま　お救いください！！
column6: Ziria-sama, you must save him!

column5:
湖に　浮かぶ　小島に\n
白タカさまの　\n
封印された石が　あります！！
column6: The sacred White Hawk has been sealed in the small island in the lake.

column5:
火の勇者　ジライアさま！\n
はやく　橋を　渡り\n
白タカさまの　もとへ！！
column6: Hurry, Ziria-sama! Cross the bridge and rescue our beloved White Hawk!

column5:
さがみの国に　帰りたいのですが\n
箱根の関所が　封鎖されていて\n
帰れないのです
column6: I want to go back to Sagami, but the Hakone barrier has been closed off!

column5:
村の　宿屋には　温泉が\n
わいてます　入ると　体力が\n
モリモリよ！
column6:
There's a hot spring in our village.\n
Soak in its waters for a while and you'll feel great!

column5:
ジライアさん！　オラ　見たサ！　\n
しゅぜん寺村の　東の堤防を\n
大門教の　やつらが　こわしてたサ！
column6:
Ziria-san! You won't believe what I saw!\n
The Daimonists demolished the embankment east of Shuzenji Village!

column5:
それが　ヘン　なんだサ\n
村人を　呼んできて\n
自分たちで　こんどは　直していたサ！
column6:
But here's the weird part!\n
They called the villagers up to watch them repair it! What's up with that?
column7: ZenkiTN: you get another side of this in Shuzenji Village. The villagers think the embankment broke on its own, and the Daimonists repaired it out of the goodness of their heart. But the truth is they broke it themselves to look like saviors.

column5:
しゅぜん寺の　村人の　半分は\n
すでに　大門教に　コロんだと\n
いうこっちゃ！
column6: Half of the residents of Shuzenji Village have already joined the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
この村も　いずれは\n
南蛮屋の手が　のびて\n
しゅぜん寺村みたいに　なるのかしら
column6: One of these days, that merchant will set his sights here, and we might end up just like Shuzenji Village...

column5:
うえーん！　うえーん！\n
白タカさまが石になっちゃったよお！　\n
おニイちゃん　たすけてくれよおー！
column6:
Bwaaaa! Sob...\n
Our beloved White Hawk has been turned to stone! Please save him, mister!

column5:
火の勇者よ！　わたしは　白タカ！\n
この　ジパングを　天空から\n
見守ってきた　神の使いだ！
column6: Fire Heroes! I am the White Hawk, messenger of the divine. I watch over Jipang from the great blue sky!

column5:
マサカドの　怨念に　同調した\n
悪霊どもが　天地から　あふれ出し\n
この国に　災厄を　もたらしている
column6: Evil spirits who share Masakado's grudge have seeped into our world to bring about calamity.

column5:
今　人びとは　飢え　物欲に　おぼれ\n
たがいに　憎しみ　あっている\n
これも　全て　悪霊のせいなのだ！
column6: They are the reason mankind is drowning in a sea of hatred and greed!

column5:
なぜ　悪霊が　あふれるのか！\n
なぜ　人の心が　すさむのか！\n
なぜ　マサカドが　よみがえるのか！
column6:
Why are the evil spirits seeping into our world? Why is mankind losing its way?\n
Why is Masakado coming back?

column5:
それも　これも　すべて\n
大門教のせいだ！\n
大門教を　許してはならぬ！！
column6: There is only one answer: the Cult of Daimon! They must pay for their sins!

column5:
火の勇者たちよ！\n
ジパングを　守る\n
３つの　神器を　さずけよう！
column6: Fire Heroes! I bestow upon you three sacred weapons to assist you in your quest to save Jipang!

column5:
これから先　大門教は　ますます\n
手強い！　愛と　勇気と　根性の力を\n
忘れずに　すすむのだぞ！！
column6: Facing the Cult of Daimon will be more and more difficult. Go forth with your love, courage, and determination!

column5: 神獣白タカの　封印を　解き放った
column6: You have broken the seal of the divine beast White Hawk.

column5: 白羽の剣を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained White Plume Sword.

column5: 白羽の弓を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained White Plume Bow.

column5: 白羽のオノを　手に入れた
column6: Obtained White Plume Axe.

column5:
これから先　大門教は　ますます\n
手強い！　愛と　勇気と　根性の力を\n
忘れずに　すすむのだぞ！
column6: Facing the Cult of Daimon will be more and more difficult. Go forth with your love, courage, and determination!

column5:
ハッハッハ！　南蛮屋のおかげで\n
わたしもビンボー　あなたもビンボー！\n
みんなビンボー　ひさんなビンボー！
column6: Hahahaha! That Merchant ruined me! I'm poor! You're poor! We're all poor! We have nothing left!

column5:
湯船には　温泉の湯が　あった\n
その湯を　浴びると　体に\n
力が　わき上がってきた
column6:
The pool is filled with hot spring water.\n
You feel reinvigorated as soon as you enter.

column5: 温泉宿
column6: Hot Spring Inn

column5:
南蛮屋は　なんでも　火の勇者を\n
江戸へ　行かせないために\n
箱根の関を　おさえているそうだ！！
column6: That overseas merchant ordered the Hakone barrier to be closed to prevent the Fire Heroes from going to Edo!

column5:
南蛮屋は　なんで　あんなに\n
お金を　欲しがるんだろう！\n
ちょっと　イジョウだぜ！！
column6: Why does that merchant love money so much? That goes beyond greed!

column5:
ここは　温泉やど！！\n
今どき　なんと　タダ！！\n
泊らないとソン！！　泊まる？！
column6:
This is a hot spring inn! It's completely free! You should stay for a while!\n
How about it?

column5: また　おいで！！
column6: Come back!

column5: ごゆっくり！！
column6: Rest well!

column5: 茶店
column6: Tea House

column5:
いらっしゃいませー！\n
ここは　茶店でーす！！\n
ごようは　なあに？
column6:
Welcome to my tea house!\n
How may I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それじゃ　また　きてねー
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: 神社
column6: Shrine

column5:
湖の橋を　渡ったところの　石は\n
白タカさま　なのじゃ\n
あんな　おすがたに・・・　シクシク
column6: Cross the lake's bridge and you'll find an ominous boulder. That used to be our sacred White Hawk...Sob, sob...

column5:
火の一族の　勇者でしたか！！\n
白タカさまが　くださった　武器で\n
このジパングを　お救いください！
column6: O hero of the Fire Clan! Use the weapons of the sacred White Hawk to save Jipang!

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
東の　さがみの国は　ジパングの中で\n
いっとう　大門教徒の　多いところじゃ\n
ジライアさん　お気をつけなされよ
column6:
The lands of Sagami, to the east, are completely under Daimonist control.\n
You must be careful there, Ziria-san.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
ふるい　伝説に　よると\n
火の一族は　ガマ　ヘビ　ナメクジ族の\n
３つに　わかれた　そうじゃ
column6: According to ancient legend, the Fire Clan is comprised of the Toad, Snake, and Slug clans.

column5: しゅぜん寺村
column6: Shuzenji Village

column5:
火事で　家や　米ぐらが　焼けたり\n
つつみが　きれて　田畑が\n
水びたしに　なったり
column6: Our village has been hit by a series of unfortunate accidents...

column5:
ちかごろ　この村では\n
不幸な　事故ばかり　\n
続いているんですよ
column6: A fire burned down many houses and the granary...Then the embankment ruptured, flooding our rice fields...

column5:
だけど　そういう　事故が起こるたび\n
助けてくれるのが\n
南蛮屋さんと　大門教なんです
column6: But the Merchant and the Cult of Daimon were always there to help us.

column5:
ここは　しゅぜんじ村\n
とても　よい村よ！
column6:
Welcome to Shuzenji Village.\n
Lovely place, isn't it?

column5:
おれら　助けていただいた\n
南蛮屋さまには\n
足を向けて　寝られませんだ！
column6: We'll always be grateful to the Merchant!
column7:
ZenkiTN: I realize now I don't really like "overseas merchant"... Maybe I should just use his Daimonist name Gouyokku.
Supper: I've opted for "the Merchant" in most instances, which I think gives the desired vibe

column5:
大門教に　入れば\n
いろんな　ものが　タダなの\n
入会して　よかったわ
column6:
Once you join the Cult of Daimon, you get all kinds of things for free.\n
I'm so glad I joined!

column5: 大門教に　だまされてたわ・・・
column6: Those Daimonists deceived me...

column5:
南蛮屋には\n
ハクライもんの　珍しかもんばかり\n
売っとるんさ
column6: The Merchant sells many exotic products imported from foreign countries.

column5:
おれは　プディングが　好きさ\n
なんだか　食べるたびに　たましいが\n
軽うなって　いくような　気がするんさ
column6: Lately, I'm into a sweet called {pudding.} It's so delicious, I feel my soul slip away with every bite!

column5:
南蛮屋が　大門教だったのか！\n
だまされとったさ
column6: You mean that merchant was a Daimonist? I can't believe I fell for it!

column5:
南蛮屋さんには　おカネが\n
ザックザック・・・　すごいですなあ\n
わたしも　ああ　なりたいですなあ
column6:
The Merchant is loaded with money...He's so cool.\n
I want to be like him.

column5:
南蛮屋が　なくなって\n
ふつうの村に　もどれたんですなあ\n
これで　よかったんですなあ
column6:
Now that the merchant is gone, our village is back to normal.\n
I guess this isn't so bad.

column5:
大門教の　人たちって\n
ほんとうに　すばらしいわ！\n
わたし　涙が　出ちゃった！！
column6:
The Daimonists are all wonderful people!\n
I'm always moved by their kindness!

column5:
東の川の　堤が　きれたときも\n
水の中に　コシまで　つかって\n
泥だらけに　なりながら　修理してたわ
column6: Some time ago, the embankment on the east river broke down, but the Daimonists went there and repaired it themselves!

column5: これで　平和に　なれるわ
column6: Peace is finally back.

column5:
ウソつきの　子どもの\n
いってることを\n
信じちゃ　いけないよ！
column6:
Don't listen to that kid!\n
He's just a liar!

column5:
あたしら　おとなが　バカだった！\n
子どもの　ことを　信じていれば
column6:
How could we adults be so foolish?\n
We should have listened to that kid!

column5:
ぼく　ウソつきじゃ　ないよ！\n
ボク　見たんだよ！
column6: Bwaaah! I'm not a liar! I really saw it!

column5:
南蛮屋から　出て行った人たちがね\n
家に　火を　つけたんだよ\n
信じてくれよ！！
column6:
People came out from the import shop and set fire to the houses!\n
It's true! I'm not lying!

column5:
ね！　やっぱり\n
ぼく　ウソつきじゃ\n
なかったでしょ
column6: See? I told you I wasn't lying!

column5:
お金持ちの　南蛮屋さんに\n
この村を　もっと\n
りっぱに　してもらわねば！！
column6:
The Merchant is going to bring wealth and prosperity to our village!\n
You'll see!

column5:
お金に　目が　くらんで\n
心を　なくして　いました\n
はずかしい　ことです
column6:
I was blinded by greed...\n
I'm ashamed of myself.

column5:
南蛮屋？！\n
ありゃ　人間のかたちをした\n
オニだよ！！
column6: That merchant is a demon in disguise, I tell you!

column5:
あんなやつに　借金をするのも\n
バカだけど\n
大門教に　入らないからって
column6: I was dumb enough to get a loan from him. And you know what he told me when I refused to join the Cult of Daimon?

column5:
借金の　カタに\n
なにも　一人娘を　連れて\n
行かなくったって　いいじゃないか！！
column6:
He said that according to the contract, he can take my daughter as collateral!\n
That's messed up!

column5:
きょう　食うものにも　こまってるが\n
たとえ　草の根　食ってでも\n
おれは　大門教に　入らねぇぞ！！
column6: I have nothing to eat...But I'd rather eat grass off of the ground than join the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
くそーっ！　南蛮屋め！！\n
この手で　こらしめて　やりてぇが\n
そのための　武器を　買う　金もない！
column6:
Damn that merchant! I'd love to get a sword and give him what's what...\n
But I don't even have the cash to buy one!

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
この村は\n
大門教に　入らないと\n
生きていけない　ところだ！！
column6: Life is hard in this town if you don't join the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
早く　出て行かないと\n
おれまで　南蛮屋に　はめられて\n
大門教に　入れられっちまう！！
column6: I'd better leave quick before that merchant tricks me into joining!

column5:
勇者の人たちが　村を　すくって\n
くれたんだ！　ありがたい　ことだ\n
ナンマイダ　ナンマイダ
column6:
You are the heroes who saved the village! Thank you so much!\n
Praise the Gods for sending you!

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　６５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両65 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　６５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両65 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: 武具屋
column6: Armory

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　武具屋です\n
ご用件は　何ですか？
column6:
Welcome to my armory!\n
How can I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それでは　また　ご利用ください
column6: Come back anytime.

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 預かり所
column6: Warehouse

column5: 南蛮屋
column6: Import Shop

column5:
まいど　おいでやす！\n
ここは　信用第一の　南蛮屋だす！\n
なんぞ　ご用でっか？
column6: Welcome, welcome! If you're looking for high-quality exotic goods from overseas, look no further! What'll it be?

column5:
お客さんやから　案内してますのや\n
あんまり　知らん人に\n
店のこと　話さんといてや！
column6: Since you're a paying customer, let me just mention -- don't go telling strangers too much about our shop!
column7:
CHECK
NOTE: this is what he says when you leave the menu after making a purchase. if you don't buy anything, you just get the "come back anytime" message.

column5: ほな　また　おいでませ
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: ほな　また　おいでませ
column6: Come back anytime!

column5:
おいでやす！　ここでしか\n
手に　入らん　世界の一流品が\n
店んなか　ぎょうさん　ありまっせ
column6: We have many unique goods from all over the world! You won't find these anywhere else in Jipang!

column5: ゆっくり　見とっとくなはれや
column6: Take a look around!

column5:
主人は教会に行くと　なかなか\n
もどってこないんです
column6:
The owner rarely comes by.\n
He's usually at the church.

column5: 大門教会
column6: Daimon Church

column5:
この教会の中の　人のほとんどは\n
火事で　家を　失った　人たちです
column6: These poor souls have lost their homes to a terrible fire.

column5:
気の毒な　かれらの　ために\n
１００両の　寄付を\n
おねがい　いたします？
column6: Would you make a donation of 両100 to provide them with the bare necessities?

column5:
神は　あなたの　行ないを　\n
いつも　見て　いらっしゃいますよ
column6: Remember: God is always watching you.

column5:
さあ　お入りください\n
同志と　ともに　神に　祈りましょう！
column6: Please, come on in. Let us pray together.

column5:
なんだ！　お金もっていないじゃ\n
ないですか！　かえって　ください\n
教会には　いれられない！
column6:
What?! You don't have enough money?!\n
Leave at once! This church isn't for you!

column5:
この教会の　中の　人のほとんどは\n
水害で　田畑を　失った　人たちです
column6: These poor souls have lost their fields to a terrible flood.

column5:
気の毒な　かれらの　ために\n
１０００両の　寄付を\n
おねがい　いたします？
column6: Would you make a donation of 両1,000 to provide them with the bare necessities?

column5:
さあ　お入りください\n
同志と　ともに　神に　祈りましょう！
column6: Please, come on in. Let us pray together.

column5:
神は　あなたの　行ないを　\n
いつも　見て　いらっしゃいますよ
column6: Remember: God is always watching you.

column5:
そうですか！\n
さあ　なかへ　どうぞ
column6: Thank you. Please, come on in.

column5:
なんだ！　お金もっていないじゃ\n
ないですか！　かえって　ください\n
教会には　いれられない！
column6:
What?! You don't have enough money?!\n
Leave at once! This church isn't for you!

column5:
この教会の中は　火事で\n
家を　失った村の者で\n
いっぱいです
column6: This church is filled with those who lost their homes to a fire.

column5:
不老不死　不老不死\n
お金も　ほしい　不老不死\n
死んでも　命が　あるように！
column6:
Eternal life...Eternal life...\n
I want infinite wealth and eternal life...

column5:
南蛮屋さんの　はからいで\n
他の村に　新しい家が　\n
もらえる　そうなんです
column6: The Merchant is arranging new homes for us in another village.

column5:
わたし　新しい土地で\n
イチから　がんばる　つもりです！
column6: I'll have to start from scratch, but I look forward to my new life!

column5:
ジライアさん　雲切りの里の者です\n
大門教徒に化けて　じょうほうを\n
集めていました
column6:
Ziria-san, I'm from Kumogiri Hamlet.\n
I'm here undercover to gather intel.

column5:
となりの　教会の部屋の　すみを\n
調べてください\n
なにか　ヒミツが　ありそうなんですよ
column6: You should check the corner of the hall of the neighboring church. Apparently, there's some kind of secret in there.

column5:
はあ　体のいたみが　きえていく・・・\n
ずつう　かたこり　せいりつう\n
なんでも　なおる！　大門教さまさまや
column6: The Cult of Daimon cured my headache, my stiff neck, and even my period cramps! Say goodbye to pain! Join the Cult!
column7: ZenkiTN: I'm surprised a Japanese game would mention period cramps. I tried to make it sound like a painkiller ad.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
こないだ　米を　いっぱい　つんだまま\n
わしの船は　沈んでしまったんじゃ\n
首でも　つろうかと　思っとったら
column6: A while back, my ship filled with rice sank. It was such a loss that I actually considered hanging myself...

column5:
南蛮屋さんが　いらして\n
大門教に　入ったら　新しい船を\n
くれると　いうてくれたんじゃ
column6: But then the Merchant told me he'd give me a new ship for free. I just had to join the Cult of Daimon.

column5:
大門教なんか　わしゃ　スカンけんど\n
首　つるよりは　ずっと　マシかと\n
家のもんに　話しとったん　ですわ
column6: I didn't really like the idea, but my family convinced me it was better than taking my own life.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
いつぞや　南蛮屋は\n
「お金が　命だ」と　いっておった\n
なんと　がめつい　やつじゃ！！
column6: Some time back, that merchant mentioned that to him, {money is life.} What a creepy fellow!

column5:
ジライア殿の　盗みの技で\n
あいつの　命とやらを　とって\n
やったらどうじゃ　試してみなされ！
column6: You should try using your stealing technique to take his {life} away, Ziria-dono!
column7: ZenkiTN: this is a hint at the solution for the boss battle. Gouyokku has 65535 HP, but stealing his HP also doubles as the money he carries, so you're supposed to keep stealing until he's dead.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
お寺の　おはかを　こわして\n
大門教会を　ぶったて　やがって\n
南蛮屋のやろう！！
column6: That overseas merchant tore down the cemetery to build his stupid Daimon church! I hate him so much!

column5:
うちの亭主は　南蛮屋さまのことを\n
悪く　いいますが\n
わたしは　そうは　思いません！！
column6: My husband is convinced the Merchant is a bad person, but I don't think so!

column5:
さすがは　うちの亭主！！\n
わたしの　えらんだ　男！！\n
ホレ　なおしました！！
column6: My husband was right! That's why I married him! Oh, I'm falling for him all over again!

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
この村では　ちかごろ　やたら\n
火事が多くて　焼け出された　人たちは\n
大門教会を　かり住まいに　しています
column6: There's been so many fires lately. A lot of people are living inside the Daimon church for the time being.

column5: 地下への　階段を　見つけた
column6: You find a staircase leading underground.

column5: あっ！
column6: Ah!

column5: 床に　かすかな　スキマがある
column6: You notice a thin gap around this floor tile.

column5: 大門教会
column6: Daimon Church

column5:
この教会の中の　人のほとんどは\n
火事で　家を　失った　人たちです
column6: These poor souls have lost their homes to a terrible fire.

column5:
気の毒な　かれらの　ために\n
１００両の　寄付を\n
おねがい　いたします？
column6: Would you make a donation of 両100 to provide them with the bare necessities?

column5:
神は　あなたの　行ないを　\n
いつも　見て　いらっしゃいますよ
column6: Remember: God is always watching you.

column5:
なんだ！　お金もっていないじゃ\n
ないですか！　かえって　ください\n
教会には　いれられない！
column6:
What?! You don't have enough money?!\n
Leave at once! This church isn't for you!

column5:
さあ　お入りください\n
同志と　ともに　神に　祈りましょう！
column6: Please, come on in. Let us pray together.

column5:
さあ　どうぞ　なかへ\n
みなさん　あつまってますよ！
column6: Please, come on in and join the others.

column5:
この教会の　中の　人のほとんどは\n
水害で　田畑を　失った　人たちです
column6: These poor souls have lost their fields to a terrible flood.

column5:
気の毒な　かれらの　ために\n
１０００両の　寄付を\n
おねがい　いたします？
column6: Would you make a donation of 両1,000 to provide them with the bare necessities?

column5:
神は　あなたの　行ないを　\n
いつも　見て　いらっしゃいますよ
column6: Remember: God is always watching you.

column5:
さあ　お入りください\n
同志と　ともに　神に　祈りましょう！
column6: Please, come on in. Let us pray together.

column5:
なんだ！　お金もっていないじゃ\n
ないですか！　かえってください\n
教会には　いれられない！
column6:
What?! You don't have enough money?!\n
Leave at once! This church isn't for you!

column5:
南蛮屋さんが　たててくださる　家は\n
ずいぶん　遠い土地らしいんですが\n
そんなことは　気にしてませんよ
column6: The new houses we're getting from the overseas merchant are far away from here, but I don't mind much.

column5:
一日も　早く　ウチにも\n
家の　割り当てが　回って　来ないかと\n
いなくなる人を　見るたび　思うんです
column6: Every time I see someone leave, I keep hoping I'll be the next lucky fellow!

column5:
いのっていると　たのしいの\n
イヤな　ことが　みんな\n
消えて　いくような　気がするの
column6: I like praying. It feels like all the bad things are fading away.

column5:
もう一つの　教会にも　私たちと\n
同じように　大門教に　救いを\n
求めている人たちが　いるのです！
column6: The other church is also filled with those who have been saved by the Cult of Daimon.

column5:
さあ\n
あなたたちも　いっしょに\n
いのりましょう！
column6: Come, let us pray together!

column5:
おや！　ジライアはん！\n
わてが　南蛮屋だす\n
ツナデは　めんこいのう
column6:
'Ey, Ziria! Just your local Merchant here. Izzat darling Tsunade?\n
Cute as a button, ain't she!
column7:
ZenkiTN: I should mention that Gouyokku has an Osaka-ben accent. His dialogue could use some extra pizzazz.
Supper: well, you asked for it!

column5:
どうだ　ジライアはん！！\n
その　ツナデ　１０００両で\n
売りまへんか？
column6:
How 'bout it, Ziria?\n
What say ya sells her to me for 両1,000?

column5:
ほれ　見てみい　ツナデ！\n
ジライアも　欲ボケじゃ！\n
友情も　なにも　あらへんで
column6:
Hoo! Ya hearin' this, Tsunade?\n
Ziria'd sell his friends for easy dough! He might be greedier than me!

column5:
さあ！　やりましょ　ジライアはん！\n
わてが　大門教１３人衆の　８番手\n
ゴーヨックだす！
column6:
Now get ready, Ziria!\n
I'm the eighth of the Thirteen Daimon Cultists, Gouyokku!

column5:
そんな　ムチャ　やがな・・・\n
よろしい　ほな　１００万両や\n
ツナデを　売ってくれはりまっか？
column6:
Ya drives a hard bargain, pal...\n
All right! I'll give ya 両1,000,000 for 'er!

column5:
いや　たいした　友情だすな！\n
ごりっぱや！　しかたないな\n
大門教１３人衆の　８番手
column6:
What a beauuuutiful friendship! Brings a tear to my eye.\n
Allow me to introduce myself...

column5:
この　ゴーヨックが　ぼちぼち\n
あいてに　なりまひょ！\n
わて　ほんまに　つおいで！！
column6:
I'm the eighth of the Thirteen Daimon Cultists, Gouyokku!\n
Lemme warn ya...I'm pretty strong!

column5: 寺
column6: Temple

column5:
大門教に入れば　不老不死に　なるから\n
はかなど　いらぬと　いって\n
境内に　大門教会を　たておった！
column6: Those Daimonists claimed there wouldn't be any need for cemeteries once they achieve eternal life...

column5:
ひどい　はなしじゃ！！\n
それなのに　みな　だまされおって\n
大門教に　入会してしまった！！
column6: That's how they convinced the villagers to convert and let them build their churches on our holy ground!

column5:
だれか　この村を\n
救って　くれない　ものか！！\n
ナンマイダ　ナンマイダ・・・
column6: Can Shuzenji be saved before the end? May the Gods have mercy...

column5:
勇者の人たちが　村を　すくって\n
くれたんだ！　ありがたい　ことだ\n
ナンマイダ　ナンマイダ
column6:
You are the heroes who saved the village! Thank you so much!\n
Praise the Gods for sending you!

column5:
関所のサクは　かたく\n
閉ざされている
column6: The gate is sealed shut.

column5: なにもありませんでした
column6: You find nothing.

column5: 箱根の関
column6: Hakone Barrier

column5:
おれは　南蛮屋から\n
なにも　もらっておらんぞ！\n
ツマラン　いいがかりを　つけるな！
column6: Say whaaat? The merchant bribed me? No way! I'd never accept a bribe! I mean, whaaat?

column5:
この　箱根の関は\n
大門教以外は　通さん！\n
かえれ！！
column6:
The Hakone barrier is closed!\n
Only loyal Daimonists may pass!

column5:
ちぇっ！　いつから\n
通れなく　なっちまったんだ！\n
まったくよ！　ふざけんな！
column6:
What do you mean, it's closed?!\n
You gotta be kidding me!

column5:
ありがとうございます\n
これで　さがみに帰れます
column6: Thank you. I can finally go back to Sagami.

column5:
さがみの国の　あたみ温泉に\n
行きたいんじゃ！\n
俳句の会が　あるんじゃ！！
column6: I need to go to Atami Hot Spring in Sagami! I miss the haiku club!

column5:
ありがとうございます\n
あたみ温泉に　行くことがありましたら\n
ぜひ　俳句の会を　のぞいてくだされ
column6: Thank you. If you ever go to Atami Hot Spring, you should pay a visit to the haiku club!

column5:
関所の　向こうの　さがみ国じゃあ\n
大門教が　大はやりずら\n
世も末ずら！！
column6: The lands of Sagami are just beyond the barrier. It seems the Cult of Daimon is very popular there...How dreadful.

column5:
橋を渡って　北へ行けば\n
白タカさまの　三島村！\n
南へ行けば　しゅぜん寺村よ
column6:
If you cross the bridge west from here and head north, you'll find Mishima Village, where the sacred White Hawk lives!
#BOXPAUSE()
Go south from the bridge and you'll find Shuzenji Village.

column5:
この　さがみ国には\n
「アシモト　五兄弟」っていう\n
とんでもない　やつらが　いてよお
column6: A word of warning...During your travels in Sagami, you're going to come across the Ashimoto Quintuplets.

column5:
旅人に　おそれられてんだよお\n
あんたも　せいぜい　気をつけなよ！\n
すぐ　人の足元　見てくるからよお！
column6:
They're a nightmare for all travelers!\n
Don't let them take advantage of you!
column7: ZenkiTN: "ashimoto o miru" means "take advantage". It gets lost in translation, but it's a play on their name.

column5:
この関所から　ひんがしに　行きゃあ\n
ジパングで　一番　でっけえ温泉町\n
あたみ温泉が　ありますけん！！
column6: Go east from here and you'll find Atami Hot Spring, the biggest hot spring town in Jipang!

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
理想郷を　つくるとかいいながら\n
結局　大門教にのみ　つごうのいい\n
世界になるんだ
column6: The Cult of Daimon keeps talking about making a perfect world, but you can bet it's only going to be perfect for them.

column5:
南蛮屋の　借金の取り立てが\n
きびしくって　夜逃げして来ました\n
なんとかしてください　ジライアさん
column6: I had to skip town before that overseas merchant came to collect his debt, {or else.} Please, do something about him!

column5:
ありがとうございます\n
これで　しゅぜん寺に　帰れます
column6: Thank you. I can finally go back to Shuzenji Village.

column5:
雲切の里の者です！！\n
まだ　大門教は　マサカドの復活に\n
てまどって　いるようです
column6:
I'm from Kumogiri Hamlet!\n
It seems the Cult of Daimon is having some trouble reviving Masakado.

column5:
そのため　火の勇者の　ジライアさんが\n
江戸に　着けないように\n
時間かせぎを　しているようです
column6: That's why they're trying to delay your arrival in Edo as much as possible.

column5:
箱根の関を　止めたのも\n
どうやら　そのためのようです
column6: Closing the Hakone barrier must have been one of their attempts to buy time.

column5:
この先も　まだ　大門教のワナが\n
待ち受けていると　思います\n
お気をつけて！　ジライアさん！！
column6: I'm sure they've set many other traps along the way. Stay sharp, Ziria-san!

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　６５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両65 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　６５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両65 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 預かり所
column6: Warehouse

column5: 茶店
column6: Tea House

column5:
いらっしゃいませー！\n
ここは　茶店でーす！！\n
ごようは　なあに？
column6:
Welcome to my tea house!\n
How may I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それじゃ　また　きてねー
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: 大門教会
column6: Daimon Church

column5:
なによぉ　これ・・・\n
なにも　入っていないじゃないの\n
ふん！
column6:
What? Nothing?\n
No fair!\n
Hmph!

column5:
ドカッ！\n
と　けりを入れる\n
ツナデだった
column6:
THUD!\n
Tsunade kicked the casket in frustration.

column5: つづらの下から階段が現れた
column6: The casket was hiding a staircase.

column5: 中には　何も　入っていなかった
column6: There is nothing inside.

column5: つづらの中を　調べた
column6: You look inside the casket.

column5: つづらの中を　調べた
column6: You look inside the casket.

column5:
突然　中から　影が\n
飛び出してきた
column6: Suddenly, a shadow leaps out.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
中には　金　２０００両が　入っていた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There are 両2000 inside.

column5: 金　２０００両を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained 両2000.

column5: どうやら　下につづいているようだ
column6: You should be able to go further down below.

column6: Daimon Church

column5: 武具屋
column6: Armory

column5: 箱根の関所
column6: Hakone Barrier

column5:
ぼくらは夏には\n
芦の湖で遊ぶんだ
column6: We like playing at Lake Ashi in the summer.

column5:
風魔の取り締まりで\n
俺たちにまでとばっちりがきてる\n
迷惑な話だぜ
column6: We're getting mixed up in this Fuuma business. What a bother.

column5:
風魔一族をひっとらえるまで\n
ここは通行止めだ
column6: Access is closed until the Fuuma Clan has been apprehended.

column5: ここは箱根の関所じゃ！
column6: This is the Hakone barrier.

column5: 大門教会
column6: Daimon Church

column5:

なにも　入っていないじゃないの\n
ふん！

No fair!\n
Hmph!

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
なんの用だい\n
ここは宿屋じゃないぜ
column6: What do you want? This isn't the inn.

column5:
みぐるみはがされない内に\n
さっさと出て行きな
column6: Get out of here before you lose everything you own.

column5: 食物屋
column6: Eatery

column5:
いらっしゃい\n
なににいたしますか
column6: Welcome! What can I get you?

column5: ありがとうございました
column6: You have our gratitude.

column5:
・・・・・・\n
ありがとうございました\n
シブシブ・・
column6:
...\n
Yeah, yeah. Thank you or something...

column5: 大門教会
column6: Daimon Church

column5:
なによぉ　これ・・・\n
なにも　入っていないじゃないの\n
ふん！

Hmph!

column6: Daimon Church
