中には　何も　入っていなかった
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
There is nothing inside.

column5:
つづらの中を　調べた\n
突然　中から　大きな影が\n
飛び出してきた
column6:
You look inside the casket.\n
Suddenly, a large shadow leaps out.

column5:
うう〜　苦しいよ〜\n
はやく　楽にしてくれ〜
column6:
Urgh...I'm suffering...\n
Please, deliver me from this pain...

column5:
人の　恨みや　憎しみの　こもった\n
たましいほど　マサカドは\n
よろこぶって　いうんだ
column6: Masakado delights in souls filled with regret and hatred...

column5:
ここにいる　たましいは　みんな\n
マサカドに　喰われちまうんだ\n
つぎは　おれの番かもしれない
column6: Masakado consumes the souls that end up here...It could be my turn next...

column5:
はやく　わたしたちを\n
もとの姿に　もどしてください！
column6: Please, return us to our bodies!

column5: 呉服屋・・・
column6: Kimono Shop

column5:
ここは呉服屋です\n
来る所をお間違えじゃありませんか
column6:
This is a kimono shop!\n
You have no business here!

column5: 裏へ回りな
column6: Go around the back.

column5:
貧乏人にゃあ用はねェよ\n
さっさと消えな
column6:
You have no business here, you bum.\n
Get lost.

column5:
はいらんのか？\n
まぁせいぜい気を付ける\n
こったな
column6:
You don't want to? All right.\n
Be careful out there.

column5: 親分にごあいさつしろ！
column6: Give my regards to the chief!

column5: じゃあな！　しっかりやれよ！
column6: Good luck out there! See ya!

column5: 必要になったらいつでも来いよ！
column6: Come back whenever you need!

column5:
左大臣の屋敷には\n
出入りのある酒屋から\n
忍び込めるって話だ！
column6: They say you can sneak into the Minister of the Left's residence from the brewery!

column5: 材木屋
column6: Lumber Dealer

column5:
お店をお間違いじゃないですか　　\n
ここは材木屋ですよ！
column6:
You have the wrong store.\n
I'm a lumber dealer!

column5: どいた！　どいた！
column6: Out of the way!

column5: 盗人訓練所
column6: Thieving School

column5:
ここは　大門教を　やっつけるために\n
ぬすっとを　養成する\n
通称　ぬすっと訓練所です！！
column6: This is a Thieving School, where you can improve your thievery in order to help defeat the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
奥の　部屋に　入って\n
教官を　よけて\n
つづらの中の　お金を　とるんです！
column6: Head inside, avoid the instructors, and steal the money from the casket!

column5:
みごと　お金を　とることに\n
成功したら\n
そのお金は　あなたのものです！
column6: If you can steal the money successfully, you get to keep it for yourself!

column5:
まあ　遊びだと　おもって\n
気軽に　たのしんでくださいよ！\n
だけど　マサカド打倒も　お忘れなく！
column6:
Think of it as a game and have fun!\n
But don't forget your quest to defeat Masakado!

column5: 呉服屋・・・
column6: Kimono Shop

column5:
ここは呉服屋です\n
来る所をお間違えじゃありませんか
column6:
This is a kimono shop!\n
You have no business here!

column5: 裏へ回りな
column6: Go around the back.

column5:
盗人保険に入らねェか？\n
保険に入りゃ重傷を負ったとき\n
救助隊が迎えにいくぜ
column6:
Would you like to buy a Thief Insurance?\n
If you have our insurance, we'll send a rescue team if you get hurt badly.

column5: 確かに！ぞんぶんにおやんなせえ
column6: I see. Suit yourself.

column5:
気が付きなさったか\n
よかった、よかった\n
また、旅に出なさるのけえ
column6:
You've made the right choice.\n
Good luck in your travels.

column5: 気をつけてな
column6: Stay sharp.

column5:
貧乏人にゃあ用はねェよ\n
さっさと消えな
column6:
You have no business here, you bum.\n
Get lost.

column5:
はいらんのか？\n
まぁせいぜい気を付ける\n
こったな
column6:
You don't want to? All right.\n
Be careful out there.

column5:
盗人宿では武器や盗みの道具も\n
売ってるんだぜいるかい
column6: The Thief Inn sells weapons and thieves' tools.

column5: じゃあな！　しっかりやれよ！
column6: Good luck out there! See ya!

column5: 必要になったらいつでも来いよ！
column6: Come back whenever you need!

column5:
左大臣の屋敷には\n
出入りのある酒屋から\n
忍び込めるって話だ！
column6: They say you can sneak into the Minister of the Left's residence from the brewery!

column5: 材木屋
column6: Lumber Dealer

column5:
お店をお間違いじゃないですか　　\n
ここは材木屋ですよ！
column6:
You have the wrong store.\n
I'm a lumber dealer!

column5: どいた！　どいた！
column6: Out of the way!

column5: 芭蕉庵
column6: Bashou Hermitage

column5: ＲＥＤ
column6: RED
column7: ZenkiTN: this is most likely an inside joke from the developers. RED is the name of their company. I bet the NPCs in here are some of the staff.

column5:
私が小林です\n
ただそれだけ・・・
column6:
I'm Kobayashi.\n
That's it.

column5:
うぃー　ひっく\n
どぶろくがうまい\n
監督とよんでね
column6:
Hic...This moonshine's great.\n
Don't tell my boss.

column5: 吉原１号店
column6: Yoshiwara N.1

column5: にぃさん　いらっしゃい！
column6: Welcome, handsome!

column5:
ウフフフ・・・・\n
遊んでいきなまし
column6: Tee-hee...Do you want to play with me?

column5: まあ！いい男！
column6: Hello, cutie!

column5: 吉原２号店
column6: Yoshiwara N.2

column5: いらっしゃいませ
column6: Welcome.

column5: 遊んでいきなさいよお
column6: Here to play?

column5: まけとくからさぁ！
column6: I'll give you a discount!

column5: 吉原３号店
column6: Yoshiwara N.3

column5:
よぉ！\n
にいさん常連だね
column6: Hi! You must be regular!

column5: さぁ　遊んでいきなまし
column6: Are you here to play?

column5: 吉原４号店
column6: Yoshiwara N.4

column5:
若い兄さんには\n
刺激がつよいよ
column6: Aren't you a little young for this?

column5: 遊んでいきなまし
column6: Let's go play.

column5: パフパフ・・・・
column6: Puff puff...

column5: 吉原５号店
column6: Yoshiwara N.5

column5: [f7]<$80>月姫！！　早く逃げろ！
column6: [f7]<$80>Tsukihime! Run!

column5: 吉原６号店
column6: Yoshiwara N.6

column5:
兄さん\n
いい娘がいるよ
column6: We have the best ladies, friend!

column5: 遊ばない？
column6: Here to play?

column5: まあ！いい男！
column6: Hello, cutie!

column5: 見せ物小屋
column6: Show Tent

column5: 吉原
column6: Yoshiwara

column5:
誰だ\n
今夜は左大臣清勝様の貸し切りだ\n
あやしいやつめ！！
column6: Who are you? The place has been reserved for Minister of the Left Kiyomasa-sama!

column5:
ああ　かわいそう\n
月姫様が危ないでありんす\n
だれか　おたすけを〜
column6: How sad...Tsukihime-sama is in danger. Who will help her?

column5:
おまえさまは強いねえ\n
あちきと遊ばないかい
column6: You look strong. Will you play with me?

column5:
左大臣は２人の怒鬼という\n
用心棒を連れてありんす\n
おそろし〜
column6: The Minister of the Left brought two Doki as bodyguards. Isn't that scary?

column5:
ほんとうは\n
あちきは左大臣が大嫌い\n
自来也さますてきでありんす
column6:
The truth is...I hate the Minister.\n
But you look quite handsome, Ziria.

column5:
左大臣は女ったらしでありんす\n
月姫様になにをなさるか分かりません\n
月姫様　かわいそう
column6:
The Minister of the Left is a womanizer.\n
I don't know what he'll do to Tsukihime-sama. Ahhh, how sad...

column5:
これで江戸も\n
すこしは平和になるのね
column6: Edo should be a little more peaceful now.

column5:
おとこは好きだけど\n
左大臣の清ちゃんは\n
ヘンタイだから嫌いでありんす
column6:
I like men, but I don't like Kiyo-chan.\n
He's too much of a pervert.

column5:
よくみれば\n
おまえさまも\n
いい男じゃない
column6:
Now that I take a closer look...\n
You're pretty handsome, you know?

column5: 江戸
column6: Edo

column5: 前橋
column6: Maebashi

column5: 川越
column6: Kawagoe

column5:
俺は大門教徒であることが誇りだ\n
マサカド様が復活して\n
俺たちの国がもうすぐできるだろう
column6:
I'm proud to be a Daimonist.\n
Soon Masakado will be revived, and Jipang will be ours.

column5:
ここは川越の町よ\n
江戸のうわさが\n
町中で聞けるわ
column6: This is Kawagoe. We hear all sorts of rumors from Edo.

column5:
わしはちょっと前まで\n
出稼ぎにでておって\n
江戸の町で穴を掘っておったんだ
column6: I was digging holes in Edo until recently.

column5:
江戸の右大臣様と左大臣様の争いは\n
たいへんなものらしい\n
月姫様のユウカイもどちらかの
column6: It seems the conflict between the Ministers of the Right and Left is getting serious.

column5:
仕業だと言う者まであるそうじゃ\n
かわいそうに月姫様\n
御無事であられるといいが
column6:
There's even rumors that one of them is behind Tsukihime-sama's kidnapping.\n
Ah, poor girl. I hope she's well...

column5:
滝川様の御病気\n
随分悪いと聞いております\n
奥方様は看病もなさらないとか・・・
column6: I heard that Takigawa-sama is very sick, and that his wife doesn't seem to care...

column5:
江戸の猿若座に\n
歌舞伎を見に行きたいなァ！
column6: I wish I could see a kabuki play at Edo's Saruwakaza Theater!

column5:
この町にも大門教に\n
かぶれた者がおる\n
困った事じゃ
column6: Way too many people here seem to like the Cult of Daimon. It's worrying.

column5:
江戸の滝川殿は病気がちで\n
左大臣の清勝が\n
城を牛耳っているという話だ
column6: They say that ever since Takigawa-dono's illness, Minister of the Left Kiyomasa controls Edo.

column5:
江戸にゃ雲霧の親分が\n
来ていなさるそうだ
column6: I heard that Chief Kumogiri went to Edo.

column5:
盗人村は気をつけといても\n
物をスラれるぜ\n
かくごしときな
column6: Don't go to the Thief Village, unless you want to be robbed blind.

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
お泊まりは　２０両です\n
泊まりますか？
column6:
Welcome!\n
It's 両20 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お早ようございます\n
いってらっしゃいませ
column6:
I hope you enjoyed your stay.\n
Have a nice day.

column5: いつでも　ご利用下さい
column6: Come back anytime.

column5: ごゆっくり！
column6: Rest well!

column5:
お客様・・・・\n
お金が足りないですよ
column6: Uhm, sir...You don't have enough money.

column5: 材木屋
column6: Lumber Dealer

column5:
お店をお間違いじゃないですか　　\n
ここは材木屋ですよ！
column6:
You have the wrong store.\n
I'm a lumber dealer!

column5: どいた！　どいた！
column6: Out of the way!

column5: 回船問屋
column6: Shipping Agency

column5:
帰った帰った！\n
ここは小売はしてないよ
column6:
Scram, kid!\n
We don't do business with the general public!

column5:
まだいたのか！\n
さっさと出て行かないと\n
奉行所を呼ぶぞ！
column6:
Are you still here?\n
Get going before I report you to the magistrate!

column5: 寺
column6: Temple

column5: 刀鍛治
column6: Swordsmith

column5:
親方のウデはたしかだよ\n
新品同様になるよ
column6:
The master is very talented.\n
It'll be as good as new.

column5: 矢切の渡し
column6: Yagiri Ferry

column5:
舟は出たばかりだ\n
しばらく来ないよ
column6:
The ferry just left.\n
It'll be a while before it comes back.

column5:
ここからは渡れないから\n
江戸の南の六郷橋を渡って\n
相模に出るといいよ
column6: To go to Sagami, you'll have to cross the Rokugo Bridge south of Edo.

column5: 茶店
column6: Tea House

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ダンゴにお茶はいかがですか
column6: Welcome! Would you like some dango to go with your tea?

column5: まいど、ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you for your patronage!

column5: またどうぞ！
column6: See you soon!

column5: 相模国
column6: Sagami

column5: あたみ温泉
column6: Atami Hot Spring

column5:
ここは　温泉で\n
有名な　あたみ村　です
column6: This is Atami Village, renowned for its hot springs!

column5:
村に　入るとき\n
温泉代として　みなさんから\n
１００両　いただいてるんです
column6: To meet the increasing demand of the market, we ask all visitors to pay a small fee of 両100.

column5: お支払い　いただけますか？\n
column6: Is that all right with you?

column5:
ここは　温泉で\n
有名な　あたみ村　です
column6: This is Atami Village, renowned for its hot springs!

column5:
村に　入るとき\n
温泉代として　みなさんから\n
１００両　いただいてるんです
column6: To meet the increasing demand of the market, we ask all visitors to pay a small fee of 両100.

column5: お支払い　いただけますか？\n
column6: Is that all right with you?

column5:
温泉は　たくさん　ありますから\n
どこでも　好きなだけ　入って\n
ゆっくりしてって　ください
column6:
We have many hot springs here.\n
Feel free to relax in any one of them.

column5:
お金を　いただかないと\n
村には　入れられない\n
決まりなんです
column6: I'm sorry, but you can't enter the village without paying the entry fee.
column7: NOTE: this message doesn't seem to be used. they probably intended for this to be the response if you say "no", but that just uses the below text, which is what's shown if you say "yes" when you don't have enough money.

column5:
お金が　ないんですね\n
こんどは\n
お金を　持って来てくださいね
column6: Ah, it seems you don't have the money. Don't worry, I'll wait.

column5:
お待ちして　おりました\n
弟から　ウワサは　きいて　おりますよ\n
ジライアさん　ですな！
column6:
Ah, you must be Ziria-san!\n
My little brother told me about you.

column5:
おれは　大門教の　ヤシャ姫さまに\n
９９９両　もらったんで\n
ここを　動くわけには　いきません
column6: Yashahime-sama is paying me 両999 to stand on this spot and prevent you from going through.

column5:
でも　それ以上のお金を　もらえるなら\n
おれにも　せいぎの心が　ありますから\n
通して　さしあげましょう
column6:
Buuut...I'll move out of the way if you offer me a better deal.\n
I do believe in justice, after all!

column5: １０００両払って　いただけますか？\n
column6: Are you willing to pay me 両1,000?

column5:
お待ちして　おりました\n
弟から　ウワサは　きいて　おりますよ\n
ジライアさん　ですな！
column6:
Ah, you must be Ziria-san!\n
My little brother told me about you.

column5:
おれは　大門教の　ヤシャ姫さまに\n
９９９両　もらったんで\n
ここを　動くわけには　いきません
column6: Yashahime-sama is paying me 両999 to stand on this spot and prevent you from going through.

column5:
でも　それ以上のお金を　もらえるなら\n
おれにも　せいぎの心が　ありますから\n
通して　さしあげましょう
column6:
Buuut...I'll move out of the way if you offer me a better deal.\n
I do believe in justice, after all!

column5: １０００両払って　いただけますか？\n
column6: Are you willing to pay me 両1,000?

column5:
すみませんねえ　大将！\n
たしかに　１０００両　いただきました\n
さあ　お通りください！！
column6: ...998, 999, 1,000. That's 両1,000, all right! Thanks, love. You may pass!
column7: ZenkiTN: the Ashimoto brothers call you 大将, "chief", but I feel like they'd call you "love".

column5:
おだわらの　兄たちの　ことも\n
ひとつ　よろしく\n
おねがい　いたします
column6: Say {hi} to my brothers in Odawara for me!

column5:
おだわらの　兄たちの　ことも\n
ひとつ　よろしく\n
おねがい　いたします
column6: Say {hi} to my brothers in Odawara for me!

column5:
それじゃ　ここは　動けないなあ\n
でも　ホテイ丸って　人が・・・\n
ヤシャ姫さまは　気短かだから・・・
column6:
Then I won't be going anywhere.\n
Poor Hoteimaru...I hear Yashahime-sama has a very short temper...

column5:
ジライアさん　助けてデース　とか\n
いってたのになあ\n
かわいそう　だったなあ
column6:
I can still hear his voice.\n
{Oh, friend! Ziria-san! Help!}\n
What a shame, what a shame...

column5:
お金が　ないんですか？\n
でも　ホテイ丸って　人が・・・\n
ヤシャ姫さまは　気みじかだから・・・
column6:
Awww, you don't have the money?\n
Poor Hoteimaru...I hear Yashahime-sama has a very short temper...

column5:
ジライアさん　助けてデース　とか\n
いってたのになあ\n
かわいそう　だったなあ
column6:
I can still hear his voice.\n
{Oh, friend! Ziria-san! Help!}\n
What a shame, what a shame...

column5:
この村には　あの　悪名高い\n
「アシモト　五兄弟」の　ふたりが\n
いるのよ　やーねぇ！！
column6: Two of the infamous Ashimoto Quintuplets are in the village!

column5:
この村を　出て　南へ　行くと\n
大きな　大門教会の　ある\n
おだわらの町だぜ
column6: Go south from our village and you'll reach Odawara Town and its huge Daimon church.

column5:
でも　あそこは\n
大門教徒　ばっかりだからな\n
行く　気は　しねえよ
column6:
As you can imagine, there's plenty of Daimonists there.\n
I wouldn't go if I were you.

column5:
おじいさんたちの　俳句の会が\n
開かれている　温泉宿が\n
あるんですよ！
column6: The old men of the village opened their own haiku club at one of the inns!

column5:
ここも　いつ\n
大門教に　おそわれるか\n
わからないから
column6: We don't know when the Cult of Daimon is going to attack us...

column5:
みんな　こわいの　通り越して\n
ひらきなおっちゃって\n
そりゃ　もう　すごい歌　ばかりよ
column6: So they've opted to exorcise fear by writing poetry!

column5:
ボクの　人生には\n
いろんなことが　あったなあ\n
でも　いちども　あきらめなかったよ
column6: I've faced many hardships during my life. Remember, boy: you must never succumb to sorrow.
column7: ZenkiTN: the joke here is that this is a very young kid, but he talks like he's had a life's worth of experience on his shoulders.

column5:
いつも　前だけを　向いて\n
ひとり　歩いてきたさ！\n
にいちゃんにも　いつか　わかるよ
column6: Hold your head high, your eyes on the future. One day, you will understand.

column5:
村の外には　モウリョウと　いう\n
怪物が　たくさん　いるぞ！\n
あんたも　気をつけなされ
column6: There are monstrous creatures known as Mouryou outside. Be careful in your travels!

column5:
この先の　おだわらと　かまくらは\n
町ぐるみ　大門教なんだよ！
column6: The towns of Odawara and Kamakura are teeming with Daimonists!

column5:
ジライアさん　今までの　ところとは\n
わけが　ちがうから\n
じゅぶん　用心してくださいよ！！
column6: It's worse than anything you've seen before, Ziria-san. Be cautious!

column5:
このままでは　さがみの国は\n
大門教に　完全に\n
支配されてしまいます
column6: Sagami is under almost complete Daimonist control...

column5:
ジライアさん！\n
どうか　この　さがみの国を\n
大門教の手から　お救いください
column6: Ziria-san! Please, save our country!

column5:
ジライアさん！\n
ホテイ丸さんを　助けて！！
column6: Ziria-san! Please, save Hoteimaru-san!

column5:
おだわらの　ヤシャ姫が\n
ホテイ丸さんを　連れてったの！！\n
早くしないと　殺されちゃう！！！！！
column6: He was captured by Yashahime of Odawara! His life is in danger!

column5:
ありがとうございます　ジライアさん！\n
でも　大門教で　苦しんでいるのは\n
ここばかりでは　ありませんよ！
column6:
Thank you so much, Ziria-san!\n
But many others are still suffering because of the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
湯船には　温泉の湯が　あった\n
その湯を　浴びると　体に\n
力が　わき上がってきた
column6:
The pool is filled with hot spring water.\n
You feel reinvigorated as soon as you enter.

column5: 温泉宿
column6: Hot Spring Inn

column5:
わしらは　大門教の　マの手を　逃れ\n
せめて　余生は　平和に　くらしたいと\n
ねがう　かよわき　じじいたちじゃ
column6: We are feeble old men who want nothing more than to spend the last years of their lives in peace and quiet.
column7: ZenkiTN: I will do my best to write haiku that are structurally correct (5-7-5 syllables), but they're not going to be masterpieces. Which is probably fine, since they're just old men having fun writing haiku.

column5:
だから　ここでは　俗な世間の　ことは\n
忘れて　風流に　俳句の会で\n
楽しんで　いるのですじゃ
column6: That is the reason we escape from the worries of society by writing elegant verses.

column5:
そこで　一句\n
村の　はんえいを　ねがう　うたじゃ\n
「まつしまや・・・
column6:
Here is my haiku, a wish for a prosperous future for our village.\n
{Ah, Matsushima...
column7:
ZenkiTN: this is a play on a haiku credited to Basho, though it's not actually his. The original one is:
「松島や ああ松島や 松島や」
Something along the lines of:
"Matsushima, ah Matsushina, Matsushima"

This one however instead of repeating Matsushima, mentions two other places. It doesn't make much sense, but I guess that's the point.

column5:
ああ　たかしまや　ながさきや」\n
　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　一茶
column6:
Beautiful Takashima,\n
and Nagasaki.}[space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px]-- Issa
column7: ZenkiTN: I think this 一茶 is a reference to Issa Kobayashi (小林一茶), known as one of the four greatest haiku masters of Japan. He'd sign his haiku as simply 一茶 (Issa, or "one cup of tea"). Here they roll with it, and each one of them signs their haiku with the kanji for numbers 1 to 10. This'll probably be lost in translation since western players won't really associate the reading of a kanji to its meaning. Using English names that carry the number meaning would feel out of place. I guess "lost in translation" is something we need to accept.

column5:
わしらは　この宿で　ひらかれる\n
俳句の会が　今では　ただひとつの\n
たのしみ　なのですじゃ
column6: This haiku club is the only pleasure we have left.

column5:
そこで　一句　すべての　生けるものを\n
オーエンするうたじゃ\n
「やせがえる・・
column6:
Allow me to compose a few verses in support of all living creatures.\n
{Skinny little frog...

column5:
まけるな　二茶　ここにあり」\n
　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　二茶
column6:
Don't be beaten, don't give up!\n
Nisa stands by you.}[space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px]-- Nisa
column7: ZenkiTN: this one is basically a straight quote of the original Issa haiku, but it swaps "Issa" for Nisa.

column5:
この宿に　いる　じじいたちは　みな\n
俳句を　深く　愛するものばかりじゃ\n
この場に　いられるのが　幸せじゃのう
column6: Everyone here loves haiku. I'm glad to be among like-minded people.

column5:
そこで　一句\n
この世の　平和を　待ち望んだ歌じゃ\n
「うぐいすや・・
column6:
This haiku embodies my desire for peace in the world.\n
{Little nightingale...

column5:
なくまでまとう　ホトトギス」\n
　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　三茶
column6:
If the cuckoo will not sing,\n
wait till it does so.}[space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px]-- Sansa
column7: ZenkiTN: this one is a mix-and-match of two different haiku. "Uguisu ya" is the beginning of a few Issa haiku about the nightingale, while the rest is a famous haiku credited to Ieyasu Tokugawa (a famous story about Nobunaga, Toyotomi and Tokugawa writing haiku about the same subject, "what to do if a cuckoo won't sing").

column5:
俳句を　こよなく　愛する者でないと\n
わしらの　よむ　俳句の　ワビサビは\n
味わえない　じゃろうなあ
column6: Only a true haiku fanatic can fully appreciate our verses.

column5:
そこで　一句\n
季節を感ずる　旅人を　よめるうたじゃ\n
「行くはるに・・・
column6:
Now, here is a haiku about a traveler noticing the change of seasons.\n
{Spring is leaving, too...
column7: ZenkiTN: I'm not 100% sure, but this might be a play on one of Basho's famous haiku, 行く春や鳥啼き魚の目は涙, though only the 行く春 seems to be shared.

column5:
はるばる　来たぜ　はこだて」\n
　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　四茶
column6:
Oh my, would you look at that?\n
It is now summer.}[space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px]-- Shisa
column7: ZenkiTN: it's likely I didn't understand the reference of the haiku in the game, so I made another one, rolling with the explanation about the changing of seasons.

column5:
みなさんの　風流な　うたを\n
きいていると　身も　心も\n
洗われるような　気がしますなあ
column6: As I listen to these refined verses, I feel refreshed in body and mind!

column5:
そこで　一句\n
田子の浦を見た　感動をよめるうたじゃ\n
「たごのうらゆ・・・・ウム！
column6:
I will now compose a few verses inspired by my visit to the Tago-no-ura bay in Suruga.
#BOXPAUSE()
{Tago-no-ura...} Hmm, let me think...
column7: ZenkiTN: the first verse may be a reference to a poem by Yamabe no Akahito, "Having crossed Tago Bay", though it's not in a haiku format.

column5:
「たごのうらゆ\n
　ウララ　ウララ　ウラウラで」\n
　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　五茶
column6:
{Taga-no-ura,\n
Oolala, oolala,\n
oola-oolala.}[space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px]-- Gosa
column7: ZenkiTN: as the following line makes apparent, this devolves into being the lyrics to Linda Yamamoto's "Nerai uchi", a hit song from 1973 (you may recognize it as one of the songs featured in the first Ouendan game). It doesn't even follow the haiku format in Japanese, honestly.

column5:
この後の　「この世は　わたしの\n
ためにある　ウッ！」を　あえて切る！\n
これを　切るまでに　十年かかった！
column6:
I had to cut the next part, {This whole world has been created entirely for me.}\n
You guys aren't ready for that yet!
column7: ZenkiTN: I wrote that part in a way it somewhat fits the Nerai uchi lyrics "Kono yo wa watashi no tame ni aru". Also I referenced Back to the Future in that final line (what Marty says at the end of his Johnny B. Goode performance).

column5:
ここまで　みごとな　句をよめる\n
人が　集まっていると　自分の存在が\n
いかに　小さいものか　わかりますなあ
column6: With so many people gathered here and reciting verses, you realize how small we are compared to the world.

column5:
わしも　一句\n
老いへの　はげましを　よめるうたじゃ\n
「ふるいけや・・
column6: I feel inspired to write a few verses to encourage those who are getting on in years. {A very old pond...}

column5:
「ふるいけや\n
　いけいけ　ひゅうま　ドンといけ」\n
　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　六茶
column6:
{A very old pond.\n
There's a puma over there.\n
It leaves at full speed.}[space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px]-- Rokusa
column7:
ZenkiTN: this is a play on one of Basho's most famous poems:
古池や　蛙飛び込む　水の音
The old pond-
a frog jumps in,
sound of the water.
to be fair, only the "ancient pond" part is in common.
NOTE: for the sake of anyone outside our group who might be looking at this file (who ARE you?!), Zenki noticed while translating that the playthrough video he was watching had ピューマ instead of ひゅうま here. after puzzling over that for a while, we eventually found out that this is because the video was taken on the PS3 release of the game, which edited this line for legal reasons (the original is referencing the opening theme to the old baseball anime Kyojin no Hoshi). but Zenki had already written a haiku based on "puma" and the reference is untranslatable anyway, so we just stuck with that.

column5:
この句の　そこはかない　力強さに\n
世の老人は　みな　涙するじゃろう
column6:
These verses convey the hidden strength that we have in our old bones.\n
Very touching, if I do say so myself.
column7: ZenkiTN: from my understanding, the "old pond" was a metaphor for the mind of an old man (most likely the poet).

column5:
俳句を　味わう　余裕を\n
もてずして　この世を　生きる者は\n
ただ　あはれみしか　感じぬ
column6: I pity those who live in this world without being able to appreciate a good haiku.

column5:
そこで　一句\n
虫の　あはれさを　よめるうたじゃ\n
「やれ　うつな・・・ウム
column6:
Speaking of which, let me compose a few verses about a pitiful fly...\n
{Wait, don't strike that fly...} Hmm...
column7: ZenkiTN: the first line is a reference to one of Issa's famous haiku, やれ打つな蝿が手をすり足をする, "Wait! Don't strike that fly! / he is wringing his hands there / and wringing his feet".

column5:
「やれ　うつな\n
　ハエハエカカカ　キンチョール」\n
　　　　　　　　　　　　　　七茶
column6:
{Wait, don't strike that fly.\n
Raid hunts bugs down like lizards,\n
and it kills them dead.}[space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px]-- Shichisa
column7: ZenkiTN: then it devolves into an old ad for an insecticide called "Kinchol". I've decided to do something similar, and reference a classic Raid insecticide tag. I did swap "Radar" for "lizards" because radar technology might be too advanced for this world (ignore the fact that "Raid" wouldn't exist either)

column5:
ううむ　あはれすぎる\n
とくに　さいごの“ル”の　ひびきが\n
かなしい・・・かなしすぎたのう
column6: Yes, I believe this haiku conveys the sadness of their existence. When we see flies, we think only of killing them...

column5:
みなさん　だてに　お年は\n
めされて　いないようじゃ\n
うたの　年輪を　感じますなあ
column6: You can tell from our verses that our lives have been full of different experiences.

column5:
そこで　一句\n
富士の　バクハツを　しずめるうたじゃ\n
「富士やまに・・・
column6: I will compose a few verses so powerful, they could contain the eruption of Mount Fuji itself.
column7: ZenkiTN: this is a reference to Taro Okamoto, who said that "art is an explosion". I think it's been swapped with "Fuji" because Mount Fuji is a classic subject for haiku.

column5:
「富士やまに\n
　顔が　あっても　いいじゃないか」\n
　字余り　　　　　　　　　　　八茶
column6:
{If our Mount Fuji\n
had a face in its crater,\n
would it be so bad?}[space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px]-- Hachisa
column7: ZenkiTN: Taro Okamoto once made a glass with a face at its bottom, while those around him told him not to. There's a famous commercial about this glass (that came free with a bottle of whiskey) where he says "a face at the bottom of a glass isn't so bad, is it?" (グラスの底に顔があってもいいじゃないか). Pretty obscure reference.

column5:
道を　キワめた者にしか\n
この句の　おくの　深さは\n
見えぬ　じゃろう
column6: Only those who have mastered the art can perceive the true depth of my haiku.

column5:
みなさんの　うたは\n
自分の　そうさく意欲を\n
しげきするものが　ありますな
column6: These verses answer our strong urge to create something beautiful.

column5:
わしも　負けずに　一句\n
花の美しさを　たたえるうたじゃ\n
「ホウセンか・・・　美しい花じゃ
column6: On that subject, I'm going to compose a haiku about the beauty of flowers.

column5:
「ホウセンか\n
　ソソソクラテスか　プラトンか」\n
　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　九茶
column6:
{Daisies, oh daisies.\n
The most lovely of flowers.\n
Just don't push them up.}[space8px][space8px][space8px][space8px]-- Kyuusa
column7: ZenkiTN: This is a reference to a Suntory Gold ad from 1976, featuring Nosaka Akiyuki (famous for the novel "Grave of the Fireflies", which was later made into an animated movie by Studio Ghibli). Here's the ad in question: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SwzQkt56T6Y The joke is because "Housenka" ends with "ka", like "Socrates ka, Platon ka". Well, it's pretty untranslatable.

column5:
どうじゃ　いんの　ふみかたに\n
やさしさが　見えかくれして\n
作者の心が　しのばれるじゃろう？
column6: Beautiful and deep. I don't mean to brag, but this is a real masterpiece.

column5:
みなさん　なかなか　お上手で\n
じゃが　まだまだ　上の句と　下の句の\n
つながりが　甘いようじゃ
column6: My friends are pretty good, but they still haven't mastered the art.

column5:

column6:
Let me show you the fruits of years of training.\n
{Summer's verdant grass...}
column7: ZenkiTN: this is a reference to a famous Basho haiku, 夏草や兵どもが夢の跡, "Summer grass; all the warriors are but the remains of dreams".

column7: ZenkiTN: the original text goes for "grandpa, your breath stinks". I figured I'd make them all rhyme instead (because a real poet rhymes, right?), and you know what rhymes with grass.

ますぜ

column5:
と　いっても\n
おれは　大門教徒じゃない\n
話によっちゃ　考えないでも　ない
column6:
Then again, I am no Daimonist.\n
There might be a way to change my mind...

column5:
ジライアの大将なら\n
オレの　いってる　意味が\n
わかって　くれるはずだよねぇ
column6: Do you catch my drift, love?

column5:
ここは　おだわらの町だ\n
オレは　ヤシャ姫さまから　９９９９両\n
もらって　ここを　みはってるんだ
column6:
This is Odawara Town.\n
Yashahime-sama is paying me 両9,999 to guard this spot.

column5:
と　いっても\n
おれは　大門教徒じゃない\n
話によっちゃ　考えないでも　ない
column6:
Then again, I am no Daimonist.\n
There might be a way to change my mind...

column5:
ジライアの大将なら\n
オレの　いってる　意味が\n
わかって　くれるはずだよねぇ
column6: Do you catch my drift, love?

column5:
さすが　ジライアの大将　さっしがいい\n
オツムの　できが　ちがう！！\n
たしかに　１００００両　預かったよ！
column6:
My, you're a clever one!\n
Thanks for the 両10,000!

column5:
ほかの兄弟も　ひとつ\n
めんどう　みてやってくださいよ\n
ジライアの大将！
column6: Send my regards to my brothers, love!

column5:
ゆうずうの　きかねえ大将だなあ\n
ホテイ丸が　どんなめに\n
あってるかも　知らないで
column6: My, how stingy. Don't you care about your friend Hoteimaru at all?

column5:
自分さえ　よけりゃ　いいんだ？\n
ジライアの　大将は！
column6:
I suppose it's every man for himself.\n
Isn't that right, love?

column5:
また　お金のあるとき　相談しような\n
ジライアの　大将
column6: Come back when you have the cash, love!

column5:
トノさまの　命令で　ここは\n
だれも　通せません　\n
許可を　もらってくるんだね
column6: Nobody can pass without the lord's permission.

column5:
待ってましたよ！　ジライアの　大将！\n
えーと　そうだな\n
ヤシャ姫さまは　手持ちのお金　全部？
column6:
I've been waiting for you, love!\n
You see, Yashahime-sama gave me, uhm...everything?

column5:
そうそう　ぜんぶだ！　全部だよ！！\n
全部を　くれて　おれに　ここに\n
立っていろって　いったんだ！
column6:
Yes, that's it.\n
She gave me all the money she was carrying to stand here and block the way!

column5:
おれは　ほかの　兄弟みたいに\n
ヒドイことは　いわないよ！\n
ヤシャ姫さまと　同じでいいよ
column6: I won't ask for a better offer like my brothers did! I ask only that you do the same as her.

column5:
ジライアの大将！\n
手持ちの金　全部　くれるかい？
column6: So, are you going to give me all the money you're carrying?

column5:
待ってましたよ！　ジライアの　大将！\n
えーと　そうだな\n
ヤシャ姫さまは　手持ちのお金　全部？
column6:
I've been waiting for you, love!\n
You see, Yashahime-sama gave me, uhm...everything?

column5:
そうそう　ぜんぶだ！　全部だよ！！\n
全部を　くれて　おれに　ここに\n
立っていろって　いったんだ！
column6:
Yes, that's it.\n
She gave me all the money she was carrying to stand here and block the way!

column5:
おれは　ほかの　兄弟みたいに\n
ヒドイことは　いわないよ！\n
ヤシャ姫さまと　同じでいいよ
column6: I won't ask for a better offer like my brothers did! I ask only that you do the same as her.

column5:
ジライアの大将！\n
手持ちの金　全部　くれるかい？
column6: So, are you going to give me all the money you're carrying?

column5:
まいどあり！\n
はやく　かまくら城に　いってやんな！\n
ツナデさんと・・・
column6:
Thanks, love!\n
You'd better hurry to Kamakura Castle. Tsunade is waiting for you...

column5: おれの　アニキのために
column6: ...And so is my brother.

column5:
さすがは　火の勇者　きっぷが　いいね\n
さ　さ　通んな　通んな！
column6:
You really deserve the title of hero!\n
By all means, go ahead!

column5:
ツナデの　命が　おしくないのか\n
あの子は　いい子なのに\n
かわいそうだなあ・・・
column6: Oh dear. Don't you care about Tsunade? Poor girl...She trusted you...

column5:
さすがの　おれも\n
ジライアの　大将が　モンナシとは\n
気が　つかなかったぜ！
column6: I can't believe it. You actually don't have a single coin to your name!
column7:
ZenkiTN: this is probably for when you have a round 0 money in possession.
Supper: yeah, and he doesn't let you through in this case, either.

column5:
おだわらの町も　大門教が　きてから\n
ほんとうに　住みやすくなったわい\n
ヤシャ姫　さまさま　じゃなあ！！
column6:
Life has never been better in Odawara!\n
Thank you, Yashahime-sama!\n
Thank you, Cult of Daimon!

column5:
早く　マサカドさまが　復活して\n
大門教の　理想郷が　来ないかしら\n
不老不死に　なりたいわ
column6:
I hope Masakado-sama is revived soon.\n
I really want to be immortal, you know?

column5:
不老不死って　デタラメだったの！\n
わたしたち　ヤシャ姫に\n
あやつられていたのね
column6:
That whole immortality deal was a sham!\n
Yashahime tricked us!

column5:
お城を　まもるために\n
大きな　カラクリ人形が\n
作られた　そうだぞ！！
column6: I heard the castle is guarded by a huge clockwork doll!

column5:
これで　火の一族が　来ても　安心だ！\n
来るなら来てみろ　火の一族！！
column6: Now we have nothing to fear from that evil Fire Clan!

column5:
城の　カラクリ人形が　倒されたそうだ\n
この　おだわらは　おしまいだ！\n
早く来てくれ　マサカドさま！！
column6:
The clockwork doll has been defeated...\n
This is the end of Odawara!\n
Please save us, Masakado-sama!

column5:
不老不死って　デタラメだったの！\n
わたしたち　ヤシャ姫に\n
あやつられていたのね
column6:
That whole immortality deal was a sham!\n
Yashahime tricked us!

column5:
マサカドさまが復活すれば\n
このジパングも　いい国になる\n
今のままじゃ　ダメなんだ！！
column6:
I hope Masakado-sama is revived soon.\n
He'll make Jipang into a glorious nation, unlike the dump we've got now!
column7: ZenkiTN: I tried hard not to write "He'll make Jipang great again"

column5:
大門教に　ダマされていました\n
早く　江戸へ　行って\n
マサカドの　復活を　止めてください！
column6: We all fell for the lies of the Cult of Daimon...You must hurry to Edo and prevent Masakado's return!

column5:
大門教の　ヤシャ姫さまが\n
お城に　おいでになられてから\n
トノさまも　大門教に　入られたのです
column6: Our lord joined the Cult of Daimon shortly after Yashahime-sama visited the castle.

column5:
トノさまが　モウリョウだったなんて\n
よく　そんな　でまかせを　いえるわね
column6: What do you mean, our lord was a Mouryou? Don't even joke about that!

column5:
毎週　えらばれた者が\n
マサカドさまの　復活の　お手伝いに\n
江戸の　邪神斎さまの元へ　行くのです
column6: Every week, one of us is selected to go to Edo and assist Jashinsai-sama in the resurrection of Masakado-sama.

column5:
わたしも　ぜひ　えらばれて\n
その　メイヨある　仕事の\n
お役に立ちたい！！
column6:
There is no greater honor!\n
I hope I get chosen soon!

column5:
火の勇者が　来たら　おれが\n
やっつけてやるんだ！！\n
おまえ　火の勇者を　見なかったか？
column6:
I'll keep the castle safe from the evil Fire Heroes!\n
...Hey, you! Let me know if you spot them!

column5:
どこから　火の勇者が\n
忍び込んだんだ！？\n
おまえ　火の勇者を　見なかったか？
column6:
How did the Fire Heroes sneak inside?!\n
...Hey, you! Let me know if you spot them!

column5:
おれは　ぜひ　火の勇者に\n
じかに　会って　お礼を　いいたい！\n
おまえ　火の勇者を　見なかったか？
column6:
I'd love to meet the Fire Heroes and thank them for what they've done!\n
...Hey, you! Let me know if you spot them!

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
ここの　南に　かまくらの町が　あるぜ\n
あそこも　ここと　おんなじで\n
大門教徒で　いっぱいだ！！
column6: Keep going south and you'll reach Kamakura. Beware...That place is full of Daimonists, just like here!

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　７０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両70 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　７０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両70 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5: 武具屋
column6: Armory

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　武具屋です\n
ご用件は　何ですか？
column6:
Welcome to my armory!\n
How can I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それでは　また　ご利用ください
column6: Come back anytime.

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 預かり所
column6: Warehouse

column5: 大門教会
column6: Daimon Church

column5:
マサカドさまの　復活を\n
ともに　祈ろう！！
column6: Let us pray for Masakado-sama's return!

column5:
ジパングに　大門教の手で\n
理想郷を　きずこう！！
column6: May the Cult of Daimon turn Jipang into our paradise!

column5:
今　江戸で　邪神斎さまが\n
マサカドさまの　復活のために\n
力を　尽くされて　おります
column6: Jashinsai-sama is in Edo, doing everything possible to revive Masakado-sama.

column5:
さあ　あなたも　いっしょに\n
マサカドさま　復活のために\n
お祈りを　ささげましょう！
column6: Come now, kneel with us! Let us all pray for Masakado-sama's return!

column5:
ヤシャ姫さまは　ここに\n
いらっしゃって　ないわ\n
ほんとうよ
column6:
Yashahime-sama isn't here.\n
I swear.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
おまえさん　すんだ目を　しとるのお\n
わしが　ジパングの　未来を\n
占ってしんぜよう！
column6:
You have beautiful eyes, boy.\n
A proud gaze, full of life.\n
Allow me to look into the future of Jipang!

column5:
ムムム・・・　　　　　ムムム・・・\n
　　　　　　　ムムム・・・ムン！！\n
やや！！　これは　不吉じゃ！！
column6:
Ohmmm...Ohmmm...\n
Ohmmmmm...\n
Ahhh! This is horrible!

column5:
マサカドさまの　まえで　\n
三人の　火の勇者が　そろって\n
三つの玉を　かざしておる！！
column6: The three Fire Heroes hold the three orbs towards Masakado-sama!

column5:
うぉぉおぉっっぉ\n
まぶしいぃ！！\n
玉の光がぁぁ・・・・・・・・・・・・
column6:
Aaahhh! The light!\n
It's too bright!!

column5:
あんずることは　なぁい！！\n
わしの占いは　たまには\n
はずれることも　ある！！
column6: D-Don't worry! I've made mispredictions every once in a while!

column5:
おまえさん　すんだ目を　しとるのお\n
わしが　ジパングの　未来を\n
占ってしんぜよう！
column6:
You have beautiful eyes, boy.\n
A proud gaze, full of life.\n
Allow me to look into the future of Jipang!

column5:
ムムム・・・　　　　　ムムム・・・\n
　　　　　　　ムムム・・・ムン！！\n
やや！！　これは　吉兆じゃ！！
column6:
Ohmmm...Ohmmm...\n
Ohmmmmm...\n
Ahhh! This is wonderful!

column5:
マサカドの　まえで　\n
三人の　火の勇者が　そろって\n
三つの玉を　かざしておる！！
column6: The three Fire Heroes hold the three orbs towards the evil Masakado!

column5:
うぉぉおぉっっぉ\n
まぶしいぃ！！\n
玉の光がぁぁ・・・・・・・・・・・・
column6:
Ooohhh! The light!\n
It's so bright!!

column5:
安心なされぇい！！\n
わしの占いは　一度も\n
はずれたことは　なぁい！！
column6: Don't worry! My predictions have never been wrong!

column5: つづらの中を　調べた
column6: You look inside the casket.

column5: 中には　いくさオノが　入っていた\n
column6: There is a battleaxe inside.\n

column5: いくさのオノを　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Battleaxe.

column5: 中には　なにも　入っていなかった\n
column6: There is nothing inside.\n

column5: おだわら城
column6: Odawara Castle

column5:
この城には　大門教に　忠誠を\n
尽くさぬ者には\n
災いが　おそいかかる　魔力が　ある
column6: A powerful spell brings misfortune upon those who enter the castle without any faith in the Cult of Daimon.

column5:
トノさまに　会いたければ\n
ずっと　おくに　入っていくが　よい
column6: The lord will receive you. Simply follow the corridors all the way back.

column5: つづらの中を　調べた
column6: You look inside the casket.

column5: 中には　白キジの尾が　入っていた\n
column6: There is a White Pheasant tail inside.\n

column5: 白キジの尾を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained White Pheasant Tail.

column5: 中には　なにも　入っていなかった\n
column6: There is nothing inside.\n

column5: おだわら城
column6: Odawara Castle

column5: つづらの中を　調べた
column6: You look inside the casket.

column5: 中には　白ガマの油が　入っていた\n
column6: There is White Toad oil inside.\n

column5: 白ガマの油を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained White Toad Oil.

column5: 中には　なにも　入っていなかった\n
column6: There is nothing inside.\n

column5: おだわら城
column6: Odawara Castle

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
わしゃあ　ヘンな外人が\n
城の中に　連れていかれるのを\n
見物しとんじゃ！
column6: They brought a weird foreigner into the castle the other day.

column5:
あやつ　よっぽど\n
悪いことを　したんじゃのう\n
ムチで　はたかれて　おったわ！
column6: He must have done something real bad, because they were whipping him every step!

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
はじめ　トノさまは　大門教を\n
きらって　おったのじゃが\n
ヤシャ姫さまの　お人がら　かのう
column6: At first, our lord opposed the Cult of Daimon, but Yashahime-sama was able to change his mind with her lovely manners.

column5:
トノさまも　やっと　\n
わかって　くだされた\n
ばんじ　めでたし　めでたし　じゃ！！
column6:
I'm glad he's seen reason.\n
Don't you love a happy ending?

column5:
なにぃ！！！！！！\n
トノさまが　化け物じゃったとな！\n
うそじゃ　うそじゃ　うそじゃ！！
column6:
What?! Our lord was a monster in disguise?! No...No. That's not true!\n
That's impossible!
column7: ZenkiTN: I quoted Star Wars for no real reason (Luke's reaction to "I am your father")

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
ジパングの　未来の姿を\n
知りたいのなら\n
占いオババの　ところへ　いきなされ
column6: If you're curious about the future of Jipang, try asking our fortune teller.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
ここだけの　はなしじゃが\n
ヤシャ姫さまは　火の勇者の　ひとりを\n
ここで　しとめると　いっておったぞ！
column6:
Just between you and me...\n
Yashahime-sama declared that here, she will eliminate one of the Fire Heroes.

column5:
ヤシャ姫さまは　いわれたことは\n
必ず　守る　おかたじゃ\n
心強いのう　フォフォフォフォ！
column6:
Yashahime-sama always keeps her word. That Fire Hero is as good as gone!\n
Hoh hoh hoh!

column5:
ヤシャ姫さま　約束通り\n
火の勇者の　ひとりを　とらえたらしい\n
さすがじゃ！
column6:
Like she promised, Yashahime-sama got rid of one of the Fire Heroes.\n
She always keeps her word!

column5:
さすが　ジライアさん！\n
仲間を助けだしましたね！
column6:
You saved your comrade?\n
Way to go, Ziria-san!

column5: かまくら町
column6: Kamakura Town

column5:
ヨオッ　ジライアの大将！！\n
かまくら町へ　ようこそ！\n
「アシモト　五兄弟」の　長男ですよ！
column6:
Welcome to Kamakura, love!\n
I'm the eldest of the Ashimoto Quintuplets!

column5:
あっしは　ヤシャ姫さまの　全財産を\n
ゆずりうけて　ここで　火の勇者を\n
通さないように　してるんだ
column6: Yashahime-sama gave me everything she owns to stop the Fire Hero from passing through here.

column5:
だけど　安心して　くだせい！\n
あっしは　弟たちみたいに　人の足元を\n
見るような　こたあしませんよ
column6: But don't worry! I won't take advantage of you, like my little brothers!

column5:
ジライアさんの　今　お使いに\n
なってない　ものだけで　いいんです\n
つまり　そうじ！　そうじですよ
column6: I'll just take the things you obviously no longer need.

column5:
早い話　預かり所に　預けてあるもの\n
全部で　ジライアの大将のために\n
ヒトハダ　脱いでやろうって　わけだ
column6: In short, I'll take whatever you've left at the warehouse. It's like spring cleaning, really!

column5: どうです　ジライアの大将？\n
column6: Does that seem fair to you, love?

column5:
いってみるもんだなあ\n
じゃあ　預り所にも　このことを\n
伝えて　おくよ
column6:
That's the spirit!\n
I'll send word to the warehouse immediately.

column5:
おれ　きれい好きだから\n
預かり所のほうは　まかせてください\n
一つ　のこらず　始末しておきますよ！
column6: I'm a bit of a clean freak, so I'll make sure to leave your storage completely empty!

column5:
ジライアの大将！\n
どうぞ　お通りください
column6: You may pass, love!

column5:
ああ　ジパングも　おしまいだあ！\n
火の勇者が　こんなことで\n
大門教打倒を　あきらめるなんて！！
column6:
Is this where the Fire Hero gives up?\n
Ah, this must be the end of Jipang!
column7:
ZenkiTN: what triggers this line, exactly? refusing multiple times in a row?
Supper: saying "no", that's all

column5:
ああ　あわれな　ツナデ！！\n
財産よりも　軽い命だったなんて！\n
ああ　涙が　でてきた・・・
column6:
I see...You value material wealth more than your friend. Aaah, poor Tsunade!\n
I will pray for her soul...

column5:
ジライアの大将！\n
どうぞ　お通りください
column6: You may pass, love!

column5:
ヤシャ姫さま　お一人で\n
火の勇者　三人を\n
相手にしているのよ！
column6: Yashahime-sama will defeat the Fire Heroes single-handedly!

column5:
美しさと　強さを\n
あわせ持った　ヤシャ姫さまって\n
すてきだわー！！
column6:
Beauty, strength, and wisdom...Yashahime-sama is perfect in every way!\n
I want to be like her!

column5:
ヤシャ姫さまが　バケモノですって\n
ウソよ　ウソ！\n
信じられないわ！！
column6:
Yashahime-sama...a monster?!\n
No! I don't believe you! Say it isn't so!

column5:
ここ　さがみ国の　かまくら町は\n
大門教が　ジパングに　入って来た\n
さいしょの　町なんだ！
column6: Kamakura is the first town the Cult of Daimon entered in Jipang!

column5:
この町の人は　みんな\n
そのことを　ほこりに　思ってるのさ
column6: That is a source of pride for us.

column5:
おれは　とんでもないことを\n
してしまった　白オオカミさまを\n
封印する　手伝いを　してしまったんだ
column6:
I've done something terrible...\n
I helped the Daimonists seal the sacred White Wolf.

column5:
ジライアさん！！\n
南の　みうら村へ　急いでください！\n
白オオカミさまを　お救いください
column6: Ziria-san! You must hurry to Miura Village to the south! Rescue the sacred White Wolf, I beg you!

column5:
ありがとう　ジライアさま！\n
白オオカミさまを\n
助けていただいたんですね！
column6: Thank you for rescuing the sacred White Wolf, Ziria-san!

column5:
おだわらで　ヤシャ姫さまが\n
火の勇者の一人を　捕らえたそうだ\n
さすがは　ヤシャ姫さま
column6: Yashahime-sama captured one of the Fire Heroes in Odawara. She's so cool.

column5:
南の　みうら村の　白オオカミを\n
石に　封印してやったぞ！\n
神獣なんか　たいしたことは　ないな
column6:
I heard the White Wolf from Miura Village to the south has been turned to stone.\n
So much for being a divine beast!

column5:
ヤシャ姫さまの命令で　だれも\n
ここから　出すわけには　いかん
column6: Under Yashahime-sama's orders, none shall pass through here.

column5:
どうしても　ここから　出たければ\n
命を　おいていくんだな\n
さあ　どうする！　ジライア！
column6:
If you REALLY want to pass, you'll have to pay...with your life!\n
What will you do, Ziria?
column7: ZenkiTN: you actually get a choice.

column5:
本当に　命を　おいて　いくんだな？\n
もう一度だけ　きいてやる\n
本当か？
column6:
Seriously? Let me ask again.\n
Are you really going to give me your life?
column7: ZenkiTN: you get another choice to confirm.

column5:
ありがとうよ！\n
ワシの　てがらに　なるぜ\n
フェッ　フェッ　フェッ
column6: Why, thank you! I'm totally getting a promotion for this! Bwahahaha!

column5: ジライアは　力つきた[color]<$00>
column6: Ziria blacked out...[color]<$00>

column5:
ならば　ヤシャ姫さまに\n
許可を　もらってくるんだな
column6: Then you'll have to get permission from Yashahime-sama.

column5:
ヤシャ姫さまは　遊んでらっしゃるのよ\n
火の勇者を　一人ずつ　消して\n
なぶりものにして　楽しんでるんだわ
column6: Yashahime-sama is only toying with the Fire Heroes. She will enjoy killing them one by one.

column5:
余裕が　なせる　ワザねえ\n
さすが　ヤシャ姫さまね\n
演出が　心憎いわ
column6: She's leading the show with her typical poise. Yashahime-sama is really something else.

column5:
ヤシャ姫さまが\n
女の子を　連れて\n
城へ　入って　いったわ
column6: Yashahime-sama brought a girl to the castle.

column5:
今ごろ　あの娘は・・・\n
明日あたりが　たのしみネ
column6:
She's probably already been...\n
Heh heh heh. I look forward to tomorrow's news!

column5:
ツナデさまと　オロチ丸さまは\n
獄門島へ　連れて行かれるに\n
ちがいありません
column6: Tsunade-sama and Orochimaru-sama must have been sent to Gokumon Island.

column5:
獄門島へは\n
さがみ国の西　神奈川村から\n
船が　出ていると　きいております
column6: I've heard the ships bound for Gokumon Island set out from Kanagawa Village, on the eastern edge of Sagami.
column7: ZenkiTN: the original text says it's the "west of Sagami", but that doesn't make any sense, since Kanagawa is on the eastern coast of Sagami.

column5:
ジライアさん！\n
三人の勇者が　そろったんですね！\n
マサカドの復活を　阻止してください！
column6: I see you've reunited with your friends, Ziria-san! May you stop Masakado's return, Fire Heroes!

column5:
かまくら城に　トノさまは　いないのさ\n
大門教に　さからって\n
てんばつを　受けたんだ
column6:
The lord of Kamakura Castle is gone.\n
God punished him for defying the Cult of Daimon.

column5:
獄門島は　大門教に逆らった\n
人びとが　流される\n
悪魔の島です
column6: Gokumon Island is a hellish place that those who defy the Cult of Daimon are banished to.

column5:
早くしなければ\n
ツナデさまと　オロチ丸さまが\n
そこへ　送られてしまいます
column6: You need to hurry, before Tsunade-sama and Orochimaru-sama are sent there!

column5:
ボク　大きくなったら\n
マサカドさまの　身のまわりの\n
お世話をするのが　夢なんだ！
column6: When I grow up, I want to assist Masakado-sama in his daily life!

column5: 大門教の　バーカ！
column6: The Daimonists are big doo-doo heads!
column7: ZenkiTN: these are just a series of childish insults

column5: おまえの　かーちゃん　デーベーソ！
column6: They smell like old cheese!

column5: おしり　ペンペン！
column6: I bet they have cooties!

column5: あー　スッキリした！
column6: Whew. I feel much better now!

column5:
まえの城主は\n
毒ヘビに　かまれて\n
お亡くなりに　なったので
column6: The previous lord passed away after he was bitten by a venomous snake.

column5:
今は　ヤシャ姫さまが\n
このお城を　治めて　おられるのです
column6: Yashahime-sama has graciously deigned to replace him.

column5:
おや？　おれは　なにをしていたんだ\n
トノさまが　ヤシャ姫の　毒ヘビに\n
かまれたまでは　覚えてるんだけど
column6:
Huh? What am I doing here?\n
Last thing I remember was our lord being bitten by Yashahime's snake.

column5: 宿屋
column6: Inn

column5:
あれ？　火の勇者は\n
三人　そろったって　きいたぜ！！\n
数が　たりねえぜ！　どうしたんだ！？
column6: Huh? I thought there were THREE Fire Heroes! Looks like you're running short! What happened here?

column5:
えっ！　ジライアさん　答えてくれよ！\n
ほんとうに　あんたに　まかせておいて\n
このジパングは　大丈夫なのか
column6:
C'mon, Ziria-san! Get it together!\n
Man, is Jipang doomed after all?

column5:
ジライアさんが　そんなに\n
落ち込むことは　ないよ\n
神獣だって　雲切だって　ついてるよ！
column6:
Don't be so down, Ziria-san.\n
The divine beasts got your back, right?\n
And you have your old friend Kumogiri!

column5:
それに　それに　それに　それに\n
おれだって　おれの　かあちゃんだって\n
それに　カエルさんも　いるじゃないか
column6:
Uhm...My mom thinks you're nice!\n
Then...Oh yeah! You have a cool frog!\n
See, it's not so bad!

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　７０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両70 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　７０両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両70 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

column5:
お客さま！\n
お金が　あるときに\n
また　おこしください！
column6:
Good sir!\n
Please come back when you have enough money!

column5:
それでは　\n
ごゆっくり　お休みください
column6: Please rest well.

column5: また　おこしください
column6: Please come again.

column5:
いってらっしゃいませ！\n
お気をつけて　ジライアさま
column6: Take care of yourself, Ziria-sama.

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
きろく　しますか？\n
いえいえ　お金はいりません
column6:
Good day! Would you like me to keep a record of your progress?\n
No need to pay -- it's free!

column5: それでは　きろく　します
column6: Let me write this down.

column5: また　お気軽に　どうぞ！
column6: Come back anytime!

column5:
ここは　温泉やど！！\n
今どき　なんと　タダ！！\n
泊らないとソン！！　泊まる？！
column6:
This is a hot spring inn! It's completely free! You should stay for a while!\n
How about it?

column5: また　おいで！！
column6: Come back!

column5: ごゆっくり！！
column6: Rest well!

column5: 武具屋
column6: Armory

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　武具屋です\n
ご用件は　何ですか？
column6:
Welcome to my armory!\n
How can I help you?

column5: ありがとうございます
column6: Thank you very much.

column5: それでは　また　ご利用ください
column6: Come back anytime.

column5: よろず屋
column6: General Store

column5:
おいでやす\n
うちは　よろず屋でおます\n
ごようむきは　なんでっしゃろ？
column6:
Welcome, welcome!\n
This is my general store.\n
Tell me what you need!

column5:
おおきに\n
また　おこしやす
column6:
Thank you, thank you!\n
See you soon!

column5: また　おこしやす
column6: Have a nice day.

column5: 預かり所
column6: Warehouse

column5: 大門教会
column6: Daimon Church

column5:
ここは　ゆいしょある\n
かまくらの　大門教会です\n
祈りなさい
column6:
This is the Daimon Church of Kamakura.\n
It has a long and fascinating history...\n
Let us pray.

column5:
マサカドさま\n
早く　復活してください\n
わたしは　その日を　待ち望んでいます
column6: I look forward to the day when Masakado-sama is revived.

column5:
やっと　邪神斎さまの　お手伝いに\n
江戸へ　行けることになりました\n
これ以上の　幸福は　ありません！
column6: I've been selected to assist Jashinsai-sama in Edo! There is no greater honor!

column5:
あなたにも　早く　この幸福が\n
訪れますように\n
祈って　さしあげましょう
column6: I'll pray for you to be chosen soon.

column5:
ヤシャ姫さまは　お城で\n
お祈りを　されるので　めったに\n
教会には　おいでに　なりません
column6: Yashahime-sama mostly prays from the castle, so she rarely comes to the church.

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
悩み多き　若者よ\n
ジパングの　未来を　占ってしんぜよう\n
よい　よい！　見料は　いらぬよ
column6:
You seem troubled, boy.\n
Allow me to look into Jipang's future.\n
Oh, it's fine, I'll do it for free!

column5:
うーむ！　むむむむ！\n
・・・　むむむ　・・・　かーっ！\n
おお！　これは　不吉じゃ！！
column6:
Ohmm...Ohmm...\n
Ohmmmmm...KAAAH!\n
Oh, no! This is bad news!

column5:
引き裂かれた　三人の　火の勇者が\n
ふたたび　出会っておる！！\n
じゃが　安心いたせ！
column6: The Fire Heroes, separated, gather once again! But do not worry!

column5:
あやつらが　出会う所は　地獄じゃ\n
あそこからは　出て来れん！！\n
ジパングの　未来は　あんたいじゃ
column6:
It is in Hell that they will reunite!\n
They will never find a way out!\n
Jipang's future is assured!

column5:
大門教が　この国を　お救いくださる\n
ははっははは！！
column6: The Cult of Daimon will save our country! Hahahaha!

column5:
悩み多き　若者よ\n
ジパングの　未来を　占ってしんぜよう\n
よい　よい！　見料は　いらぬよ
column6:
You seem troubled, boy.\n
Allow me to look into Jipang's future.\n
Oh, it's fine, I'll do it for free!

column5:
うーむ！　むむむむ！\n
・・・　むむむ　・・・　かーっ！\n
おお！　これは　吉兆じゃ！！
column6:
Ohmm...Ohmm...\n
Ohmmmmm...KAAAH!\n
Oh, yes! This is good news!

column5:
引き裂かれた　三人の　火の勇者が\n
ふたたび　出会っておる！！\n
出会う所は　地獄じゃ
column6: The Fire Heroes, separated, gather once again! It is in Hell that they will reunite...

column5:
じゃが　安心いたせ！\n
火の勇者なら　地獄であろうと\n
かならずや　戻って　くるじゃろう！
column6:
But do not worry!\n
They will definitely find a way out!

column5:
ジパングの　未来は　あんたいじゃ\n
火の勇者が　この国を　お救いくださる\n
ははっははは！！
column6:
Jipang's future is assured!\n
The Fire Heroes will save our country! Hahahaha!

column5: かまくら城
column6: Kamakura Castle

column5: つづらの中を　調べた
column6: You look inside the casket.

column5: 中には　白ツルの羽が　入っていた\n
column6: There is a White Crane plume inside.\n

column5: 白ツルの羽を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained White Crane Plume.

column5: 中には　なにも　入っていなかった\n
column6: There is nothing inside.\n

column5: かまくら城
column6: Kamakura Castle

column5: つづらの中を　調べた
column6: You look inside the casket.

column5: 中には　山わらじが　入っていた\n
column6: There is a pair of mountain sandals inside.\n

column5: 山わらじを　手に入れた
column6: Obtained Mountain Sandals.

column5: 中には　なにも　入っていなかった\n
column6: There is nothing inside.\n

column5: かまくら城
column6: Kamakura Castle

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
この村にも\n
有名な　占いオババが　おるんじゃ\n
よく　当たるゆーて　評判なんじゃ！！
column6: A famous fortune teller lives in our town. Her predictions are rarely wrong!

column5: 民家
column6: House

column5:
ヤシャ姫さまは　シャレた　おかたじゃ\n
相手に　あわせて\n
戦いを　お楽しみになる
column6: Yashahime-sama is an inspiration for us all. She fights fair and square, and does so with style.

column5:
火の勇者とて　ただの　ヒマつぶしの\n
お相手で　しかないのじゃ！\n
心強いことじゃて！
column6: She'll have no trouble dealing with those pesky Fire Heroes. We feel safer with her around!

column5:
ヤシャ姫が　バケモノだったなんて！！\n
あぶなく　大門教に\n
だまされるところでした
column6:
Yashahime was actually a monster!\n
We almost fell for the Daimonists' lies!

column5:
必ず　ヤシャ姫さまが\n
火の勇者どもの　ハカを\n
このかまくらに　打ち立てるじゃろう
column6: Yashahime-sama will surely kill those foolish Fire Heroes.

column5:
さすれば　この町は\n
大門教の　聖地として　よりいっそう\n
カクが　あがるという　ものじゃ！
column6: Then, Kamakura will be known as the holy land of the Cult of Daimon! I can't wait!

column5:
この町が　大門教の聖地として\n
名をはせたことが\n
なんと　恥ずかしいことであったか
column6: Being known as the holy land of the Cult of Daimon would have been a disgrace...

column5:
ジライアさん！\n
一刻も早く　大門教を倒してください！
column6: Ziria-san, you must take down those Daimonists as soon as possible!

column5:
赤地に　黄色い文字で\n
「大」と　しるされた　大きな石がある
column6: There is a large red stone marked with a yellow 大 symbol.

column5: なにもありませんでした
column6: You find nothing.

column5: みうら村
column6: Miura Village

column5:
わしは　なまぐさ　坊主じゃ\n
大門教が　キライでの　あんたらと\n
いっしょに　戦うことにした
column6: I'm a corrupt priest who hates the Cult of Daimon. I'm coming with you.
column7:
CHECK, corrupt priest name.
ZenkiTN: looking at all the mentions of なまぐさ in the script, I have a feeling that his name is actually "Namagusa", with the joke being that "namagusa bouzu" means corrupt priest. There are a few dialogues where he just calls himself "Namagusa", and a priest in Edo that says he received a letter from his friend "Namagusa". I've been using "corrupt priest" throughout the script, but I think it's supposed to be his name. Priest Namagusa.
Supper: fair, but almost nobody has a hiragana name in this game, so this seems kind of off. I vote for translating the times where he just calls himself なまぐさ as "Corrupt" like it's a nickname, and leaving the rest as "corrupt priest".

column5: 助っ人　なまぐさ坊主が　仲間になった
column6: The corrupt priest joined you on your journey.

column5:
あんた　ジライアさん　でしょ\n
ツナデちゃんや　オロチ丸さんは\n
どうしたんだい？
column6:
You're Ziria-san, right?\n
What happened to Tsunade-chan and Orochimaru-san?

column5:
ジライアさん\n
大門教打倒の日まで\n
がんばってください
column6: Never stop fighting the Cult of Daimon, Ziria-san.

column5:
すてきな　オロチ丸さんは　どこ？\n
みうら村に　来るって　きいて\n
楽しみに　していたのに・・・
column6:
Excuse me? Where's Orochimaru-san?\n
I heard he was coming to Miura.\n
I was looking forward to seeing him...

column5:
大変です！　ジライアさん！！\n
この村の　守り神の　白オオカミさまが\n
石に　封印されて　しまったのです！！
column6: This is terrible! Our beloved White Wolf has been turned to stone!

column5:
どうか　白オオカミさまを\n
もとの　お姿に　戻してください！
column6: Please rescue him, Ziria-san!

column5:
白オオカミさまを　たすけていただき\n
ありがとうございました
column6: Thank you for rescuing our beloved White Wolf.

column5:
大門教が・・・かまくらの大門教徒が\n
この村にやって来て　白オオカミさまを\n
石に　変えてしまいよった！！
column6: A group of Daimonists came from Kamakura and turned our beloved White Wolf to stone!

column5:
なんでも　獄門島って　いうのは\n
大門教の　資金源らしいのよ\n
黄金が　とれるって　きいたわ
column6: From what I've heard, the gold extracted from Gokumon Island's mine is the Cult of Daimon's main source of income.

column5:
この村の　坊主は　ふざけた野郎だ\n
自分で　なまぐさ坊主と\n
名のってやがる！
column6:
Our priest is a real piece of work.\n
He actually refers to himself as a {corrupt priest}!

column5:
肉は食う！　女の尻は　追いかける！\n
この村の　坊主は　文字どおりの\n
なまぐさ坊主じゃ！！
column6: Our priest eats meat and lusts over women...He is the definition of {corrupt}!
column7: NOTE: I love how everyone goes on and on about how wicked this guy is but we never actually see him do anything but pray and be nice

column5:
おまけに　悟りを　開いたものは\n
欲望のままに　動けばいいと\n
ぬかしやがる！！
column6: He once had the gall to claim that you can only achieve enlightenment by fulfilling your desires!

column5:
なまぐさ坊主が\n
大門教を倒そうと　思った理由は\n
女にモテたい一心に　ちがいない
column6: The only reason our corrupt priest wants to fight the Cult of Daimon is because it'll make him popular with the ladies.

column5:
理由は　ともあれ\n
あのおっさんの　法力は\n
肉を　食ってるだけあって　すごいぞ！
column6:
Be that as it may, he's the real deal.\n
His priestly powers are second only to his appetite!

column5:
助けてもらい　礼を　いうぞ\n
石に　されている　気分は\n
あまり　よいものでは　ないからな
column6:
Thanks for freeing me.\n
Living as a rock isn't as much fun as it's cracked up to be.

column5:
ところで　ジライア\n
このさき　大門教の　勢力は\n
ますます　ふくれあがっている！
column6: Anyway, Ziria...The more you progress, the stronger the Cult of Daimon seems to get.

column5:
凶悪な　怪物が　群れをなし\n
それを　ひきいる　大門教の　ボスも\n
一筋なわでは　いかん　つわものだ！
column6: Their monsters are more and more vicious, and their leaders are unlike anything you've faced before.

column5:
苦しい戦いが　つづくであろう\n
だが　ジパングの　全ての人びとが\n
おまえを　信じておるのだ！
column6: The odds are against you...But the people of Jipang have faith in you!

column5:
負けることは　ゆるされんぞ！\n
わが　オオカミ族に　つたわる\n
三つの　武器を　持ってゆくがよい！
column6: Defeat is not an option! Here, take these weapons, handed down in the Wolf clan across generations!

column5:
ぐずぐずしている　ヒマは　ないぞ！\n
マサカドが　復活してしまう！\n
いそげ　ジライア！！
column6:
Masakado may be revived soon.\n
There's no more time to waste!\n
Now go, young Ziria!

column5: 神獣白オオカミの　封印を　解き放った
column6: You have broken the seal of the divine beast White Wolf.

column5: 白狼の剣を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained White Wolf Sword.

column5: 白狼の弓を　手に入れた
column6: Obtained White Wolf Bow.

column5: 白狼のオノを　手に入れた
column6: Obtained White Wolf Axe.

column5:

いそげ　ジライア！！

There's no more time to waste!\n
Now go, young Ziria!

column6: Inn

東へ行くのを　見たぜ
column6: I saw the Daimonists bring a girl, a handsome man, and a weird foreigner to the east.

マサカドの復活を　阻止してください！
column6: The three Fire Heroes are back together! You have to stop Masakado's return!

column5:
いらっしゃいませ！\n
ここは　宿屋でございます
column6: Welcome to the inn!

column5:
ひと晩　７５両でございますが\n
おとまりになりますか？
column6:
It's 両75 for the night.\n
Will you stay?

いらっしゃいませ！\n

ごゆっくり　お休みください

We will forever be in your debt.

column6: House

すごい武器を　持っているそうじゃ

column6: House

column5: 雲切の里１３
column6: Kumogiri Hamlet 13

北に向かって　お走りください！！\n
早く　しないと　手遅れになります！！
column6: Ziria-sama! You must hurry north, before it's too late!

column5:

乗せた船が　まもなく　神奈川の港を\n
出てしまうそうです！！！！！
column6: The ship carrying Tsunade-sama and Orochimaru-sama will leave from Kanagawa's harbor soon!

column5: ジライアさま　お急ぎください！！
column6: Please hurry, Ziria-sama!

column5:
海に　そって　北へ　行くと\n
神奈川村です！\n
あそこも　大門教の町です！！
column6: Follow the coast up north and you'll find Kanagawa Village. Beware: that place is under complete Daimonist control!

column5:
くれぐれも　お気をつけください\n
かならずや　二人のお仲間を\n
救い出してください！！
column6: Stay sharp, and do everything you can to save your friends!

column5:
どんなことが　あっても\n
火の勇者は　くじけては　いけません！\n
勇気と　愛と　根性です！
column6:
The Fire Heroes never give up, no matter how desperate the situation is!
#BOXPAUSE()
Never forget your courage, love, and determination!

column5:
大門教の　支配する\n
島は　獄門島と　呼ばれて　います！
column6: Gokumon Island is under complete Daimonist control.

column5:
われら　雲切の里の者も\n
たくさん　つかまっています
column6: Many of our comrades have been sent there after being captured.

column5:
なんとかして\n
みんなを　助け出したいのですが\n
手だてが　ありません！
column6: We wish we could break them out, but that island is impregnable!

早く！　早く！\n
神奈川の港へ　急いでください！！！

お一人では　勝てないかも　しれません

獄門島の　ムテキオーが　神奈川村に\n

Mutekiou just arrived in Kanagawa Village from Gokumon Island.

わからなかったそうです！
column6: Unfortunately, we weren't able to figure what kind of magic he uses!

column6:
Masakado will be revived soon!\n
You must hurry, Ziria-san!

にいちゃん！\n
なにか　たのみたいことが　\n
あるんなら
column6:
Hey, big guy!\n
Is there anything you really want?

今　ムテキオーさまが\n
いらっしゃっているから\n
おねがいしてみたら

バカどもを　毎日　獄門島へ\n

column6: Every day, a ship filled with fools who defied the Cult of Daimon leaves port, bound for Gokumon Island.

大門教のために　はたらくのよ\n
ザマアミロ！！

名前ぐらい　おぼえておけ！！
column6: The most important person in the Cult of Daimon is Jashinsai-sama, in Edo! Remember his name!

ムテキオーさまは\n
大門教の　金庫番さね
column6: Mutekiou-sama is the real money-maker of the Cult of Daimon.

column6: He has gold extracted from Gokumon Island, and then he personally sends it to Edo.

いらっしゃってるわよ

column5:

His faith is truly inspirational.

column5:

絶対に　生きては　出られんそうじゃ\n
さすがは　ムテキオーさまじゃ！
column6:
Once you're sent to Gokumon Island, you never leave again.\n
Mutekiou-sama is very thorough!

column5:
ムテキオーさまなら\n
おくで　お祈りを　ささげていますよ
column6: Mutekiou-sama is praying in the back.

column5:
ここを　倉庫に改造するつもりです\n
まずは　あの　魔神像を\n
こわさなきゃならいわ
column6: We're converting this building to a warehouse. First order of business will be getting rid of that creepy statue.
column7:
NOTE: surely these lines aren't used? you can't come back here after gokumon because you don't have kogama anymore
...oh wait, i guess white crane plumes still work? man, then what's the point of writing kogama out?
actually, no, after checking it out, it seems these lines STILL don't appear even if you go out of your way to use items to backtrack here. well, whatever then.

column5:
マサカドさまの　力により\n
ジパングが　不老不死の　理想郷に\n
生まれ変わりますように！！
column6: May Masakado-sama create a new world and give us eternal life...

column5:
魔神像を　こわすのは　もったいないな\n
何かに　使えないかな？\n
えーっと　えーっと
column6: It's kind of a shame to destroy the statue. Maybe we can use it for something else.

column5:
つけもの石には　デカすぎるし\n
船のイカリには　ぶかっこうだし\n
ジライアさん　何か　ありませんか？
column6:
It's too big to use as a counterweight...\n
And the wrong shape to use as an anchor. Any ideas, Ziria-san?

column6: House

なんじゃ！？？\n
おまえ　火の勇者か！！

だれか　来てくれー！！！

がんばってください

物好きな　やつよのう

ムテキオーさまに\n

column5: 民家
column6: House

ヤシャ姫じゃ！

Well done coming this far, Ziria.\n
I am the ninth of the Thirteen Daimon Cultists, Yashahime!

column5:

かえして　ほしくば　かまくら城の\n
てんしゅかくに　くるがよい！　ハハハ
column6:
I'll be taking Tsunade.\n
If you want her back, come to Kamakura Castle's tower! Hahahaha!

column5:

つくらせた　カラクリ兵は\n
つよい　だろう！
column6:
How did you like the Clockwork Soldier?\n
It was created by your friend, Hoteimaru!

column5:
しかし　ホテイ丸は　ここには　おらん\n
かくごだ！　ジライア！
column6: It's a shame that he's not here, isn't it? Prepare to die, Ziria!

column5:

column6:
Don't you understand?\n
You can't defeat me without your friend!
column7: NOTE: if you lose and come back for a rematch

一人で　さびしがって　おるぞ！

Poor Tsunade was feeling lonely all by herself!

column5: たすけて！　ジライア！
column6: Help me, Ziria!

column5:

二人　そろって　獄門島へ\n
飛ばしてやるわ！！
column6: By the way...I'll be taking Orochimaru as well! I'm sending them both to Gokumon Island!

column5:
くやしいか　ジライア！\n
ならば　かかってくるがいい！
column6:
Awww, are you mad, Ziria?\n
In that case, prepare to fight!

column5:
わたしは　大門教１３人衆の　９番手\n
カーミラだ！！
column6: I am the ninth of the Thirteen Daimon Cultists, Carmilla!

column5:
くやしいか　ジライア！\n
ならば　かかってくるがいい！
column6:
Awww, are you mad, Ziria?\n
In that case, prepare to fight!

column5:
わたしは　大門教１３人衆の　９番手\n
カーミラだ！！
column6: I am the ninth of the Thirteen Daimon Cultists, Carmilla!

column5: 盗人訓練所
column6: Thieving School

column5:
ここは　大門教を　やっつけるために\n
ぬすっとを　養成する\n
通称　ぬすっと訓練所です！！
column6: This is a Thieving School, where you can improve your thievery in order to help defeat the Cult of Daimon!

column5:
奥の　部屋に　入って\n
教官を　よけて\n
つづらの中の　お金を　とるんです！
column6: Head inside, avoid the instructors, and steal the money from the casket!

column5:
みごと　お金を　とることに\n
成功したら\n
そのお金は　あなたのものです！
column6: If you can steal the money successfully, you get to keep it for yourself!

column5:
まあ　遊びだと　おもって\n
気軽に　たのしんでくださいよ！\n
だけど　マサカド打倒も　お忘れなく！
column6:
Think of it as a game and have fun!\n
But don't forget your quest to defeat Masakado!

column5: 獄門島
column6: Gokumon Island

column5:
ジライア！　会えて　よかった！！\n
大門教の　このひどい　やりかた\n
おれは　ぜったいに　ゆるせない！
column6: Ziria! It's good to see you! The Cult of Daimon has gone too far. They have to pay for what they're doing to these people!

column5:
おれたち　３人の　友情の力を\n
やつらに　見せてやろう！！\n
さあ　行こう！　ジライア！
column6: Let's show them the power of our friendship! Onward, Ziria!

column5:
火の勇者の　ひとり！！\n
オロチ丸と　再会した！
column6: You have reunited with the Fire Hero Orochimaru!

column5:
死ぬまで　この地下で\n
はたらかされるんだ・・・\n
グスン　グスン　おかあちゃん！
column6:
I'm going to work here until I die...\n
Sob, sob...Mommy...

column5:
この地下からは　でられないさ\n
もう　みんな　あきらめてる\n
でも　オレは　あきらめないぞ！
column6:
Everyone says it's impossible to escape. They gave up hope...\n
But I'm not giving up yet!

column5:
力持ち　だからって　女の子まで\n
こんな地下で　こき使うなんて\n
ほんとうに　ヒドイやつらじゃ！
column6:
They're even making a girl work down here, just because she's strong.\n
How could they be so evil?

column5:
獄門島から　掘り出される黄金で\n
カラクリ兵を\n
ドンドン　作られたんじゃ
column6: The gold extracted from the island is used to build the clockwork soldiers.

column5:
この　ジパングが\n
大門教のものに　なるのも\n
時間のモンダイだぜ！！
column6: It's only a matter of time until the Cult of Daimon conquers Jipang!

column5: 獄門島
column6: Gokumon Island

column5:
やっと　気がついたね！\n
ここは　獄門島じゃよ\n
死んでも　出れない　地獄じゃ！
column6:
Hey, you. You're finally awake.\n
This is Gokumon Island...\n
Welcome to Hell.
column7: ZenkiTN: couldn't resist that Skyrim meme.

column5:
大門教の　ために　死ぬまで\n
はたらかねば　ならんのさ\n
くやしいが　あきらめる　ことじゃ
column6:
Now that you're here, you can only work for the Cult of Daimon until you die.\n
Sorry, but that's the harsh reality...

column5:
はじめは　みんな　戦うが\n
大門教は　強いんじゃ\n
この島は　出られんよ・・・
column6:
We tried fighting together at first, but the Daimonists are too strong.\n
There's no way off of the island...

column5:
この下の階に　温泉が　わいてて\n
ちょっと　ひとやすみ　できるんだ\n
ナイショだぜ
column6:
There's a hot spring on the floor below.\n
You can go there to rest.\n
Keep it a secret, okay?

column5:
温泉の　まわりを　調べて　みなよ\n
回復のポイントが　あるはずですぜ
column6: Inspect the area around the hot spring and you should be able to recover your health.

column5:
ここで　はたらかされている\n
オロチ丸って男は\n
火の勇者だって　ウワサじゃ
column6: There's a rumor floating around that Orochimaru is actually one of the Fire Heroes.

column5:
おっ！　ジライアさん！\n
おれは　雲切の里の者ですよ！\n
雲切の　おやぶんと　つかまっちまって
column6:
Oh, Ziria-san! I'm from Kumogiri Hamlet.\n
I was captured alongside Chief Kumogiri.

column5:
おやぶんも　この島の　どこかで\n
はたらかされて　いるはずです\n
捜してみてください
column6:
The chief is somewhere on the island.\n
You should look for him.

column5:
がんじょうな　木のトビラが　ある\n
カギが　かかっている！！
column6:
A sturdy wooden gate stands before you.\n
It is locked shut.

column5: 木のトビラは　開いている！！\n
column6: The wooden gate is open.

column5: 獄門島
column6: Gokumon Island

column5:
トホホホ・・・\n
わしは　おだわらの　トノさまなのに\n
大門教に　コキ使われとる
column6: Siiigh...How could I, the lord of Odawara, be forced to perform manual labor...

column5:
なんでも　ナメクジと　ヘビの\n
二つの玉を　江戸に　運んだとかって\n
大門教のやつらが　いってましたぜ！
column6: I heard the Daimonists say that the Slug and Snake orbs were sent to Edo!

column5:
この地下から　出る　黄金で\n
大門教は　カラクリ兵の軍隊を\n
作っているらしいのじゃ
column6: Apparently, the Cult of Daimon uses the gold we extract from these mines to build their clockwork army.

column5:
地下を　掘ると　黄金がでる\n
黄金が　１コ　あれば・・・\n
まあ　１００００両だな
column6:
A single gold nugget is worth, let's see...\n
I'd say 両10,000.

column5:
だけど　ここから　出られないんじゃ\n
ただの石と　いっしょだぜ！！
column6: But down here, it's as worthless as a pebble!

column5:
海に　飛び込めば逃げられる\n
かもしれないが・・・　まあ　ムリだ！\n
地上に　出られないもんな・・・
column6:
We might be able to escape if we were to jump into the sea, but...\n
There's just no way to reach the surface!

column5:
ジライアさん！　雲切の里の者です！\n
獄門島を仕切っている　ムテキオーは\n
ケタちがいに　つよいです
column6: Ziria-san! I'm from Kumogiri Hamlet! Mutekiou is on a completely different league from anyone you've faced before!

column5:
火の勇者といえども　まるごしでは\n
勝てません
column6: Even the power of the Fire Heroes may not be enough!

column5:
獄門島の地下で　ホテイ丸さんが\n
なにか　すごい武器を\n
みつけたそうですんで　行ってください
column6: Apparently, Hoteimaru-san has found an incredible weapon on the bottom floor of the mine. You should talk to him.

column5: 扉があいた
column6: You unlock the gate.

column5: 獄門島
column6: Gokumon Island

column5:
おや　ジライアさん！　わたしですよ\n
さがみの国の　なまぐさ　ですよ\n
大門教を　やっつけてください
column6:
Is that you, Ziria-san? It's me, Corrupt!\n
Go and beat the Cult of Daimon, will you?

column5:
そうだ！　カギをひろったんだ！\n
なんの　カギだか　わからないけど\n
あんたに　あげますよ！
column6:
Oh yeah. I found a key.\n
Dunno what it unlocks, but here you go!

column5:
ナンマイダー　ナンマイダー\n
さあ！　大門教を　やっつけて\n
平和を　取り戻してください！！
column6:
Namo Amitabha, Namo Amitabha...\n
Take down the Cult of Daimon and bring peace back to Jipang!

column5:
ジライアさん！\n
今まで　この獄門島を\n
ぬけ出たやつは　いないが
column6: Ziria-san! Nobody has ever escaped from Gokumon Island before, but...

column5:
火の勇者が　三人そろえば\n
きっと　できる！！\n
できますよ！！　かならず
column6:
The three Fire Heroes together might be able to do it! Yes, you'll find a way!\n
I'm sure of it!

column5:
そうだ！　カギをひろったんだ！\n
なんの　カギだか　わからないけど\n
あんたに　あげますよ！
column6:
Oh yeah. I found a key.\n
Dunno what it unlocks, but here you go!

column5: 島ぬけのカギを　もらった
column6: Received Island Escape Key.

column5: 島ぬけのカギを　もらった
column6: Received Island Escape Key.

column5: 地面から　黄金が　出ている
column6: You notice the glint of gold in the wall.

column5:
黄金を　そっと\n
ふところに　しまった
column6: You stealthily pocket the lump of gold.

column5:
温泉が　わき出している\n
その　湯を　体に　浴びると\n
体力が　回復した
column6:
The pool is filled with hot spring water.\n
You feel reinvigorated as soon as you enter.

column5: 獄門島
column6: Gokumon Island

column5:
ジライアさん！！\n
ここじゃ　つれえことばかりで\n
楽しいことは　ひとつもねぇ
column6:
Ziria-san. There's nothing fun down here.\n
It's nothing but pain and hardship.

column5:
けど　これも　人生だよ！\n
ジライアさん！\n
とりあえず　きろくするかい？
column6: Still, this is our life, and it deserves to be recorded. Would you like me to record your progress?

column5:
希望を　捨てるんじゃないよ\n
これも　また　経験だ！\n
じゃ　きろくするぜ！！
column6:
Never lose hope. Surely there's something to be learned from this experience!\n
Now, let me write this down!

column5:
あんたの　気持ちは　よくわかるよ\n
こんな島　少しでも　早く\n
ぬけ出したいよな！！
column6:
I know how you feel.\n
I hope we can find a way out soon!

column5:
ワーッ！　ジライア！　あたしよ\n
ツナデ！　ここ　すっげえ　ひどいのよ\n
あたし　プッツンしたよ！
column6:
Aaahhh! Ziria! It's me, Tsunade!\n
This place sucks harder than a baby goat!

column5:
もう　ぜったい　おこったからね\n
大門教を　メタクソに　やっつけよう！\n
はやく　行こう！　ジライア！
column6:
I'm SO totally done! Let's beat the crap out of the Daimonists and leave ASAP!\n
C'mon! Hurry up, Ziria!

column5:
火の勇者の　ひとり！\n
ツナデと　再会した！！
column6: You have reunited with the Fire Hero Tsunade!

column5:
この奥に　黄金が　ころがってるのに\n
ここじゃ　なんの\n
役にも　たちゃしない！
column6:
There's gold along these shafts.\n
Too bad it's completely useless down here!

column5:
ホテイ丸って　ヘンな　やつがよ\n
いちばん　地下で　何か\n
見つけたらしいよ
column6: This weirdo called Hoteimaru found something on the deepest floor.

column5:
もし　島の東の　さんばしから\n
海に　飛び込めば　流れに　のって\n
千葉国へ　行けるはずだ
column6: If you jumped from the island's eastern pier, the currents would carry you all the way to the coast of Chiba.

column5:
あそこからなら　江戸は\n
もう　目と　ハナの先だ！！\n
きっと　ぬけ出して　くださいね
column6:
Edo would be just a short walk away!\n
Find a way to break us out, okay?

column5:
大門教の　カラクリ兵が\n
地下の一階と　二階を　囚人が\n
逃げないように　みはっているんでさあ
column6: The Clockwork Soldiers in the first and second underground floors make sure no prisoner can escape.

column5:
あんたの　目には\n
希望の光が\n
かがやいている！
column6: I see the glimmer of hope in your eyes!

column5:
もしや　はじめて\n
この島を　ぬける男に\n
なるかも　しれんな
column6: You might become the first person to ever escape Gokumon Island.

column5:
そして　大門教が　ほろびれば\n
わしらも　助かるのじゃが\n
ハハハ・・・　年寄りの　夢じゃな
column6:
Then you'll defeat the Cult of Daimon, and we'll be able to go home!\n
Hahaha...Even an old man can dream.

column5:
おれだ　ジライア！\n
盗人のおやぶん　雲切だ！\n
どうも　ドジふんでよ
column6:
Ziria! It's me, Kumogiri!\n
The chief of the thieves!\n
I really messed up, huh?

column5:
大門教に　つかまっちまった\n
くやしいね　そうだ　ヘヘヘ\n
いいものを　おしえるぜ！
column6:
I can't believe I got captured by the Daimonists...Oh, yeah! Heh heh heh!\n
Lemme teach you something special!

column5:
おれの　あみだした　さいきょうの術だ\n
戦っているときに　敵に　使えよ\n
たしかに　おしえたぜ！
column6:
This is an amazing jutsu I came up with myself. Use it in battle!\n
There, now you know how to use it!

column5: がんばれよ！　ジライア！！
column6: Good luck, Ziria!

column5: 雲切の術を　さずかった
column6: You learned the Kumogiri jutsu.

column5: がんばれよ！　ジライア！！
column6: Good luck, Ziria!

column5:
わしらは\n
毎日　生きてゆくのが\n
つらかったが・・・
column6: They've been working us to the bone every single day...This is a living hell.

column5:
ジライアさんが　この獄門島に\n
来てから　希望が　わいてきました！\n
がんばってください　ジライアさん！
column6:
But you bring us hope, Ziria-san!\n
You're going to break us out, right??

column5: 土でできた　不思議な人形が　ある
column6: You see strange figurines made of clay.

column5: 獄門島
column6: Gokumon Island

column5:
オー！　フレンド　ジライアさん！\n
あんたも　ココに　来た　デスカ！\n
大門教　ドンドン　つよいよ！
column6:
Oh, friend! Ziria-san!\n
You here too? Cult of Daimon, very very strong!

column5:
大門教　ワタシ　つかまえて\n
カラクリ兵　作らされてたヨ！\n
カラクリ兵　ドえらく　強いヨ！！
column6:
Daimonists catch me, make me build clockwork soldiers!\n
Clockwork soldiers, super tough!

column5:
でも　ワタシ　すごい　ヒミツ\n
見つけた！　ジパングの　神が\n
作った　カラクリだよ！
column6:
But I find cool secret!\n
Clockwork dolls made by Jipang Gods!

column5:
「土偶ロボ」だヨ！\n
ちっちゃいが　使うで　ビッグになる！\n
三人乗りネ　でも　水に　よわいヨ！
column6:
It is {Doguu Robot}!\n
Small, but get big when use!\n
Three can ride! But weak to water!

column5:
さあ！　これ　あげる！\n
アタシの　カラクリ兵　コワシテよ！
column6: You take! You break my clockwork soldiers!

column5: 土偶ロボを　手に入れた！！
column6: Obtained Doguu Robot!

column5:
「土偶ロボ」だヨ！　ちっちゃいが\n
使うで　ビッグになる！\n
三人乗りネ　でも　水に　よわいヨ！
column6:
It is {Doguu Robot}!\n
Small, but get big when use!\n
Three can ride! But weak to water!

column5:
ワタシ　カラクリ兵の　せっけい図を\n
ぜんぶ　やぶります！　はやく\n
イッテ　ください！　フレンド！！
column6:
I shred all clockwork soldier plans!\n
Now go, friend!

column5: 土偶ロボを　手に入れた！！
column6: Obtained Doguu Robot!

column5: 獄門島
column6: Gokumon Island

column5:
おれは　えどっ子でい！　さあ\n
スシくいねえ！　と　いいてえが\n
そうも　いかねえな
column6:
I'm from Edo, born and raised! Let's go for some delicious sushi after our shift!\n
...Oh, right.
column7: ZenkiTN: that スシくいねえ is a reference to a song from the band Shibugakitai from 1986. I don't think anyone in the west could get the reference.

column5:
大門教に　逆らったんで\n
この　獄門島に　連れて\n
来られちまったんだ・・・
column6: They sent me here for standing up against the Cult of Daimon...

column5: 獄門島
column6: Gokumon Island

column5:
おや　おや・・・\n
獄門島の地下から　ぬけ出すとは・・・\n
さすがに　ジライア！！
column6:
Oh, my! You managed to escape Gokumon's underground!\n
Very impressive, Ziria!

column5:
せっかくだから\n
持てるだけ　黄金を持って　いこうよ！\n
あとで　きっと　役に立つからさ！！
column6:
Let's bring all the gold we can carry!\n
I bet it'll come in handy!

column5: 獄門島から　脱出した！
column6: You've escaped from Gokumon Island!

column5: 千葉
column6: Chiba

column5:
ジライアさん！！\n
よく　獄門島を　脱出できましたね！！\n
さすがは　火の勇者だ！！
column6: Well done escaping Gokumon Island, Ziria-san! You truly deserve the title of Fire Hero!

column5:
この　千葉村で　ゆっくり　休んで\n
それから　江戸へ\n
向かってください！！
column6: Take some time to rest in our village before leaving for Edo!

column5:
ジライアさんの　あとに\n
獄門島を　ぬけ出した人々が\n
近くの　海岸に　流れついているそうだ
column6: It seems that those who left Gokumon Island after you are washing up along the shore.

column5:
まかしてください　ジライアさん\n
獄門島に　のこった人たちは\n
あっしの舟で　助け出しますよ
column6:
Don't worry, Ziria-san!\n
I'll use my boats to rescue everyone else from Gokumon Island!

column5:
き　奇跡じゃ！！\n
あの　獄門島から　脱出してくるとは！\n
さすがは　火の勇者！！
column6:
You escaped Gokumon Island??\n
It's a miracle! You truly are the Fire Heroes!

column5:
神さまは　まだ　このジパングを\n
見捨てて　おられなかったのじゃ！！
column6: This must be a sign that the Gods have not abandoned Jipang!

column5:
ヘンな　外人が　流れついて\n
「フレンド！」とか　さけびながら\n
南のほうへ　走って　いったわよ！
column6: A weird foreigner washed up here and immediately started running south while yelling about his {friend.}

column5:
ジライアさん！\n
あっしも　獄門島から\n
逃げてきた者ですが
column6: Ziria-san! I escaped from Gokumon Island!

column5:
あの土偶ロボは　おしかったですね\n
まさか　海水に　とけちゃうなんてね\n
本当に　残念ですね！
column6: It's a shame about the Doguu Robot, isn't it? It was made of soft clay, so it melted when you jumped in the sea...

column5:
黄金を　雑貨屋に　持ってくと\n
１コ　１００００両に　なるってんだ！\n
どっかに　ころがってねえかな！
column6: Apparently, the general store will buy gold nuggets for 両10,000 apiece! You wouldn't happen to have any, would you?

column5:
この　千葉国の　北から\n
江戸城が　見えるのじゃ！！！\n
おぬしらの目指す　江戸じゃ！！
column6:
You can glimpse Edo Castle from the northern edge of Chiba!\n
That is your end goal!

column5:
江戸城は　大門教が　完全に\n
支配したんですって！　マサカドが\n
とうとう　復活するのかしら！
column6: Edo Castle is fully under Daimonist control! Masakado may be revived soon!

column5:
有名な　剣の名人の　\n
千葉　シュウサク先生は\n
この村の　生まれじゃ！！
column6: This is the hometown of the famous fencer Master Chiba Shuusaku!

column5:
今　先生は　修行の旅を　終えて\n
この村へ　戻っていらした\n
これで　この村も　あんたいじゃ！！
column6:
Master Shuusaku has returned after finishing his training!\n
He'll keep us safe!

column5:
待っておったぞ！　ジライアよ！\n
わしが　天下一の　剣の名人\n
千葉　シュウサクじゃ！
column6:
I've been waiting for you, Ziria!\n
I am Chiba Shuusaku, known as the greatest fencer in the world!

column5:
剣とは　おのれの　心を　みがくもの！\n
自らを　きたえ　人を　生かすための\n
ものでなくては　ならぬ
column6: To follow the way of the sword is to cultivate one's soul. The sword must be used to save lives, not take them.

column5:
だが　大門教めらは　剣を\n
悪しき　欲望のため　人を　斬る\n
道具としてしか　使っておらぬ
column6: And yet the Cult of Daimon considers the sword a mere instrument of death, something to satisfy their dark desires.

column5:

とても　大門教など　たおせんぞ！
column6:

If you cannot surpass me, you'll never be able to defeat the Cult of Daimon!

わが奥義　シュウサクぎりを\n

You have mastered my special technique, the Shuusaku Slash.

がんばってくれよ！！
